Reviews.Title: “Mediocre breakfast in a poorly maintained setting.”
Reviews.Author: rada1938
Reviews.Content: This particular Hyatt offers a buffet breakfast that is an ideal setting, but for the price the overall offerings were fairly mediocre, and the large dining room, which has a spectacular view, was marred by the obvious lack of basic maintenance (major chipped paint on the metal railing between the food area and the dining floor, clearly visible and obviously old 'dings' on the large wooden doors that open toward the ocean, and other signs of wear and tear that just don't jibe with the Hyatt Regency standards we've come to expect).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Beach!”
Reviews.Author: pixstix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt the week of March 5th through the 12th. It was a company trip so we didn't pay for our room itself. The only downer... the fact that that as a couple we didn't get a king bed - we got a double beds (actually I think one of them was a single). Even when we had flight delays and stayed another night, although the company requested a king bed we still got the two beds. It was a small thing considering the hotel is really very lovely. The hotel rooms were spacious, a nice walk in closet with safe, big screen tv and a balcony with view of the resort and the ocean. All of the staff were very nice and always very courteous. Every wake up call we got, we were also told what the weather would be like that day. Always had the Maui news under our door in the morning (even though we would often wake up around 5:30 AM) and the rooms were always made up well. There isn't much of a beach in front of the hotel and the ocean right by the hotel is a bit rocky. It's no more than a 5 minute walk to get to a nicer beach in front of another resort and all of the resorts are connected with a nice beach walk. The waves can get pretty big (this is from a mainlander with no experience surfing). A pretty strong undertow but lots of kids, boogie boards and surfers were able to have fun in it. The Hyatt makes up for it's smaller beach area with a beautiful layout. The grounds of the hotel are spectacular, lots of interesting paths with lots of flowers, little man made rivers and waterfall. You saw different birds along the way like Penguins, Swans, Ducks, Flamingos. The lobby atrium also had some tropical birds out during the day which was a nice touch. The pool is nicer than a lot of the other hotels but the water is cold, too bad it wasn't heated but that may have only been an issue because half of our stay was rainy. Nice big hot tub made up for it! Fast water slide and cute kids play area that are separate from the adult pool where they also have a hoop set up for some water sports. Lots of deck chairs around the pool and kids area for sunning if you don't feel like going right out onto the beach. 10-15 minute walk to Whaler's Village via the beach walk. Lots of joggers took advantage of the path if they weren't keen on jogging in the sand. We had two events at the Hyatt with our company. One was moved in doors due to rain - but the band was still great and the food was good as well! . We also enjoyed the hotel luau, great show, again, lots of good food, open bar and wonderful hula dancing. We tried Japengo once just for a few drinks, it was raining but had a nice view of the beach front and staff were really nice. We ate at Swans Court for breakfast every morning - fast omelette station, a great selection of breakfast pastries, fruit (papaya and pineapple were delcious), hot food and even miso soup. Overall it was a great stay and would stay here again on our next trip to Maui. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: Dan V
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and had been primarily loyal to Marriott prior to this stay. Since I was unable to book a room at a Marriott property in Kaanapali Beach, I gave Hyatt a try and boy am I glad that I did. Prior to my visit I contacted Hyatt Gold Passport to determine if they would provide a trial Diamond membership based on my Marriott status. They obliged based on the condition that I complete 12 Hyatt stays in the next 3 months which I agreed to. Based on my positive experience at this property and a less than ideal experience at the Marriott in Wailea I have decided to shift my business to Hyatt. I had read some mixed reviews about this property and was not sure what to expect. While the property is not new, renovations have kept the space fresh and aesthetically pleasing. The lobby is open is grand with views of the pool and ocean. The grounds are meticulously maintained and there is an abundance of wild life including penguins, flamingos, and other tropical birds. Check in was a breeze. I was promptly assisted at the Diamond Check in and both my wife and I were given lovely orchid leis. The guest relations rep upgraded us to a deluxe ocean view room and arranged to have wine and seared ahi sent to the room. The folks at this Hyatt property went out of there way at every turn to make our visit special. The employees at this property seem to like what they do and this goes a long way in making guests feel welcome. The Regency Club offered a wide array of food offerings and the service was both friendly and efficient The grounds are massive which is both a pro and a con. It can take a while to get from one place to another but the upside is that the resort did not feel terribly crowded despite being fully booked. The pools were expansive and built to blend in with the lush tropical surroundings. The pool area was serviced regularly by attendants and drinks were reasonable by resort standards. The pool was a bit chilly. I would have liked to see the pools heated but few in Hawaii seem to be. You have likely read other reviews about the beach being rocky and that is true. The Hyatt does not sit on the best stretch of sandy beach but it is only a short walk to find wider stretches of sand and larger surf. You can walk the boardwalk or beach to access other properties along Kaanapali beach. Check out Whalers Village for retail and restaurants. If you are looking for quaint this is not the property for you but if you want to have a wide array of dining and activity choices than the Hyatt offers families,couples and business travelers a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded but lovely”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 7 days of our honeymoon....the hotel room was great, but the shower and toilet area were a little tight as they are right next to each other with a door for privacy. the views were great and the food throughout the hotel was great--we got the breakfast buffet as a package deal through our travel agent, Jen Byrne at theTropicaltravelers.com. She really set us up with everything we love--pool, snorkeling, beach! The beach bar was fabulous--we enjoyed swimming up to it for drinks. The walking path through all the hotels on Kaanapali is convenient but very very crowded and narrow. We enjoyed walking down to the Sheraton's beach for AMAZING snorkeling and a wide open beach that had a safe way in and out--the beach at the Hyatt is tiny and there are quite a lot of rocks when getting in and out of the water. Overall it was a great hotel, just crowded at the pool and walking path (not the beach though). the Luau was also good at the Hyatt--but don't pay the extra VIP fare--not worth it--we are so glad we just paid the regular price. The rental fee for the beach chairs was very reasonable at the hotel---they were so perfect for our days away---great idea to rent if you are going off for the day to other beaches! We thought that the towel tickets were a little annoying---who wants to steal bright yellow towels if you can afford to stay at a Hyatt...I recommend they just give you as many towels as you want, no tickets---everyone will give them back---no one wants a wet yellow towel--trust me!

Reviews.Title: “seating at luau”
Reviews.Author: ann c
Reviews.Content: paying extra for the special seating a big fat rip off. we got there early were the 1st in line for the special seating with promise of being seated 1st and fed 1st and watched the whole 1st row of tables fill with peope who arrived after us and were waved straight by us standing in line,when the lady behind us complained they took her in and also sat her in the 1st row promised we had assigned seats and well much later came back for us and sat us in 2nd row the show was good so was food DONT PAY EXTRA FOR SPECIAL SEATING

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service but showing a little age.”
Reviews.Author: travlinmanIowa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive and grand with it's open lobby. Great location, food was very good and all around service was excellent. The only minor negative was that the room we stayed in was showing it's age with some wear and tear, however it was kept very clean by the staff. Typically areas around the pool are packed by mid morning and instead of fighting the crowd, we opted to renting beach chairs for $5 a day. The beach only had a handful of people on it and you could listen to the surf and watch the whales with your toes in the sand. That beats laying around a pool anyday! I would also advise on making a couple trips into Lahaina for shopping and experiencing some of the great places to eat. While you're there you have to have some Hawaiian shaved ice - it was amazing. Driving the road to Hana was beautiful but plan it taking the entire day. Leave the resort by mid morning or it will get too dark to see all the beauty of your drive. Also make sure to stop and grab your picnic lunch and have some extra water on hand as there literally isn't much along the entire route.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt on a slipping slope”
Reviews.Author: ambassd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5day stay at the Hyatt, Maui Hi. Check in was easy but they forgot to give us a daily activites sheet. The room was large but dark. All wood seemed chipped. Past guest dirty towel in bath. Bed was on a wood frame with just the mattress. Very low and difficult to get in and out of. They brag about their thread count on the sheets, but our sheets had a tag that said 250. This side of muslin. Rust around tub drain. We unnpacked then open the drapes. Our view was of a roof and in the far distance some trees. There was debris on the roof, fork, cigarette butts and bottle caps. This room is 1403. Avoid this one for sure! I had to adjust the cords on the TV to get a clear picture and one of the phones had problems. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful with well kept flower beds and water interests. They had penquins, swans and other wildlife. I guess the $25 per day extra fee was for food. We ate at Son'z, great quiet happy hour, Umalu bar and Japengo. The waite staff was great everywhere and the help very curteous. Wood everywhere around the hotel is in need of repair but from the room door out it was a wonderful stay. Beware, before you unpack check out your room. A change may be in the cards.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Josh A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights here for our honey moon and it was incredible! The front desk gave us an awesome photo album and free bottle of champagne for our special occasion which was unexpected and really great! I thought the rooms were nice, but, seeing as we were Hawaii, we tried to stay out as much as possible. The restaurants are all pretty pricey, so we only ate at the Swanz for breakfast. Breakfast was included in our rate, which I highly recommend because their breakfast buffet was simply amazing. We would eat so much great food in the morning that we were never really hungry for lunch. The pool was huge! It even has a grotto bar with TVs. There's also a basketball hoop and water slide, which, as a guy in my early 20s, I had a lot of fun with. The grounds were so beautiful and well kept. You can literally walk up to flamingoes and swans in their garden! There was a lot of construction going on while we were there which was a bummer, but I'm sure they've finished by now. The beach by the hotel is full of coral so I suggest driving north a little ways. My wife and I found an awesome secluded sandy beach about 15 min or so north. Overall, it was an awesome experience and I personally think that after walking by all of the other hotels in that area, that the Hyatt regency definitely had the best setup.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: 0eus0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is HUGE, sometimes I find myself thinking its too big. It takes forever to walk anywhere since its kinda built like a maze (similar to vegas style hotels). The zig zagging paths in and around the pool area make it a chore to get out to the beach, and the fitness center is all the way in the corner of the property (by the luau). It is however a beautiful hotel, with flamingos, penguins, parrots, and other exotic wildlife. It has beautiful gardens and walkways. You definitely feel like you're staying somewhere special. The hotel beach isn't that great, its a narrow beach that basically disappears when its high tide. The hotel is close to other beaches within walking distance. The pool area is large with lots of deck chair space available. Its a wonderland of a pool, complete with waterfall, and a bar inside a cave. The hottub is large too, can definitely fit more than 10 people. There is a kids pool separate from the main pool, with a fake sandy beach area. However night time swimming or hot tubbing can be difficult due to poor lighting. The restaurants at the hotel are top notch, and the entire hotel has a great "outdoor living" type feel, where the line between "inside" and "outside" is blurred. PROS: - Excellent location. 10 minute drive to Kapalua (great beaches, excellent snorkeling, golf, restaurants). 5 minute drive from downtown Lahaina, which features great local shopping, restaurants, ice cream and coffee joints. It's also where the Lanai ferry departs, and where a lot of boat tours and dinner cruises depart from as well. There is also a Safeway and a Foodland (grocery stores) in Lahaina too. - Large comfortable rooms. Walk in closet, lots of counter space around the sink. There's a nice flat screen TV with HD channels. Also plenty of lamps and plugs everywhere. There is also a separate non-minibar fridge for your snacks / drinks. - Friendly service. Concierge and hotel staff are eager to serve. You feel like you are special. CONS: - There is a $25 resort fee charged per day. Besides internet and self-parking, I'm not really sure what you get for that $25. One complaint I would have is that the inroom coffee should be of better quality if you are paying $25 / day resort fee. You get the basic motel quality coffee, powdered creamer and plastic tube stirrers, I was expecting actual liquid creamer here, and maybe even complimentary bottles of drinking water per day. - Self parking lots are kinda far. There's a closer lot that's smaller, and fills up quick. The main lot is accross a field. Both parking lots aren't well lit at night, and people suck at parking so many cars end up taking 2 spots. TIPS: - On checkin, valet parking is free until 11pm that night, so don't self park when you first get to the hotel - If you are living on the north building, you can enter the hotel via the 1st floor stairway if you are self parking (there's a "doctor on call" sign from the outside). This will save you a lot of walking. Use your key to open the door from the outside. - Buy drinks from the Lahaina Foodland / Safeway since you have a fridge in the room - Do not stay on the first floor if you are a light sleeper, especially if your room faces the parking lot - Priceline bid the hotel 2 weeks prior to your trip. We got a partial-ocean view room for $160 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: Traveller8879
Reviews.Content: Partial Ocean view room is worth the extra $. View of gardens & beach lovely. Gardens & facilities are great. Room average. Noise from rooms next door & above travels & makes it hard to sleep if guests are moving around in the night. Coffee pot not cleaned & floor could do with a good vacuum in certain areas. Bathroom small but rest of room generous. Hotel restaurants offer good quality food & location is great. Service ranged from excellent to below average depending on staff. Overall hotel appears to be best option in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ivy54321
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation on Maui and staying at the Hyatt was the best experience! Beautiful grounds and we loved the exotic birds and fish on the property. I can not say one bad word because it was such a wonderful vacation and I have recommened the Hyatt to several friends who have since stayed there and loved it as much as us!.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hazel H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 blissful nights at the Hyatt on Maui last month. The property is beautiful, with flowers, ponds and streams everywhere. The pools are sparkling and blue, and that warm Pacific ocean is right across the walk way. We liked everything about our stay, and were particularly impressed by how friendly and helpful the staff were. We had a room with an ocean view and spent lots of time sitting on our patio, in our kimonos (provided by the hotel), watching the whales.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: catristen713
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned here in September of 2011. Overall we had great time! Room was beautiful and spacious- it was a partial oceanview and I loved enjoying my coffee every morning on the balcony waiting for my husband to wake up. Pool area was awesome- the waterslide is a must try! We had a blast on it!. Hot tub was large and spacious- this is where we either started or ended every evening. Like previous reviewers have mentioned, the beach is pretty much non existent, so if you want to be able to go to the beach without leaving your hotel, this is not the place for you. We of course rented a car and tried a new beach every day. Our favorites were to the north, Napali beach where you could see sea turtles swimming along the rocks, or south, past Wailea, to Big Beach, which won our hearts (just be careful exploring the rocks on the right side of Big Beach, because on the other side is Little Beach, which is a complete nude beach-boy were we surprised! Food was pricey at the hotel, as is everywhere in Hawaii though. Parking was tight, but if you come back at night and the parking lot is full, they do open up the valet lot so you can self park free of charge- it really wasnt a hassle either way. There is a convenience store in the hotel which has anything you could need, from over the counter medications, snacks, beer, to souveniers. Over all a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Has it All”
Reviews.Author: Runner0382
Reviews.Content: Service: Top notch. Matches that of any hotel on Maui - Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Ritz, you name it. Genuine. Greeted with an "aloha" on the vast majority of occasions. It is clear this Hyatt has trained its employees well, and they appear to be happy going about their jobs. From front desk check-in, valets, grounds staff, towel staff to housekeeping, the staff is doing well. And they should be considering their rack rate can be $400/night. Location: for my money, it's here or Wailea. Nothing new to add from other reviews. Walking distance down to Black Rock, one stoplight down from the Westin Villas in front of which is a wonderful, uncrowded spot to snorkel. Swam with a turtle for 10 minutes there with nobody around. Whaler's is close. Nice path to get a workout in the morning. Price: Well, some people think $400/nt is reasonable or okay. I don't, especially coming out of high season. We booked at less than 1/3 of that. Resort fee is $25/day and gets you gym access, "free" self park, and wireless. Deal with it. It is a reality of travel these days, but it still feels like a nice big slap in the face. Had I paid rack rate, I would feel a bit cheated. Restaurants: didn't eat in any b/c I am of the firm opinion that hotel food generally stinks. Apparently some of their spots are quite good, but I wasn't willing to take a chance on any of them especially given their resort prices. Use your fridge for breakfast and Happy Hour on your lanai and splurge on nice dinners. Pool: divided with kids (2 waterslides) and adults (+ a basketball hoop) with a grotto (and bar) in between. Bar isn't swim up. Dark in there! No issues with getting seats. Activities: no kids, but I'm sure this is a good spot for them. TONS of couples here with young children. Having stayed at a lot of properties on Maui on all sections of the island, the Hyatt meets or exceeds the best. Sure, there are hints of the property's age but the service and location more than make up for it. Room are all newly renovated and they utilized the space well with a warm, traditional but slightly modern feel. You can find nicer rooms but you will not find nicer service. Like Happy Hour outside the hotel? Download the Happy Hour Hawaii app to your smartphone! I highly recommend Merriman's based on our dinner there and Pineapple Grill has 50% off Pupus on Thursdays after 5:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation with our two little ones!!”
Reviews.Author: Prettyjoelle
Reviews.Content: First time in Maui as four and had a best time and best service. Staff are very welcoming, professional and accomodating. I travel for my work worldwide and have been to many different places but hyatt regency Maui is far best place for a family looking for a fun and relaxing time. Special thanks to one of the managers who organized an unforgettable luau experience after a minor issue at check in process with bell desk staff. I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Maui. Mahalo!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: myles c
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hyatt and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The room was great and overlooked the pools and beachfront. The hotel has absolutely everything you could need and was easy access along the waterfront to the Whalers Village and the golf course. It was a real steal for what we paid on Hotwire and the whales just offshore were a bonus. If you don't mind a bit of a walk, the Castaway Grill is a fabulous spot for breakfast and whale watching.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, especially about room reservations.”
Reviews.Author: JeffandDiane11
Reviews.Content: FYI, don't book here through Orbitz if you feel like you might to change your room before you go. If you call the Hyatt directly, they'll tell you they can't because you booked through Orbitz. You call Orbitz, and they say they have to call the Hyatt to see about your change. Really? Anyway, after being there 3 days we finally got to change to a better room than the 2nd floor room above the patio rooms with the screaming children and barely any ocean view, some "Deluxe Ocean View Room" that was. The area in which the Hyatt is in is perfect, Kaanapali is a great place to be, the weather is very favorable there. I probably would come here again but do my booking differently, the resort is very pretty with many things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much we didn't leave the resort until check out!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly63
Reviews.Content: We were here for only 2 nights after a 5 night stay in Wailea. On arrival a valet parked our car and we didn't leave the resort for the next 48 hours of bliss. The Regency Club was excellent. Superb staff and the place was always immaculate despite being very busy especially during breakfast period. Spent most of our stay at the main part of the pool next to the waterfall. It's heated so we were ready to jump in straight after breakfast. The deeper section was a quiet area to swim in and was mostly kid free, bonus! My teen daughter enjoyed the big slide and shooting hoops in the pool. Only negative was the grotto was grotty. Under the waterfall is a nice shady section of pool but the area is a little smelly. It's naturally dark of course but also dank and a little too sulfurous at times. Easily avoided but an alternative swim up bar would have been nice as the one in the grotto was deafening due to the two waterfalls plus the off putting aroma unpleasant. Plenty of loungers and the best fluffy yellow towels of any hotel that I've visited. Shout out to the towel staff poolside; very friendly, efficient and polite. Poolside restaurant was very good and we also enjoyed the shops within the hotel. Beautiful lobby with penguins (wow, so cute!), parrots and then stunning gardens with swans, ducks, flamingoes and a crane. When we could drag ourselves away from the pool the beach was our second home. Whale watching was wonderful right at the shoreline. Did not want to leave and I'm planning a return trip for a longer stay asap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: mlachance
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Hyatt Regency. I was a little worried about staying there based on reviews I read before we went. I couldn't have been more relieved when we got there. We were lucky to get a partial ocean view room even though we had booked a standard room. There were nights where we slept with the slider to the balcony open so we could listen to the waves all night. Our kids loved the pools. They mainly stayed in the kiddie pool area. The area in the pictures below show this. There is one area where the water is only about 1 â€“ 2 feet deep (where you see all the floating animals). This area also has a small slide for the little kids. The area right behind that area (beyond the nets) is around 5 feet deep. There is a much larger slide that empties into that area. Kids must be at least 48â€³ tall to go on that slide. The slide empties into water that is about 9 feet deep. My older son, husband and I loved the slide. My younger son wasnâ€™t tall enough to go on it but he loved the smaller slide. The larger slide take 5 â€“ 7 seconds to slide down. There is a larger pool area that we didnâ€™t spend any time at. The water is deeper â€“ 4 feet and up. Between the kiddie pool and the larger pool is a cave area that has waterfalls at both entrances. The grotto bar is located in the cave. About the only â€œcomplaintâ€� that I have is that I wish there was a pool area where the depth was around 3 â€“ 3 1/2 feet deep. There were some areas, right where you get in that were around that depth but they quickly got deeper to around 5 feet deep. The kiddie pool was quite shallow and 5 feet deep is too deep for most kids. I had read some reviews that werenâ€™t so favorable before we went. Many people talked about some construction that they were doing to update the hotel. Iâ€™m happy to say that that seemed to be over when we were there. We saw no signs of construction. And as you can tell from our room pictures, the hotel is very up to date. There were also some comments complaining about parking. We had absolutely no issues with parking even when the luau was happening. There are 4 parking lots that you can use. Two are fairly small in the front of the hotel (to the right as youâ€™re entering the resort). Thereâ€™s also a rather large parking lot in the back of the resort (the entry is to the left right before the circle for valet parking). We never had a time when we couldnâ€™t find parking in one of those 3 lots. However, if those are ever full, you can also park in the self-parking lot near the golf course. We did have a little mishap with our reservation we made for Camp Hyatt. We booked Camp Hyatt and a dinner at Japengo through the e-Concierge site. We got confirmation notices on both. However, when we went to Camp Hyatt to drop off the kids, it was closed. We went to the Concierge Desk. It took about a half hour but everything got resolved and we made our reservation at Japengo. Although Japengo is pricey (as some have complained), that is to be expected on Maui and the dinner was one of the best I've ever had. And the kids had a great time at Camp Hyatt. They made "stained glass" crafts and watched the Smurf movie. We loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui. We found everyone we encountered to be very friendly. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and the kids loved the pools. There was so much to do at the resort and itâ€™s located at Kaâ€™anapali Beach. I would definitely recommend this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly an excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: aretiredtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a real five star hotel, except for the somewhat uncomfortably firm beds. Located at a strategic spot on Kaanapali Beach, it's within walking distance of good restaurants at Whaler's Village. Morning walks on the beach were fun. We included breakfast in our reservation (served in Son'z al fresco overlooking a pond), which was copious, excellent and convenient. Having a car made Lahaina easily accessible for other dining choices (and self parking is free).

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at the Hyatt Regency in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Scurry49428
Reviews.Content: We visited last year with the kids and returned this past January without them. What a great hotel. From the time we arrived the staff treated us great. We were celebrating our anniversary and the front desk set us up with a free dinner for two at Japengas. As a daimond member with Hyatt we were upgraded to the regency level. As usual, the Regency Club was very nice. The breakfast was good but not great but the appetizers and dessert at night were fantastic. The staff in the Regency Club are very friendly and helpful, especially Karen. Karen was able to get us reservations at Japengas the same day we requested and she even got us a table close to the ocean. The hotel was busy but it didn't feel crowded by the pool. There was always plenty of lounge chairs and the service at the pool bars was excellent. This hotel is great for couples and families. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Anniethompson
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little dated but was very clean. Terrible view over the roof however. The bars and restaurants at the hotel were fab and the staff were wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Great Family vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: JillRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hyatt in Lahaina. The property was beautiful and our daughter (8) loved the pool and waterside. They had a great workout facility and there is a 2.5 mile loop to run along the beach. It is in walking distance to Whaler's Village (shopping). Overall- we were thrilled we picked the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: sballeh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first 4 nights of our honeymoon here and loved it. We stayed in the penthouse ocean front room, talk about a view. Being on Eastern time, I woke up before sunrise each morning to an awesome sunrise. Also, we really enjoyed watching the whales right out in front of the hotel...just watch the boats chasing after them and you will spot the spouts in no time. Also, going to bed each night with waves crashing in the background was so nice. Everything and everyone at the hotel was so nice. The front desk was extremely helpful and the restaurant was really good (pricey but definitely worth trying 1 night). If you get a chance, check out Mala which is just as you enter Lahaina...so good. We even ran into a fellow Clemson Tiger there who was the bar tender. Really cool guy and recommended the Seared Ahi Bruschetta....you will not regret it! We did not do the Luah although it looked pretty cool. From our room, we pretty much experienced the whole thing minus the food/drinks from our balcony. The beach trail in front of the hotel was pretty cool too. This was a lot of rambling, but the Hyatt was great and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Do you like penguins?”
Reviews.Author: sonic1us
Reviews.Content: yes, everybody loves penguins!! they were so cute. They live in the hotel lobby!! Everything was fablous; pools, food, fitness room and rooms. Each room had a fridge and coffee pots. We rented a car from the hotel and had no problems with it. The bell staff was very helpful. Newspapers delivered every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dg1ANDonly
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a beautiful property. The views from the ocean front rooms are amazing. The rooms are adequate in size and nicely furnished...mind you nothing fancy. The beds are platform beds and not very comfortable unless you like a VERY firm mattress for sleeping . The rooms are layed out well, and you are able to move about easily......BUT the biggest drawback, especially of the ocean fron rooms...no matter what floor you are on..We were on the 20th) are extremely noisy. I truly enjoy sitting on the balcony and watching the whales and the beautiful sunsets, but each afternoon-evening until at least 9:00PM sometimes later, there was loud live music being played at both of the outdoor venues, and somestimes three. Each resturant...Japango, and Umulu had their own performer with different types of music...so the noise that one heard in the middle was not really pleasant. Out of the 7 nights that we were there, 4 of the nights they had outside parties on the lawns below. One night it was a birthday party of about 100 people with a live band that was great, but went until 11:00 or so, mixed in with the other venues music was not very peaceful. The other large parties were obviously companies who were using the hyatt for their meetings. Great idea, but Hyatt should have alternate area for these types of events so that the guests not involved with the business can have some peace and quiet that one pays for when on a "relaxing" vacation. Our room was a nice prime room,and certainly was not inexpensive. We should not have been subjected to the cacophony of noise and lack of privacy . The resturants Japangeo,and Swan court serve very good food...again not inexpensive...but good. The service in japango is slow and disappointing. The settings are beautiful. The main pool is nice but crowded with the usual people who awake at 6:am to through their towels on a chair, and don't show up till noon.. They have a seperate smaller area especially for kids which includes a water slide etc. and is nice. We have stayed at this hyatt in the past, but this time the experience was somewhat more challenging. We won't be returning to this property. If you don't mind the noise on a continual basis, this could be a hotel for you. It has the location and the setting, but you pay dearly for both. (including 25.00 resort fee which gives you "free internet" not high speed, and 18.00 valet parking fee. ( We did get a lei upon arrival from very pleasant and efficient staff members.) Free

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: zeb h
Reviews.Content: The hotel accommodations were beautiful. The views were heart stopping from my room, and Swan Court was the most amazing place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Great_Expectations84
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed that we were not lei'd upon arrival! The Front Office staff had them there behind the counter when we showed up with our suitcases. Was it not made clear that we were checking in even though we said that we were checking in? As if we were going to ask for them! By the end of the trip I was lei'd countless times so this is not a deal breaker. But if the Hyatt wants to call themselves a five star and they have the staff right there and the lei right there - and I say "Hi Im checking in" - they need to be on the ball. The Deluxe Ocean View rooms are recently renovated and they do have a nice view of the sea, Lanai in the distance as well as lush garden-like grounds below. Ask for a room on a higher floor to receive the best view possible. These rooms are nice and tastefully decorated; not "too Hyatt" and not "too Hawaiian". Good large sized closet and robe, but no slippers. Private triangular balcony with table and two chairs. The staff were nice and mostly from the mainland USA. For example, we met so many people from Boston, all wonderful and very friendly. The restaurants we tried at the hotel were too expensive and not very good. Even the breakfast buffet; not very good. Plus it is inescapably indoor/outdoor and therefore there are lots of birds flying around your food. (We had a delicious dinner at the Honua Kai down the beach, prices much more reasonable in comparable if not better location.) The hotel is way to big something like 800 or so but it feels like thousands and thousands. Took me 10 minutes to hustle from my room on the 8th floor down to the main lobby area. But because the hotel is too big there are many shops including a large Macy's and everything you could require. The expansive grounds are gorgeous, very well maintained, floral and lush. Meandering pathways, Asian Gardens and penguins. So many amenities here to choose from. A great number of pools - though not always open - and a groovy Grotto Pool Bar! Valet was friendly; efficient. One thing I must mention that truly impressed me: housekeeping. We took the Haleakala Sunrise Volcano tour and had to leave the hotel at 2:30am. I was so happy to find my room had already been made up - upon my return to the hotel about 10:00am. Could hardly believe it! It makes sense though. People who take these tours do not like having someone interrupt them while they're trying to catch a few zzzz during prime maid service hours. Clearly the hotel listened and has found a away around this. Fantastic, well done!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - no way!!!”
Reviews.Author: MauijonYoungtown
Reviews.Content: You listed the Sheraton Maui as one fo the top 10 pools - did whoever do that review ever go there??? It is a nothing blah pool - go downt he beach to the other end of Kaanapali and take a look at the Hyatt pool - waterfalls, bridges, cave bar; fabulous kids pool - this should have been on your list. !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachesVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to over 40 countries and I can't understand how anyone can give this hotel a negative review. My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt from Feb 3-12th and absolutely everything was perfect!!! We travelled to Maui with 54 of our closest friends and family to celebrate our wedding on the 8th! Only half the group stayed at the Hyatt but all we heard from our guests was how much they enjoyed the Hyatt! Not once did we hear a complaint, a testament to a truly outstanding hotel! My husband and I were upgraded from ocean view to ocean front ( see attached pics) and we couldn't have been happier with our room. The rooms were much more spacious than we imagined, equipped with a fridge to store drinks and snacks and the lanai perfect for two! Most mornings we would sit on our lanai with our coffee watching the whale show below! Wow we must have seen 10 whales every day we were there!! My Maid of honour and I visited the heavenly spa the eve before our wedding. Loved the massage and the thermal bath/steam rooms. I also worked out at the gym every day prior to our wedding and it was top notch! Love the little extras like cold face cloths and lemon water! The Hyatt grounds are absolutely breathtakingly beautiful. We have visited some really nice places, from Asia to the South Pacific and we both agreed the Hyatt and the Kaanapali strip was one of the most beautiful areas we had ever seen, after 10 days I was still in awe!! The pool is fantastic, the service top notch and many of the waitresses remembered my favourite drinks from day to day. Although the drinks were expensive we didn't find the pool side restaurant too pricey and the food was delicious, especially the tuna salad! We only ordered room service once to the room and although we loved our breakfast on the lanai, at $85 for two we only did it once as a morning after our wedding treat! Many reviewers have complained about the beach at the Hyatt but after spending an afternoon at the beach in front of the Sheraton we all agreed that we loved the beach down our end better. Although the beach is narrower it was way less crowded, the ocean much calmer and just a more peaceful atmosphere with less people around. We walked by all the hotels on the boardwalk and besides the Westin which looked very nice, we thought the Hyatt was the best looking hotel on the strip! We have allready raved to all our friends about our fabulous stay at the Hyatt and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!! Thank you very much for a wonderful memorable stay and for all the little honeymoon extras we received at check-in. Mahalo,

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for toddlers”
Reviews.Author: dawnchan
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week a the Hyatt in Maui with a three year old and we loved it! All of their rooms are well outfitted and spacious. Our favourite room was the ocean view room beside the kids pool where you could just walk out your lanai to the grass and take in the ocean sunsetting. Really convenient to go in and out all day long. The kids pool is fantastic for toddlers, you can really kick bac k and relax as they play in the sand, go on the slide, jump in all the little tide pools and all not more than in a foot of water. Together or with a life jacket you can venture under the waterfalls to the large pool, swim up to the bar or play some pool basketball. The kids menus were very reasonable and to their palates. We had a couple of dinners at Japengo but for fish/suishi I preferred hopping in the car and going to Roy's. The luau is one of the best if you want to take one in as well. For a more lively scene and cocktails etc I would head up to Whaler's Village. Lunch at Leilani's or the Hula Grill. Also before 7pm you can do a three course at Leilani's for a good deal. I liked their macadamia mahi mahi. Their desserts are a disaster. I also totally recommend to go down to baby beach in Lahaina, you can walk out forever it is so shallow!

Reviews.Title: “An OK Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Totham
Reviews.Content: Situated on a nice but small beach alongside a few other hotels and close to a shopping and restaurant area. The building is a bit austere with open air atrium "airport style" around which rooms and noise rise. Variety of pools suitable for families with young children , external areas were a bit tight when we were there as hotel was full. Reasonable size rooms but bath/wc small with separate vanity area. Sonz restaurant was very good for food quality and service, Two Swans breakfast ($30/head) buffet restaurant was also nice with ocean view and fish pools. Its an ok hotel suited for families and as we are a couple I would not use again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Chul A
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Maui is a beautiful and relaxing resort. The ocean view is fantastic! The hotel ground is beautiful, and pools are really great! I really enjoyed every minute of the resort until I had a dinner at Sonz (Swan Court). Sonz is a really nice restaurant. The food was great. However, the attitude of a waiter (man who wore white shirts. He looks like a manager. His clothes are different from that of other waiters) is really bad. He spilled the beer at my table. He did not say anything, and left the table. He is not kind. When we finished our entree, he left the check. Even though our party size is two, he wrote 20% tip on the check and left. I cannot believe the attitude of the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to see the whales!”
Reviews.Author: Seattletravel_11
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hyatt in Feb. to see the whales. It was great to be able to see them right off shore. The hotel itself is large, with beautiful grounds, pretty pools, and great dining options. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “an ok Hyatt hotel”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days as part of a work conference. We had a hard time finding the hotel as the hotel signage is quite inconspicuous. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was quite spacious and clean. The gym/tennis facilities were excellent. I had a lot of trouble with the wireless and I wasted over an hour on the phone with technical support to try to fix it but no luck. The front desk manager said she would send someone to my room to fix it within 10 minutes. I waited over an hour and no one came. I gave up and just used the wireless in the lobby which worked very well. I tried to get a 1 pm checkout but was told it was impossible. Oh well. Anyway, it was a nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort”
Reviews.Author: rhnaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt last fall and found the resort to be well situated along the walking path on Kanapali to all the other hotels and Whalers Village. It is an older resort but the grounds were very well kept and all the staff very accommodating and friendly. During that period, the hotel was just preparing for renovations in the lobby and main entrance, so there was construction draping present everywhere. We found the food at the hotel on the expensive side, especially the buffet breakfast at the Swan restaurant for what they were serving as compared to many of the all-inclusive resorts we have visited in the Caribbean. Otherwise, the quality of food at the self-serve restaurant by the pool was good. We had a ground floor room which turned out to be convenient when making trips back and forth to the pool. As proof of the superior service we received, my wife accidentally flushed one of her contact lens down the sink. Luckily, she immediately stopped the drain and called concierge, who dispatched a maintenance staff to our room. Within a matter of 15 minutes from the time of her call, my wife's contact lens was retrieved. Now that's service. We also utilized the tennis courts and took a couple of lessons with the resident Pro, whom we found was very knowledgeable in providing pointers to improving our game. Our only minor negative to the property would be parking. Unless you utilize valet parking - which can get expensive if you come and go a number of times throughout the day - there is limited number of free self-parking spots on the grounds. All in all, if you can obtain a reasonable rate for the Hyatt, we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July for a week for my honeymoon and would highly recommend this hotel. On arrival, the staff had noted on the system that it was our honeymoon we were presented with gifts including free bottle of wine at the hotel restaurant plus a room upgrade with a beautiful ocean view. Throughout our stay, the staff were extremly helpful. Included in the room prices was the buffet breakfast which had a wide selection of food. The rooms were spacious and cleaned regulary. We will defiantly be returning here in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt, Maui”
Reviews.Author: the_proms
Reviews.Content: Just concluded our trip to Maui, and stayed at the Hyatt for 9 nights in Jan-Feb 2012, and I will say, the renovations which everyone is complaining about, are done. Overall, our experience as a family was a positive and if we found a got a good deal, we'd stay here again. Check in was without a hitch, no wait and was done before it started. We received water and shell necklaces and we were quickly taken to our room with baggage delivery via a very friendly bellboy. Location, location, location! Talk about amazing, with a walkway along the beach, one way to a beach, the other to Whaler's Village area and beaches...walked this daily/nightly with our kids...GREAT GREAT GREAT, cannot say enough about it. Rooms are on the nicer side, and I do not know what anyone would complain about. There is even a spacious walk in closet with ironing board, robes, etc. There are 2 fridges, one is a bar, the other is for your own stuff, which we always fill with Costco goodies before arrival. Word to the wise, have the tray of yummies removed immediately, or you will be charged because it is 'weighed' and any movement can cause charges to you. Beds are platform beds, so pretty low to the ground, which didn't bother us at all. The pillows were great and we all slept VERY well during our stay. The grounds of the hotel are really neat with all the wildlife (my kids adored R2-D2, Luna, Roger, Shrek) and has a very Asian vibe, as most Hawaiian hotels do. And the upkeep was pretty spot on. The pools (although could use a little tlc) are nice, and VERY busy and the setup is a bit awkward. This hotel isn't a romance hotel by any means, so keep that in mind! There are a lot of kids and with kids comes chaos, especially when mom and dad have checked out to be in 'vaca' mode. And at the pool is no different. You will get splashed at unexpected times, you will hear laughing and goofing off and you will see kids... The kiddie area is really a great area for kids under 5. Above that, they'll get bored fast. Also, there is only 1 hot tub, located right NEXT to the kiddie area...don't know who's idea that was... They offer free pool classes and snuba (scuba/snorkel) demos daily which are neat little perks. They let my 9 yr old son do it multiple times; we didn't buy the trip as it is pretty pricey...but he did enjoy it a lot in the pool. There is staff everywhere at this hotel, always cleaning, picking up, etc, so I was pretty surprised to see some slack in the cleanliness. I kinda felt like their thoughts at the hotel was to clean what's seen but leave the unseen uncleaned. For instance, in our room, there looked to be maybe soda spray by our bed/lamp that was not caused by us, and was not removed/cleaned the whole stay. Or, the sand collected in my kids shoes was never vacuumed up from the corner I pushed it into during our entire stay. And the little nooks and crannies that kids find in hotels, those areas were in need of some tlc. This said, the hotel did not lack in clean open spaces that people frequent, just makes me wonder... Food-wise, only ate at Umalu's 2 times, during lunchtime next to the poolside via poolside service, which is AWESOME, but yes, expensive, get over it! You don't have to order! My family loved the garlic fries, biggest basket of fries I've ever seen! And I absolutely adored the Chop Chop Salad. It's the best salad I've EVER eaten in my entire life. Parking...it's been said, I don't have much more to say. Yes, you have to pay. Yes, the parking is limited. Yes, they are tiny spaces. This is ALWAYS the case in Hawaii...ALWAYS. f you're going to enjoy anything on the island, try The Pacific Whale Foundation's activities. They are top notch, respecting the ocean, and everything goes to help the ocean life. We enjoyed our whale excursion a lot and will remember it forever. Amazing. Had a great great great time AGAIN, cannot wait to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: It is nearly 12 months since our stay and the Hyatt Regency but the memories are still vivid. The Hyatt still ranks as one of the best resorts my wife and I have stayed at. Friendly staff, people, community and with picturesque scenery you cannot go wrong. The hotel boasts many restaurants, activities, pools and bars, you can find yourself being busy or happy doing not a lot at all... and thatâ€™s ok. I normally enjoy writing long reviews, but if I was to write about everything good at the Hyatt I would be here all day. I would recommend this resort and the community of Kaanapali to nearly anyone. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Second favorite Maui bed to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: LTFrench
Reviews.Content: Top place to stay in on this side of the island. Repeat customers here. We keep coming back for more. (Grand Wailea would be our top pick but there location is not convenient at all)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel on Ka'anapali beach”
Reviews.Author: beachbro
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here on minivacation. The service was really nice, from check in to check out. The location is great, pleanty to see and do nearby. Be prepared for a VERY crowded pool deck area. Folks go down around 7-8am to throw towels on chairs and reserve a spot. Good luck finding a poolchair after 10am. The pool is very cool and even has a deep end. 9ft I think, Theyalso have a water slide for the kids and kids at heart. Good times.

Reviews.Title: “Impresive Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Scot-at-YEG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five nights as part of a conference. The resort is really very impressive it has a beautiful setting right on the ocean with extensive gardens, numerous pools and extensive and well-kept landscaping with a range of birds and other animals. I experienced a luxury king room that overlooked the main swimming pool and towards the beach. This room was well appointed with computer-sized safe, mini-bar and a separate fridge. There were nice toiletries, fluffy towels, very comfortable bed and large plasma TV with a good range of channels. Room had patio sliding doors onto a very small balcony (lanai) that received lots of sun and was a great place to view the sunset. Room was cleaned up each day by cheery and pleasant staff. Indeed all staff in hotel were exceptionally nice and provided a first class experience. Pools were clean, had ample loungers, and waitress bar and food service was pleasant. On the negative side, the breakfast buffet was fairly expensive and was only of standard quality. Sure, it is located in a beautiful location open to a waterfall and pool with swans gliding by, but seating appears limited as there are often long line-ups to get in. There was a custom omelette station, but lines were long and slow and the cook was overworked and grumpy. There was also the conventional mix of cereals, muffins, breads as well as other cooked items such as eggs, bacon and sausages. Interestingly, they also offered a Japanese-style selection (miso soup, etc). I did not experience hotel lunches or dinners as I was told there are many better places in nearby Lahaina. Warning â€“ do not leave a plate of food on your table as it will be attacked by flocks of small birds; wearing a hat is also a good idea as these well-fed free-loaders to require frequent bathroom breaks. Another negative was the evening show (luau). In fact it was so bad in so many respects â€“ food, although plentiful, was of poor quality; waiter service for open bar was so slow, I had to serve myself; wine and beer quality was extremely poor; and the show itself was dreadful, particularly the smarmy/cheesy MC and the faux-rock stage setting was ridiculous. I would certainly not recommend this event.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous suite, crowded pool”
Reviews.Author: StressedOutTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at my Hyatt's, and they recently renovated this one. I got upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Suite which was absolutely stunning- I never wanted to leave the room. My one complaint about this hotel is the pool situation- for such a huge complex, they only have one hot tub and they do not offer enough shade. Umbrellas is a cheap and easy fix- people were literally putting their towels out at 6am by the pool to get a good spot with some shade. For such a nice hotel, this is ridiculous and guests should not have to play such "pool and towel games."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: KcCabinfever
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hyatt for a conference in January. It is a stunning resort. The grounds are very well kept and beautiful. We had an oceanview room, it was very nice. Our beds were comfortable, the view was awesome. My only compliant about our room is when we opened the balcony to listen to the waves the birds in the gardens below were so loud that we couldn't enjoy it at all. So we spent very little time on the balcony. The beach in front of the hotel isn't as nice as some of the other hotels just up the pathway. It is pretty rocky so watch your feet. There is a long stretch of beautiful beach up closer to Black Rock, so grab your towel and go for a little stroll. The pool area is nice with plenty of loungers to be enjoyed. There is a cool water slide on the other side of the Grotto bar but be careful, the water at the end of the slide is very deep. This was a bit of a shocker as I shot out the end of the slide. I was trying to compose myself (wiping eyes and coughing up pool water) all while treading water because I couldn't touch. The food is expensive, but what we had we enjoyed. Ordered room service once, it was fast and the food was hot. Service at the Hyatt was terrific from check in, housekeeping, grounds workers, restaurants to check out. Overall I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort on the beach”
Reviews.Author: sajopik
Reviews.Content: We've had an ocean and mountain view corner room. Clean rooms, very nice customer service. Hotel located on the beach. Very nice restaurants and bars. A bit pricey but worth the money. Hotel located close to black rock with fabulous snorkeling experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Everything about the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Ashley K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in everything from 2 stars to 5 stars, and a firm believer in you get what you pay for. If this is you continue to read this review. (keep in mind we are a couple that is upper 20's and lower 30's, 1st time to Maui) Trip: Jan. 22-Jan.28. My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for business and leisure. Conference: The only thing I didn't appreciate is, I wasn't allowed to eat breakfast with my husband in the conference buffet area, unless we wanted to pay $40-$50 per day for me to eat with him. Rooms: The rooms offer a great space, beds are comfy, great closet space and counter space by the mirror. The only complaint about the room would be the partial ocen view, if I was to recommend anyone to not waste the money on the partial because you had to look around the corner to see the ocean. Either splurge and get the ocean view or just get a downgraded view. Service: I loved the service! They use your name at most restuarants, they offer great service in the hotel, poolside, and throughout the restaurants. They also allowed us to check in an hour early which was great after traveling for a whole day. Restaurants: Our favorite was Japengo, we ate there 2 nights. My suggestion is to make reservations to get a seat on their gorgeous terrace seating or indoor seating. The first night we didn't have reservations and had to eat by the bar which was excellent as well. But the second time they gave us an awesome table with a breathtaking view of the sunset. Umalu: Great nachos and salads by the pool. Swan Court: Excellent breakfast buffet. I also ate off the menu which was excellent, the service here is one of the best in the hotel! The only thing I would have liked to see is the ability to order more items a la carte versus having to get such large portions off the menu. Location: It is walking distance to Whaler's Village, which is a bunch of great shops. Walking distance to other great restuarants including Longboards and Hula Grill (recommend the Gado-Gado salad and the fish and chips)! You are also able to walk to many tourist activities including certain dinner cruises and sailing excursions that pick you up on the beach. The Hyatt is located towards the end of that hotel strip making it just minutes away from downtown Lahaina which offers more great restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe, Cheeseburger in Paradise, etc), shops, and a Safeway for groceries. However, I would avoid Lahaina when a cruise ship is docked, it is jam-packed with people. Great snorkeling right in front of the hotel tons of fish, turtles, and more! Rent the snorkel gear for $40 for the whole week!!! Concierge: The desk was very helpful and towards the end of the week we canceled one of our excursions and because we gave 24 hour notice they gave us a full return. They also assist in setting up dinner reservations. Hertz: Do yourself a favor and rent a car before you arrive. They are able to get you a vehicle through the hotel if they are not sold out, but they charge a lot and the lady that helped us was not overly enthused about checking different prices before we made a choice on what to pick for a vehicle. Fitness Center: I used the fitness center every morning. I did go early, around 4:30-5 am, after about 6 am it does pretty full and could be difficult if you are hoping to snag a particular piece of cardio equipment. But overall the equipment is some of the best of the Life Fitness brand. They offer sanitized headphones, water coolers (regular water & lemon flavored), cool towels, wide variety of equipment. Pool: Since I was up early I was always able to get a good spot by the pool. The pool is great, relaxing, and quiet (they don't play loud music). I could see this being a big complaint by late-risers, because people show up early and place items on the chairs to hold spots and then I watched some people not show up until 10:30 or 11:30 to use their chairs. I usually laid by the pool at 7:30 or 8 am and stayed until mid-afternoon. The rule is supposed to be after an hour your chair is gone, but how do you regulate that? Therefore, my suggestion follow what the trend is, if you want a good spot, get up early place items or towels on your chairs before you go to breakfast. Since this is a family resort I was worried about kids being around splashing, screaming etc. But they placed the kids pool on the other side of the Grotto bar and bathrooms between the two pools keeping most of the kids on the kids side. Besides they have a huge waterslide and a lot of fun kids stuff to do by the kids pool making all the kids want to be over there. Resort Fees: The resort fees are kind of a bummer, they should just add it to the room total. We did get wi-fi for approximately for four days, I think they should give free wi-fi to the guest of the hotel if they are going to charge the resort fee of $15 extra a day.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Club Worth It”
Reviews.Author: mubbs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hyatt and I must say was very happy with the exception of a couple of things. I expected this to be a crowded place. It is a large resort with crowded pools but we are not pool people. At any time I walked by the pool area there were empty spots. The grounds are beautiful and the wildlife,especially the penguins are a bonus. The staff,especially the Regency Club Staff was very friendly and helpful. We walked the beach without problem and I actually sat on the beach one day just to read and whale-watch. We saw whales from our balcony every day. The Regency Club made our stay fantastic with soda and water available throughout the day plus breakfast,snacks, pupus and dessert. Well worth (to us) the extra cost. My negative comment is that even the Regency Club has that goofy snack tray taking up valuable counter space and is "motion sensitive". It is in the way all of the time. Why would anyone pay that much for a snack? I also have a problem with the "resort fee". Why not include in the room fee??But I realize that all resorts do this on Maui. And,yes, the parking stalls are small..Rent a small car. We had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: wharthog521
Reviews.Content: we stayed here a few months ago. hotel is in a great area - feels a little run down/not extremely luxurious but the views are nice from the top and the open atrium is a cool touch. i agree, the pools are pretty crowded but didn't think it was too bad. we'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dated”
Reviews.Author: riveroutlook
Reviews.Content: Great location,helpful staff.Buffet a little ordinary for the price.Rooms look a little tired and the bathroom was very last century.I had to get my husband to turn the shower on as it required more strength than I had.Bed great and birds in the grounds a highlight.pools great as well.Overall fot the price not really worthwhile.Finally the rooms were very noisy.Not so much from adjoining rooms but more from the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but beware of "resort view" rooms”
Reviews.Author: MAGLUVSTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: I booked two "resort view" rooms at the Maui Hyatt for the week of Jan 7-14, 2012. Upon check in I was assigned room #1404 and room #1502. I expected both rooms to have views of the interior courtyard, or nearby golf course, or even a parking lot. #1502 was okay. But, look at #1404! I complained and the Hyatt did give me a new room the following afternoon - room #1704. Overall, the Hyatt is a lovely property. It is located at the quiet end of Ka'anapali Beach, has a great pool for kids, fantastic gym and very fresh seafood at the Sushi restaurant. I would stay there again, but only if I got an ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a ton of revocations in the hallways and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Southerncal12
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Regency from 12/26-12/31/2011. 2nd visit to this same hotel years ago. The grounds are beautiful along with most of the property being well maintained. All of that still looked the same, if not nicer since our last visit to the Hyatt. The only one other thing that remained the same which was not a nice surprise was that the rooms were still very old, popcorn ceilings in the rooms, i and it looked like nothing had been upgraded in many, many years. The rooms are very outdated and the room we were in needed a lot of patch work here and there and just some new up to date bedspreads, beds, pull-out couches, etc. We had to have a roll-away brought up to us because the mattress on the pull-out couch was so old it could not be used. The bathrooms need to be renovated also. The carpets need to be replaced in the room we were in. The help at the front desk was great. If you did not get down to the pool by no later than 8 a.m., you would not be able to get a chair to sit on unless you wandered around and waited for other to leave so you could have their chair.

Reviews.Title: “Charming resort on Paradise Island”
Reviews.Author: Dorcas A
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved our stay at the Hyatt. It is a great resort for families or couples. The location was really good, there was good shopping nearby, and it was a short drive to get to other key places on the Island. While the Hyatt beach isnâ€™t very good or swimmable â€“ all you have to do is walk along the beach for a few metres and you will find a much better swimming area. We stayed in a secluded and quiet area in Kauai, so we were happy to see that the Hyatt was in a much busier location in Maui surrounded by plenty of restaurants, at the same time it was a short drive to more secluded quiet beaches/areas. Our room was nice and modern, spacious and clean. The only negative was the bathroom, Iâ€™m really picky about bathrooms and I hate when 4 or 5 start luxury resorts have the shower over the bath and a plastic shower curtain! The Service was good and efficient. The Hyatt grounds are superb, it is like a zoo, there is wildlife everywhere including penguins and parrots that talk! One day a monk seal flopped itself down for the day on the Hyatt beach, that was amazing to see. The pool area is huge and has a swim up bar which is always a cool feature. We attended the Hyattâ€™s drums of the Pacific Luau and I would not recommend it. It is far too expensive for what you get. The food is cheap buffet food and while the performances are ok, it is definitely not worth the amount you pay. For half the price you could go to another Luau which would probably be of the same quality. One activity I definitely recommend doing is hiring a car and driving the road to Hana. This was my favourite part of our whole trip to Hawaii â€“ it is absolutely spectacular and the seven sacred pools at the end is well worth the sometimes hair raising drive! Maui was our favourite of the 3 islands we visited, the island is just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt remains marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Bentley
Reviews.Content: Starting with the welcoming check-in personnel, the helpful commentary during the escorted first trip to our waterfront room and the gracious attitude throughout our five day visit, this resort exuded the "aloha" spirit and friendly attitude that makes a stay at this Hyatt a truly relaxing and happy one. Maui is wonderful and this Kaanapali locale is a perfect headquarters for seeing the whole island. Recommended highly.

Reviews.Title: “A very underwhelming honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: VeggingOut
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt Regency around midday from Australia for a 6 day stay for our honeymoon. We has spent a huge amount of money for this 'honeymoon destination' but we are very disappointed!!! We were told our room would be ready within a number of minutes, we went and waited and ate lunch by the pool for an hour then headed back to reception and were told by another receptionist that our room wouldn't be ready until 4pm (another 3 hours), I told the receptionist I wasn't feeling too well and asked if there was anywhere I could sit out of the cold and wind- she said she didn't know. When we got to our room luggage department had misplaced our luggage because reception had taken our luggage ticket. We paid more in our package for breakfast- not worth it! There was bird faesces on our plates and finches flying all through the dining area. Our mini-bar wouldn't unlock and staff did nothing for 3 days (even after I had called 4 times about it), maintenance finally came to fix it. Our balcony door wouldn't open and when I inquired about it they said maintenance would fix it- they didn't. This has been the least special honeymoon possible- thanks to rude and ignorant staff at the Hyatt that left me in tears!

Reviews.Title: “I was here for a medical conference so I had to stay”
Reviews.Author: dermgoddess
Reviews.Content: The location is gorgeous, but there are quite a few deficiencies that need to be corrected IF this is truly a four star hotel. First and foremost, I arrived at 11:30 pm. There were no self-parking spots to be had anywhere. The self parking lot is dark and the spots are cramped. I parked in the valet lot, and the walk from the parking lot to the hotel is dark and dangerous. Secondly, maid service is not up to what I considered four star. I had to contact the management at 2:30 when my room was still not cleaned. In all fairness to management, a basket of goodies was sent up to my room. Nice, but not necessary. And in fact, my room has not been made up before noon, any day since. Third, the rooms are somewhat dated, as it the bathroom. More importantly, the bathroom smells of mildew and mold. I could not see black mold, but the smell was ghastly. The bed IS very comfortable, on a positive note. Fourthly, lunch options do not exist! I am here for a conference- I am basically held hostage here. There is only 1 restaurant, and that is a self-service pool bar! Very noisy, crowed, and no real choices---and I am here for 8 days. There is NO room service after 10 am and before 5 pm! How disappointing that no other options exist, not even at the neighboring hotels. Breakfast at Son'z at Swan court is interesting. Typical hotel buffet, however, the view is beautiful with the swans and other birds. BUT, the small birds are a big nuisance and quite annoying. They fly around all over, and if you leave the table to go back to the buffet, the birds swarm all over your plate and cup. YCCH! Lastly, customer service needs improvement. The valet guys are helpful, the housekeeping staff try hard, but the front desk staff, at least in the evenings, need some help. And the people at Umalu are not too helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Maui wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NQuoryo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years ago. Place was really nice and laid back, but had to walk to the beach, Hyatt doesn't have it's own beach. Kaanapali beach is nearby and also nearby shopping area, hotel can shuttle you there. Trips are available for a fee. Their restaurant serves really good, fresh food. Pool is good for kids. There's also a luau, the show was very nice done at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “The honeymoon of our dreams!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maude B
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Hyatt for every travellers, but especially for those celebrating their honeymoon! They had many gifts and surprises for us honeymooners: sparkling wine, free cooking lesson, star-watching with a professional astronomist, etc. We visited the other hotels around (in Kaanapali) and the Hyatt is by far the best! The lobby is breathtaking, the pool is fantastic, the rooms are clean and renovated... and the staff was very helpful and polite. Yes, it is expensive. The restaurants in the resort are also pretty expensive. But still, quality has a price! One last tip: taking a room with breakfast included is really worth it, as the breakfast is a fantastic deluxe all-you-can-eat buffet with an omelet bar, tons of fresh tropical fruit, amazing strong coffee, fresh pastries, etc. It's worth 35$ per person when not included in the room... and it's in the Swans' Court, so you're enjoying your breakfast with swans in a nice pond with waterfalls... this restaurant was voted one of the most romantic restaurants in all the US! We stayed there for 9 nights and we are very happy with our decision to choose the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Way too pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Derksb
Reviews.Content: While the resort was beautiful and the pool was fun this resort was way over priced. Keep in mind that the price per night only covers your room and nothing else. You even have to pay $25 a day to use the pool. Also beware that the mini bar and snacks are on sensors so if you pick something up, regardless of whether or not you consume it, you will be charged. The walkway behind the hotel is nice because it goes along the whole ka'anapali beach, however, the walkway is full of resorts so it was always crowded. If you like the busy resort feel you might appreciate it more but they nickel and dime you every chance they get which made me realize from now on, it's condos all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsrwings
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a belated honeymoon the first week of November. The grounds and the staff were wonderful. The only thing that kept this from being a "5" was the construction going on which we were warned about ahead of time. We really enjoyed walking from the Hyatt property up and down the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother going elsewhere, this is all you need. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: DA_Denver
Reviews.Content: I can tell you one thing, I will not stay anywhere else in Maui. This is wonderful resort. A few tips for your stay: 1. Spring for Regency Club rooms - the snacks are great, free beverages, pastries, fruit, coffee, etc. is an awesome perk. And, given the price of Hawaiian meals in general, this can easily pay for itself as you may not feel like doing the full meal thing after beach / pool or for breakfast. 2. The breakfast buffet is a life altering experience. Not only is the food great (I'm still craving guava pancakes and fresh pineapple), but the view is epic and service spectacular. 3. I also ponied up for the full ocean view. I don't in any way regret this. Especially after grabbing some coffee in the regency club and bringing it back to the room. Something about crashing waves with your coffee on the lanai.. it's literally the greatest way to start a day. You'll notice I don't score high marks in value - this is in no way a negative, but rather, a warning to all those cheapskates who haven't adequately prepared for how much a vacation to HI will cost. I didn't find the Hyatt to be excessive in any regard, and actually booked a great bundle deal through Costco, but be prepared for everything to be expensive from that point on. This includes paying for valet and not trying to save a minuscule amount on parking, understanding that resort drinks will run a steep tab, and the words "great deal" will likely never cross your lips until you return home. A few additional Maui travel tips: 1. Don't rent from Alamo or any of their sister companies (Enterprise, National). Message me if you want to know the nightmare that was my car rental. 2. One of the best meals we had was at a roadside food truck called Big Beach BBQ in Makena. You can find them on facebook. Their fish tacos will change your life. 3. Another great meal I recommend is the Mahi at the Fish Market located in Paia. Go there. Eat. Be happy. 4. Skip the tourist trap that is a luau. Just trust me on this one. Your money is better spent elsewhere. 5. The Road to Hana is a long and painful experience, especially as the driver. Stopping at the 7 sacred pools made it worth every minute. The rest of the drive? Meh.. take it or leave it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Amitbest
Reviews.Content: The resort is very nice, has very good rooms we had one with partial ocean view however it seemed like a full ocean view! We were on our honeymoon and were given a very nice welcome wife loved the photo album given to us and also flowers. The restraints have very nice views especially the Japanese one has great sunset views. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I can't wait to get there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: tarheelfan91
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Maui Invitational. Very nice, large room. Excellent service, The spa is amazing! It is right on the beach and you can sit on the deck in the ocean breeze after your spa treatment. Breakfast buffet was amazing. Hotel offers shuttle from the airport which is convenient. They also will schedule special excursions for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Hoped It Would Be”
Reviews.Author: TracyS1014
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui with my husband and our two adult sons (18 and 20) for a holiday vacation. The boys had a room next to ours and that was perfect. We sprung for the Regency Club and that was well worth it. The staff in the Regency Club was always helpful. The hotel was responsive to the guests. One morning the Regency Club was very crowded for breakfast. Later that day an additional club location was opened and the problem was solved. All of my shopping was done at the hotel. We spent five days lounging at the hotel and leaving only for dinner. I have beautiful photos of the incredible lobby and grounds. Thank you everyone at the Hyatt Regency Maui for a dream vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jillian646
Reviews.Content: My husband & I honeymooned in Hawaii and spent the final 10 nights at the Hyatt Regency in Kaanapali. Overall we enjoyed the resort and facilities, although it wasn't our favorite location in Maui. Kaanapali was the first mega resort development in America (built in 1960s), so the beach is lined with various hotels, restaurants, shops -- which isn't exactly what we wanted for our honeymoon. If you want "true" Hawaii, then I recommend spending a week in Hana. Back to the hotel though... we had an oceanfront deluxe room in the middle building (in front of the pool). Construction was going on during most of our stay, although they were just finishing everything up for Christmas.
