Overall, the hotel location is nice because it's not in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali, but it is within easy walking distance of the Whaler's Village and other hotels. Last week I would have said that I would definitely stay here again. A couple of things have happened that have kind of made me think about looking at other locations for our next trip. One, the availability of pool chairs. Although this sounds petty, it was a big deal to us. As we had a view of the pool, we could easily see when people were saving those seats with their towels early in the morning. A few hours later, the people had never come back but the seats were still being held for them. We were surprised that in October the hotel would be this crowded. Seats were at a premium. The pool staff makes a half-hearted attempt to remove things after 60 minutes. I never saw this happen. I did see them put a couple of signs on seats saying that they would remove items, but it didn't appear that they did so. A few days ago an Arbonne skin care group arrived at the hotel. Nice ladies, but they aren't in meetings. They are at the pool every day. The pool staff told us today that the ladies would save seats for their friends and when they put signs on the chairs, the ladies would remove them so the seats wouldn't be taken by others. Very frustrating when you've been searching for a seat for an hour and no one has sat in several all day. I took a picture of the pool this morning from my balcony at 7:30 am - most of the seats were "taken" by towels and only two people were even in the vicinity of the pool. I think the Hyatt is missing the boat here - they need to do a little bit more and be strict about this policy and have someone monitoring the situation. We are all paying to stay here so we should all have an opportunity to get a seat. We picked the Hyatt in very large part due to their pool but we haven't been able to enjoy it much at all the last few days. VERY frustrating. Another item that we didn't know about was the construction. Perhaps we should have but we didn't find out about it until we arrived and found the front entrance covered and scaffolding all around. The lobby really doesn't have any ambiance due to the construction. It's only done Monday through Friday, but it's loud. We received a letter tonight saying that it will continue through December 20th so just be aware of it if you are traveling during those dates. They are having to make repairs to the lobby ceiling and are re-doing their entrance at the same time. Not as big of a deal as the pool to us, but it would have been nice to know. They have relocated the front desk, conceirge, bell desk and little coffee shop to the Lahaina Tower during the construction. Last, but not least, the parking situation is not so hot. We expected that though. We did visit a few other resorts and they seem to have a better parking situation, but I think it might be tough in this part of Kaanapali. Again, not a deal breaker for us. In summary, our stay was great but the pool could easily be a deal-breaker for us. We love to go on beach vacations and have stayed in Hawaii, Mexico and the Caribbean. We understand about the reserving of chairs. Most resorts try to monitor the situation. The Hyatt really doesn't have a handle on it and I don't think realizes that the pool is a big part of a vacation for many. I will say that the pool is nice and the waterfalls and lava tube are great. Just wished we could have enjoyed it more!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more!”
Reviews.Author: sclmkl
Reviews.Content: Just came back yesterday, rooms were ok, very little drawer space could not unpack as not enough space. Honor bar took up way too much usable space. Undergoing renovations in the lobby, which we were told were emergency repairs but then one of the valets said it wasn't going to start for 2-3 weeks, which is not an emergency in my book. Hotel definitely has wear and tear issues. Had fantastic oceanfront room and view was spectacular dead center in front of main pool in Atrium section. Breakfast buffet was excellent though and service top notch. Self parking was a long walk. Valet service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: GWoyicki
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, parking was a nightmare and we immediately noticed the front and back of the hotel as well as areas of the lobby had scaffolding up and were covered in tarps for future construction. This obstructed views and really took away from the ambiance of the hotel. The rooms were small, they had modern furniture and dÃ©cor but the lanai was small and the bathroom was terrible. Without being too critical all I can say was that the room with the toilet and the shower was cramped and dimly lit. You could tell the shower had not been replaced in quite some time and really just looked dingy. The grounds were nice enough, there were tropical birds stationed throughout; parrots, penguins, flamingos, swans and an African Crane. The pool was very basic, nothing special and it was ALWAYS difficult to find chairs poolside. There was a childrenâ€™s pool, a slide and a swim to grotto bar concealed on both sides by waterfalls (this bar was "swim to", not "swim up" - you had to get out of the water and walk up to the bar). I guess since it looks like they are beginning construction they are going to be doing some updating and it is badly needed. Everything reminded us of visiting grand parents in Florida. It didn't really have that Hawaii feel. I would explore other options before settling on the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Anniethompson
Reviews.Content: Hotel was urn renovation and we weren't informed. Our room had a terrible view of the convention centre roof and the corridor was in need of renewal. Good choice of restaurants and bars with helpful staff. Excellent locTion right on the beachfront and a short walk to other bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn out”
Reviews.Author: wilkinson123
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this fabulous resort for nearly 10 years now and this is first time I have noticed the wear and tear. Looks just a bit beat up and to be honest they are trying to update and remodel while staying open. I great hotel on a great island. Also, the food on Maui in general has deteriorated, the fish at the restaurants seems "old" and many of the servers are not native islanders anymore- seems like an influx of eastern European servers and shop help. What's up with that?

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: CPB1006
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for anything better at Hyatt Regency Maui. The rooms were so clean and comfortable, I felt right at home! I loved the modern furniture and decor, which all had a little touch of Hawaii. The beds are SO comfy, I literally slept like a baby every night! I would definitely recommend upgrading to an Oceanfront Suite...we had two balconies with AMAZING views of the ocean. We could also catch the sunset every night! It's in the perfect location on Kaanapali Beach, easily within walking distance of Whaler's Village and several other restaurants and activities within the area. There are really great surf instructors about a five minute walk up the boardwalk -- which I would highly recommend! The service at the entire property (including the restaurants, bars & pool) was impeccable. You can tell these employees truly love what they do, and they go out of their way to make your stay unforgettable. Japengo is their newest restaurant, which is a great spot to watch the sunset while you dine. Also, the Coconut Creme Brulee is to die for! We also had lunch every day at Umalu's by the pool, which had delicious food as well. The pool is huge, and we could always find two chairs available. They have an awesome waterslide that is even fun for adults! They also have a Grotto Bar in the pool area where my finance could swim by and catch some of the football games that were on last weekend. Definitely take the opportunity to stay here if you can!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “from a very picky beach person...but just perfect....”
Reviews.Author: beachloverjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our 4nites anniversary trip and thought the hotel was gorgeous! It has the best ocean view rooms compared to other resorts along the same strip. Book the delux ocean view and it was all worth it! make sure to get the deals with breakfast included as they have the best breakfast buffet! The hotel is lively, accomodating, clean, beautiful and we thought the decors are really quaint in interesting kinda way. It's our first time in Maui and we were glad to have pick the Hyatt as our stay. The grounds and resort are so clean and well-kept and very family oriented but by no means at all lacking for couple romance. It's in the great location and we fell in love with Maui and our experience and awesome view of the hotel grounds and surroundings! We definitely are looking to come back to this hotel on our next Maui trip. On a side note, Maui is the most beautiful island with lots of activities of all kinds and if you plan to come to Maui try to plan to stay at least 6 nites if you do lots of activities and exploring the island and trying to relax at the same time. by staying a little longer will allow you to enjoy and relax in the hotel when you're not doing any activity and will appreciate the truly experience you have with the Hyatt! yes, they are having construction going on but it did not bother us at all. no noise whatsoever so don't let that stop you from coming to Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on earth”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa W
Reviews.Content: This resort is paradise the grounds were wonderful. We were a party of six and the staff greeted us and was very nice and helpful. The lobby was breathtaking with the open atrium. I had call ahead of time and requested a higher bed for my husband because he is disabling and the housekeeping staff brought us a mattress the night we arrived. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and the grounds were simply beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to Maui. Because I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Why doesn' t Hyatt let you know about the construction when you book”
Reviews.Author: fcdisappointed
Reviews.Content: Checked in Oct 7 for a 5 nite honeymoon stay. Checked out Oct 8 and moved to the Four Seasons for a real honeymoon free from scaffolding and hammering. Very dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice to stay at in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Melissabkatz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a week stay at the Hyatt and we can't say enough good things about it! The hotel is very nice and the room we stayed in was terrific. The service was great as well. We ate at the 2 restaurants at the Hyatt and were impressed with both. Service at the restaurants and by the pool were top notch! Whatever we asked for or needed always came quickly and everyone was so friendly. The only negative encounter we had was with the concierge desk. The few times we went down to speak with someone they either seemed to rush us along or they were taking personal calls. Luckily I did some homework in advance and was able to set up reservations on our own. All in all though we had a great time at the Hyatt and would definitely recommend it to others and hopefully be back there someday ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rookayj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 2 weeks for our honeymoon staying in an ocean front room. The room was a good size and the bed very comfortable. Good selection of food at the Swan Court for breakfast and although you generally had to queue if you went down after 8, it didn't take long to get seated. Our first night we wanted a snack and ended up going to Japengo. By far the best sushi we have had, although it wasn't cheap it was definately worth it. We ended up eating there another 3 times. We also ate at Umalu, which had really good salads and cocktails. We booked our activities with the Expedia desk in the hotel, these included snorkeling at Molokini, surfing, hire car, tour of the stars and ziplining. All of the tours were great although we found the snorkeling to be better by Black Rock than at Molokini, especially as that is where we spotted 3 turtles. We loved the wildlife around the hotel, the penguins were my favourite. The only thing we didn't like was the $25 daily resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: pcianc
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience at the Hyatt Regency Maui in Kaanapali was fantastic. The staff was great â€“ from the front desk and housekeeping to the bartenders at Umalu. We enjoyed the atmosphere and location as well - plenty of restaurant options on the resort or nearby to keep things new and lots of fellow honeymooners and other fun couples to meet. It's a close walk to Whaler's Village which gave us access to a variety of other restaurants and activities. We were most impressed with our VIP Concierge, Monica Ellison. Monica's dinner and activity recommendations along with her overall perspective on the island was authentic and on point. Her enthusiasm and passion for what she does shined through right away and she truly made it a great experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jud54
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival first noticed hotel was under renovation (draped with brown cloth both inside and out) did not make for a very good 1st impression. Then we were given a room on the 1st floor (below lobby) for our resort view room which had not been cleaned. We were told to go out for about 2hrs and it would be cleaned upon our return - we did and it was. The bed was very uncomfortable (low to the floor and very hard with just a mattress on a board). Also the hallway, as soon as you walked off the elevator, had a very bad odor the entire 5 day stay (the doctor's office was on this floor so I do not understand how this odor was not addressed). The hotel charges an additional $25.00 resort fee per night plus $18.00 nightly for valet parking - you can park yourself but lots fill up quickly and are a distance to walk. We booked through a travel agent so I'm not sure of the cost for the room but the front desk told me approximately $325.00 nightly for the room we had (she did a great job with our hotels on Kauai & Ohau). On the positive side, grounds are beautiful (ocean front) with nice pool and bar. Swan Court Restaurant Staff was friendly and efficient - food was fantastic. Valet parking staff was also efficient and friendly upon arrival - used self parking day 2 and on. Overall interior/shops were nice if you overlooked current renovation. For our experience would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for about 8 days on our honeymoon. The hotel was beautiful and clean. They have several restaurants in the hotel that you can eat at, and they're also nice to have a drink at, at night, after you've been out all day doing excursions and whatnot. The lobby is gorgeous, they had a little bit of construction going on while we were there, but it still looked beautiful. We couldn't see or hear any work going on while we stayed there, just saw the scaffolding that they had up. There were birds that sang to you as you walked by, and little penguins and fish in the lobby, I couldn't believe it. The staff here were the most accommodating people I have ever experienced. When we arrived, someone helped us get the bags out of our car, and then we were able to park in the free parking lot in the back of the hotel. Once we checked in, we started to go to our room and they let us know that there had been a mixup (we were totally unaware of any problems) with our room number, and they gave us a new room key and a 100.00 credit to the room for the inconvenience. It wasn't much but we were happy!! The gentleman who brought our luggage up gave us all kinds of advice on what to do in Maui while we were there. It was great. They have a good size pool, but if you want a good seat you need to get there early. This is pretty common though. They also had this grotto bar that you could swim up to, we loved that. There was also a separate area for the kids which was nice, there weren't a ton of children playing on the adult side of the pool. The Mai Tai's at the Umalu restaurant were super tasty and strong :-). We had breakfast included in our stay and ate at the Swan Court restaurant every morning. This restaurant is gorgeous everything is open, there are no doors on anything. You can sit right next to this pond where they have beautiful swans swimming. It was so relaxing to sit there every morning. The only bad thing about this restaurant was that birds were swarming us while eating, but we had fun with it, we also had to wait in line a few times in the morning but even then, there was so much to look at that neither of us cared. What's also nice about this hotel is it's the first hotel in the line of them that are in Ka'anapali. So it's much closer to Lahaina than the rest of the hotels. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui on their honeymoon, or for a family vacation. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt, not what they should be.”
Reviews.Author: AlexTravel253
Reviews.Content: The hyatt is currently being remodeled. The public spaces are 1992 Hawaii cliche. The beds are comfortable bu too low to the ground. The pool area is way too crowded. There is no beach and if you want an ocean view lawn chair you must pay extra for it. The service was great, but not worth the price. One comment on the Kaanapali area my wife made was that she was very uncomfortable walking the beach side promenade was that it was too narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hyatt Regency!”
Reviews.Author: GStoGM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our 3rd trip to the Hyatt since 2007. We got engaged there in 2007, honeymooned there in 2009 and just got back from our early 2nd anniversary trip. The property is just as great as it was on our first trip (even better). There is some slight "construction" going on in the atrium lobby. There was no noise from the work, but there is scaffolding up over by the penguin pool that cuts the view from the main lobby. However, it is a minimal disturbance if any. The staff was incredible. We had requested an atrium tower room when we booked. When we arrived, we were put in a room in the Lahaina Tower. We requested to be moved. They were unable to accomodate us on our first two nights, but they then moved us to a nice high floor in the atrium tower. The move couldn't have gone more smoothly. We left the room for the day for a snorkel trip to Molokini. By the time we came back, we went to the front desk and got our new keys - everything was in our new room for us! Perfect! Depending on what time you went for breakfast, there could a line. However, if you waited 10 minutes and went back, there was no line. The buffett was delicious. As far as pool lounge chair issues, we didn't have a problem. The pool staff was great about making sure no staked out chairs early in the morning and then left for the day. There are signs all over the pool area advising people that anything left unattended for more than 60 minutes would be moved. The staff went around regularly to enforce this. The food at Japengo was amazing as was the food at Sonz. However, I wasn't that impressed with the food at Umulu. I felt like it lacked some easy quick lunch options. The drinks and service more than made up for it. We never had an issue with the self-parking. If the lot in the front was full, we just went around to the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families and young couples”
Reviews.Author: Britt B
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive hotel from the minute you walk in the door - you instantly feel like you're relaxed and going to be well taken care of, which was perfect as we were on our honeymoon. We chose a garden room, and to be honest, were a little underwhelmed. The view didn't offer much, so we decided to upgrade to a ocean view room (for an additional charge) which had two twin beds...which wasn't exactly ideal, but we couldn't turn down the view. The breakfast was OUT OF THIS WORLD, and the whole dining experience was pretty cool. I have never seen a bigger buffet in all my life. The pool area is fantastic - waterfalls, little caves, basketball hoops, etc. The staff waits on you hand and foot, and it's in a good area. Plenty of things to go on the grounds given the fact that it's not an 'all inclusive resort'. (You aren't in walking distance to the local town, but it's a short drive away. Parking at this location is quite an issue (small cramped spaces, if you can find one). Bartenders were fantastic, and met some great people! Would recommend this hotel - but we would probably try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great bar and food....”
Reviews.Author: Dootson
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, but it is Huge!! 4 places to eat 2-3 bars. Location is perfect, located on the beach with the rest of the giant hotels, but close enough to the very cool Lahaina town for dinner and drinks. If you're looking for style and originality in a hotel, this is not the place. If you're looking for a safe, well catered hotel with a great location, pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beach?”
Reviews.Author: wnpverona
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hyatt Regency Maui with one exception. There's no beach. I had heard/read that the Kaanapali beach area of Maui was one of the best beaches on the island. When I found no beach at the Hyatt, I walked on the beach walk that connects all the hotels in that area and found the beach I was looking for in front of the Sheraton. It was beautiful. The pool area, shops and lobby of the Hyatt are fantastic. The pool area was very crowded all 5 days I was there. The breakfast buffet was very nice (very expensive, but it was included in my package) and I ate at one of the hotel restaurants one night, Japengo, and had an excellent meal. I had a partial ocean view room and it was ok. The bathroom was small and a bit dark. I had a package through Costco Travel that included the room and taxes, breakfast, a car (including taxes) and a $25 per day resort credit which the hotel let me apply to their $25 per day resort fee. The staff at the travel/excursion office were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, friendly & courteous service, lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: researchplanaholic
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, the front desk staff were fabulous - addressing with smiles and real aloha spirit. The hotel is undergoing some remodeling so the open air lobby had scaffolding marring the ocean views, but otherwise this property was fine. We stayed in an ocean front room in the Napili Tower and it was a delight. At night we slept with the patio doors open and we fell asleep and woke up to the sounds of the ocean waves - just perfect. The room was clean and comfortable for our family of four. A mini-fridge in the room was useful for chilling bottled water and beverages. The bathroom was a bit small, but we liked that the sink area was separate as it helped everyone move along in the morning. Housekeeping was wonderful - they brought extra towels, left extra soaps/shampoos upon request and were very prompt when we asked for blankets to take up to Haleakala during our planned visit. The staff was just so courteous and cheerful. We also utilized the Regency Club which was a nice treat. Here the staff was exceptional, chatting about the day and sharing tips. They were also very attentive with respect to placing food and keeping the areas clean for guests. We really loved the pool area though we did have to send one of our family members to secure shadier spots early in the morning. You can opt to choose chairs facing the ocean or facing the pool, and some a bit of both. The only strange thing was the towel policy - you receive a card to exchange for one towel and when returning the towel, you got the card back. At checkout you had to make sure all your cards were turned back in. Weird towel accounting method that was not properly explained. We found the pool attendants just a bit brusque if not slightly rude about the policy. If anything, they need some refreshers on smiling (I'm sure they're fed up and bored all day long just handing out towels or watching out for unattended chairs, but still they should have been a bit more friendlier). The walk to Whalers Village was lovely especially near sunset. Lots of shops if you want to spend the time. Also, a nice hula show in the evening around 6:30, I think. The concierge was very helpful - if you think you'd like to plan any excursions at all, book early as slots seemed to fill up and we had to "re-arrange" our itinerary a bit to fit things in. We took advantage of parasailing and ziplining. We had booked surfing as well for the teens, but it got canceled due to unsafe wave conditions for beginners. The highlight was the visit to Haleakala at sunrise - no guarantees of views given, but worth attempting. We used our car rental only once to head out to Napili/Kapalua Bay areas. So glad we did as the beach areas in those locations were wonderful and not too crowded. To secure a parking spot, we headed out fairly early (before 9:30, I think). Meals are slightly on the costly side on property, but if you'd like to explore there are other options in Whalers Village and Lahaina. Just a matter of preference and convenience. We would definitely return to this idyllic retreat in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Maui - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: OnIslandTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui 8/26-30 and really enjoyed our stay. We got a great deal through priceline ($169 a night) so wasn't surprised that we did not get an ocean view room. However, our room in the lahaina tower was wonderful - plenty of room, balcony, and a great view of the west Maui mountains! We booked the luau in advance and were not disappointed - very entertaining and the food was v. good! Also enjoyed Son'z restaurant on site - chopped salad was excellent! Pool scene was a lot of fun! Grounds were awesome with beautiful gardens and numerous exotic birds and penguins. Only drawback is the beach is a bit narrow here. However, you can walk 10 minutes futher up kaanapali and have a great beach to hang out on. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 50th anniversary in Maui and couldn't be more pleased with the Hyatt. The lobby was a bit dark with renovation scaffolding but the rooms and common areas were great. We had an ocean view on the 7th floor that was just about perfect. Comfortable beds, easy chair, desk and chair, small deck, (lanai) with table and 2 chairs. Everything was spotlessly clean and kept that way. Housekeeping arrived when we were out for breakfast so the room was made up when we returned. The line at the Swan Court moved quickly, never more than a 5-7 minute wait to be seated for the buffet. We were given a commplimentary bottle of champagne and 2 fresh flower leis as a token for our anniversary. We also ate at Umalu(sp) one evening and found it to be excellent at well. Self parking could be dicey at times, parking spaces are small so if you have a rental car it behooves you to rent a compact one. The first night is valet at no charge. The concierges are friendly and very helpful. Really enjoyed the variety of exotic birds throughout the grounds. Walking around the grounds of other hotels leads me to believe Hyatt probably has the nicest of the bunch. This place was a pleasure from check in to check out.

Reviews.Title: “11 nights in...The Presidential Suite!”
Reviews.Author: RPV5
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned in an oceanfront room in this hotel in 1993. We have vacationed in the Hawaiin islands over 50 times, but this was our first time returning to this hotel as we usually stay exclusively at more upscale 5 star properties and honestly Maui our least favorite Hawaiian island. The locals call it "Mauiwood" as quite a majority of guests tend to be from LA. I prefer not to run into friends, neighbors and business associates on my vacation. The Kaanapali are reminds me of Waikiki with its very busy beachfront walkway from the Hyatt to the Sheraton at Black Rock. While the Hyatt is on the narrowest strech of sand and they do not reccommend swiming right there, this is the best location in our opinion as it is at the end of the walkway. We took a chance and overall we were quite happy that we returned. We will be back and definitely stay in this suite again! This is a beautiful 4 star resort and we were very pleased with the way the hotel has been maintained. It certainly does not show its age. The Aloha spirit of the staff is exceptional...much better than at The Grand Wailea and The Four Seasons Maui! This hotel caters to a completely different clientelle and it was refreshing to not be poolside with everyone talking on their cell phones about how rich and important they are! My only serious service issue has to do with room service. It is only available for breakfast until 11am and for dinnerafter 5:30pm. There is no room service at all during the day!? We like to come up from the pool to cool off and relax and have lunch and cocktails in our room, as well as late afternoon cocktails and snacks but this was not to be at this hotel. When I called down I was informed that there was a takeout menu from the hotel restaurants in our room and I was free to go down, order and carry up whatever I wanted. I probably should have contacted management as I'm sure they would have accomodated us, but I chose not to, my mistake. Please Hyatt Maui...change this...especially in your suites. You will make a lot more money and have happier clients. We ended up driving into Lahaina or up to Kapalua for lunch quite a few days. When we arrived back at the pool the day of my call after eating in the pool restaurant which is the only one open for lunch, our pool cocktail server (can't rememner her name but she was from Lanai) asked how our afternoon was going. When I mentioned no room service and being in the presidential suite she said had we asked her, she would have hapily delivered to our room as she was "old school" service oriented and believed that the customer should never be told no. I think this is one of the main reasons why this property is a 4 star hotel and no longer rated as 5 stars. At check in we were granted a paid upgrade to The Presidential Suite for all 11 nights.. With taxes it ended up being about $1,800 per nite. Well worth it for a 2,300 sq ft suite that rents for over $6,000 per nite! It is located on the top floor of the atrium tower on the Regency Club floor. The suite is gorgeous. It consists of an entry way with hawaiian antiques, then you step down into the "V" shaped large living room which wraps around the corner of the hotel and provides ocean front views all the way to golf course and west maui mountain views in the rear of the hotel. The living room has a raised bar type table with 4 chairs, 2 large sofas, coffee table,a dining table for 8 as well as the "den" area to the left which has 2 more sofas, coffee table, chairs, large tv, DVD and Bose stereo system. This part of the suite had 5 balconies but unfortunately only 1 of these had and was large enough for chairs! There is a kitchen with full refrigerator freezer, coffeemaker and the necessary appliances and dishes/glasses. No mini bar in suite?? We are not the type to go out and stock your own refrigerator on vacation and would have loved a mini bar in the master bedroom. There was a seperate door to the hall from the kitchen which made it easy for staff when you had room service. Right outside the kitchen in the "den" area there was a door to an adjoining golf-mtv view room in case you wanted to book this as a 2 bedroom suite. Back thru the living room and en route to the master bedroom there is a office area containing a desk with a computer and printer which made it easy for us to check in on our boys at summercamp. There was also a lovely powder room as well as a room with a large daybed, chairs and another large TV and a balcony with 2 teak chairs that they call "the library." This would not work as a 2nd bedroom, except for an infant or small child unless you wanted to share your tub or shower in the master bedroom. The master bedroom was quite large with a seating area, another large tv and then a raised area for the bed. We are very picky about beds and linens and were quite happy with this bed. The master had a large, but very narrow balcony with 2 teak chairs and small coffeetable. My only real complaint here is with a suite of this size, at least one of the balconies should have had a chaise lounge, but alas the balconies are too narrow. Maybe when they decide to do a renovation, they will decrease the size of the library room to make a larger balcony and put in some lounges. From the master bed you stepped up into a hall with 4 closets, then into the center of the master bath which had a nice dressing area with seating. From here if you turned left you had the ladies side of the bathroom with long counter (no granite or marble??) with sink and makeup area . There was a seperate ladies toilet. There was also a 1 person sunken into the floor jacuzzi tub which I only used once because it was a bit scary stepping so far down to get into it or climbing out of it. There were glass shelves above with nice bath products and battery operated candles to create a nice ambiance. Unfortunately the lighting on the ladies side was no where near as bright as on the mens side of the bathroom. The men's side contained another counter and sink, mens private toitet, a small open shower and a nice sauna. For a suite this size, the bathroom is very dated and desperately needs a renovation if it is to rent at anywhere near full price. The shower only had 1 showerhead and someone had cracked parts of the pink marble on the walls/floor and they had used some really bad, mesy caulk to fill it in. Housekeeping was 5 star excellent. Our 2 housekeepers Lucrecia and Elvie were very friendly, always inquiring about our day and exuded the aloha spirit! They noticed the huge flower arrangement my husband had ordered me thru the concierge before we arrived and left us a nice note from them wishing us a Happy Anniversary! It was a very nice touch and one that was most appreciated. We enjoyed the pool area every day and never really had problems finding lounges, even if we arrived after 10:30am. Water was clean and refreshing. Except for 2 days, service was excellent. Being July we had expected to see more families, so the overall quiet was very nice. Unfortunately on a few afternoons toward the end of our stay, the activities staff turned into "cruise directors" and walked around the pool with a small megaphone trying to recruit kids for a 15 minute jump into the pool contest. This contest took place in the deepest area of the pool right by the entrance to the pool restaurant. This area was usually mostly adults who had to move to make way?! Unfortunately we were seated about 4 lounges down from that area one day. We were asked to be judges. I stayed and judged as I was enjoying the sun, my husband bolted for our suite. Afterwards I was given a free drink coupon for my efforts. We learned to sit in other area of the pool for the rest of our stay. A few evenings they put out a large inflatable movie screen in the sand by the kids side of the pool to show "dive-in" movies. We had 2 excellent late diners at Sonz at Swan court. Very nice food, an extensive wine list and excellent service. We watched them turn away many people without reservations. We also enjoyed 2 dinners in their Japanese restaurant, Japengo and 2 dinners sitting at the sushi bar there. We know good fresh fish as one of our best friends is Japanese, owns one of the best sushi places in LA and we have been with him to Tokyo Japan and eaten sushi after the 5am Tsukiji fish market auctions. The sushi was excellent and we really enjoyed talking car racing with all the chefs. We thoroughly enjoyed room service dinner altho the menu is very limited. Umulu, the poolside restaurant was ok, not great for lunch. We only had 1 breakfast there...unfortunately it is cafeteria buffet stlye for breakfast and we both got sick within the hour. Breakfast was included in our room rate but we never went down to Swan court...the lines were too long. We had room service or else went to the regency club lounge and brought it back to our diningroom table. There used to be a lobby bar, but sadly that turned into a take away type coffee and pastry place in the morning. Your only 2 bar options are the poolside Umulu or Japengo, both of which do not have sunset views. Entertainment...If you did not go to the Luau, there was sadly no Hawaiian entertainment. They did have 2 hula dances as well as 2 male dancers come over from the Luau for 2 minutes at sunset to blow the shell signifying sunset. The hotel brought in a college orchestra from LA who entertained poolside in the afternoons and evening. We would sit on our balcony and enjoy the music. They were good but played close to the same set each night. On 2 days they took over 1/5 of the pool area near the bar and restaurant and set up a large stage. They could have set it up mid afternoon so guests would have more space by the pool. The days it was up it was more difficult to find a lounge certain hours. Overall it was a very nice 11 days and we very much enjoyed the presidential suite. Hopefully they will do the much needed bathroom renovation and them we will happily return...even if we have to pay close to the rack rate. Thanks to the staff for their Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Gift”
Reviews.Author: matovirm
Reviews.Content: We spent eight of the most wonderful days in Hawaii at the Hyatt Regency. This is the first time out of five trips that we have stayed there and we will be going back. Where do you start? From the moment we walked in the door we felt special. Jeff at the front desk was a big help and he always had a smile on his face. The valet was helpful in giving us tips on what to see and do. Dave, helped us book outside activities and they were all wonderful and suited to what we wanted to do. We ate breakfast all but one day at the hotel. We went on a snorkeling trip that one day and left before we could get breakfast. Everyday the breakfast was outstanding. You could special order an omelet or go through the buffet line. Either way you couldn't miss. The food was so fresh and delicious. The waiters and waitresses were so pleasant and seemed to be at our beck and call. We didn't want to go try anyplace else to eat. We had an ocean view room and it was wonderful. Every day we sat on our lanai and watched the parasailers as they went by. The gardens that we saw below were well taken care of and we couldn't have asked for more. People that say it is outdated obviously haven't stayed elsewhere - hotels don't remodel their rooms every year. The beach wasn't the best but you could walk in either direction to get exactly what you wanted for a beach site. We sat by the pool for a few hours each day and it was easy to get a spot but if you wanted shade you needed to get there early or watch for one of the umbrellas when they opened up. The lava shoot was so much fun. We aren't kids but we loved it. The pool area left nothing to be desired. The bar girls came around on a reular basis to make sure that you were well hydrated. The swans, parrots, penguins and fish were relaxing to look at and try and talk to (parrots). My husband travels a lot and was so impressed we're going to try and stay at the Hyatt over Christmas in Anaheim. You can't miss here. We will be going back to take our sons soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: murraydog
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Maui is one of the finest hotels in the world! The grounds are spectacular, with native vegetation, birds, penguins, fish, etc. The open-air lobby is huge, filled with amazing flowers, plants and trees, plus there are several shops on the ground floor, including Macy's. My favorite place is the pool- OMG! Anytime I mention staying at the Hyatt in Maui, those who have stayed there always comment, "Isn't that pool AMAZING?!" And it truly is.,, beautiful blue water that's a perfect temperature, plenty of room for everyone, plus waterfalls, fun water slide, grotto bar (nice and cool in the cave!), awesome poolside bar, comfortable lounge chairs, excellent drinks and food- the outdoor restaurant adjoins the pool. Their fish tacos are the best on the island! I think they invented the Aloha Spirit- the staff is wonderful and they make you feel so incredibly welcome and they are always accommodating. We loved our stay and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mfeeney
Reviews.Content: An incredibly relaxing and upscale place to do just about anything!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: BrainsJr
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, and the room was comfortable with a beautiful view. However, we found a used condom wrapper in the nightstand drawer. Breakfast was ok, but get there early if you don't want to wait in line. The rester aunts are not good and overpriced like everything in Hawaii. Concierge service is great. They took care of all our little trips. Beach just south of the hotel is great, and the pool is fabulous. And, the bars' lava flows were like candy. Overall, it was good, but the food and prices could be a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: phantom101
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt the first week of Septmember. I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews but overall I really loved this hotel. Check in was easy and Janice was very friendly. They offered cookies and bottles of water along with a shell lei. My luggage was lost so they gave us some toiletries. Room was better than I pictured. Walk in closet, decent sized bathroom. Two big beds and the best part was the VIEW! We had an ocean view and were on the 7th floor. Everyday I looked at palm trees and the ocean. It also overlooked the swan/flamingo garden area. The grounds were really beautiful and well kept. There was a little bit of construction going on, didn't really bother me. If you eat at the little cafe/breakfast bar area near the koi pond some of your view will be obstructed but it didn't stop me from eating there twice. Mostly I ate at the hotel. I loved Umalu, the quesidillas, fish tacos and cobb salad were wonderful! I had the buffet twice at Sonz, it was buy one get one ( I wouldn't have paid full price for it). It was decent. There was an omelet bar, fruits, pastries, and sushi. The firsttime I went was arund 7am and there was hardly any line but when I went at 8am I stood in line for about 25 minutes. I enjoyed the little breakfast bar that I mentioned before. They had starbucks coffee, some pastries, fruit, and breakfast sandwiches. The beach in front of the hotel isn't the best but its fine to wade in. Mostly I walked the 15 minutes or so to whalers village area and the Sheraton(which has the best beach by far!). I never went to the pool (why go when there is the ocean?). It was crowded by 9am and cleared out around 6pm. I originally planned a spa day at the Westin but do to my sunburn I ended up cancelling and instead got a pedicure from Spa Moana (Hyatt). $85 is a little steep for 50 minutes. The foot massage was nice, although it seemed to last about 5 minutes, if that. The view of the water is relaxing and afterward I stayed in the relaxation room for about 15 minutes (water and fruit were offered). I probably wouldn't go back to the spa as it seemed to be the most expensive of all the hotels on Ka'anappali Beach. Upon check out I was overcharged $80 ( a room charge that was not mine). The front desk had to go through all the receipts but the charge was taken off and they were very apologetic. FYI I have noticed that a lot of people are complaining about the $25 a day resort fee. Yes I think it should just be included in the hotel price but its not and every hotel along the beach has the same fee or higher. Overall the view and location were nice. I would stay there again as long as I got the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Overpriced Services”
Reviews.Author: SeaUThere
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Beautiful Hyatt Regency in Maui. Although the hotel is beautiful and the staff was friendly (accept for the lady making the omelets at Son'z Maui at Swan Court - my husband likes to refer to her as the Omelet Nazi) this hotel is WAY OVER PRICED. Glad our package included the breakfast buffet. Had breakfast not been included with our package the buffet would have been $62.50 a day for breakfast! That is just plain ridiculous and the food was nothing special. The breakfast at the Marriott in Kauai was much much better! There is also a $25.00 a day resort fee which we knew about in advance. This fee was also ridiculous. I would not stay here again. I would much rather stay in South Maui. We spoke to a couple on the beach that have been renting a condo every other year in South Maui on the beach for $110.00 a night. This includes a washer and drier in their room as well as beach chairs and coolers which they can take right out to the beach. Much better value

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Fee35
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the hyatt for 8 nights and we had a wonderful time. We stayed in the deluxe ocean room, we had a great room with a fabulous view. The breakfast at swan court is great and worth the wait. We could not fault the service, all the staff were very professional and very helpful. Gael from expedia was absolutely fabulous I can't give her enough praise she assisted us with booking in all of our activities during our stay. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “**Gay friendly** Honeymooners very pleased and will return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shelb077
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 day honeymoon stay at the Hyatt and it was amazing. I loved the location and I am so glad, after seeing the other hotels, that we chose this one. Some tips would be to definitely get an ocean view or ocean front room. The views were amazing. Also make sure you get a package that includes your breakfast. Breakfast for 2 was 62.50! And if you are into the gym and spas these are the best facilities that I have ever been in. We received a couples massage and it was truly unbelievable. They let you use their facilities all day for the day you receive treatments. For instance, our massage was at 5, we got there around 3 to use their hot tub, steam room, sauna, and to shower there. Fresh fruit, coffee and tea were also provided. Another tip would be to get to the pool early! We got clean towels the night before the towel window closed (around 5 PM) so we were set for the next morning. We were at the pool by 830AM. It is bright and sunny then! We laid out and enjoyed the amazing pool til about noon or 1 then ventured out around the island. Same for the breakfast buffet. I read reviews where people had to wait in line. We were at the buffet around 730 every morning and we never got the long line. There isn't a lot of space to lay out on the beach right in front of the hotel, but if you take a short walk down to the other resorts, you can enjoy the beach there. Also, you can rent chairs from the resort and go to the many other amazing beaches in Maui! We are definitely beach people, but the pool at the Hyatt was amazing and we didn't mind spending our mornings there. I did read reviews about a lot of kids around the pool. I did not experience this. There is a separate pool for kids and I didn't notice many kids around the resort at all. The Japengo restaurant was really good, expensive but good. Drinks at the resort were very expensive (Mai Tai $12) also but that was to be expected so we went to the Safeway, 5 min away and stocked up on our alcohol. I also read reviews complaining about the $25 a day resort fee. Well all the resorts have a fee and the Hyatt does not charge you for parking, internet and gym like the other resorts do. Bottom line is the staff, the resort itself, the location everything was truly paradise! We will definitely be returning to the Hyatt in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “big disapointment”
Reviews.Author: stephenhider
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at this hotel. It was very very expensive. Staff were polite but brusch. Very orientated to oriental visitors. Would not recommend. Lousy beach. Sheraton is best beach

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!! Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nwmom2011
Reviews.Content: We have booked this vacation thru Costco for 5 nights back in Mid Aug. We had a partial ocean view room and we couldn't be any happier. The view was priceless. Some of the things we raved about was the upkeep of the hotel. I would put it at a 5 star hotel. I traveled the world and have been to many resorts around the world. This is one of the best I have been to. The breakfast buffet (At the Swan Court) was superb, perhaps not too many variety but the quality and taste were perfect. We had to wait inline for 20-25 mins but we've never felt inconvenienced. It was worth it. The view while having breakfast was amazing. **The positives are: the property is well kept and maintained including the rooms. Food is exquisite (breakfast at the swan). My 7 yr old loved the pool and the lava tube. the service was excellent. Not a long walk to Whaler's village unless you're lazy and don't want to take a nice stroll along the beach. Negatives: parking was very limited and never could find a parking spot starting in the afternoon as they had the Luau every night. However, they let us park in the valet parking with no charge. We had to go either left of the hotel or to adjacent hotel's beaches to get a good spot for swimming but that wasn't a big issue for us. Just enjoy waking up to the priceless view. **I want to extend my thank you to the housekeeping department since they were very helpful in returning my son's wallet as he left it on our last day in the room. They mailed it to us Fedex within 2 days at no cost. Thank you for the wonderful service. We can't wait to go back again!! Thank you Hyatt for making our Maui experience one of a lifetime!! We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Points to be aware of when selecting this property”
Reviews.Author: kazumdc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently booked a trip through Costco and the package included breakfast, Spa Access and a $25 per day credit to be used to offset the Resort Charge which includes Internet access. I am just going to list the pros and cons as we saw them. Pros - Service was excellent. All of the personnel in the hotel were extremely helpful and courteous. This would include the front desk, the Spa, restaurants, and housekeeping. - Property was well taken care of - They were able to accomodate an early check in and late check out (12:30 PM) - Umalu Restaurant was ok - Breakfast at the buffet at the Swan Court was good with eggs cooked to order - The room itself (partial ocean view) was fine and more than met our needs and expectations - Our flight left at 8:50 PM and having the Spa Access allowed us to enjoy another full day in Maui. The Spa has excellent facilites and all of the amenities one could ask for including razors and shaving cream Cons - Beach is almost non existent ( this is supposed to be a beachfront resort hotel). We found a fantastic beach called Polo Beach located behind the Fairmont in Wailea and the one behind the Sheraton in Kaanapali is great as well - Our partial ocean view room overlooked a cemetery - SInce the beach really couldn't be used, most people took advantage of the two nice pools available. The problem is that people lay their towels over the lounge chairs early in the morning to claim them and you had a difficult time in finding some, expecially those placed under the umbrellas - The wait time for the breakfast at the Swan Court was about 20 minutes. There is another one at the Umalu restaurant which we were told had the same food without the eggs cooked to order - Their location with respect to the good beaches and Whaler's Village (Shopping Center with several restaurants) was further away from the other resorts on Kaanapali beach. All in all, we had an excellent time (who can't in paradise???) and we made do with some of the resort's shortcomings. Next time however, we will be staying at a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Delight”
Reviews.Author: MaculMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Maui Hyatt Regency and loved it. Staff was courteous and helpful, food was very good and the full ocean room view outstanding. The breakfast buffet was one of the best anywhere, and well worth the price. We were able to land a deal of book 3 get 1 night free, and free breakfast buffet. Room was not huge, but adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: N_and_C_2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from a week trip to Maui staying at the Hyatt Regency Maui (Kaanapali Beach) and were extremely disappointed with the resort and location. Our strong recommendation to anyone reading this would be - DON'T stay here! Stay at another hotel and location (perhaps Wailea - my wife had stayed at the Fairmont, Wailea a couple of years ago and only had wonderful things to say about the hotel and beach). My wife and I are seasoned travellers, having stayed in all types of accommodation (budget to five star+) all over the world. There were a number of reasons why we were so disappointed with our stay, but in the interest of presenting a balanced view, we've listed the positives and negatives of our recent trip to Maui: POSITIVES: 1. Great customer service. Like anywhere in the United States, the customer service was very good. All the staff were attentive, helpful and friendly, and we had no issue with the staff at all. 2. Japengo restaurant. The food at Japengo was really tasty, flavoursome (the sushi in particular) and reasonably priced for a hotel. It was the best food we had in Maui (although we didn't have a car so didn't travel too far from the hotel). Make sure you book dinner (or at least pre dinner drinks) around sunset so you can enjoy the views. NEGATIVES: 1. Price of rooms. We stayed in an ocean view king sized room and for the price we were paying per night were extremely disappointed with what we were paying versus what we were receiving (in the context of all the other negatives below). 2. Dated decor. Both the rooms and the hotel itself is in desperate need of renovation. We could not believe that given a) the number of rooms at the hotel (also a negative) and b) the price they were charging that the hotel could be so dated (brown, old carpet etc). The owners of the Hyatt Regency are obviously trying to save money by not reinvesting in their property and unfortunately it is clearly evident. 3. Lack of beach. The Hyatt Regency Maui has no beach to speak of. Even if you did spend 15 minutes walking down to Whalers Village for a swim in the ocean - be warned that the beach itself is not a good one for a relaxing, leisurely swim. The beach suffers from strong rips (no lifeguards), waves breaking right on the foreshore and isn't really very clear (certainly not turquoise / aqua blue). Whilst this is an issue for the Hyatt Regency, it is also an issue for all hotels on Kaanapali Beach and we'd strongly recommend not staying in this area if you like an ocean paddle. 4. Lack of shade at the pool and "beach". We were bitterly disappointed with the hotels lack of shade around the pools. In this day and age with the prevelance of skin cancer, we were disgusted that there were only a few pool chairs that had permament umbrellas and shade. As a consequence we quickly found that these disappeared early in the morning as people (rightly or wrongly) reserved them for the day with their towels. This meant that I ended up waking up at 6:30am every morning to try and secure a shaded seat (who needs to sleep in on their holiday right?!). To capitalise on this lack of shade, the Hotel did offer to rent out chairs (they came in a pair) with shade covering for about $50 / day or shaded cabanas for $150 / day. I suspect that this is a trend that most hotels in Kaanapali follow, however, I don't understand why they can't just invest in umbrellas that give the guest the option of having shade or not. 5. Room. Notwithstanding the dated look of the rooms, they also suffered from a strange smell and very small bathrooms. Again for the price you are paying, we felt it was inappropriate. 6. Breakfast. If you have breakfast included (we did), you will probably end up eating at Sonz which offers the best breakfast option at the hotel. Unfortunately as the hotel has underinvested in appropriate breakfast eating areas you end up waiting 15-20 minutes each morning for a table for breakfast and then another 5-10 minutes if you'd like a freshly cooked omlette. We don't think its appropriate to wait this long every morning for breakfast. 6. The $25 / day "wireless / gym / parking" charge. This is just a marketing charge. As far as I can tell if this isn't an optional charge ie if you don't have a computer or car or gym gear, which it wasn't, then it should be added to their advertised rate and not "added on" to the advertised rate. Just further evidence of hotel management doing everything they can to try and squeeze every single dollar from their guest without actually giving them anything for it. 7. Other matters. We won't go into it too much, but its fair to say that the spa treatments are ridiculously expensive (and from the look of them not worth it) and there is limited transport options unless you have a car (buses are available, but they come every hour or so). We don't normally write reviews etc on any websites, but we thought it necessary that we present our views on the Hyatt Regency Maui and strongly encourage anyone thinking to stay here (or on Kaanapali Beach) not to.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Kenmnc1
Reviews.Content: A trip of a lifetime. How many times do you get to fly to HI and stay at the Hyatt in Maui. Service was excellent. Treated as royality. Motel was outstanding with openness on the inside lobby and the smell of fresh flowers is heaven to your nose. Everything was so clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Lfour44
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel and the employees were very helpful. The pool and grounds are very nice and it is very clean. My only complaint is the beds. The bed is very low (about a foot off the ground). This makes it very awkward for a tall person to get in and out of. It was pretty firm and not comfortable. If the beds were better it would have been a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui Raves”
Reviews.Author: kayefa
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary at this great resort. We had stayed there years ago when our children were small and wanted to return to reminisce of fun times in this beautiful hotel. We had a package which included a breakfast buffet each morning in the Swan Court and was a wonderful way to begin our day and even meet others who were enjoying themselves, as well, We stayed there most of the time and enjoyed the Spa, pools, restaurants and just relaxing each day as we viewed the sunrise and sunset out of our ocean view room. The service was wonderful and staff was very customer oriented. Be sure and include Mama's Fish House about 45 minutes away - the other side of the airport. Not inexpensive but wonderful food and service and quite a treat for us. You will not be disappointed with this wonderful stay on Kanaapali Beach. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Facility, Great pool, my 7 year old loved it”
Reviews.Author: tozaisen
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice place. Golf is very close by and the twilight rates were cheap. The pool is big and a lot of fun. My 7 year old loved every day of it. The slide was a real highlight. We stayed on the Club Floor, which gave us access to breakfast, drinks during the day, a happy hour buffet that totally rocked and dessert bar in the evening that was pure evil to the waist line. It was a little more money to stay on the Club floor, but well worth it when you consider that a bottle of water costs $4!! We probably made up the extra cost just in water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: g8rb878
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have a "babymoon" so we chose Maui. After looking at several hotels and package deals, the best one we found was at Costco. The price included the Hyatt hotel, a car, breakfast at the hotel, unlimited soda cup for two and many vouchers. All I can say was, I wish the trip was longer than a week. The hotel was absolutely beautiful - especially the lobby area with the plants, the penguin area, the koi pond and the pineapple garden. In addition to the lobby, they had gorgeous places like the gardens, the pool, the white and black swans, the ambiance when you have your buffet breakfast (which was delicious - such an awesome selection), the location, the hammocks, the shopping, the luau - gosh, I could go on and on. To top that off, our room was really nice too. It was a recently updated room with an ocean view and everything met our expectations. The AC did give us issues on the first day, but someone came out to fix it for us pretty quickly. When our son gets older, we may have to drop him off with the grandparents and do this trip again! Go to Costco, look up this bundle deal for the Hyatt and book it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SMSMHH
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Maui is very conveniently located and the hotel itself is well maintained. Nice kids water play area for kids 6 and under. Only negatives are that there is very little sandy beach area so you have to walk to other nearby resorts. Also, the Main breakfast restaurant is so crowded in the morning so you have to wait for 15+ minutes to get a table or go an outdoor restaurant which has most (but not all) of what the Main restaurant offers.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with Toddlers? Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: OneTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent the week of Thanksgiving at the Hyatt in Maui. It was our second time at this property with toddlers so that can tell you how much we love it! For kids there is a fenced wading area with dolphins and turtles climb on. A small waterslide was fantastic adventure for my 2 yr old versus the larger one they have that is great for big kids and adults. Flamingos, penguins, parrots and koi are on property for everyone to view. My kids loved feeding the koi and watching the penguins feed from Hyatt employees. Pool is definitely a resort pool, not really relaxing for adults traveling solo, but great for families. The beach is amazing in front of the property with very minimal waves. Rooms are clean, spacious and nice. Spring for a full ocean view if you can and you won't be disappointed! The Hyatt Luau is way too touristy for my taste and takes far too long to get started if you have kids. If you are buying tickets to a luau, I recommend the Old Lahaina Luau because it is very authentic and more of a complete experience. I recommend this hotel to anyone with young children or looking to have fun and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Concierges with very limited knowledge”
Reviews.Author: matias2718
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Maui is a 4 star hotel but their concierge service doesn't live up to this level. I asked which spot on the way of road to Hana was the scene of the movie Jurassic Park and got the answer: I don't know, you tell me if you found out. I found, from google, the place is called Garden of Eden. My wife wanted to know the shopping place in the vicinity of Hyatt. The concierge staff recommended Canary Mall and Whaler but missed the most important one - Front St. The bathroom fixtures are so old and loose, need to be replaced. Expect the free parking is difficult in the evening and the valet service costs $18/day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: frustrateddb
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Maui in August and it was simply wonderful. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort, which was great. I had read some previous reviews for Hyatt and was a bit concerned, but am glad we chose to stay there. We had an ocean view room and each morning the view was breath taking. The hotel and their restaurants were very pricey but everything in Hawaii is expensive. Maui is such a relaxed and laid back place to just kick back and enjoy. Our room was nice and the hotel lobby was pretty. Our only complaint was there is not a beach at the hotel. There is barely room to walk from the property before you are in the ocean, we walked to some of the nearby hotels and the Westin had the best beach by far there was room to actually sit on the beach while enjoying the beautiful scenery. We will most definitely go back to Maui, not sure if we will book at the Hyatt but we will be back. Just as a note to smokers, your habit is not welcomed in the state of Hawaii. The hotels do not allow smoking on your lanai or the hotel property. You must take a hike to find a place to smoke, while that is an inconvenience we enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt with two small kids”
Reviews.Author: osu26
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with the exception of the location. We loved the rooms, very peaceful and roomy, beds were low to the ground so the kids had no problems climging on/off. The mini-fridge was nice to keep their milk cold. At age 4 and 18 months, the kiddie pool was great. That completely occupied my kids, especially the kiddie slide. The adult slide was surprisingly fun for the hubby and me. Grounds were beautiful and unlike other reviews, I thought the beach was nice, if you went to beach on the side that they day wave runners. It's kind of next to the parking lot area, but I think most people miss that part of the beach and it's actually very nice. We enjoyed getting lunch at the pool bar (took it to go for a picnic), although very pricey something like $22 for a CB/FF when buying an adult meal the kids got a meal free. The kids meals were large so both kids ate one meal and the burgers were half pounders with a huge order of fries, so we split that making lunch actually cheap. We had picnics almost daily on the beautiful grassy lawns under a palm tree, it was perfect! The only negative for us was that we walked to the Sheraton a couple of times to snorkel black rock and also walked about 3 times to Whalers Village area to eat at Leilani's (fish tacos and hula pie are great!), with an 18 month old and barely 4 year old in tow this made for a long walk. Don't get me wrong, the walk was manageable or we wouldn't have done it so often but it was tiring. I personally like the location of the Westin Hotel, more central but then again all the resorts are beautiful and I wouldn't change our choice solely because my son loved the kidde area so much. Also, the breakfast buffet was included and convenient but IMO it would not have been worth the cost. The food that was ordered from the menu looked better and less expensive. Other than that, Aloha Mixed Plate is another great place to get food on the go for a picnic. It is located in Lahaina, one of the best/reasonable meals we ate. We bought a painting at Jim Kingwell's gallery in Lahiana. Overall a great trip with many memories!

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever...”
Reviews.Author: alwyscllct
Reviews.Content: Our third stay here and we are always thrilled we came. This trip was but 2 nights at the Hyatt as part of a 10 day Hawaiian vacation (the others were spent at 4 Seasons Maui and The Koa Kea in Kauai reviewed separately. ) We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and spent time at the Hyatt on our honeymoon in August '81. We were upgraded and flourished with gifts to celebrate the occasion I contend the service here is as close to perfect as possible particularly considering the size of the hotel. As an example, after checking in we were wandering towards the beach/pool area tired and probably looking lost we were approached by Kekoa Mowat who (unsolicited) asked if he could help direct us, after pointing us towards our destination near the beach he offered to get us towels (which were in the opposite direction) and a few moments later he appeared with said towels in hand and a smile. He refused a gratuity. Later that evening we received a card from him congratulating us on our 30th Anniversary. These touches have always been a hallmark of our experience at the Hyatt. Kudos also to Victoria at check-in and Jimmy at the pool/cabana deck. We love the buffet breakfast, the overall vibe, the views, the staff, the shops (thanks Nadine in South Seas), the atrium lobby, the beds, the pool, the gym and the general location. This would be a 5 star if the beach was wider and a little less rocky. Overall this property always brings me good feelings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjjane
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is beautiful from the moment you walk into the main lobby. It is lavish without being overly done. The center opens up to the sky, with plants and birds and even penguins. The service is excellent -- from the front desk to the people at the bars and restaurants. The pool is wonderful -- with enough room to accomodate the kids and the adults without stepping on each other's toes! The poolside bar has great drinks and food. The only downside -- no real beach to lie on (but you can walk right into the ocean) and it is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: Dananada
Reviews.Content: The lobby usually has expansive views of the ocean, but right now construction is blocking that view. Very disappointing. I feel strongly that they should have disclosed this before our reservation was complete. Service is so-so. No one in any area - pool, valet, restaurants, front desk, etc. went out of there way to make the time special. We had to fight to get the valet's attention and beg to get information on hotel restaurants and services. The room is ok, showing signs of wear. The view is great - ocean front. Most days the housekeeper forgets items - tp, wash clothes, soap, etc. Our room is really far from everything - pool, frontdesk, restaurants, etc. I would request the center tower next time (although there's not likely to be one for me). Breakfast buffet is large and the food is good, but the dining room is invested with birds. They are so bold I saw them eat off of a man's plate while he was still eating. This is a huge problem and made us not want to eat the breakfast that was included with our room. We figured out that we could get it to go and eat it from the pavilion. That worked ok but was a hassle. If you don't have kids stick to the adult side of the pool - much calmer. The pool bar serves great drinks. Try a lava flow. Yum! They rent cabanas with an ocean view. Although expensive it's worth it on a day you want to spend the whole day at the pool/beach. And, if you've gotten a bit too much sun these nicely shield you while still being able to see the view. Check with the concierge service early on, provided by Expedia. They have good, knowledgable staff who can help you plan and reserve everything you want - restaurants, adventures, etc. Many restaurants and activities require reservations and the concierge can usually get you discounts. Considering the cost vs benefit of this hotel, I would not recommend it. I think you can do better with a condo or other comparable hotel for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Treat us like ROYALTY???? How DARE you!!!”
Reviews.Author: DorthysFriendTravler
Reviews.Content: Aloha! And welcome to my favorite resort in Maui! We relaxed here last year at Thanksgiving and are returning again this Thanksgiving and we can hardly wait. What can I say that hasnâ€™t already been said before? There comes a certain level of service and expectation when staying at any Hyatt resort and Hyatt Maui does not disappoint. From the moment we checked-in to our departure we were made to feel like Royalty. From our awesome large Deluxe Ocean View room (I had to laugh at those travelers that said the room wasnâ€™t modern. Hyatt Maui underwent a multi million $ renovation last year with all new Hawaiian themed furnishings) to the most beautiful landscaped grounds in Maui, I understand why many guests return when traveling to the Islands. The wildlife on the manicured grounds are a daily delight to enjoy. From the swans, flamingos and penguins, they always brought a smile to our face. The staff, everyone from top to bottom always had a smile and a friendly â€œalohaâ€™ when passed. Cocktails and pupus by the pool at happy hour were always delicious. The pool is great. Beach is small but you walk 2-3 min towards Whalers Village and you have a big beach. A Breakfast Buffet to die for. If you go away hungry, it is your own fault. Expensive? Yes, it can be, but when staying at a luxury resort, EXPECT it or stay at Motel 6. They go hand in hand. We all want value and Hyatt Maui delivers. I am a true believer that your vacation is what you make of it and if one thing like paying for parking or internet, listening to the wonderful musical sounds of the nightly luau, that your room was not cleaned first thing in the morning or you have to walk a bit to get around at a large resort and it is going to ruin your vacation, then stay home. Do some internet homework before you book and know before you go. These are some of the reasons we, as seasoned travelers, know what to expect when traveling on a budget or in luxury. Even the unexpected are part of the adventure! My only complaint was that we werenâ€™t able to stay longer! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: YankinMelbs
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Maui was a great price for its amenities - great pools and beach access and location. The rooms are a bit outdated but clean. The staff is incredibly helpful and the food at the restaurants were pretty good but not gourmet standards. For the price we got it for, through a Qantas special, it was a steal of a deal. I did see it advertised online for much more than we paid and am not sure I would pay the prices online for it. You would be able to find more modern furnishings and better food at other places close by for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant place to stay on Maui. Here's why:”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: At arrival we had free valet parking that night, super friendly staff and cookies with fruit punch when you walk in. Quick check-in too. (Seems silly, but these little things are nice after a day of exhausting traveling.) The pool is awesome and the layout is great for kids and adults. Activities for the kids were an excellent touch also. No funny business on the bill at check-out. There was alot of scaffolding setup on the front of the building. No work was being done when we were there (08-30-9/5/11), so it didn't bother us, but they are either staring some pretty major work, or finishing up work (call first to see!). A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: MNTourists
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8/28-9/4. We were given a room in the main tower. There was a partial ocean view if you sat on the far side of the balcony. As other reviewers pointed out, the bed is extremely low to the floor. The pillows were hard. We had the a.c. on all the time, but at night it never seemed cool in there. It didn't help that there was a sheet-comforter-sheet layout to the bed. The room was always cleaned extremely late in the day. I noticed a previous guests lip gloss under the bed. Also, there was can of a previous guests beverage under the tv. These things were there for the entire 6 nights we were there. The bathroom looked like it had been partially remodeled. They seemed to have stopped with the bathroom door and bath tub. The pool was nice, but is probably a little too deep for most people. Half of the pool is 8 or 9 feet deep. It didn't bother me, since we had brought our own tubes, but there was hardly ever anyone in that part of the pool. You need a towel card to get towels for the pool and have to turn them in to get new towel cards after you use them. It was a pain. We stayed at Hyatts in Waikiki and Kauai and neither of them had this annoyance. The room was quiet; we couldn't hear our neighbors. Lots of people put towels on the pool chairs and I never saw them. Maybe they only enforce the 1 hour removal rule during the high season. There were some nice shops in the hotel: Maui Hands, Macys, a sundry. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Whaler's Village and a few restaurants. We at at Umalu once. It was ok. The prices were pretty steep at for the food; there was no kids menu here. They have a happy hour at Umalu and Japengo. There were plenty of other restaurants outside of the hotel that were cheaper. Front Street in Lahaina has a ton of restaurants and shopping, which is a short drive away. We called the guest request number to ask about a later checkout after having been told by the front desk to call in the morning. The woman on the phone immediately said no; she never asked what room we were in or anything. We later walking down to the front desk and a very nice front desk man said it depended what room we were in; we were in a room that allowed for the late checkout (1pm), which was very helpful. The real low point of the stay was the parking/valet situation. Upon our arrival we stated that we wanted to check in quickly and then we would park our car ourselves. We clearly stated we did not want our luggage removed from the car. One valet guy said no problem and he'd just move our car over to the side. After we checked in, I noticed our bags were on a cart with a bellhop standing by. I was very annoyed by this, but I was annoyed even further after we returned from getting our bags dropped off by the bellhop to find that our car was nowhere in sight. It was not parked on the side as we were told. And that valet person was nowhere in sight. It took another 15 minutes for the other valet person to find out where our car was and bring it back. There is also a luau at the hotel every night. It is very difficult to find a parking spot at night because of this. We continuously drove from one parking lot to another and did not find a spot. Then, we were back in the valet situation again. You also don't need any kind of parking pass to park in the hotel lots so anyone could park here at anytime. They really need to focus on making parking easier for their guests. I'd definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth part one”
Reviews.Author: lovebnbs
