Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The grounds were beautiful. Room were very nice, restaurants were great' and the location was perfect. The beach wasn't what I hoped for but the rest of the place made up for it. There were swimming pools for kids and adults. There is even a bar in the pool in a cave. You have to see it to believe it. Breakfast by the Swan pond with the waterfalls is just about the best possible way to start any day. Lahaina is only a short drive and there is plenty of things to do there. We had an ocean view room which I recommend. The views are fantastic. We really loved the Luau at the hotel. The food was great and the show was vevy relaxing. Just a note- Rent a car. It's the best way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VT1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights for our honeymoon in a deluxe ocean front room. The room itself was clean and a good size (though the bathroom/shower was a bit small). The balcony was a good size and had a great view over the pool and beach. The breakfast at Swan Court was brilliant and had a variety of choice and we were glad to have it included in our package as at $30 per person its not the cheapest! There were queues but we never queued for more than 10-15 minutes and we went at all times in the morning. The pool was busy though we did manage to get seats on all the days. The service was great throughout our trip. We ate at the Umalu restaurant most nights and were very impressed. The beach outside the hyatt is not good at all and i would avoid if you can and walk down a bit further. We went to the Kaanapali Ali beach which was much better! Overall a fantastic hotel with great views. Tip: Go to see the Warren and Annabelle Magic/Comedy show in Lahaina town centre, its brilliant and you can get a bus from Whalers village for $1!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Nina G
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the a hyatt hotel for our honeymoon for a week. We had a beautiful delux ocean front view room and I just loved the sounds of the waves we could easily hear from there. The room was very comfortable and clean. The only thing I would have changed if I could was the bathroom area which was too small for my opinion. The hotel location was perfect, very close to Laina where you can find many restaurants and souvenirs stores. The pool area was clean with comfortable access to the beach and great servers (just loved the fresh papaya & pineapple). We ate few times at the pool caffe and the food was tasty and fresh. The self parking was very close and when the lot was full we were referred to another parking. We had a great time in here and we can't wait to our next travel to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachside location”
Reviews.Author: MLMurray
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency Maui. This hotel is centreally located in Kaanapali & the location was perfect. It was a short drive to Lahaina & the Whalers village where there were plenty of shopping and dining options. We stayed in a Partial Ocan view room on the 19th floor in the main tower which we found dissappointing. The room overlooked a dirty large rooftop and you could only see the ocean if you stood on the tiny, windy balcony & looked over the side to the right. The room was nice however was lacking in cleanliness upon our arrival. The mini bar was covered in a thick layer of dust which was a bit off putting. Our package came with Wi-Fi however we were unable to maintan an internet connection for most of the time we were there. We did contact the IT Desk - Business centre for assistance however the staff advised us that the hotel was located in an area which had poor internet reception. We didn't dine in any of the Hyatts restaurants as the were all way overpriced. The Beach walk & Whalers Village was a favourite for us. The Whalers village provided a great variety of well priced beach front dining alternatives & lovely shopping & was only a 20 minute walk down the Beach walk. The room service was good. Of the 4 nights we were there our room was serviced every day so it was always nice to come back to a tidy room with exception to the dusy mini bar. Overall, our stay in Maui was lovely & there is plenty to see & do there. We will definitely return one day, however we did find the Hyatt dissappointing & will probably chose another hotel upon our return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, beautiful views with lots of activities for both teenagers and adults”
Reviews.Author: 924Debbie54
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location on the beach. We had a spacious room with a partial ocean view. They included a complimentary roll out bed which was as good as the other beds. The pool area with it's waterfalls and slide was a big hit with my teenage sons. They spent hours playing basketball in the pool, as well as table tennis. The games room was also very popular. Whalers Village was a 15 minute walk from the hotel along a Palm tree lined path. It was easy to walk up to Black Rock to snorkel and to see the Hawaiian Green Turtles. The lobby of the hotel was beautiful with all the exotic plants, trees, birds and penguins! I will definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Sydneytraveller2153
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel. The grounds were amazing and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The Aloha Spirt is certianly alive in this part of Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ValB78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt at the end of February/beginning of March, so definitely not the peak season, but it was a wonderful experience. The grounds are gorgeous. All the birds/fish/animals were a nice touch and the grounds are very well maintained. The location is great--away from, yet close to, downtown Lahaina and walkable to the shops and restaurants at Whaler's Village. Room was nice, not ultra modern but I was expecting it to be a lot more dated based on other reviews. Hotel was not at capacity, so we never had any issue getting a pool chair and hardly anyone was in the pool! Water slide was fun as was the water basketball! Good food on the property, pricey but it's Maui! We rented the cabana at the far end of the property away from the pool which was serene and beautiful. The outdoor couples massages and the dinner on the beach were phenomenal ways to celebrate our anniversary. The service for the beach dinner was excellent, worth the splurge. The luau was what you'd expect. Rented a car onsite for part of the stay and the process was easy. Probably the best part was the breakfast. We (unfortunately!) remained on central time and were up early, but we never waited to be seated and we got a table on the swan court pond each day. Beautiful and the food was great. Definitely try the POG juice and all the pineapple. And you can't beat starting the day with mahi mahi! Finally, we never saw a bug the entire time. And I looked! We would definitely stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: kreilly32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented an ocean view room for our honeymoon. One day, we returned after the housekeeping had been through and the door was open. Luckily, nothing was gone, but it was alarming. Another day, they took my swimsuit cover-up (a wedding gift) with the towels hanging on the back of the door (which they were not supposed to take). The staff was friendly and apologetic about it at the time, but I just called back two weeks later (it's still not found) and Kirsten, the front desk manager, was extremely rude and unhelpful. She asked if I wanted to be transferred to housekeeping, with whom I had already spoken. I said no, she said OK, then hung up. The pool was also extremely crowded and it was virtually impossible to find two chairs together. There is no beach to speak of. If I had to do it all over again, I would have spent extra money and stayed somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: eric2carmen
Reviews.Content: Very good overall, but with one major exception.... the parking is awful. Every night we came back to the motel the parking lots were full and we had to use valet parking. The motel did not charge for valet parking under these curcumstance, but some of the valet staff were absolutely rude and it became a major annoyance. I would not mind the inconvience so much if the staff would have been more professional. In one situation the Hyatt staff directed me to park my car in a certain place and another staff came over and "chewed" me out for parking there. When I tried to explain that I was told to park there the staff member becamce more argumentative. My wife and I could not believe were treated this way.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: Jerseysandy
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront room for three nights, Aug 21 - 24 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel itself, the grounds and our room were absolutely beautiful. The view from our room was breathtaking especially the sunsets. The room we booked included the buffet breakfast and that was delicious with a huge assortment of choices. My only complaint was that every day we needed to get bracelets for the pool and hand in "towel cards" to get pool towels. When the towels were returned, the cards were returned for the next time you needed towels. I considered this practice to be annoying and cheapened the hotel. When paying $500 a night for a room, I do not think I should have to be bothered with bracelets & towel cards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: qbera
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the Hyatt for a week on our honeymoon and we were very impressed with the hotel and the resort - its just beautiful, the sea views, open spaces, stunning gardens (flamingos and pinguins in it), 2 fabulous restaurants (japengo and the swan court), very nice and helpful staff. Would defintely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “stunning view & great service”
Reviews.Author: Abby1974
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Costco Travel. It was our first time to Maui and we were celebrating our 33rd wedding anniversary. We paid a little extra for a Delux Ocean View and we are so glad we did! We got a corner room in the Atrium tower with a beautiful view of the ocean and partial view of the pool and the hills as well. The room was very quiet. The hotel gave us a voucher for a bottle of sparkeling wine for our anniversary to use in one of their restaurants. The room was a bit dated but the bed was very comfortable, (so were the pillows.) The bathroom was suprisingly small. The inside of the hotel lobby was very beautiful. It had no ceiling and so the sunshine flooded in. It was full of palm trees, beautiful plants and flowers and birds. Every morning we took a walk on the path in front of the hotel around sunrise. It was very peaceful at that time and cool too. We always got to the breakfast buffet about 7:00 AM and never had a problem getting a table at that time. We thought the food was delicious; especially the fresh fruit and omlettes. We loved the waterfall view there and we enjoyed all the different birds. Jovan waited on us and he was so attentive and friendly that we asked for him everyday. We rented a cabana on the beach one day and wished we had done it more often. It was nice to have the shade and to be right on the water - we rented # 25 and it was a perfect spot. Our waitress was very nice and she ran all day in that hot sun. We liked the bar, Umalu next to the pool and often went there for happy hour. We also liked the entertainment at Umalu on the weekend - there was a very good male singer with a very mellow voice. The pool was very nice and big but the shaded spots did fill up fast. The Maui Hyatt definetly has a parking problem; there just aren't enought parking spots. We tried to self-park, but many evenings the lot was too full and the staff ended up valet parking our car for us. Of course they didn't charge us when they did this but it was kind of a hassle anyway. We have to compliment the guys at the valet parking though. Even though they were extremely busy, they were always upbeat and respectful. We loved walking to Whaler's Village and we went to Leilani's and the Hula Grill for happy hour and to see the sunset. We also walked down past the Sheraton to Black Rock and because the beach is bigger, the snorkeling is good and we saw a turtle there. We really loved staying at the Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach and we would defintely stay there again. We would also recommend this hotel to our friends. This hotel is in the middle of all the action and the views are absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “So far, the best on the Kaanapali beach”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: Overall, a much better package for our family than the Westin down the beach; rooms, swimming pools, spa and fitness programs, beach equipment rentals and instruction. Breakfast buffet good but lineup needs to be fixed. Unfortunately, a decent stroll is needed to enjoy happy hours at the Whalers village and snorkeling at Black Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Location”
Reviews.Author: pba1
Reviews.Content: We went in August 2011. This is a great family friendly hotel. The pool is great for kids. We did have some trouble finding shady pool lounges, but didn't end up spending a lot of time on the lounges (probably part of the problem; people stake out lounges then leave.) I don't know that I'd recommend this hotel for a honeymoon; it does seem geared toward families. The room was nice; great ocean view. Bathrooms are a bit on the small side (not a Vegas bathroom). The closet was big. Large flat screen TV that we only turned on to watch the visitor channel. The staff was very nice and accommodating across the board. Self-Parking does fill up, but they comped the valet when that happened or they just opened the valet lot across the road for self-parking. The Swan Court breakfast buffet was nice, but I would not stand in line for it (we went early and were seated immediately). Omalu (sp?) was adequate, although a bit overpriced. Pool side service was was prompt and frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: tanvi k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on our honeymoon and were dissapointed! We first went to the Grand Hyatt in Kauai, which was incredible! The customer service, food, and resort were the best we have ever experienced. The Hyatt Regency Maui was pure chaos. When we arrived, there were so many people waiting for their cars at valet and it looked like a madhouse! They were overbooked 15 rooms. There was construction going on in the lobby and all we could see were tarpes, not the lobby ocean view we were promised! Our partial ocean view room was a mountain view and the ocean could only be seen if you completely leaned over the balcony and looked to the right. When we called to tell them that there was a very foul smell coming out of our air conditioning vent and that our water constantly shut off while we were in the shower, they sent someone right up but then said the person that had the key to the closet/office where the airfreshners were for the vent was out until the morning. They tried to change the filter but it did no good. The water problem was never fixed. When I went down to remind them of the water problem and said that I thought it was ridiculous that they could not correct the issue and that we would hope that the service would be better especially snce it was our honeymoon, the manager outrageously and rudely said "everyone is on their honeymoon." I was shocked! Oh! There was about a 20 minute wait to get into the breakfast buffet every morning. This hotel could be better if they expanded to accomodate for all the people they have! They should focus more on quality rather than their clear focus on quantity to make more money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoom destination”
Reviews.Author: angelcity_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon having been travelling to vegas, LA, San Fran. It was perect. The staff were very helpful and offered a good friendly service. The room was very spacious and clean with good air conditioning with excellent storage space for clothes etc. The pools were excellent and the staff waiting on with drinks and food were very efficient. The food both in the restaurants and the pool side area was excellent. We dined at the Swan Restaurant a few times and realy enjoyed it. The hotel is right on the beach front with hammocks galore. It was lovely to take a stroll with a bottle of champagne, sitting in the hammock watching the sun set. If i went to Hawaii again, i would def stay here again. No negatives at all

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lovely property - swim up bars shouldn't be in caves”
Reviews.Author: MariHara
Reviews.Content: Lovely, accommodating, from every step of the way. Gorgeous, distinctive grounds and pet residents - including flamingos, swans and penguins. Who knew??? Japengo restaurant was extraordinary. Poolside grill was okay. Inside "expensive" brunch location - okay, but not really worth the extra time and having to dress for it. Our last night on property we planned on dining at Japengo for a 3rd time, only to find it was closed that evening for a private event. The poolside grill wasn't exactly the "last night ambience" we were looking for, so we went inside to the more formal restaurant where brunch was served, only to find it so understaffed in the bar area while we waited for a table, that we opted to leave the property.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, fairly pleased.”
Reviews.Author: vbab2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is fairly nice and the staff is fairly accommodating. But, don't plan on getting a chair at the pool unless you arrive at 6:30am to save your spot. It's insane! When we first arrived we were in a room on the first floor- which smelled like a basement, and felt like one too. After speaking with the front desk- we were switched to a new room. Much better, and had a view. also- the hotel has almost no parking, which forces you into valet, even if you have paid the $25/day resort fee which should include parking. You then have to tip. Some updates would be nice- it's a little old fashioned in style. Everything is overpriced in Maui- expect to pay for a $20 cheeseburger.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect end to island hopping in Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: NWLondonHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt for the last 3 nights of a 3 week trip in August and had a fantastic time. The hotel itself whilst not ultra modern is great, big wide open spaces, great views of the ocean and an awesome pool with its own grotto! We had an ocean view room overlooking the gardens with the flamingos which was nicely decorated and overall the service at the hotel was top notch. We did not really want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Worth the "Resort Fee"”
Reviews.Author: ShottaNIC
Reviews.Content: I am typically not impressed with hotels, but I must say that this is one of the most impressive hotels I have been to. First off, the hotel is huge, which is typically a negative for me, but in this case it made the experience even better. The pool spans almost the entire property and has various sections to it (slides, basketball, cave, etc). I was blown away by the ambience of the hotel, from the flamingos that walked right in front of me to cross the walkway, to the black swans 3 ft away. Then there were the penguins waddling around and the parrots that kept whistling at and talking to me. The gym is the best I have seen at a hotel. The Sauna is wonderful also. Free parking is a plus and if the lots fill up, they give you free valet. The beach is not very impressive, but in Hawaii all beaches are public, so we just went up the beach to black rock and swam with the sea turtles (free). We really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. The food and extra amenities are really expensive, but we didn't really stay at the hotel for meals or services. I highly recommended (and if you bid properly, you can get this hotel on Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matttravelin
Reviews.Content: After a pretty exhaustive search of Kaanapali, we chose the Hyatt over the Westin & Sheraton. It was a great choice as we felt the customer service was great and the room (Ocean View) had a great view. The service was so great that we left something in the room safe and a day later they were able to get it back for us. Kudos to the Hyatt. Thank you for making our stay enjoyable. The pool was crowded but they enforced the 1 hour rule which was nice. The beach could be better but we rented a cabana ($50/day) to look out on the water which was money well spent (I think I was there from 9:30 - 4:00).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Peaceful Resort”
Reviews.Author: eva0128
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for couples honeymooning or just going on vacation. There was nothing wrong with this hotel. My husband and I loved it there. The workers are so generous and helpful there. The room is spacious and relaxing. There were happy hours each night that we attended and enjoyed. The views are spectacular. Really, I have nothing bad to say about this. I remember there was a parrot that would "speak" to you in the lobby. There were penguins waddling around and swimming. The pools are amazing here. We did come at a time when the beach water was still a bit chilly, but that's not the hotel's fault. I totally recommend this hotel to EVERYONE if they are staying in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again? No, but I can see how it would be a good fit for some...”
Reviews.Author: Just4Jme
Reviews.Content: Okie dokie... I was there with my 8 year old and this is my opinion on my stay here... First the pros - ~ It's a very nice resort, location as far as wanting to explore (via automobile) is wonderful. Very nice room w/ an amazing bed and PILLOWS (some might find that odd, my preoccupation with pillow comfortablity). The room was very clean and the colors the choose to use were very "zen" feeling which makes me feel more at home. ~ The staff was AMAZING. I cannot tell you how pleased I was with them. They were all so wonderful, thank you to each and every one of them! Before I start on the little minor issues, I have one big, huge, complaint I must share and it is the sole reason, I will not stay there again... ~ YOU CAN'T ORDER PIZZA AND HAVE IT DELIVERED ONTO THE PROPERTY. HYATT IS THE ONLY HOTEL ON THE ISLAND THAT DOES NOT ALLOW PIZZA GUYS ON THE PREMISES. You have to go and meet the pizza guy a mile down the road at the entrance. (if you are curious as to why I would need pizza in the first place, please see comment directly below) It still baffles me that you can get a pizza at the Ritz or the Grand Weilia but not the Hyatt, crazy. Cons - ~ I have a very, very PICKY 8 year old when it comes to food (sensory issues, etc)...I tried everything to get him to eat but to no avail. The buffet for us wasn't a very wise choice for us (even with the second person being free) because all he ate was fruit loops, however the buffet was very good for me, especially considering it was "free" but I will tell you right now, DO NOT GET THERE AFTER 7:30AM because the line is AWFUL!!! 6:30-7:10am is the best time. My own friendly suggestion if you get your meal complimentary, just eat and leave, don't just sit and chit-chat and take up space, I felt horrible for all the people waiting in line. I'm not one of those persons that feel I'm justified in taking up space just because I can. Especially if I got the meal for no cost in the first place... ~ The pool was CROWDED! So get up about 6am and reserve a spot. I know this is frowned upon but seriously, you will NOT get a chair otherwise. Be careful though, don't try to reserve it for 3 or 4 hours before you get there, besides that not being very nice, they will move your belongings. ~ The tables at the pool were ALWAYS sticky, everyday. Bring baby wipes or a damp cloth otherwise anything you stick on them with be sticky too. ~ Our room was very nice but we were MILES away from everything! It's a hike, let me tell you, if you'd been meaning to start that exercise routine but never got around to it, ask for the far tower and you'll be all set! ~ The beds were very comfortable but very low to the ground, futon height. So be very aware of your toes, I can't tell you how many times I nailed my toes on the base of the bed. ~ The food was WAY, WAY, WAY expensive. Not entirely their fault I'm sure since it costs considerably more to get things/items to the island but gee-ma-knee, be prepared to cash in your kids college fund. ;) ~ The lobby was extremely small and undersized/understaffed. You'd think with a hotel that massive it would have an entrance to match. ~ The Valet guys were great, expensive but worth it for me. I tipped them 5.00 each pick up and drop off. I thought I was being a cheapO only giving 5.00 but apparently they usually only get 2.00-3.00. :) ~ THERE IS NO BEACH...I read the reviews and I thought it may have been a bit of an exageration but nope, there really isn't any beach. A little to the left and a little more the farther right you go but none in front. I don't personally like spending time on a beach away from my own hotel, Remember that whole sensory issue I was talking about earlier, well I need to be close to the room to help him de-stimulate. ;) - OUR ROOM WAS NEVER CLEANED BEFORE 4pm so any nap time wasn't going to be an option for us..The silly people would clean the vacant rooms before ours, doesn't make a lot of sense to me. Horrible typing cramp...I'll finish my review shortly. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Kkkkkkkkkkkkkkkkk
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs maintenance, and is a little run down the grounds are great lush green plants, different types of animals. Penguins, flamengos etc. The food is o.k japengo is probs the nicest place to eat

Reviews.Title: “After a 2 year break ...”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: The hotel remains consistent. They are adding additional food options which were needed to provide a lower price point. Of note was that coin operated clothes washing and drying machines are available on the lobby level behind the elevators. The ground remain a picture despite the economic downturn. A Hyatt I like!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: pyt_go_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days at this hotel from a successful bid on Priceline. A bit higher than I would have wanted to pay but I guess it's summer season. Just under $200/per night plus the resort fee. On arrival, my husband tried to find guest parking in the lot closest to the front lobby but ended up parking in the lot on the other end. Parking can be an issue but valet will park your car for you complimentary if you let them know that you were not able to self park. There was a bit of a wait when checking in. They booked us for a partial ocean view room but we wanted a room closer to the pools so in exchange they gave us a resort room with a parking-lot view on the 2nd floor with a $150.00 resort credit that we could use. Not bad! Beds were so comfortable. We all slept early and very well. Bathroom facilities were roomy. Great service. Pools were great. Kids took advantage of the complimentary snuba and snorkeling lessons. Wonderful beach front property. Everything was impeccably clean and you did feel that you were in a 5 star resort hotels because of the small touches: cold towels and pineapple flavoured drinking water in the fitness center with an oceanfront view to boot! Very impressed with Umalu. At first, we thought the prices were exhorbitant, $20.00 for a burger, but when the food was served, we thought it was worth it due to quality and presentation and portions were huge. Can't say the same for Japengo. Very disappointed, $12.00 for a california roll! We expected something better than the normal food court sushi but it was just average. Beautiful grounds with the flamingos,penguins and parrots. They have many free activities that you can avail of. Lei making, hula lessons, resort tour, penguin tour but we only stayed for 2 nights so we weren't able to take advantage of them. They have a screen in the lobby that tells you what activities are available for the whole week, so take note of this. They even had a "dive-in" movie each week where they show a children's movie in the pool area in the evenings. Just be aware that you'll be doing a lot of walking since the hotel complex is huge. Our room was close to the pools which we wanted but the walk to the fitness center was a good 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: JohnBunts
Reviews.Content: This place came highly recommended from various friends; therefore, I hoped it would be worth the price for our once-a-year family vacation. Like everything on Maui, it is pricey, and this is one of the most expensive. Pros: Elevators are fast. I don't think I waited more than ten seconds for one the entire week. The housekeepers and most other staff are very friendly as you would expect. The pool is great for the kids. Mine is an eight-year-old. Self-parking is free and convenient. Cons: Beginning with check-in, they didn't have the room I had booked months ahead of time available. The clerk kept disappearing behind a door for several minutes at a time to "check availability". Next, they disclose a $25/day "resort fee" that was never mentioned. It was also not disclosed that the hotel was undergoing major renovations. Large areas of scaffolding covered by canvas blocked the ocean view from much of the main building. When I went down to the desk the next day to request the room I booked, the disappearing act began again. I'm not exaggerating when I say the clerk disappeared twice for ten minutes only to return saying the room wouldn't be ready until the afternoon. I have a feeling this works with many guests who would just give up and walk away. Back to the resort fee. It is supposed to cover things such as in-room coffee, etc. The coffee is a tiny coffee maker with the cheapest grade of coffee packets they could possibly find. Like you'd expect at a one star motel. If you're not a fan of Starbucks, like me, you are in trouble here. That's ALL they serve in the entire resort other than the stuff in your room. The "game arcadeâ€� that my son couldn't wait to see; not a single game working. I had to be refunded the several dollars I had dropped in the various games only to be told nothing is working??? Even my eight year old recognized that as pretty lame. On two or three occasions, my room key failed to work and I had to wait for security to bring another one. These guys apparently felt it was my fault since they never apologized for the inconvenience. They only seemed really annoyed, ask for my ID and handed me a new card. These are just a few things off the top of my head. I don't normally write these reviews but I really felt this was worth taking the time. The overall experience was not what I've come to expect from a place so highly recommended and expensive. LOTS of other choices in West Maui for the money. I'll go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and room changed at our request”
Reviews.Author: Kingfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt 8 days and overall had a great time. Paid for concierge level, which allows you to avoid the long lines at the breakfast buffet. Also thought we paid for full ocean view, Regency Club Ocean front, but when we got to our room we were on the side of the building opposite the sunset and had to look to our right on the lanai to see the ocean. Being from the midwest and enduring long bleak winters I called the front desk immediately to get this corrected. To me it was troubling that I thought we paid for the best view, yet we still looked mostly at mountains and no sunset (two years ago when we stayed at the Marriott on the Big Island, we got upgraded and got more than we paid for) This was a deal breaker and would have colored my entire vacation. Fortunately, Victoria at the front desk didn't need much convincing and moved us to room 2210, the top floor, almost to the corner room nearest the sunset. That made all the difference. Didn't care about the room size or anything else. It also made us closer to the concierge room, so we didn't have far to walk to pick up our yummy breaksfasts (fruit, breads, cereal, hot egg dish - AWESOME coffee) and bring them back to our room. So I LOVE Victoria - she understands hospitality. Other stuff: was a little taken aback by the african & non-native wildlife & art (parrots, flamingos, etc.) but my 9 year old loved them; I would have preferred more of a hawaiin theme. Umalu's tuna burger without the bun is awesome - great slaw. We were there last week in July and were entertained by a great band several nights of our stay - really added to our vacation. We rented a cabana and were able to reserve the exact spot we wanted - liked that. Liked the Maui Hands gallery in the hotel, and actually liked that there was a Macy's there (small - just beach & swimwear) because I had to buy a cover-up and they had a great selection. Used Camp Hyatt twice and thought it was only okay - asked my daughter what she learned about on Hawaiian Culture day and she said there was nothing about hawaiian culture covered - they just painted on a tile. But at least my husband and I got to go snorkeling during that time. Resort staff was great. Given all that I've written, and we really have great memories from this Hyatt property, but I really liked the beach and snorkeling opportunities up by Black Rock (near Sheraton) and might try the Westin or Sheraton next time (although they each have their issues too.)

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: fooddentista
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to Lahaina. Great pool and bar. People were very attentive and they went out of their way to help. They have a great gym open 24 hours a day. The only bad thing is that there is no room service during lunch...but that being said, there are plenty of places to eat that are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are amazing-Hotel should be torn down”
Reviews.Author: lion61fish
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Maui with the family and we stayed at the Hyatt Regency Kaanapali. I have to say that I was dreadfully disappointed with the hotel accommodations and service, especially for a Regency resort and especially for 300 plus dollars a night. Next trip we stay at The Four Seasons, Fairmont or Grand Wailea. I arranged the trip through JetSetter who had sent me an offer for 100 dollars less than I had already booked with the Hyatt direct, although my Hyatt deal included FREE breakfast. I was not able to get the 10 nights I needed through jetsetter so had to book to extra 2 nights with the Hyatt who would not honor the same price and forced me to pay an extra 100 dollars for both nights even though the reservations were linked. They said they can only honor the discount to the agency and some other marketing double talk they mentioned. I say this is just rude and a chance to squeeze a few more dollars from a guest but as you will see this is the hotels business model, with 25 dollar "resort fees" and 18 dollar a day parking since every self park lot is full every night. To their credit they did comp the parking upon check out. I was worried about having 2 separate reservations and confirmed the reservation link several times with the hotel and JetSetter. I must say jetsetter staff and personal were prompt, courteous and professional. A great outfit but they need to be more selective with their hotels. Low and behold when I checked in they could not find the reservation for the two nights, only showing the JetSetter 8 nights and the hotel was full to capacity, even though I was holding a printed confirmation. A stressful start to an expensive vacation. It took over 20 minutes for the woman to emerge from the back room. I had to ask other people to track her down. During that time we were subjected to the awful banging and screeching of scaffolding being erected right over our heads. The noise was deafening. No one told us the hotel was under construction when we booked or offered an y discount based on this remodel. I was told this was "Emergency-Remodeling" which sounds scary. Was the hotel collapsing? I was also subjected to an upgrade charge to have an "ocean view" which I thought I already had. I had already upgraded on JetSetter from partial ocean view to ocean view (there were only 2 choices) Naively assuming that "ocean view" means "ocean view". How naÃ¯ve of me. The geniuses at the Hyatt have devised a way to charge multiple tiers for the ocean view rooms, with partial ocean view (20%) to ocean view (I guess 60% view). If you want an actual ocean view you have to get FULL FRONT DELUXE OCEAN VIEW. What a scam? I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode. Why not add a few more levels while you are at it? High floor ocean view and low floor ocean view, right side of the building ocean view or left side of the building ocean view? They charged me 25 dollars extra for this. They also charge 25 dollars a day for a "resort fee", apparently 300-400 dollars for the room does not include use of the pool or facilities. If I decided not to pay this does that mean I can't swim at the resort? They Hyatt never misses a chance to squeeze the customer. Nickel and diming like a shoddy Vegas property, not a 4 star family resort. Finally they found the reservation. The room was supposed to have 2 "Grand Plush" beds a Hyatt TM which they even boast of as the most comfortable beds in the industry. Some nerve! The marketing folks at Hyatt have never slept at a Westin I guess. These beds were small (queen/double) and are cheap mattresses with minor pillow tops on top of hard beds on cheap wooden platforms and headboards which rattle. The wood platform is 1 foot off the ground, with no box spring so you have to practically roll onto the floor to get out of the bed. The beds are hard and very uncomfortable. The rooms are also dated even after a remodel (popcorn ceilings?) and are very small. The bathroom is so small one person can barely fit in it with the toilet butting up against the tiny bathtub. I have seen bigger bathrooms in $39 dollar rooms in Elkhorn Nevada. The rooms are small, the terrace is minuscule and the ceilings in a supposedly remodeled room still have the 80's popcorn. The biggest thing in this 300 dollar plus room is the minibar setup (profit center) and sits where a chest of drawers should be. Your clothes have to go on shelves in the tiny closet. The hotel was overbooked I was told. How this is possible I donâ€™t know since there is a finite number of rooms but the hotel and pool area were overrun like an ant farm. The Hyatt offered a free breakfast package to the masses I guess, so the Swan Court breakfast restaurant had 100 people on line every morning just to get in. It was like the line for the Matahorn at Disney. There was also one toaster for all these people in the buffet so just to toast a bagel took 15 minutes. The pool has I would guess 1 chair for every 30 guests and almost no shaded areas so it is a battle to get seating, forget shade. If you want a good spot at the pool you are required to wake up with the sun and stake your claim. The Hyatt pool police will move your stuff every hour if you leave it so someone must be present at the chairs at all time. Other guest swarmed around us and literally attached their chairs to ours or moved us as to share the shade. It was like being at an 80% off sale on Black Friday. I was surprised the hotel did not offer roll out umbrellas for guests, even for a charge. We ate at Umalu, the Hyatt midscale restaurant which also supplies the pool food as well. The service was so bad our first night, taking 30 minutes just to get an ice tea that Gordon the manager comped our meal and sent us a gift basket. Very nice fellow. He is a professional and handled the situation very well. On his invite we tried it again for lunch as his guest and it was a little better. Mistakenly we went back again for dinner as the food when it finally arrives is pretty good. The next night the service was even worse with two tables seated after us getting fed before my daughter even got her Mac n cheese. Apparently for dinner they are woefully understaffed. Overall the appeal of this dated, tired property (even with a remodel) is the pool area and grounds which are exceptionally fun and beautiful and the location as the first hotel on Kaanapali has great unobstructed views of the mountains. It offers great beaches and many beach services, but the terrible service and tiny, uncomfortable rooms was so bad I would have to sadly look for other accommodations in Maui, and I spent my honeymoon here 25 years ago. Better than I guess since it was newer. I do recommend JetSetter though. Great deals, customer service, good locations, and good offers. They need to strike the Hyatt from the list I think if they want to market their as an upscale travelers club. If anyone form the Hyatt would like to contact me I would happy to speak with them. jeffg@super72i.com As of today neither JetSetter or the Hyatt has offered me any compensation for an extraordinary expensive and disappointing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A solid hotel but with several disappointments”
Reviews.Author: jafojaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the main section of the hotel with connecting & corner ocean front view rooms. Overall comfortable and clean rooms with good views (partially blocked by the tall coconut trees). One BIG disappointment -- surprisingly small & tight bathrooms. The open atrium definitely felt tropical. Most of the staff members were efficient and friendly. Breakfast buffets(included in our package, otherwise the cost was $30/person). There were many yummy choices (Hawaiian papaya, salmon egg benedict, all kinds of scrumptious cakes) to choose from. For most of the mornings, expect a long wait for a table after 7.30AMish. Relatively small pools for the size of the hotel. Poolside chairs are hard to come by after 11AM. Forget about chilling out at the narrow beach head...better off swim/sunbath/snorkel at the Black Rock. Around the sunset time, we saw a local fishing at a "special spot"...apparently there is a nice channel 100-200 yards out with plenty of prized fish swimming thru the channel. Free/self parking is limited! Valet parking $18/day -- Lowell is the most helpful valet guy. Be aware, between 5- 6.30pm is a zoo time at the hotel -- many people arriving for the checking ins and for the Luau show and hotel guests trying to go out for dinner. Free shuttle to Whalers Village/Sheraton-Black Rock is convenient. Nothing bad about this solid hotel. However, next time we visit Maui, more than likely we will look to stay at another hotel, given the similar price,quality of service and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and pool area.”
Reviews.Author: Fmhunt
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt exceeded our expectations. They have beautiful grounds, a variety of onsite shopping and fun pools. My daughter also enjoyed all of the animals, especially the macaws and flamingos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: dale300300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of our honeymoon (the other half at the Fairmont on the Big Island). I can't say enough great things about the staff here- they really took care of us and made us feel welcome. They blew the Fairmont staff away. We had a great ocean view room- small, but with a view like that, I can't complain! Only downside (and reason for 4 stars instead of 5)- the pool area was extremely crowded and it was often hard to find a chair- especially in the shade. The water slide was also closed when we were there. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PlanoHorn
Reviews.Content: Went over for a conference and came out a few days early and stayed a couple of days extra. What a great place. They treated us like royalty while we were there. Ritz Carlton experience with a Hyatt price tag. The Luau was amazing and the fire knife dancer was unforgetable. We also had the award dinner for the conference at an outside venue. Quite a memorable change from the traditional stuffy ballroom location. The hotel was laid out nicely, clean, and everyone was so friendly. From the desk clerks to housekeeping, they could not have been more accomodating. Highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Siciliangal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with my family of six. We had three adults and three kids ages 11, 10 and 10. The hotel itself was gorgeous and well maintained. The rooms were very comfortable; we had two adjoining rooms. Although the hotel was full, they did give us somewhat of upgraded rooms by giving us partial ocean rooms. The breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had. We only ate a few meals at the hotel, preferring to go out elsewhere for dinners. The food was good and the prices were reasonable by Hawaii standards. The pool was gorgeous, however, the beaches were not the best for swimming. We preferreed Wailea for swimming and took the drive there. But again, the pool was great. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcsAbcs
Reviews.Content: We actually went March '08 on a great package. This hotel is in a good location and helped make Maui what we expected. A lot of scenic drives and a good quality hotel to return to each evening. One of our best dinners ever was at this hotel in the fine dining restaurant with the sunset...the wine, food and company made it non stop smiles on our faces. Definitely plan to eat at least one night at the nice restaurant arriving well before sunset and staying well after.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Fourfauls
Reviews.Content: Roaches, outdated, inoperable refrigerator, bed hard as a rock, TV unformatted, Chair and couch uncomfortable. Really I'm not much of a complainer but I would never stay here again. Go to Mammas Inn and relax in tranquillity. Stayed there for two nights and 5 here at the Hyatt. You almost cannot ruin Maui. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Another beautiful Maui hotel”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful. Wonderful service from valet to restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: snowdctr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our week stay at the Hyatt. The room was pretty nice (although not the nicest for the class of hotel), and we have a view of the luau in our oceanfront room. The poolside restaurant (Umlau) was really good, but expensive. Hard to find pool chairs after 9 am, so we ended up paying $50 for a cabana on the days we planned to hang out by the pool/ocean. It would have been nice not to have to do that, but oh well. The ocean was really rough the whole time, so we weren't able to swim/snorkel in it. It seemed like it wasn't so rough further up the beach in the Westin area. It was nice to walk to Whaler's Village, and it's a short cab ride to Lahaina, which was great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Maui? This place is "A Dream Come True!"”
Reviews.Author: ditsmom
Reviews.Content: My title says it all! Go to the website and check it out... The place is lovely! Be sure to get an OCEAN FRONT room and sleep with the windows open... GREAT PLACE!! Wonderful Breakfast Buffet too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyLils
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about the 9 nights my girlfriend and I enjoyed recently. My only tip is that the Oceanside dining is extremely expensive and a better eating experience can be enjoyed at sunset at the Japengo restaurant at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise? Close......but not entirely”
Reviews.Author: Sad2BHomeDenver
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our family vacation to Maui and stayed at the Hyatt Regency. It was at the top of our budget from our selections.It was definitely beautiful and has so much that warranted the price. I rely heavily on these reviews so I try to post reviews while it's all still fresh in my mind. We travel with our 2 sons, 12 and 16. We enjoy a hotel with nice ammenities and try to be very patient and self sufficient travelers. Driving up to the hotel is a visual treat, beautifully landscaped and overlooks both golf course and beach. The open 'atrium' is lovely and grand. There was a bit of a wait for check in but they were friendly and helpful. There is some construction on site but I felt it was minimally invasive and kind of expect that most resorts have a little touch up going on most of the time. The walk from the desk to our elevator passes through a nice selection of stores, jewelry, Macy's, linens, clothing, etc. I didn't spend much time shopping but one could make an afternoon of visiting the various stores and galleries on the premises. We all shared a room with an ocean view and for a fairly standard room, I appreciated the layout. The bathroom area had a separating wall from the bedroom area making it much more convenient for changing clothes and made it feel like much more space. They stocked the bathrooms with generous sizes of shampoos and lotions which were nicer than your standard hotel products. They were replaced several times over our week's stay. The view was breathtaking and we enjoyed a glass of wine each evening watching the sun set over the ocean from the balcony. The beds were platform beds, sitting low to the ground and weren't amazingly comfortable, like I have come to expect at a Hyatt. Not horrible, just not that .....ahhhhh factor. The grounds are spectacular. My youngest loved taking close up pictures of the swans, flamingos and other wild life on the grounds. We dined at the Swan's buffet each morning and the selections were good with made to order eggs. It was a treat to eat in the open air overlooking the ponds, waterfalls, and beach. There were a lot of birds that flew in and were little thieves. The waiters worked constantly to be sure there were no unattended plates for them to feed on but they were still fairly rampant. It was a small price to pay to have the beautiful open feeling. There was typically a long line between about 8:30 - 10:00 each morning but the lines moved very quickly and there never seemed to be a dip in the buffet due to crowds. We did not dine at any of the other restaurants. The beach is a bit rough and not as clear as the Black Rock area but we had fun with the body boards as the waves were pretty decent. The pool area is very nice but the other reviewers are correct in saying getting a chair could be a challenge and getting the cocktails server's attention was difficult. I celebrated my birthday while at the Hyatt and my husband treated me to a few services at the spa. My scrub/wrap with Jewelie was wonderful, she was warm and professional (making it much more comfortable when you're in such a 'vulnerable' :) state), my massage with Alexa (oh darn, I'm thinking that's not right on the name but I'm sure it starts with an A) gave me one of the best massages I've ever had. Again, the perfect professional. Then my facial....I won't give names here but what a let down. The esthetician talked non stop (about herself) and the facial itself was very basic and rushed feeling....what you'd expect from someone right out of school with the standard massage manipulations. She taught dance and kept commenting on how hot she was for a woman of her age. I found it odd and not the least bit relaxing. I thought maybe I was being too hard on her but overheard another client saying basically the same thing the next day at the pool. I may be a bit picky here but I managed a day spa for 5 years and for spending $130 for a standard 50 minute facial, I felt like it was something I could have received at an esthetician school. The workout area was nicely stocked was not overly crowded the one time I visited. Housekeeping was a bit slow to get to us and we had to call one of the nights to get the room serviced. Not a huge hiccup but it would have been nice to return from our day at the beach to the room being clean and it rarely was until after dinner. There is free parking in the back , a really nice feature. They also have a luau there and the visitors use that parking so you needed to valet at night......nice touch since they don't charge you for it when you are unable to park in the lot. Overall, a lovely hotel with gorgeous grounds and beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stayâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: RacingFan2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week of July 10th and it was a very pleasant stay. I had requested two connecting rooms, one room with a king and the second with a double on a high floor. When we arrived around 3pm, they were both ready. They were on the 19th floor with an excellent ocean front view and exactly what we had requested for beds. We had stayed at this hotel many years ago for our honeymoon. While the rooms have now been updated the hotel has matured well and is in an excellent, well maintained condition. The gardens and the animals were all as we had remembered them. Breakfast every morning at the Swan was very enjoyable with much variety to choose from. Used the pool a few times. Got there at 10:30 and could not find 4 chairs together right by the pool. As is typical, lots of saved towels but fewer people around. However if you keep walking down the path, the Hyatt has plenty of extra chairs facing the ocean and we had no problem finding 4 together. Used the valet parking and the service was always fast and courteous. The only improvement could have been the checkout process. The morning of the checkout there was no bill underneath the door to review. I checked the TV to see if the invoice was â€œonlineâ€�, but it was â€œunavailableâ€�. I would have liked to look at it prior to going to the checkout desk as we had pool service, bar items, etc on there that I wanted to check. The good news is that upon reviewing the invoice, there were no errors and it was perfect. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least...”
Reviews.Author: Lizjaneh
Reviews.Content: The hyatt should be ashamed of this property. It's very old and run down. Despite many calls to the hotel prior to arrival, they never once mentioned the construction that was taking place. The entire lobby view is covered with scaffolding and beige tarps. Our ocean view room had a view of the scaffolding and the huge grey tarps at the front of the hotel. Our room was dark and dirty, with huge wood chips cut out of the doors, tons of bird droppings on the lanai, and a mystery substance stuck onto the sliding doors. We also had to wait for almost an hour at check in (after 4pm) and then waited for another 30 minutes for bad food at the pool restaurant. There was one day that we had to call for our room to be cleaned after returning in the very late afternoon. The only reason I gave this hotel two stars was because my kids had great fun in the pool. The toddler area was great for our four year old. We could sit and enjoy our drinks while watching our kids safely. However, we were only approached ONCE in three days for poolside service. We had to go get our drinks/food. There were so many people in the pool area that I felt like we were competing for space. We weren't the only unhappy people. I've never seen so many people complaining or unhappy at a hotel in a beautiful area. We checked out early and will never be back. Go to the Grand Wailea, Four Seasons, or some other resort. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler051
Reviews.Content: The grounds were well maintained. It has some great ocean views. Staff were courteous and friendly. There were many dining options available on side and more just a short walk up the beach. The pool was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: MrsFord86
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency was our honeymoon destination and we can safely say it is the most beautiful place we have ever stayed - we can't understand the poor reviews. We stayed on a bed & breakfast basis, and had no faults with the food. There was a huge selection at breakfast - it was my favourite meal of the day during our stay! Yes, If you chose to stay at the hotels restaurants for your other meals I suppose they were a bit pricey, but we expected this. That said, the food was delicious & the cocktails even better! The staff were more than helpful, and the rooms were both spacious and very clean. Our stay here was perfect - if it wasn't (quite literally for us) the other side of the world I would be back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Tixie972
Reviews.Content: Do not be disappointed, this is not 4 stars! While the other reviews are technically accurate regarding the pool, etc., they do not give you the feel that the chairs are packed in so tight you cannot get to the pool and will be sitting on top of other guests. There was slides but my 8 and 10 year old kids did not use them as they are weak. Do not plan on getting any benefits from your Hyatt Passport either. Do to the hotel being full we did not get the room type reserved, the restaurants were very slow and food was okay for a day or so. However, they do not really have an order off the menu breakfast other than in the buffet...makes no sense. The other buffet is down by the pool, but food is largely the same as the other buffet with less selection. While the hotel is on the water there is little beach. The beach is much better down by the Westin and you can catch catamaran sail tours by the nicer restaurants at Whalers Village. The beds in are terrible. Many in the reviews seem to love them? They are 6" off the floor mattress only on a wood platform with a foam topper! Cheap and uncomfortable if you are normal size. Managers not helpful either. I could go on but chalk this up to lesson learned. Pick the better brands and read between the lines of what is not said in the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: GZNorman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is full of energy the moment you pull up to this great resort. The valet did a fantastic job! My ocean front king was very comfortable, relaxing & beautiful view as stated. Room service had really good food & service. The pool restaurant had good food & service. Poolside service was very nice but did take some time to get drinks and check to sign. But on her defense, the pool was jam-packed with people. The grounds are beautiful with interesting birds, parrots, etc. all over. The spa was amazing! My husband & I had a couples massage & both massage therapists were fantastic. Best massage I've ever had!!! Maui is awesome & so is this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: CC2Tucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui for a week and had a tremendous vacation. My grandson had never seen the ocean and was totally enamored with it and playing in the waves. There is a perfect beach without rocks for swimming about a 5 minute walk towards Whalers Village. We had rooms with ocean views and the lounge was terrific for a light breakfast each morning. While the hotel is older it is extremely well maintained and the grounds are amazing with swans, penguins, parrots and flamingos. Everyone loved the pool area with a great water slide and water falls. It seems in the newer resorts the entire pool is a consistent 3.5 feet deep but the Hyatt pool has several deep ends, 9 feet, so you can just jump right in. The service was great and everyone was very friendly and helpful. Lahaina had an abundance of restaurants. One we loved that was not there the last time we went is the Ma La Tavern. Right on the water and lots of turtles swimming around the patio area. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui was ok”
Reviews.Author: hetalp
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hyatt end of July/end of August. A family of four, kids 4 and 7. The hotel was way too crowded for my taste. After haivng been to Grand Hyatt Kauai, this resort failed to wow us. Crowds crowds everywhere, i know its summer vacation but this was not my style. I couldn't stand the crowds - at breakfast, at pool, the luau crowd competing for parking in the evening, tour bus size groups checking in every evening. The front of the hotel with valet parking is just crazy. While we were there with kids, it was ok but i wouldn't stay at this resort for a honeymoon or an adult only trip or for a relaxing getaway. Even the employees seemed overworked a bit. We were greeted with lots of Alohas and smiles at the Hyatt in Kauai from every empoyee we encountered. But here in Maui, not much of Aloha going on. While we didn't encounter any rude employees, the overall service was not much to speak of. The resort gardens are beautiful, birds and wildlife were an added bonus with kids. We did the astronomy tour and that was amazing. This place reminded me of the mega resorts in Mexico. There is no beach to speak of. We rented chairs and umbrellas at the Sheraton by the black rock and had drinks and lunch at their Cliff Dive bar and that was money well spent. Sheraton seemed more quiet and relaxing with a killer location. We are very unlikely to return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A little faded, but still still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: brainman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 times in the last 4 years. Each time we notice fewer perks and ammenities (like no more free drinks in the regency club lounge; and keeping track of pool towels, leading to a lot of people stealing towels from each other). Initially we were discouraged, but in the end we were still very satisfied with our vacation. The ladies in the regency club lounge were wonderful and took great care of us and our kids, giving us lots of ideas of fun things to do on the island, and even giving us boxed snacks to take with us one morning. We spent one afternoon in a beach cabana, while the kids played in the waves. The best beach is more to the north (right) along the beach, near the end of the cabanas. Its some distance from the pool, but there are fewer rocks compared with the left side, where I managed to whack my head on some coral a couple years ago bodysurfing. Speaking of which, if you snorkel, go out a little ways at high tide and its great. Lots of fish and healthy coral. At low tide you can't really make it out that far, and the coral nearby shore isn't that nice. The last day we were downgraded out of the regency club due to availability. The sewer backed up (too much sand, and not our fault!). When they couldn't fix it quickly, we were moved back upstairs to the club level again! When we finally left the hotel for another up the beach, immediately wishing we were back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: Chase500
Reviews.Content: Visted for one week, beautiful property with lush gardens. Rooms were clean and well maintained, but a bit small. Hotel itself is dated, but there clearly has been an effort to re-invest and stay true to the Hyatt standards. The pool area is great for kids, and you better like kids as there were many. If serenity is what you seek, best to avoid during school vacations. Also, the one hot tub, and it is a very nice hot tub, was always occupied by parents and their babies. Having raised my own children, I'm not sure I understand why anyone would put their babies in 104 dregree water! We passed on the diaper soup. Lots of the usual chair hogging going on with towels placed on pool lounges and not occupied. But, good for the Hyatt, they enforced their 60 minute unoccupied rule well. My only complaint is the pool area is not large enough to accomodate sufficient chairs for all guests. Shade and poolside were at a premium. Other hotels we visited along the breach appeared to have larger poolside areas. Highly recommend the cabana chairs along the beach. $50 for the day gets you a reserved beach side spot, great service, shade and soft recliners. Japango restaurant is great for sushi, Swan restaraunt has an excellent breakfast buffet. The beach area quite narrow and a bit steep. You need to be careful swimming as there is a reef and lots of rock just a few feet off shore. But this also means pretty good snorkeling and good surf. Bring water shoes. If you want your room cleaned early, you need to let the hotel know, otherwise you may find it not done before 3PM. I give 5 stars for service. Everyone was friendly and had the "aloha" spirit. Value gets a 3, only because there are better properties at this price. Sleep quality a 4. It was great, just not perfect. No hotel gets a 5 from me for this because, well it's a hotel and there will always be someone making a noise in the hall late at night. Cleanliness a 4. Hall carpeting needs to be replaced and the shower curtain had a mildew smell. This is pretty minor though, but doesn't earn a 5. Restaurants 5. Great food a fair price. Spa is excellent 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: exptraveller501
Reviews.Content: We just finished a great family vacation at the resort - 4 rooms including 3 teenagers & a 6 yr old. The resort is very nice - awesome pool area. The breakfast buffet is excellent - a little pricey @ $30pp but it was included in our package. Food in general is high throughout the area.. The only negative about the hotel is the beach area - very narrow & not much beach to be exact. The beach widens a little ways down the boardwalk about a 1/2 mile from the hotel which is not too convenient when you are carrying stuff. The best beach area is closer to the Sheraton but the Hyatt is a much nicer hotel so there are some trade-offs. Parking throughout the area is scarce.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property”
Reviews.Author: jaypeaznuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July of 2011. Wife had a conference with work, and I got to tag along. STOKED!!! Property is beautiful and very tropically lush. We scored an ocean view room, and the sunsets were amazing. There is a kids, adult and grotto section of the pool. The kids pool has a waterslide that is AWESOME!!! I'm in my mid-30's, and I think I went down that thing at least 50 times during our 5 night stay...and I'm not exaggerating. You can choose and ocean and/or pool facing lounger. How great is that! Property is right across the street from golf and tennis. The gym at this place is amazing. Top of the line equipment all the way. Defininitely some incentive to get your [...] down there and work off those mai tais. This place is not cheap, but I did feel that value was worth the money (please keep in mind part of the trip was paid for by wife's work). If I had to be super nit-picky, the maid service was a bit spotty and the food was generally good (not great or excellent). But other than that 5 stars all the way. Rental cars in Maui are super cheap...if you get them from the airport. We took a shuttle to the hotel, and then rented a car and had to pay $125 airport return fee. This hotel has free parking, so I would recommend getting the car from the airport and parking at the hotel. Hotel is a bit further than a walf from Lahaina, so it definitely comes in handy. Plus, there is a refrigerator in the room, so getting some provisions at the market will definitely help reduce some of the food (beer) costs incurred during your stay. For the boozers...when we were there, the bar by the pool (Umalu) had a happy hour from 4-6. $4 mai tais and beers. So check this out if your looking to kickstart your evening. All in all, amazing property. Will definitely get back there...even if it is on my own dime next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel worth revisiting”
Reviews.Author: DawnJuliana
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Altho the rooms are higher priced than other hotels I feel I got a good value for what I paid. We went thru Costco travel and got our car included. The parking is free if you self park and there was enough self park to always park there. A sign of the times (economy). The luau ws nothing new to anyone who has seen a luau before but it was a good show with great entertainment and the food was very good. Again if your looking for something new from a luau you will probably not find it here but if you are a first timer this is a great luau for you. If you are like me I dont feel like I am in Hawaii until I am at a luau. The emcee was very good as well as the food. The pool was awesome. It had something for everyone. Of course the ocean is what most enjoy but for me the mid afternoon to evening the waves are rougher so I stay out of the ocean and the pool is the place to be. The Grounds are beautiful with lots of lush plants and trees and exciting wildlife. One hint would be they are doing construction on the front coffee shop and all those wildlife enclosures are closed which includes the penguins so if you are planning on the wildlife (penguins) call to see when they will make their grand re-entrance. Overall I would stay here again. The bed was fabulous with great pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency is the Best in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bankerlady0253
Reviews.Content: From our Check In by Victoria, to our check out , our visit could not have been more relaxing or enjoyable. The entire staff is friendly and helpful. The grounds are landscaped perfection, and the many exotic birds enhance the total experience. The perfect romantic getaway for my husband and me.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: GetAround67
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Hyatt, and we weren't disappointed. The staff was very personable and friendly. We asked for adjoining rooms when the reservation was made, and were happy that our request was successful! Room size was good, neat bathroom area, with a handy closet. Beds in both rooms were Japanese style - low, with a mattress and no box spring, which we found odd. Not uncomfortable, but different from upscale hotels where you have to climb into the bed! I don't know if all rooms in the hotel had the same type of bed. Room was quiet, never heard our neighbors. Great for families, two pools, kids' pool was fun - for kids. Restaurants were a bit pricey. We ate all our dinners outside in the casual restaurant in the pool area, which was more than adequate. Breakfast buffet was better than average, again a bit pricey, but we had 2 for 1 coupons. We're from Hawaii, and found the Hyatt Maui to be a good value for locals and fun for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Superior”
Reviews.Author: Gunnervonswish
Reviews.Content: I want all to know that when you stay at this 4.5 star resort you will see many people walking around with a plastic container. When you check in, head to the bar downstairs by the pool and pay 18.00 dollars for one of these. This container can get filled up free during your stay. No alcoholic drinks... only soda and juices. Many guests walked up to our family and asked about this. I thought I would pass this information along to those staying at the very classy resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but concierge desk service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: peacefultravelers
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations. Clean. Lots to do and a great place to relax. Good meeting facilities as well. Nice spa. Good food. Overall expensive which one would expect from a resort like this. The beach was ok-- small. We had a bad experience with the customer service at the concierge desk which surprised us for Hyatt. Other than the poor customer service at the concierge desk, we were impressed by the hotel. We would return only if business brought us back to the hotel but we saw a lot of vacationers who seemed to be enjoying themselves.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it..”
Reviews.Author: Tam0922
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7nights. Maui is very secluded and romantic. Great friendly service with a smile. Our room wasnt available so they upgraded us. Great location, on the beach, lots of indoor shops, great food, bed, and room.. Wouldnt change a thing. We even got use to the resort fee:) A few tips: as for a frig and/or microwave. The food was great, but expensive. Shop at the walmart and stock up on snacks and bottled water. Happy Travels!! will post pics soon

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, family fun, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: StellaPL
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property centrally located to all activites in the Kaanapali area and beyond. The pool is alot of fun for all members of the family but get a lounge chair early as they fill up quickly. The hotel gives you towel cards which you trade in for a towel and a wrist band. The colored wrist band identifies you as a hotel guest and allows access to pool and slide. The pool area is crowded but fun. The hotel is on the beach so the beach access is right at your feet and the water is wonderful. Swim in the ocean!!!! The hotel has a wonderful collection on wild life which is a pleasure to see daily. The penguins and pink flamingos are fun as well as the swans, ducks, and koi. The hotel also has beautiful parrots that talk. Restaurants have good selections although a bit pricey by the pool but hey, it's Maui. The hotel guest services will set you up with any activity you desire. The Luau at this property is the BEST! Do not miss it. The shops in the hotel are nice to go through especially the ones with all the locally made stuff. Parking can be tight. There is a parking lot on the opposite side of the hotel near the Spa and Luau entry. There is also public parking and beach access this way as well. Generally you will find a spot on either side since there are two lots available, otherwise, the hotel will valet for you as a curtesy free of charge. Kids activities are fun but they fill up quickly especially the free ones so sign up early.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: saavytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hyatt Recency Maui. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The lobby was amazing with many types of exotic animals. The service was great - thanks to the concierge and front desk staff. Umalu was pricey but delicious food - well worth it when sitting poolside. The pool was somewhat competitive for chairs - so get up early and save those seats! Overall we were very pleased with our stay and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, perfect location, great servive and pools”
Reviews.Author: apurva16
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, perfect location, great service and pools. Kids pool is amazing too and also the adult slides was fast :) It is a big property so if you are looking for small boutique hotel this is not for you. Breakfast is the best, take the package with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I have been coming to the Hyatt Regency for years - Great Tennis”
Reviews.Author: GaryFleishman
Reviews.Content: Living in L.A. affords me the opportunity of visiting Maui 1-2 times per year. I have tried numerous hotels and I always come back to the Hyatt Regency. It has the best Pool, golf course right there, great rooms and prices, well-located and best of all it has the greatest tennis facilities and the best tennis pro to work with, Marc Casperino. My son is a touring Tennis professional so I am very sensitive to how skilled and how well a tennis pro runs their program, Marc runs his program with skill, fun and enthusiasm. He makes you feel at home and tailors your tennis experience to what you need and desire. Applause goes out to Marc Casperino and the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel - EVER”
Reviews.Author: alebetsamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our honeymoon. The trip itself was a bit of a disaster (we both got very, very ill), but the hotel itself and the staff of this amazing establishment was a lifesaver. The hotel is difficult to find, I will admit, but once we made our way there, we felt as though we were in a tropical paradise. The lobby of the hotel is open air, and is full of exotic birds, penguins, flowers and pineapples. It opens out onto a terraced view of the ocean - truly breathtaking. The Hyatt is at the far end of a walkway connecting all the beach-side Ka'anapali hotels with Whaler's Village and Black Rock. It is very nice to stroll along that walkway and people watch, or check out the other hotel's restaurants if you get tired of the Hyatt's. We booked a package with daily breakfast at Swan Court. It was yummy. We ate one night at their Sushi restaurant (which was so-so, very fresh but nothing special - my husband and I are spoiled as to sushi, being from California), another night at their special occasion restaurant Son'z at Swan Court (which was good, but I must admit we either ordered the wrong things or it was way overpriced - though the atmosphere was SUPER romantic) and several lunches at their casual Umalu poolside restaurant (which again was overpriced but hit the spot with both fresh food and yummy burgers). The pool area at the Hyatt is very impressive, with at least two separate areas, and more pool side chairs than you can count. They have a swim up bar in a grotto area, a large jacuzzi for late night which we found to be uncrowded, and waitresses who wandered through the crowd to take orders for pina coladas and other cold refreshing drinks poolside - it was paradise! Activities from the Hyatt were easy to get to and easy to book. Their concierges were beyond helpful. We had a jam packed trip and they helped to arrange practically everything: ziplining, stargazing, out of hotel restaurant reservations. We booked a couples massage side by side on the ocean. Very relaxing, and very romantic. Also, I just have to mention that right off the beach there is a company that does para-sailing. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Now, finally, what makes this hotel my favorite of all time and reserves for them a special place in my heart... I mentioned at the start of this review that my husband and I got sick on our honeymoon - when I say that I mean we got VERY sick. About two days into our week long trip, my husband started coughing up blood and running so high a fever that he woke me in the middle of the night just from his body temperature. I was in a panic - we were far from home, Ka'anapali is 45 minutes from the nearest hospital. In the early hours of the morning, I ran down to the concierge desk to get directions to said hospital, only to find out that the Hyatt HAD A DOCTOR'S OFFICE ON SITE. And they got us in immediately. I dragged my husband downstairs, and he was seen within 30 minutes. He had a bad bronchial infection, but they were able to prescribe antibiotics, I could fill the prescription at the local Lahaina pharmacy, and he could recuperate in the comfort of the hotel room. In 36 hours, when I came down with the flu, we knew what to do, and they squeezed us in again, diagnosed, etc. We had terrible luck (I am still so sad about it) but it could have been much worse if we had been trying to drive each other to a hospital 45 minutes away, coughing and hacking the whole way, both of us running fevers.
