One call to the concierge and they were able to cancel the reservations we needed canceled for the rest of the trip, too, and get our money back when we could. They were great advocates for us when we couldn't be for ourselves. I would visit the Hyatt again in a heartbeat! Sure, they are expensive. You do have to pay a resort fee. Well worth it - take a look around! Sure, they are tropical, so there are some bugs. Good luck finding a place without any! I have no complaints...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service--will never stay at a Hyatt again.”
Reviews.Author: ray3127
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from our dream Hawaii honeymoon. The only sore spot was this hotelâ€”I wish we had stayed somewhere other than the Hyatt. I apologize for the length of this review, but I feel the details are necessary for you to understand why we rated this hotel so poorly. This is from an honest, easygoing person--not one of the TA "one-hit-wonders." We arrived in the afternoon and were given a corner room in their Atrium Tower on a high floor, as I had requested. The room was in their â€œoceanfrontâ€� category, which I had booked (no upgrade). No problems at check-in. Upon getting to our room, we thoroughly inspected it for bugs and found it to be clean. We left for dinner and returned to the hotel for bed. We both settled into bed to read for a bit. Then I noticed a little gnat/fly on my nightstand along with a little ant. I got up to get a tissue from the bathroom, and there I found a couple of more ants on the bathroom sink. Upon further inspection, there were ants crawling everywhere on the bathroom counter. I hurriedly moved our things off the counter. When I checked back by the nightstand, I noticed a number of ants over there (AND on the window curtain, which was next the next to the nightstand) as well. I called down to the front desk and they said they would send somebody up to spray. I waited 5 minutes and decided we needed to moveâ€”I was not going to be OK with this room. So I called down again and they offered us the exact same room location on the floor below us (basically the same view). I knew this was a bad idea, but I accepted at the time. We packed up our things and I went down to get our new keys. We immediately went to the bathroom to look for ants and found the same problem here. So, I called down and they said the only other available room was in another tower. I said thatâ€™s fine and requested help with our bags to get over there. After waiting 10 minutes for a bellman to arrive, we got tired of waiting and took our things down to the front desk ourselves. I asked if they had any suites or Club rooms available, and if so I would PAY to upgrade into them, since we had to change rooms anyway. They told me they had nothing available, but did give us a coupon for free dinner for 2 at their poolside restaurant Umalu. We made our way over to the new room, this time in Lahaina Tower. It was a nice room, and it was definitely â€œoceanfront.â€� However, the view was nowhere near the same as it was on the lowest of 7 floors in this tower. To me, it felt like the room was a downgrade, and since we were on our honeymoon and I had requested a high floor I felt like Hyatt dropped the ball here. The entire room move process took us about an hour. We had arrived on Oahu 2 days earlier, so we were getting accustomed to Hawaii time but we were still jet-lagged a bit. By the time we finally got settled in our Lahaina room, we were exhausted and nervous about finding unwanted critters. The next morning (Thursday), I stopped at the front desk and told them â€œwe just havenâ€™t been able to relax here, and I feel sick that I paid full price for that room last night.â€� At that time, they offered us half off the first nightâ€™s room rate and 2 tickets to their Luau. We were already going to a Luau, so I suggested maybe something more relaxing, like a spa treatment for the 2 of us. She tried calling the spa but got no answer, so she said she would just credit our account an extra $100 and we could go to the spa if we wanted to. I find this interesting because 1) The Retail Value of their Luau for 2 people is $200, and 2) $100 canâ€™t buy you anything in their overpriced spa for 1 person, let alone 2. We said â€œthanksâ€� and thought everything was OK. By Saturday afternoon things just were not sitting well with me. We did not do anything wrong, but we felt like they just stuck us off in some corner to get us out of their hair. So, we went to talk to the front desk again. I had a lengthy conversation with the front desk personnel about our situation. She â€œchecked with the managerâ€� and told us there were no suites available, but offered us dinner for 2 at Umaluâ€¦ To which I said, â€œNo, you donâ€™t understand, we are unhappy and Hyatt has not figured out how to please us.â€� She responded with something like â€œWe feel we have compensated youâ€¦ for your issues on your first night. And your room is in the same tier that you booked.â€� I did not want to ask for anythingâ€”I wanted Hyatt to realize the mental struggle that our stay had been, and I donâ€™t feel like they ever truly got that. The front desk worker was at the point where she couldnâ€™t do anything and asked if we wanted to speak to a manager. We said yes and got to talk to Kirstin (might be Kirstenâ€”not sure). Kirsten says they have tried, that â€œour room is in the category which we bookedâ€� and she basically wants to know â€œwhat we want.â€� Again, it wasnâ€™t about getting â€œstuffâ€� to us. I told Kirstin how frustrated we were and that we looked at other hotels. If anything, something that could help us relax would be niceâ€”maybe something in the spa for the 2 of us or one of their â€œoceanfront huts,â€� called â€œOcean Hales.â€� Upon hearing this, Kirstin immediately says she can book a â€œcabanaâ€� for us. A â€œcabanaâ€� ($50/day) is NOT an â€œOcean Haleâ€� ($150/day). I ask if the Ocean Hales are out of the question, and she backs down and seems to think one would probably be available for us. I ask to have it reserved for Tuesday, and she says the pool manager will call me for sure. Later that night, I get the phone call that a cabana (NOT an Ocean Hale) has been reserved for us on Tuesday. I asked the gentleman if any Ocean Hales were available, because that is what Kirstin and I talked about, and he says â€œnot at this time, but Iâ€™ll monitor it for you.â€� Sure you will. When we checked into our Cabana on Tuesday, I noticed a number of the Ocean Hales were empty. I looked on the check-in sheet (which was obvious to understand) and saw that not all of the Ocean Hales had been reserved yet for the day. So even though they had availability in their Ocean Hales, they did not offer us one. As for our room being â€œthe category which we booked,â€� I told both the front desk and Kirstin that it simply wasnâ€™t the same room and I would be happy to walk them up to each room and compare the two. I told them they should have more categories if they count them as the same. And again, we are on our honeymoon and I requested a high floor. This didnâ€™t seem to resonate with either of them. Throughout the conversation with Kirstin, her expression was rude and gave us the impression that we were a problem. Throughout the process Hyatt seemed to want to know what we wanted. When I reluctantly asked for a suite/club upgrade, spa treatment, or Ocean Hale, they only offered their Luau, dinner at Umalu, and a cabana. The items they offered us are not high-value items and really didnâ€™t make a difference to us. Every time I talked to the front desk, the worker had to go to the back and talk to the managerâ€”this took FOREVER. They simply did not see things through the customerâ€™s eyesâ€¦ I will never forget the line â€œwe feel like we have compensated youâ€¦â€� They never put themselves in our shoes and did anything that made a true difference. They just tried to give us meaningless stuff over and over again In addition to the above problems, here are other issues we have with this hotel: - Parking is an adventure. Had to wait 10 minutes one night just to get into the self-parking lot, and struggled to find a spot on a number of occasions. When we checked in, the valet told us that if we couldnâ€™t find a self-parking spot we would have to spend â€œjustâ€� $18 a day to valet it. - Hot water in the bathroom sink seldom got WARM, let alone â€œhotâ€� - The food is WAY overpriced. No way we would have eaten there if we didnâ€™t have a free coupon for Umalu. - To eat anywhere else, it can be a hike. The hotel is down on the end of Kaâ€™anapali, so you have to walk a ways or drive. - There is virtually no beach in front of the property. - The pool, luau, and other live music make for noisy oceanfront rooms, as others have noted. We had the luau right outside our room every night. It was ridiculous. They also make for a noisy pool-going experience. It was hard to relax with the hoard of people always present on the property. I wish we would have stayed at a number of the other properties on Kaâ€™anapaliâ€”we actually checked out a few and if I could do it over we would have picked the Sheraton. A condo might have been a good option, too. ANYTHING would have beaten our experience here. We will NEVER stay at another Hyatt hotel in our lives. They did a terrible job of understanding our situation and accommodating us on our honeymoon. If Hyatt responds to this post expressing their remorse, I will be astonished because they didnâ€™t seem to have any while we were actually there. Honestly, we had a wonderful time in Hawaii and will always remember it fondly. But I canâ€™t let our amazing trip cloud the view of our terrible Hyatt experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stasnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days Just love it Customer service was impeccable Any problem was addressed immediately Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Noisy oceanfront rooms”
Reviews.Author: RicGPDX
Reviews.Content: In terms of staff and amenities, the Maui Resort is up to the kind of Hyatt quality you'd expect. However, there are a couple of caveats. If you opt for an ocean facing room, expect a lot of noise from the live music in the central court area or from the nightly luaus at the south end of the property. The live music can run from 4 - 11 and when they brought in a large band, conversation or watching TV in our 9th floor room was almost impossible. Also, unless you choose to partake of the hotel's rather limited (and very pricey menu), you'll need to drive or take a fairly long walk to the nearest convenience store or small restaurant that offers light meals. The hotel's own small sundry store only offers candy, cookie and potato chips for snacks. We were also a bit offended by the electronically monitored snack tray ($3 candy bars!?). If you touch it, you've bought it. We generally like Hyatt when traveling, but this will not be a resort we'll return to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: boomeranglv
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt Regency Maui because of the all inclusive value through Costco Travel. Seems most people are here on a package so explore your options. Room: We upgraded our package in advance to a Deluxe Oceanfront Room. Our particular room was on the very end about as close as any room to the beach, so a very good location and view also with a balcony with seating for two. Average size room and small bathroom. The room was in good condition and comfortable from the soft renovation but you will notice some things are dated such as the popcorn ceilings and old fixtures. Parking: We utilized valet on a couple of nights when self parking was full and there is no charge. Avoid parking in the Napili Tower self parking (first self parking as you drive in). The spaces are so small it seems they were made for compact only and it is always full. If you do park there, expect some scratches on your car. Use the Lahaina Tower self parking lot if you are on that side of the resort. The spaces are much larger and it is overall less crowded. Too bad I only figured this out on the last night of our stay! Contrary to other reviewers who had billing issues, we had no issues at all. Seems they have that process figured out. Restaurants: Japango was excellent! Umalu at the pool was very good as well for a casual option at all times of the day and service very good. Don't miss happy hour 4-6 and again at 10pm! The breakfast buffet: Yes, there is always a line but it typically moves very quickly so be patient (9 - 9:30 seemed to be the worst time). As an option, the resort lets you eat at Umalu if you don't want to wait in line. We didn't do this as we liked the food/selection very much at the buffet. Don't go here if it is not included in your package. Way to expensive. The birds flying around the restaurant were cute on the first day but after 6 days it was quite annoying. Pool/Beach: We didn't spend much day time at the pool. The pool is 24 hours, which was very nice and we did utilize it at night. People put their towels down and leave so all the good seats are taken early. There is supposed to be a 60 minute limit on your chair being empty but I could not tell that it was enforced. We opted to pay $50 one day for a cabana on the grass/beach and so glad we did! Happened to be cabana 26 and the beach in that section was very nice for swimming. Check In - Victoria was exceptional Concierge (Expedia Travel) - Dan was exceptional Check Out - Our bill was perfect the first time around! Overall, all of the staff at this resort were very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Massive resort groaning with people”
Reviews.Author: tom_sydney11
Reviews.Content: This place is huge! Over 800 rooms - probably over 1500 people when we were there - we completely misjudged this place. Normally we enjoy boutique hotels, but there either aren't any on Maui or they are very difficult to find. The resort charges a 'resort tax' of $25 per night - a rip off that doesn't appear in hotel pricing searches. It's compulsory - so why not include it in the rate and be upfront about it? They all seem to do it. Having been to Anaheim years back with the kids, it reminded me of the hotel there. Teaming with people, tables, chairs, lounges so close to each other you know all about your neighbour's lives by the end of dinner/lunch/sunbathing. And.... to get a lounge chair in the shade, you have rent a cabana or a lounge chair on the lawn - for either $100 or $50 a day - on top on the 'resort tax'! The 'partial ocean view' we booked and paid extra for overlooked the roof of a building and we could only glimpse the ocean by standing on the tiny balcony (next to the air conditioning compressor!) and straining a look to the right - about 300 m away. Unfair advertising. We checked out other resorts to move to, but we ended up spending less time there rather than the hassle of moving. Renting a car gave us external options.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: HungryandHappy
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful honeymoon at this hotel. We have stayed at many resorts/ hotels and Hyatt Maui was exceptional. Staff went out of their way to assist and were always polite, knowledgeable and welcoming. The oceanside dining was one of the most romantic experiences, with a great waiter (Erwin), who was the perfect combination of accommodating and friendly, but never intrusive. The activities centre staff are very helpful and learned, and Pam and Ray went out of their way to help us. The room service was on time and not cold (a rare achievement nowadays!), and all the restaurants had great food and friendly, warm service. The rooms themselves were nice, bathrooms slightly small and not luxuriously fitted out, but they were always impeccably clean. The pool, beachfront facilities and gym/spa were very well thought out and the whole resort gave the impression of having been designed with guest comfort and care in mind. We are planning to return every year!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if you child is slightly under 48"”
Reviews.Author: csaszarl
Reviews.Content: I usually love the Hyatt Regency properties but unfortunately was disappointed in our stay here, resulting in our switching our stay to the Grand Wailea. I may be a bit spoiled as my family and I are used to staying in 5 star (or like) hotels, and this one was definitely not. I will give the pluses and minuses in trying to remain as fair balanced as possible. + Front desk and Jennifer with Camp Hyatt was very helpful and accommodating. + Reasonably priced and right on the beach, so the view from our room was excellent + Although didn't take advantage of it, appeared to have good entertainment nightly outside. + Loved the other wildlife on the property - penguins, birds, and swans. + Although a little bit of a walk, within walking distance to the shops in the area. + Has a luau on property every night - make sure you get VIP or priority or you will stand in line for A LONG TIME waiting to get in! - Regardless of some of these other reviews, they are VERY STRICT on their water slide rules. I believe it's due to their liability insurance, but my daughter was remeasured every morning when we got our towels and told each morning she was too short for the water slide that all of her new friends were going on (so every morning we both started off upset and frustrated - not the way to you want to start your day). Very disheartening and the major reason why we left as we chose the hotel for our child's entertainment moreso than our own. The 2nd hotel we stayed at had the same measurement restrictions but were flexible and we enjoyed our stay much more - we weren't constantly reminded what activities we "couldn't" do! - Pool, although heated, still was cold and wasn't as pleasant as our other hotel stay's pool. - One of the "parking lot attendants" was quite rude to my husband when he attempted to park the car based on the valet's specific direction. He was told by another it was the 2nd time that day that this same individual received a guest complaint. - Really no beach. - Although this hotel was supposedly recently renovated, it didn't appear so. The front lobby and chandelier appeared "dark" and the rooms still outdated. One helpful hint if you're going there - they advertise "lei making" on certain days of the week but don't tell you at check in that you have to call around 6:00 a.m. in order to book your reservation. Space books quickly and when we tried to set this up for my daughter's birthday that morning they were already "sold out". They really need to educate all guests at check in on some of these particulars in order not to disappoint their guests interested in these types of daily activities.

Reviews.Title: “complete relaxation!!”
Reviews.Author: kjs060
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend booking with the Hyatt Regency, Maui. Booked with the Regency Club. Continental breakfast, snacks throughout the day and appetizers in the evening. Breakfast offered different fruits, danishes, yougurt, and a egg dish. Coffee machine was the best!!! Latte, cappuccino, black..whatever your desire. We stayed 7 nights. The appetizers in the evening were different each night. I have to say they were heavy appetizers!!! A few of the nights we didn'y even go out to dinner. Too full!!! One night was shrimp, another night chicken skewers, along with grilled (yes grilled!!) vegetables, humus, bread, fruit, dips, brushetta...amazing. Okay that was the food. Grounds were well kept, many colorful parrots, Koi, and penguins in the lanai. Had a blast in the pool. Long winding slide that was so much fun!!! Did I say I am 61 years young??? We went with our friends and I have to say, we spent a good part of the week on the grounds. The night time they have the lighting of the torches, and Hawaiian performers call out with the conch shells at sunset. We ate dinner at the Swain Court for my birthday. The hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne!!! What a nice touch. My husband and his friend played on the Kaanapali Gold course which is right at the hotel. Perfect for fun. Wide fairways my husband said that makes you look good! Staff was great!! Would have to say that I am now a Hyatt fan. Warning...I would never go without signing up for the Regency Club!!! Everything the staff did at the club made us feel special!!!

Reviews.Title: “On Maui, you can't ask for Much More!”
Reviews.Author: braveshelb
Reviews.Content: Overview: Every few years we take a trip to Hawaii, but when we finally decided to fly back to Maui after some time it was a shock. Maui is unlike most islands, a commercialized fantasyland looking tourist area, each resort is funneled into a large resort complexes, and the Hyatt Maui is at the tail end of the largest resort complex on Maui: Kaanapli. Location: The Hyatt Maui is a large resort, but that is no reason to give it any worse or better of a rap than any other. Many Hawaiian resorts, perhaps all near Wailea on Maui are larger, larger than a measly 10 acres for sure. The Hyatt Maui is located in Kaanapali which is a beautiful area, but the Hyatt's drive from the airport is a long one. Beautiful but still taking about 40 minutes from the airport, and traffic jams can occur during the summer and winter, the peak seasons of Hawaiian. The Hyatt Maui is about 40 acres or so but actually feels smaller if you have ever been to its cousin resort the Hyatt Kauai on Kauai. But nonetheless the resort feels private being at the farthest end of Kaanpali. However if you are feeling the need for a change from the measly 4 restaurants on property, sadly you are out of luck because Whaler's Village is basically a thirty minute walk away, and black rock a forty. However if you really love to walk or jog you can get there in fifteen (either place). So the location is not terrible, and is by no means a way to say that you will not stay there. Property: The Hyatt Maui is a large property, with at least three gardens. Some with gazebos, wedding gardens, ocean views, rope bridges, waterfalls, so plan to see it. The resort is terraced on a small hill with ocean views and wildlife everywhere. Yes, like other reviewers have said, the atrium lobby is a beautiful place with large chandeliers with shells painting onto the lights and most of all small wildlife like penguins and tropical birds, a fancy name for some named Parrots. The Penguins are also there, and no noise echos through the lobby like i have heard other people say. The small atrium is a pretty sight and i recommend having a room there (in the atrium tower) if you can have the chance. The property is small compared to some other mega resorts down near Wailea or in Kauai, but it still is a beautiful property. The prettiest on Maui for sure! The sprawling nature is something i found not so much a discomfort. You can walk through a large shopping complex complete with a small Macy's. Here these walkways that extend from he atrium also are air conditioned so you can walk around everywhere. Beach/Pool: Out of everything on Hawaii, to me the beach and pool are the most important. Sadly the Hyatt Maui has a strange beachfront. The sand is small, compared to other properties down the road, and while you can take a fifteen minute walk down to the Westin and have a nice white sandy beach day, the Hyatt's beach is not so special. A bit farther down near the ballroom area of the property you will find a slightly more generous stretch of beach in which the sand is a bit wider in length. However the beach near the pool is not so special. However once you swim into the beach the waves are not to high even during high tide and for anybody who hates swimming or beaches, there are hammock right near them where you can lay down and just watch the waves go by! Hyatt always has great pools. The Hyatt Maui has two pools. One large and more of an adult pool with some waterfalls and a basketball hoop hung on the fake waterfall rocks to the left. The pool is deep, pretty, but the real fun is farther down. If you go further into the waterfall a small grotto is formed where the rocks sort of envelop you into a small channel near a small bar that is not a swim up bar. No, you have to get out and order a drink, but it still is better than having to walk out of the pool and go over to order a drink, so people shouldn't complain. Anyways the other pool is the activity pool with a small kids play area with fake sand and some squirting fountains. A small slide is here. Rocks are all around the pool, forming a large canyon and a rope bridge is overhead, something my son enjoyed so much that it actually got me worried it would fall. A small tubular waterslide that is inside rock is in this pool. That waterslide is very scary, and because it is so dark i recommend only younger folks try it. The pools are nice, and shade is everywhere. Chairs and towels do fill up, and there aren't that many cabanas but the pool is still nice. While it actually is large, it can feel tiny if the larger pool bores you. However the pool is still a very Hawaiian esque landscape, and every fun to enjoy. It is the main draw to the resort. Restaurants: While we were at the Hyatt one of the restaurants was under construction, which made dining limited. However i had stayed here once before and remember the dining at that particular restaurant to be Asian food, and was very good for the cheap price. The main casual place to eat is Umalu, an informal place with live entertainment at night, sit down lunch, and poolside service too. The place is good food, but as with all Hyatt food it was expensive, and if you are a bargain hunter try to include dining in your package when you go to Hawaii. The main restaurant is the Swan Court which also has a buffet breakfast. The place is great for dinner, but when we were there it was like a ghost town by eight thirty. However the food is excellent, with nice wine selection, and the steak and pastas are simply incredible. Room: We had an upgrade to an ocean view in the atrium tower, but all the rooms overlook the ocean to some degree (don't complain if you have a view of one of the parking lots, chances are you also have an ocean view to the side). the Mountain view rooms was one I had two years ago when i stayed at the Hyatt for business and it was excellent but the rooms were recently renovated. The beds are like all Hyatt beds, a bit low to the ground, but also very large and comfortable. The rooms are expensive, but booking a package is what i recommend. The bathrooms are large size for Hawaii and the view we had over the ocean and pool was like out of postcard or a travel website. Simply suburb even for the price. All in all the Hyatt Maui is a very nice place. Yes like all Hawaii places it is expensive but judging the hotel itself at that press time, the Hyatt Maui is great. It does have a long drive to its property, the long walks to Whalers Village are a bit of a downer but the resort feels more like an escape than anything else. The beachfront is generous further down the property towards but not quite at the Marriott next door. The pool is great for the Kaanpali area and is the largest besides the Westin, and the most artistic pool out of all of the them. The dining is great, and with the latest restaurant revamped, or at least i heard it was, the Hyatt will have no trouble being compared to the Wailea resorts down the road. The resort is a great place to relax, and I hope i helped anybody looking for to stay on Maui! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “My Family was treated like Ohana”
Reviews.Author: gebersk
Reviews.Content: My family and I are not big spenders nor are we big fish. But we were treated like them. I was very pleased with the staff as they took care of us and our children, a 5 yr old hyper excitable engine-running the whole time boy and our obstinate 3 yr old. My son even had a bad accident by falling in the koi... they were more concerned about my son then they were about how it happened... I was so surprised and pleased to see that they treated us like ohana,,, family.

Reviews.Title: “Room was disappointing, grounds were beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: msufan12345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Maui on our honeymoon the last week of June. Our travel agent booked us a partial ocean view room because she said it is very common to get an upgrade to ocean front on your honeymoon. This was not the case for us and our view from room 2001 (main tower) wasn't anything special. The room itself seemed great at first glance - sitting area with a couch, table & chairs, flat-screen tv, duvet cover on bed, refrigerator, etc. But once we looked closely, there were stains on the countertops & mirrors, there was a substantial gap under the door which was weird since nobody else seemed to have a big gap. When I called the front desk to ask why we didn't have a weather strip under our door when everyone else seemed to have one - they told me to shove towels under the crack so insects, etc. won't crawl into our room. My husband was disgusted that the front desk told me to shove towels under the door rather than fixing the situation by installing a weather strip everyone else had. When he confronted the front desk, they offered to fix it the next day, and gave us a $50 credit for lunch by the pool. We actually couldn't open our door wall and let the breeze come through the room UNLESS we shoved towels under the door - because the door would bang loudly. Very frustrating. In addition to the problem with the door, our refrigerator was broken. After arguing back and forth with the girl at the front desk about it being broken (she insisted that we hit the cool down button too many times), we finally had someone come up to confirm what we already knew - it was broken!!!! Then, after making many calls, they decided to have someone remove the stuff from our mini bar refrigerator so we can use that one. Turns out the mini bar will lock you out after a certain period of time, so after loading our groceries inside it we had to wait the next day (for about 30 minutes) for a maintenance guy to unlock our own fridge so we could get it all out. UGH!!!!! WE ARE ON OUR HONEYMOON!!!! Talk about being inconvenienced! We should have complained about the refrigerator but it was our honeymoon and we didn't want to concentrate on the negatives especially after having an amazing time in Kauai & in Oahu before arriving in Maui. The grounds were beautiful. The breakfast buffet was AWESOME. We were very happy that we booked the package that included breakfast. The beach in front of the hotel seemed too rocky for us. We just walked down towards the Marriott (right at the edge of the Hyatt property), laid our blankets down on the grassy area and swam there. It worked great for us. We brought our cooler there since it wasn't part of the Hyatt waitstaff area. The food in Maui wasn't as good as Kauai or Oahu but we had our best meal at Roy's in Maui. Leilani's was horrible. The fish was hard as a rock! The Old Lahaina Luau was fantastic but the food wasn't anything to write home about. Sansei Sushi near the Ritz was AWESOME and they have great deals on sushi on Friday nights I believe. Check out their website before going. Can't wait to go back to Hawaii... Kauai and Kona will be first on our list!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful (but huge) hotel”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here recently and overall we thought it was fine. If you like smaller, boutique hotels this is clearly not the place for you. That said, the grounds are absolutely lovely, and we all enjoyed seeing the penguins, flamingoes, parrots and other wildlife that live at the hotel. The hotel's beach is not the greatest; it's small and very rocky. But you can walk down towards the Sheraton and the beach opens up quite a bit. The people are very friendly, the rooms are nice and the location was pretty central to all the fabulous restaurants and things to do on Maui. One thing that I think something should be done about: the line for the breakfast buffet is crazy long every morning; so I don't think the breakfast facility is adequate for the number of guest rooms at the hotel. The hotel food is quite good though, we especially enjoyed the Japanese restaurant (Japengo) which had very good sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: houstonadventurer
Reviews.Content: This was not initially my first choice of hotels but since we were traveling with 2 kids it was one of the best choices. It is a clean and updated hotel. The grounds are really nice. Lots of things for the kids. There is a kids' club with activities for kids 5+years. There are a wonderful assortment of animals including all sorts of birds (parrots, penguins, swans). The pool there is nice. There is a section primarily geared towards kids with caves, waterfall, slides and a shallower wading area. We stayed on the club floor which is nice so the kids could get a cold drink whenever. Microwave is available upon request as is a minifridge in many rooms.There is a coin operated laundromat onsite which is great with kids as all your clothes will fill with damp sand quickly. So overall very family friendly. They have a takeout option at some of the hotels restaurant and the sushi was very good. Rooms are not particularly large and I would recommend requesting a mountain view or FULL ocean view. The only disappointment was the lack of beach on the grounds. Immediately right behind the hotel is a very narrow strip of sand and the waves can be rough. If you walk a little towards Whaler's village/Sheraton they have much nicer access to the beach and a protected cove with gentler waves which are much safer for the kids. Visibility for turtle and fish watching/snorkeling is better in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort that provided for an amazing vacation..”
Reviews.Author: deebenz
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Stayed for 8 nights at the Hyatt in early June with my boyfriend. Upon check-in, we knew we were in for a fabulous vacation! You really can't go wrong at this resort. The rooms were very nice and CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN - which is a major plus because I am a germaphobe. Extremely spacious with a mini fridge that we used to store our snacks and water bottles. Definitely utilize the Safeway grocery store 5 minutes up highway 31 (as the hotel can be pricey) and be sure to sign up for their discount card if you are interested in saving a few dollars. For a partial ocean view room, our view was spectacular (60% ocean, 40% resort/golf course). I can't recall our room number, but it was on the 8th floor of the Napili building. The grounds of the Hyatt are immaculate. There is basically an exotic zoo inside the lobby surrounded by beautiful landscaping. Every morning we would head down to the Starbucks for our coffee and just enjoy the view of the ocean. Definitely eat at the sushi restaurant if you are into that - it was great. Umalu and Sonz were also delicious. My only gripe with Sonz would be during the breakfast buffet, tons of birds were flying overhead and would often leave droppings, which was gross. I wish the Hyatt would do something about this.. otherwise, the food was pretty good. To sum it up, we had an absolute wonderful vacation and could not be happier that we stayed at the Hyatt. We checked out the Westin grounds, as this was our only other option we were considering, and although it was also very nice - we were still extremely glad we chose Hyatt. So jealous of anyone who is heading there soon!! ENJOY! It is truly paradise :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: JohnCitizen4me
Reviews.Content: We arrived before the designated checkin time after a very long flight and the hotel was brilliant in getting 2 rooms side by side within 20 minutes of our arrival. The property was first class with great places to relax, drink and eat and the service was good. The Hyatt is down one end of "Resort Row" and everything is within a short walk from here. From what we could see we had luckiliy chosen well and the hotel suited our older teenage kids that came along. The gym facilities are one of the best I have used anywhere. Be aware that every hotel along the beach fronmt seem to charge a $25.00 per day resort fee. Don't let it spoil your hoolliday when you see it.... they all do it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: familytravellers2011
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui and will certainly not be our last! The Hyatt Regency Resort is truly breathtaking! Just walking around from the foyer is like being in a tropical oasis. The staff are polite and friendly, all of them from the front desk to the pool service. Paul from Maui Beach Activities was especially so! The food from Umalu served by the pool along with drinks made you never want to leave your lounge.The pool itself is amazing, with waterfalls and always at the perfect temperature. The rooms were clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. It is an easy walk from the resort to Whalers Village or take the free shuttle. Here there are great shops and restaraunts. We loved "Leilani's", the food was great at a very reasonable price and the Hula pie-- OMG! We could not find a single fault with this resort and are already planning to return same time 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and pool”
Reviews.Author: pmurt2
Reviews.Content: We just finished a vacation in Maui, and checked out on July 5th. Hotel room was very nice. Pool was outstanding; enjoyed by both adults and kids. The valet parking was convenient, and the valets were quick, and always willing to assist with directions. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but a little pricey. Try to get a '2 for 1' coupon when you check in. The beach was disappointing as there is only about 12 feet of sand from the water to the plants. If you plan to spend a day on the beach, you will need to travel. We found 2 great beaches (black rock, and airport beach). Both beaches are slightly north of the hotel (not within walking distance) and were great for snorkeling and relaxing. If you have anything valuable, be sure to lock it in the safe (in your room closet).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with baby”
Reviews.Author: miffymiffy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our stay at the Maui Hyatt. I was surprised by how attentive and welcoming the staff were. Each and every staff really did their part to make our stay a memorable one. Even though the hotel was quite busy and packed with customers, the staff at Hyatt were professional, friendly and helpful! They even remembered our Wedding anniversary! The single only thing that could be improved is the weak water pressure of the shower head. Other than that, everything was quite perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with everything there”
Reviews.Author: Dr Benjamin P
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for a getaway since it offers as much action and option one could want, but equally the choice to chill out totally and do nothing. The setting is spectacular with absolute beachside proximity, lush gardens, walkways, huge pool complex and multiple choices for dining. The island of Lanai lies just across the channel and adds to the amazing views from the Oceanview side. For dining the choices are many, both at the hotel and in the general area. In the actual hotel, we liked 'umalu (al fresco bar and eatery) and Japengo (with a Japanese fusion edge). The food is surprisingly good. A 15 minute walk along the oceanside pathway takes you to Hulas, another good place to to eat at. Staff at the hotel are all pleasant, professional and endessly helpful and all their check in and out systems are highy efficient, both being able to be completed online as well. As well as having a lot of choice and space for self-parking, there is a valet service. The resort naturally has its gym and spa treatments available and of course in arrangement with others, many activity add-ons for excursions such as diving and snorkelling, trips to the top of Haleakela and more. It also has a large shopping precinct in the actual hotel complex. Our oceanside room was large, well appointed, very clean and had a very generously-proportioned space with a small private balcony. The hotel also offers seniors' rates to those over 62. WiFi comes with a $25 per day services access charge which includes gym and pool towels. These charges may vary according to room and package. Lahaina town is close and although not my fave place, it has additional eating and shopping options.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty plumbing!!!”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 2011. Had a problem with our toilet not working properly. This was a problem that occurred the whole week we were there. Every night we had to call the front desk to send someone up to fix it. They were happy to Come up and plunge the toilet every time we asked , but still..... One day I came back to the room to find water all over the bathroom floor. We would not stay here again. One of the "engineers" that were sent up to help said the toilets don't work when the hotel becomes full. Also at this resort you will find overcrowding in the morning at breakfast. On a positive note, the resort has a wonderful pool area which my 12 year old thoroughly enjoyed. Food is nothing but just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Major Bed Bugs!!! Run fast!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacayion
Reviews.Content: Here are the issues we had- First we were told this was a five star resort.. Not the case. The bathroom barley fit one person. It had â€œpop cornâ€� ceilings and only one TV to share between the â€œbedroomâ€� and living room. Beyond that we had the following major problems.. Keep in mind if we would have know this before hand we wouldn't have booked this trip. Bed bug bites on myself, my wife, and both of my small children. Every morning.. All over us. Construction (jack hammering) pool side. Would you book a vacation if they were doing construction projects? No hot water pressure in bathroom. We took mostly cold showers. Breakfast buffet were charged full price. We told them our vacation included two free breakfast per day. They told us (while we were already seated) to go speak to the front desk or theyâ€™d bill us. Obviously Iâ€™m not about to walk to the front desk in the middle of breakfast so we were billed. We never went back the entire vacation. Self parking was always full. We were told in that instance â€œvalet parkingâ€� was free. It was a battle every time to get them to honor that.. They billed us and we had to fight it. Pool slide- We were told children had to be over 48 inches high to ride the slide Both of our children are over 48 inches. When we got to the entrance of the slide we were told we needed a bracelet to ride the slide.. Why we weren't given these when we got towels is a mystery but never the less I walked all the way to the front desk (in shorts wet from the pool) to get these bracelets. When I finally got them the pool slide attendant told us â€œOur children didnâ€™t look like able swimmersâ€�. How is this his call? My children water ski in the lake.. Body surf in the ocean.. Snorkel in the ocean.. But not they aren't good enough swimmers to go down a slide? Bullsh... As a result of the pool slide issue we ended up driving every day to another resort (30 miles one way) to use their facilities. This cost me precious vacation time, gas, and added expense. I would never ever go to this resort again.. Even if it were FREE!!

Reviews.Title: “I had to be dragged away from this fabulous resort; I did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleK2
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to say how much I want to be back at the Hyatt Regency right now. From the moment we arrived and Owen, the bell man, greeted us, we felt welcomed. In fact, my 8 and 5 year old daughters would ask every time we got near the lobby "Is our friend Owen here today?" They loved how he showed them how to get the African crane to call out. They loved how he talked to them as individuals and not just little kids. Our room was large and lovely. Beds were comfortable. I loved leaving the screened door open to listen to the waves as we slept. The grounds were beautiful and we were always able to find seats near the pool, even in the shade. Food at Japengo (sp?) was outstanding. My picky 8 year old powered down the beef teryaki and she rarely eats anything like that. While the meals were expensive, there are ways to cut your costs - there was a fridge in the room and next time we come we'll hit up the Safeway for breakfast foods at least. I am so sad we had to leave to return East. I have to start planning our next trip back. What a wonderful property.

Reviews.Title: “"Get Me a Shubbery!"”
Reviews.Author: shalmunzies
Reviews.Content: The neat thing about the Hyatt is the amazing ambience.The grounds, with the tropical flora and exotic fauna, are worth a visit even if you're not staying there.The rooms themselves are nothing special, but the service is friendly, the pool areas are fun(gotta love the grotto/waterfall bar), and the beachwalk that runs up to the Sheraton is great for people-watching. Another plus is a well-maintained fitness facility that lets you enjoy ocean views while toiling on a treadmill.(If you try running on the beachwalk around sundown you will NOT be setting a personal best.)If you visit, don't forget to say hi to Spike, the resident African crowned crane - he'll try his best to peck and claw his way to your heart.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: TJD50
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the staff were helpful and pleasant to deal with....and my young daughter thoroughly enjoyed the pool & waterslide. However, I cannot recommend this location based on the many other negatives we encountered during our stay. As this was partly a working vacation for me, I purposely chose the Hyatt based on brand name/recognition, figuring there would be decent business Internet service provided (after all, it is part of their daily $25 resort fee). Nothing could be further from the truth...the wireless signal was non-existent in our room, and the staff candidly told me it wasn't much better elsewhere on the hotel grounds. Given the high cost we were already paying the Hyatt for our accommodation, we still found surprisingly high prices for breakfast, snacks, etc....and the rooms themselves just looked old & tired. There may have been some renovation done recently, but I certainly didn't see it. We'll look elsewhere for our next stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “It was all disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jdawydiak
Reviews.Content: Since we saved on our airfare we decided to live it up and choose to stay at the Hyatt. In our 10 years visiting Maui it was one of the worst hotel experiences ever. We had a cockroach experience within 2 minutes of entering the room. Then slow to no wifi was a big issue as my husband needed it for work. While the main oceanfront room area was nicely appointed - a zen feel- only one person fit on the small balcony. The bathroom was dark and tiny with holes in the doors. The "snack bar" took up an entire counter space in the bath/dressing area and you couldn't move it. This is definitely not Hyatt quality - I've stayed in nicer rooms at the Hampton Inn! Our daughter did enjoy the lava tube slide but we found the pool much too noisy, crowded and expensive. After 2 nights we were grateful that West Jet Vacations was able to check us into the new resort in Kaanapali. Making our worst accommodation the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: frescagirl
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful - very lush. It was really a gorgeous hotel in terms of the lobby, the grounds, the restaurants. The room was not as spectacular as the rest of the hotel. I would not have spent extra money to have a partial view, it really was not worth it but perhaps it is if you have a full view. We overlooked the parking lot altho we did have a side view of the beach. The bed sits on a low platform -very contemporary but not my favorite to have the bed so low. I had read reviews about the bathroom being small - true! The toilet /shower area was quite small but no really big deal. The pool is quite large and we easily found seating everyday. We met several people around the pool. We had breakfast each morning included - exquisite view and incredible selection and service! I took advantage of the complementary water aerobic classes - fun! Overall the hotel was super pretty but a little impersonal. The food was delicious and the room was comfortable. You will need to walk down to the Marriott or the Westin for a good swimming beach. The beach is beautiful to look at by the Hyatt but not much sand and it is a little rocky. There is a walkway that takes you past all of the hotels and leads to the shopping mall called Whalers Village with lots of good choices for dinner.. I think you can't go wrong staying here but if we returned we might try the Marriott or the Westin - that way you have the swimming beach and you are closer to Whaler's Viillage. We also talked about looking into condos - the resort fee at the Hyatt was $25 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, mo complaints”
Reviews.Author: Benny1022
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, clean comfortable stay. Gorgeous open air atrium. Right on a very nice almost secluded beach. All the comforts of a high end hotel and then some. Rooms large and very well appointed. Upgraded free to partial ocean view and it was such a nice view. Breakfast at the main restaurant was very good but the lines can be long to get in, so you may have to wait awhile. Pool restaurant was good but slow and expensive. Lots of activities. But you will do better price wise finding your own deals rather than using the activity desk which is powered by expedia, which sends you toward "preferred" vendors which they make a commission off of. Walking distance to whalers village and black rock. Overall would highly recommend, esp if you cand find a good deal that includes breakfast or other activities. Check in and check out very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Area was the Best Part”
Reviews.Author: The_Connoisseur1696
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June, 2011 with my wife and 3-year-old son. My parents were also staying at this property during all but 1 night of our stay and Jeff at check-in was extremely helpful and went out of his way to get us connecting Oceanfront Club rooms, which we greatly appreciated. I had remembered his name from TripAdvisor when we checked in and was relieved when he was the one that assisted us. The ladies working in the Regency Club was very friendly as well and always remembered my son's name when we went in there for snacks. The Regency Club breakfast was as good as the overpriced buffet, although since the buffet was included in our room rate we felt like we needed to eat it every day. The food at the breakfast buffet was mediocre at best and if it wouldn't have been included in our room rate, we would not have eaten it more than the first day. Our son normally loves pancakes and sausage but wouldn't touch the rubber pancakes and pink-tinged sausage on the buffet. Swan Court is truly straight ouf of a scene from "The Birds," where if you leave the table for a second, the birds gobble up any bread products left on the plate (However, they too stay away from the pancakes/sausage)! We checked out on Father' s Day and the birds were sure to give my Dad a "present" down his back - assumingly from a bird who sampled the sausage. The pool area was very nice with the waterfalls, basketball hoop, and water slide. Our son just loved the kid's slide. Keith the lifeguard was great and talked with the kids all the time. The rest of the guards were more or less like sleeping mimes. The hotel looks slightly dated but the grounds are actually quite nice and the view from our room was wonderful. If you want the view, be sure to book an Oceanfront Club room (highest 2 floors looking straight out to the ocean/island of Lanai). We rented 2 cabanas one day and although we had them from 8-5, it wasn't "prepared" until close to 10:00 and Camp Hyatt decided to do what looked like an archeological dig directly in front of us for an hour on the beach. I'm assuming they didn't find much! My dad and I got in the ocean for a couple hours. This was not a great area for swimming, as the ocean floor ceased to be sand once you got more than 10 feet from the shore. It felt more like a mixture of extremely sharp coral and volcanic rock. Overall, we got lots of wonderful pictures and enjoyed our stay here. We didn't eat at the other hotel restaurants but you're a short drive to Lahaina or walk to Whaler's Village, where there's plenty to do. We golfed at Kapalua Bay and it was awesome as always and was in much better shape than the one right next to the Hyatt. We also rode the Sugar Cane Trane in Lahaina and our son enjoyed it. The prices of everything were of course fairly outrageous but that was to be expected. The $25 resort fee should really be tacked on to the room rate if the hotel needs it that badly because otherwise the guests definitely feel ripped off. The Wi-Fi was at least 10 times slower than the Internet on my cell phone but I didn't need it anyway. Due to the prime location, kid's pool area, and for the most part the very helpful and friendly staff, I would recommend this hotel to families traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelblog3
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel for family as well as children. Food was good, value was ok, clean, attentive service. I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Month”
Reviews.Author: DebGrae
Reviews.Content: First off, April was a great month to stay. Whales were still there and we saw them from our 20th floor room with binoculars. Our room was small though the bathroom was big. The oceanfront view was fantastic. Whoever our housekeeper was, we tipped her big because she came in when we came out and straightened up after us a couple of times each day and being a mother of two on a vacation with my hubby, I really appreciated this. Beach is secluded but small. We didn't mind. We just wanted water to cool off and we only laid out a couple of times because we were busy elsewhere. The grounds - can't say enough about how well they are kept and how beautiful. We walked during our downtimes and during the fifth night found a few spots we had missed. I loved saying "hi" to the penguins in the morning and seeing which birds we could watch and talk to that day. We don't mind walking so loved the location - secluded but within walking distance of whaler's village. Fifteen to twenty minute walk to shops/restaurants on a beautfiul walkway by the ocean. Because we took this numerous times, we saw other resort lawns and were VERY glad we stayed at the Hyatt! Oh and if you can - get breakfast included. It was in our deal and thank goodness. We at a $60.00 breakfast every morning to a wonderful view of swans swimming, flamingos loitering and a wonderful man-made waterfall. It is an open air restaurant so there are birds. I had to laugh when I saw a reviewer complain about the birds. HELLO? Didn't you read reviews - open air restaurants means birds will be around. We loved that though. They didn't bother us, none pooped on anyone while we were there, and it's not like they were flocking to tables - they were just here and there and we enjoyed watching them. We always skipped lunch because breakfast was so big (and I like to eat) and went out for an early supper instead.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: jonoaks
Reviews.Content: We picked this place up on Priceline.com. Just a heads up, there is a $25/day resort fee added to your price. With that fee, you get wi-fi, etc. Even with that tacked on, we felt it was an exceptional deal. The hotel is a great resort with multiple restaurants and stores. The staff were all very nice and the location was great. The pool is large and not crowded, with waterfalls, etc. Once side is more kids and the other, separated by a waterfall and cave, is more adult. We went in the middle of June and the crowd was pretty evenly split among younger couples, families with kids and older couples, with most of the kids at their own pool. The beach is about 5 feet away and very nice. The only downside was the cost of food and the lack of alternatives. It's a hotel districts, so your food choices are often limited to other hotel food and their prices. I think Burgers were about $15-$18 each. Beers were $6. Cocktails were $12. So, for two burgers, fries, two drinks and a tip, you're looking at $60. The buffet breakfast was $18 each. The rooms have a mini fridge and there's a grocery story five minutes away for you to stock up on simple stuff. That being said, everything we ate from the hotel restaurants was great. One bit of advice, you can buy sports bottles at the hotel's Umalu market for $19. With that you can fill them up with unlimited juice and soda for the rest of the trip from their soda/juice fountain. Hypothetically, you can make your own cocktails after a trip to the grocery story. Hypothetically speaking of course. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone that asked.

Reviews.Title: “Wi-Fi SO SLOW YOU'LL WANT DIAL-UP BACK....”
Reviews.Author: const629
Reviews.Content: For your $25/DAY resort fee, you get free wi-fi. Good thing, it's worth nothing. Never seen anything so slow since I had dial-up. Don't plan on getting any computer work done while there. Take lots of money--$4 cup of coffee, drinks at poolside are $15ea, cold hot dogs at poolside are $8, Closed off the kiddie pool early so private party could have it---what are we, chopped liver? We paid $400/night isn't that enough? Housekeeping wasn't getting done until 4 PM, but we addressed that. Another afternoon, part of the lagoon was roped off for yet another party. Hotel definately showing it's age.Keith was the only lifeguard on duty that cared about the kids at the kiddie pool. Be sure to work with Jeff at check-in, he's he greatest. Stay was our 2nd there in 10 years. Still nice, but for the money we'll stay somewhere else next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Couples Dream Trip”
Reviews.Author: FlickaJackson
Reviews.Content: I may never be able to outdo my first visit to Hawaii after my stay at the Maui Hyatt. There were 3 couples in our party and we were originally going to stay in Waikiki Hyatt, but a snafu when we got there got us bumped over to Maui for the same rate. It was amazing to say the least. We had basic suites accommodations which were great. The resort itself had plenty of amenities to keep you there for a week, but we walked around to numerous other resorts and into town for some meals. The spa was nice. Probably not a great place for young families as the pool didn't have the water-slides that neighboring resorts did in the pool area, but it was quieter and perfect for couples not looking for the party theme.

Reviews.Title: “Ray Rodriguez concierge”
Reviews.Author: patriot777
Reviews.Content: My son and I walked into the Hyatt Regency Maui and we were floored by the beauty. The greetings we received were so welcoming and warm. I personally became instantly relaxed and had a feeling of joy. The check in was easy. The food and drinks in the poolside restaurant were delicious... but WAY over priced. Still, the lava flow was awesome!! The guy (Michael) at the starbucks coffee stand never failed to inspire me and then there is Mr. Ray Rodriguez (the concierge). Man... He made our trip to Maui a very happy one. He was "there" to help... No matter what. He always has a smile on his face and is very honest. Ray is very professional both in manner and deed. They Hyatt Regency has a valuable asset with Mr. Rodriguez. He has a calm demeanor and infectious laugh. Ray made our stay a deeply joyful experience. I love the Hyatt Regency Maui. My husband and I will be visiting in February of 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Locals Staycation”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: We live on Maui and the Hyatt is our favorite. The pool is amazing and the staff is always friendly. We have stayed at the other resorts down the beach and its nice to be up the beach from the foot traffic near Whalers Village. They just spent a fortune redoing Cascades restaurant - now Japango - Highly recommended go for sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay here, but..........”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Lieu
Reviews.Content: I would love to stay here, but when I asked for a quote for this hotel and the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa as part of our honeymoon. The travel agent quoted us the wrong price. I was all set on going there after reading loads of good reviews and looked at all the lovely photos. It turned out they under quoted us by Â£500, which we can not afford at the moment as we are already stretching our budget and still have our wedding in August to pay for. If we are able to stay at the Hyatt's then I am sure we will have a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could move in....”
Reviews.Author: msboston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 2011 and were very sad to leave. The one and only area for improvement would be an update of the room decor. Staff members were helpful, friendly, generous and fun. Restaurants were SPECTACULAR! The fish tacos at Umalu and miso salmon at Japengo are a must. The pool area was AWESOME. It's appropriate for singles, couples, families, has a basketball hoop, bar, waterslide and a great ocean view. As the day progresses, it can be difficult to find a chair. The location is ABSOLUTE PERFECTION! It's located on the Kaanapali Beach walk (wonderful for runners, like me, who like to head out at 6am!) where you can walk to restaurants, shops, Black Rock, golf courses, etc). There's just enough activity so you're never bored, but it never seems overwhelming or overcrowded. Bottom line...if you have the chance.....GO!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice. Recommended to friends”
Reviews.Author: Mike19821203
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Maui on Kaâ€™anapali Beach is a very nice hotel. When compared to the hotels on the â€œbeach rowâ€� on Kaâ€™anapali Beach, it appears to be the nicest. Here is a simple pro and cons list to guide your stay. Bottom line, we would stay here and recommend it again should we end up staying on Kaâ€™anapali Beach. Pros: - Nice, attentive service - Walking distance to shops, golf, restaurants on Kaâ€™anapali Beach - Beautiful beach front - Large, expansive pool with adults and kids separation (see comment under cons though) - Nice array of restaurants and activities, high end to snack shop - Snack shop is a snack shop, but is very clean, has a good selection and is quite large - Significant number of ocean view rooms - Large rooms Cons: - From above, kidâ€™s pool versus adult pool is not well enforced. My wife and I do not have kids, so we do not want to be splashed or bothered by kids when sitting (and paying for umbrella chairs) at the adult pool. - Expensive - Room service menu and restaurant menus come from the same restaurant. Prices are not only higher (to be expected), but standard items become a la carte items when ordering the room service (i.e. French fries with sandwiches are included at the restaurant but become a la carte for room service). A general commentary for Hawaii; if you are a couple and can keep yourself interested, go to Kauai. It is quieter, more romantic, more â€œself-guidedâ€�, less touristy, and lusher. If you are a family with kids and need some things to keep them entertained, Maui is better than Kauai. There is quite a bit to do and more restaurants, trips, places to go and see, etc.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: igitaround27
Reviews.Content: For 4 nights I had a most exceptional experience in this hotel. My large ocean view room was clean, fresh, and well appointed. The grounds and pools were immaculate, and the food delicious. Everything about this hotel was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this place !”
Reviews.Author: Blue
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to this hotel the level of service was everything that you should expect from a hotel. I will stay here any and every time we are in Maui. The staff was friendly and professional. The room was spotless the grounds are beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property!”
Reviews.Author: SteveVH4
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui on the second leg of our honeymoon, and while it was quite the culture shock after being in Kauai (more people, more traffic, and more crowded), it was amazing for all its own reasons. After being on a more secluded and quiet island, we were ready to get out and have a good time. The resort is beautiful inside and out and located at the end of hotel row and a close walk to restaurants and shops, and a close drive to more of the same. Pools were great, ocean front allowed you to take a dip in the ocean. There is an on-site Luau that was kind of cool (even though a little pricey). The only negatives I could come up with, and trust me, this is no deal breaker, but the breakfast at the hotel. The buffet was way over priced, the service was VERY slow, and the food was always the same. Also, the price for basic food at the pool is insane. I know Hawaii is expensive, but don't set the bar on $16 nachos and $14 sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical grounds, with top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Empireguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon.The staff were very friendly when we arrived and explained that the hotel was sold out through the weekend. Kim, one of the front desk staff was so helpful with complimentary valet, as the lots were full, and also gave us 4 free breakfast coupons($120) value.He explained that my room would not have the best view, but if I came back the next,he would find me something nicer, and he sure did! Great view. This is a beautiful resort, spectacular grounds and pool, more suited for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but nothing makes this feel like Maui. Oh, and don't book activities with the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beartrax79
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - this is a nice resort with beautiful rooms and lots of great activities. However, this resort could be anywhere - Las Vegas, Orlando... You name it. There wasn't even any beach front to make you think you were in Hawaii. If that's what you are going for, this place is for you. Us, we checked out early and went somewhere else. Note that the hotel staff was accommodating, but unprofessional in areas other than the front desk or housekeeping. "Just walk around and find a guy in a red shirt" was a response from the towel desk when we were trying to sign up for paddle board lessons. Make activity reservations in nearby Lahaina instead of the concierge. Ray at the concierge desk sold us 2 Hyatt Luau tickets for $98 a piece. We canceled before we left, but saw the same tickets going for 2 for $19 on the main drag by the banyan tree in Lahaina. Talk about a rip off! Good thing we lucked out and weren't taken this time. It really is just a shame because with all of the on-site amenities and nice rooms, this is a nice resort, but nothing makes it Maui. If you do go, be careful about your activity bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose_001
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights at the end of May 2011 for the first leg of our honeymoon. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would not hesitate in returning. The grounds and room were immaculate and the staff very friendly and helpful (especially Big Glenn at the pool bar). It was very expensive for food and drink but so are all the other hotels/bars/restaurants in Maui. Our only gripes were the queue for breakfast every morning (which you wouldn't expect when paying $30 per head - however the breakfast was delicious and there was an abundance of choice), the birds flying around swan court and walking all over the tables and the lack of sun-beds with shade around the pool. These gripes did not affect the enjoyment of our stay, however we feel they should be addressed in order to improve the stay of others. Overall, fantastic hotel and fantasic honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated our 25th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: MJV226
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt on our honeymoon 25 years ago and decided to return for our anniversary. We were not disappointed! Service was excellent, grounds were beautiful. We will definitely return to the Hyatt in Maui and would not hesitate a bit to recommend it to anyone traveling there. The location is ideal also, easy to navigate around the island

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love The Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hyatt on Kaanapali. The service and the welcoming attitude of the staff is wonderful. The hotel is huge but they still provide the personal touch despite how busy it can get. The hotel is located on a smaller section of the beach but a short walk brings you to the main strip of Kaanapali beach. If you get an ocean view room on a higher floor the views are breathtaking. The Concierge lounge is amazing. Great snacks and drinks with a lanai overlooking the beach and the ocean. The Hyatt Spa is fantastic. Finally the restaurants at the Resort are top notch. We had the best sushi I've ever had there. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all ...”
Reviews.Author: Jack1959
Reviews.Content: You expect a lot when the name "Hyatt" is on the facility ... and this place delivers. My wife and I wanted a quick getaway. We live on Oahu and called at the last minute hoping for some kama aina relief. We got a reasonable partial ocean view room. The facility is spotless. Clean is just not a strong enough word. The flowers/plants are well kept, the grounds are well maintained, the staff are well trained/attentive, and the cost is relatively reasonable. We enjoyed the pool, the beach (not the best but move of the beach a bit), the restaurants, and right now, I'm enjoying a peaceful moment near the top of the hill listening to the peaceful sound of the ocean a short distance away. This was exactly what we needed! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The service stands out!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lvtolvlife
Reviews.Content: A lot has been said about the Hyatt in previous reviews, however I want to comment on the service. In all of our travels this has been without a doubt the best service we have experienced with staff. It started when we arrived late and checked into the two rooms for our family. Not only was the staff at the front desk wonderful.... they had the house cleaning staff come down right away and help switch out the bedding and remove anything with feathers for us. They got us extra robes and brought my son cards on all the animals on the property. Everyone was so friendly and wonderful and it continued throughout our stay. The grounds are quite wonderful and the hotel seems so "warm and friendly". We had a really, really nice time. Although we were there as a family I think this would be a wonderful couples get away also. It all just blends in so well. The only negative in my opinion was the swan court breakfast at $30 per person. It was not included in our room rate so we decided to splurge one morning. What a mistake. The line was crazy long and the food was not impressive. Felt like I was on a low end cruise ship! I was really disappointed based on the price. We did have breakfast in the coffee shop and we really enjoyed the breakfast paninis... The staff was also very friendly both there and also at the bell and valet desk. They have a great team...

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but rooms not that great”
Reviews.Author: SeanW1218
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and was very disappointed with the rooms. I went with my family of five and we were told that we were in a suite and that there would be enough room for all of us but when we got there it was a queen and a pull out couch that was not at all comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “4th Time at this Hyatt and Still love it.”
Reviews.Author: lablover99
Reviews.Content: We booked an ocean view king and were not disappointed. The room was 332 and it is very nice. Our balcony overlooked the pool and beach area and the ocean. We got the sunrise each morning. The rooms have mini fridges in them which I love. We stopped at Safeway on our way in and picked up snacks and drinks. We did have issues with the self parking. The spaces are so close together you can barely get your compact in them and when you return late at night you need to drive around several times to find a spot. Just to let you know, one night we could not find a spot and they parked the car in valet for us at no charge, which I feel is very fair. The food at Umulu is good but very overpriced. 14.00 for Chicken tenders and fries. Drinks are mostly over 10.00 unless you get a mai tai during happy hour then it's 5.00. In case you don't know if you need a 2nd room for your kids you can get if for half off the price of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: OregonCoastLover1
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay in 3 years at the Hyatt. I can't speak to the 'value' rating as I know they are very expensive and we were able to use multiple discounts and get an AMAZING rate since my husband is a near constant business traveler using the Hyatt all over the US. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and nice. Everything is top notch from the upkeep of the grounds to the way they accomodate your needs and requests. The grounds are gorgeous and our room directly overlooked the beach with only the sidewalk in between us. What luxury to fall asleep nightly to the sound of the waves. Thank you, Hyatt, for working to get us into the room we desired! Everything is gracious including the staff. The Club room breakfasts/hot dinner appetizers/desserts were very appreciated. The pool is a delight for young children. This year we had friends traveling at the same time as our family so we brought their children in almost like they were our grandchildren. The pool time was so enjoyable! The Hyatt is within walking distance of Whaler's Village and close driving to Lahaina. Hyatt--we hate to leave each time. We hate to leave Maui and hate to leave you because you always make our trips worry free and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Pie....Get a Slice!”
Reviews.Author: coastaltransplant
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is a bit older and lightly dated in its decor, it is still just marvelous! Friendly, good eats, and the location is perfect. My family had a blast there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: ewclreed
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews of this resort ad nauseum and didn't know quite what to expect. The reviews seemed excellent since recent renovations were completed. I am a Hilton Honors member and was a bit nervous staying at a non-Hilton property because Hilton is almost always exceptional. Stayed at the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island last year and felt it was going to be hard for a resort to compete with this "ultra-mega" exceptional resort. But, my hats off to the Hyatt Regency Maui. Our stay, with some minor exceptions was wonderful from check-in to check out. The recent renovations, although not luxury, are only a small step below. The property is gorgeous and well kept. The staff, with very rare exception, were attentive, extremely polite and welcoming. Janice at check-in made the process quick and got us to our room quickly. She was excellent. The renovated deluxe ocean view room, although a bit smaller than I would have liked, was roomy enough for my family of four and nicely appointed. The pool was fantastic. Had read reviews about the beach being too small. Maybe, just in front of the pool, but just past the cabanas was big enough with plenty of beach for the kids to play and the sand in the water was not rocky until quite a ways out. The 150 foot water slide was a hit with the kids. My daughter is barely under 48' tall. Thanks to Josh and Emily and there excellent judgement she was given a wrist band and had a ball on the slide. I still have a problem with the policy as I know a number of kids who are 50" tall who would have floundered at the end of the slide as a child's height has nothing to do with having the ability to swim. And although Tim (another lifeguard) was hesitant about allowing her on the slide (and offered some lame explanation about the policy on the third day and some big Hawaiian dude who wasn't very pleasant on the second day, with some assertiveness on my part, she rode the slide daily and was fine (as I knew she would be as she is a very good swimmer. You people need to tell your attorneys/policymakers to rethink this absurd policy. Nonetheless, Josh and Emily were awesome. They remembered us by name throughout our day and deserve commendations for their outstanding customer service. Tim and the "big hawaiian dude" need to be informed that they should get the corn cobs out of their "you know whats" (That is for the customer service people at Hyatt who I'm certain will read this review). The frequent complimentary Otter Pops daily were a nice touch. The only other issue we had was some small issues with housekeeping. On the second day, went to our room after a day at the beach to clean up an 3:40PM and the room had not been serviced. Some other issues with the quality of housekeeping as well. Addressed my concerns to the manager. They arranged a specific time for our room to be cleaned daily. Tim, the housekeeping manager took care of my concerns and was very receptive to my issues. He sent us a small gift basket for our troubles as well. Thanks Tim. Just the kind of thing you would expect at a 4 or 5 star property. A very nice touch. The food was very good. Although there are great places outside of Hyatt to eat, and mostly ate off property, did dine at all the restaurants and enjoyed them all. Expensive, but what on Maui isn't? Breakfast buffet would have been a huge waste of money as we could have never eaten $100 of breakfast a day, but was included with the room for all four of us. Very nice spread of food, fresh fruit, hot items, etc. Just not worth $100 a pop for four people. Have an issue with the resort fee as should be included in the price of the room. And the wi-fi you get for the resort fee, in a word, sucked. To charge for the better broadband wi-fi is really crappy. And the self parking was a struggle daily. Should have a gate for hotel guests only with non-gated for public beach access. All in all, a fantastic stay. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a resort with everything you need but at the same time is not too sprawling.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiul Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysan
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hyatt Maui in a partial ocean view room. We barely noticed the view unless we stood on the balcony to see the ocean from the side. The hotel is very tranquil, in spite of the number of people that stay there. We love seeing the African penguins and the African cranes at the hotel. We spent a lot of time pool side which was nice, but they cram the lounge chairs together and there's very little space between you and the other guests. You also have to get the pool early to get a good spot. The food at Umalu is really good.
