Our only complaint has to do with the parking which is somewhat limited in the evenings when the parking lots become full. We came back from a luau around 9ish and couldn't find a parking space so we had to valet it for $18. We're paying a resort fee so we should be abe to get a parking space when we need it. Other than the parking, we would return to the Hyatt Maui on future trips to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Barb60713
Reviews.Content: Recently vacationed at the Hyatt for the first time. An incredibly beautiful property with unsurpassed service from the entire staff, but in particular from Corene and Pohaku (Recreation Dept)! Kiliko, the front desk manager, went out of her way to make sure that we enjoyed our stay and that we did! They are truly dedicated to providing excellent service to their customers. I highly recommend the Hyatt....in such a short stay, I felt like i was leaving family when it came time to return home. I will be back next year - can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “smokers not welcome”
Reviews.Author: ppehs55
Reviews.Content: Me an some friend havd a wonderful visit to hawaii We stayed @ the hyatt Maui resort spa ..........but found it very dissapointed to learn that there was no smoking on the outside balcony of our hotel room. yes we knew that we were in a no smoking hotel but they did not specify that there was no smoking on the balcony. All of the hotels that i stay in that are no smoking allow you to smoke on the outside balcony. You guys should state this prohibition in your ad. We would have chosen to stay at another hotel that was not so STRICT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jbarker201
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this resort, it puts a smile on my face just thinking about it. The lobby is open to the outdoors, overlooks the pool and ocean and is full of exotic plants and animals. I was not disappointed when it was time to return to the resort after an exciting bike trip down Haleakala or snorkeling Molokini crater. (Note: both MUST DO's while in Maui) Rooms were average in size, smaller bathrooms but they fit the need. The beds are extremely comfortable with light down comforters and pillows. The restaurant Japengo which is part of the resort was quite possibly my favorite while in Maui (We experienced some pretty good restaurants Pacific'O & Lahaina Grill). Japengo provided excellent sushi, seafood and wine as well as impeccable service. The entire restaurant, much like the Hyatt itself, is open to the outdoors allowing for breathtaking views of the ocean and sunsets. The pool was a great spot to cool off and get some sun. Drinks were available from both poolside wait staff and Åªmalu (the restaurant attached to the pool area) There is a full bar under the waterfall, however we never found ourselves there. One downside to the pool was the lack of lounge chairs come 12pm. Its a great place to be and everyone seems to agree. Be prepared to do some searching to find two empty chairs together. Spa Moana is an experience. Total relaxation. A great facility located right on the water and short walk from the lobby & pool. Massages, steam rooms, hot tubs, saunas & gym. I would highly recommend the Hyatt if you're thinking about staying in or around Kaanapali in west Maui.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, great service, incredible views”
Reviews.Author: jpriest80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 hotels whilst in the hawaiian islands and this was our favourite by far. The hotel is huge and the entrance and courtyard area is sensational with parrots and penguins, flowers etc. surrounding the walkways between the two towers. The pool is large and there were always sunbeds available, great service from the waitresses and even better from the restaurant staff. Our favourite place to eat was Umalu, essentially an outside bar restaurant it was well priced, excellent portions and the food was superb compared to some pricier restaurants we experienced in the grand hyatt in Kauai. The other restaurants was a pricey steak option (you can pay up to $200 if you want the full works!) but if you have a car then drive to Lahaina and also everyone we met reommended Mamas Fishhouse which is about a 30 minute drive away but is apparently the best place to eat fresh fish on the island, the menu even includes which fisherman caught which catch each day on the menu. Plenty of shops on site for gifts and everyday things but just 15 mins walk is Whalers Village which has a lot more to offer, and just 15 mins by bus from whalers village gets you to the mall and lahaina town where there are endless shops and quirky restaurants. Our room here was huge with a lovely view from the balcony and ample room for us to relax (king size bed, sofa, table and chairs etc.) It barely felt like anyone else was there most of the time other than around the pool area. I would recommend doing a waterfall hike through hike maui, great fun and very informative we also got to swim in some waterfalls. Also make the effort to watch the sunrise on haleakala crater, 3am pick up and wrap up with AT LEAST 2 layers and take gloves because it is colder than you could imagine at 10,000ft!!! but glorious and inspiring watching the sunrise over the clouds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler10173
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Hyatt for our honeymoon. I really didn't want to leave at the end! The grounds are just gorgeous. We loved the birds (they even said Aloha to us) and the other wildlife. The staff is just so friendly, and the hotel has a warm feel to it. Upon our arrival we received a beautiful flower lei, and as honeymooners we got a photo album and champagne, which was a really nice touch. Our room had two balconies with gorgeous views, and this was just a partial ocean view. It was a great value. The hotel does look slightly dated when you walk off the elevators, but inside the rooms are very nice. I was also concerned at first because we were near the elevator, but it ended up being very quiet. The room decor was nice and the size of the room was excellent. The only thing I didn't love was the style of the bed.. it was sort of low to the ground. I guess this is an island style but it seemed like it could have been more comfortable. The breakfast was very good and the fitness center was excellent. The pool was busy but we could always find a chair. We liked the waterfalls and pool basketball. There were a few kids, but they were really not loud or bothersome. The beach area is a bit narrower than some of the other hotels, but there is still plenty of space if you want to lay and relax on the beach. It was relatively quiet. We weren't that impressed with the luau, but maybe I'm just not a luau person (had never been to one before). Sunz for dinner and Umalu were great though, very romantic. We did have to wait on a short line to speak to a concierge, but once we met with her (Johanna) she was SO nice, helpful and very patient with us. Overall I'd recommend the Hyatt and return.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: MamaMia60763
Reviews.Content: Came here during September for my honeymoon. All I have to say is the service was impressive, the beach was amazing, and the rooms are awesome. I had an amazing time and I just booked a room for our one year anniversary. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharper924
Reviews.Content: On short notice the Hyatt Regency welcomed us with our requested 2 connecting rooms. We were so glad to be back! Our rooms were perfect---they are large and clean with comfortable beds. They brought in a crib complete with a bumper pad and a baby toiletries travel kit. They are offering hypo-allergenic rooms, which was great for our family with our allergies and asthma. We enjoyed breakfasts at The Swan Court and ordered snacks by the pool. We shopped in the shops, strolled through the gardens, talked to the birds on display, played in the pool and on the beach. We had great help from the entire staff in every area of their services to their guests. It was another wonderful stay for us at this beautiful hotel on Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasNorm
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was great. We decided to go all out and got a Regency Club Room. Very nice. They have a private lounge (included in the rate) which serves a continental breakfast and appetizers at night, which we ate as our dinner. We actually ate in the lounge quite often. Very good pastry and very good appetizers. It was a good spot to get something to eat before you hit the road to explore Maui. Drinks were good too. Our room was very nice and roomy. It even had a walk in closet. The room was very clean and organized. The hotel itself is very beautiful. The open aired atrium is a lush tropical setting with swans, fish, parrots, flamingos, and even penguins. Pool area is big with waterfalls, a big slide, a swim up pool bar thru the waterfall, and a separate kiddie swim area. The restaurants were so so and expensive (as most hotels), but we mostly ate in the included lounge or at the local hangouts. Concierge was a big help in getting us a cocktail cruise. After all the bad reviews on this type of tour we werenâ€™t going to do it. They recommended another outfit and it was great. The beach area isnâ€™t very good for swimming (rocks), but just a short walk down the beach thereâ€™s a nice spot for a swim. You can also sit on the grassy area and watch the sunset or lay around in a hammock. Itâ€™s without a doubt an ideal place for honeymooners. We walked up and down a beach walkway looking at the other hotels and this by far was the nicest. Using the walkway, itâ€™s about a 15 minute walk to Whalerâ€™s Village for shopping, other restaurants, and a small food court. Itâ€™s only about a 15 minute drive to Lahaina and about an hour drive from the airport (not bad really). The Hyatt is located on the drier side of Maui, which is nice. If we return to Maui, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “They made a great trip even better”
Reviews.Author: Jon808
Reviews.Content: First of all, the place looks spectacular . From it's open air lobby and wildlife, parrots, flamingos, swans and even penguins, it instantly transports you to paradise. The pool is beautiful and so are the grounds with tons of photo opps.the rooms were very clean and the grounds were kept neat. But what truly separates it from the others was the service. The entire staff from the girls at the breakfast buffet remembering our room number everyday, to the turn down service with chocolates every night. Everyone at the the front desk was great too. But a special thanks goes out to Jeff who went above and beyond in making this a trip me and my family will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Almost paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Sillycat
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Maui is a beautiful hotel. The grounds are gorgeous. Fresh flowers. Interesting sculptures. Penguins! Swans! It looks exactly what you would expect from a Maui hotel. It is located near Lahaina which has lots of restaurants and shopping. My room was nice, but not extraordinary. There is a daily resort fee of $25 which is pretty standard at resort hotels, but I was very annoyed that you have to pay $$$ for using the business center internet. They do have free WiFi in the room, but I didn't bring my laptop. Shouldn't this be included in the resort fee? I think so. After the 1st day, I found out that in the town of Lahaina, there are some very cheap internet cafes. Much better deal even including the high end cost of gas in Maui. The hotel has several restaurants, but no quick sandwich place. There are 2 sundry stores that carry snacks and souveniers. Umalu is the more casual restaurant on the property and it has a great location where you are outside overlooking the ocean. The food is good though a little expensive. Walking distance from the hotel (about 10 minutes) is Whaler's Village shopping center which has several good restaurants. I particularly liked Hula Grill. I worked with the concierge (Jiang) on some activities. She planned some very good excursions. Snorkeling with the non-profit Pacific Whale group was excellent. Molikini and Turtle Bay. Saw lots of tropical fish and sea turtles. They were very helpful to a novice snorkler. The Road to Hana trip with Valley Isle Excursions with Tim as the driver/tour guide was awesome. There were 11 people in the group, so not too big. Tim was full of interesting information and clearly enjoyed being with the group. He showed everyone the best photo ops and took pictures of anyone who wanted to have photos taken. The drive is long and stressful and I'd definitely recommend taking the tour instead of doing the drive. I used Polynesian Adventure for a drive to Mt Haleakala for sunrise. This particular tour I would not recommend. The driver drove well and had lots of information, but was the single most boring, monotone guide I have ever had. It didn't help that it was rainy & cold and we didn't see the sunrise, but if the guide were entertaining, at least that would have eased the pain. Overall, the Hyatt Regency is a good choice when visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “when can we move in”
Reviews.Author: joann828
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here for 3 nights (not long enough) but loved it. what landscaping, pools, wildlife unreal, flamingos, african cranes, black and whjite swans, penguins jut fantastic. rooms large, bathroom great size, walk in robe, not a negative thing about this great place we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I want to Live here - in this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: GanderTravellers
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii last year on our honeymoon and loved it so much we came back again this year! We missed Maui last year so it was our main destination this year. We were at the Hyatt for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. What a great property! We upgraded our room for a full ocean view for an extra $70 a night - not too bad. It was worth it for the view and the sunsets! We tried all the resturants except "Sonz" for dinner. We loved Japango - amazing food!! We ate there twice. The grounds were beautiful and walking around was always a treat. There are penguins in the lobby and parrots that say "Aloha" !! The location of the hotel is great - its at the end of the stretch of a hotel lined beach so there isn't alot of foot traffic walking in front of the property. In saying that - its not a very long walk to get to great shops and other resturants. Its also not a very far car ride ~10min to Lahaina - where there is lots of action! We would def stay at this hotel again - and we don't usually do that - but the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa is a keeper!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth - Great Relaxing Resort Getaway - Pool rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: angelab24
Reviews.Content: I want to move in to this hotel - seriously! Where to start....loved the room overall. Large bathroom and room, walk in closet, beautiful view of beach and pool. Only negatives were that the mini-bar door wouldn't open one night, and since it has an electronic lock that was having issues, the hotel couldn't open it. But they did comp us some sandwiches because of it. The beds (one queen and one double - with room for a <free> rollaway if you need it) could have been slightly more comfortable, and the patio a bit bigger with comfier lounge furniture, but pretty darn good overall. The lobby/common areas are just great....everything is open to the outside, tons of shops, great views and so many cool areas to walk around. Plus, the animals - they have flamingos, swans, these adorable cranes (I don't know what kind but they were super cute) and penguins (though the penguin area could have been a little cleaner) plus parrots. Check-in was great, free self-parking that is close to the front. The hotel is right on Kaanapali Beach but all the way to one end, so you're a good 10 minute walk (down the very nice Kaanapali beachwalk) from Whaler's Village. Great restaurants, the staff was all really awesome and helpful, and the pools are AMAZING! Seriously - such a fun watersilde (for big kids and adults) plus a small one in the kids pool area, pool grottos, waterfalls, the whole nine yards. Truly awesome. We actually spent the whole time at the pool because it was so great, and (as a small negative) the beach in front of the hotel isn't that awesome (rocks, water is a bit rough, and small actual beach), but you can walk just us the beachwalk again to get to a better beach area. And did I mention the pool area is so great you won't want to leave!? Overall we absolutely loved this hotel and I absolutely planto return.

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect from a Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: beachdreaming2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I asked for a quiet room and we received that with an 8th floor (of 9 floors) room in the South tower. We had a beautiful view of the Maui sunsets and we were grateful for the high floor. What I liked. The location of the hotel is on the south end of Kaanipali beach. Since it's the end of the boardwalk, its not as heavily traveled as some of the other hotels on the beach. Essentially, the closer that you get to the Whaler's Village, the more crowded is the boardwalk. I appreciated that it was less crowded. The staff was right on target for me. Professional, yet casual as you would expect in Hawaii. The poolside restaurant, Umalu, provides consistent and good food. The food in general on Maui is expensive and the food at the Hyatt is no different. Expect to pay around $20 (per person) for casual meals and $40 for dinners. We ate at many of the boardwalk restaurants and Umalu was the best or among the best. The Maui onion rings were unbelievably good. (note: for some of the best cheap eats on the island go to Okazuya at 3600-D L. Honoapiilani Rd.) If you enjoy staying out in the sun all day, consider getting a cabana by the beach so that you can use the cabana for shade when its needed. No need to worry about food and beverages...the service at the cabanas is timely. If you want privacy...choose cabana #24. It's a small thing, but the safe in the walk in closet (yep, a walk in closet) is at eye level and extremely convenient. What was less than good. There were times when the water in the shower would suddenly get cold...very cold. This is not something that I would expect from a Hyatt. The AC unit is against the opposite wall from the bed. You should expect to have the air blowing on you all night if you have it running...and you will. All in all, the Hyatt Maui is a good place to have a relaxing vacation on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, beautiful, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelling602
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved this resort. First half of our vacation was spent at Westin Kaanapali Villas...couldn't wait to get out of there and move over to the Hyatt!! What a great place. So Beautiful, lots to do, shopping, great pools (Kids separate from adults), water slide, birds saying "Aloha" as you walk passed, penguins, fantastic landscaping, Grotto bar...so much to look at an experience. Yes, the food is expensive but where isn't in Maui. Fantastic customer service, staff always acknowledging you and saying hello as they passed. Can't say enough about the Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisw03
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely great! The grounds of the hotel were well kept and the resort was definitely the nicest on Ka'anapali Beach. There were many waterfalls, tropical birds and a Zen Garden. The only real problem with the resort was Ka'anapali Beach is really narrow in front of the hotel, but it is only a little walk to wider a part of the beach. The rooms were nice and the activities desk made a great recommendation for surf lessons through the Royal Hawaiian Surf Academy and was able to charge the lessons to the room. The resort is rather large and the pool chairs fill up early. Overall, probably the nicest resort we have stayed at in Hawai'i.

Reviews.Title: “first class but pricy”
Reviews.Author: thinla
Reviews.Content: this was a fantastic place to stay, the rooms and the view was first class. only problem was considering the price of rooms and cost of food and drinks seems like the beach cabanas and chaise chairs would come with the price and not charge for everything. food overall in area not worth the money. still beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice landscaping but hotel starting to show it's age.”
Reviews.Author: Suntrips2011
Reviews.Content: Good location but be sure to rent a car. Hyatt has Hertz onsite which is very convenient and there is free self parking. Concierge was very helpful for restaurant suggestions away from the tourest trap of Whalers Village, which is walkable. She was also very helpful with explaining the Road to Hana, which we drove. Beautiful scenery on that drive. The Hyatt beach, although right outside your doorstep, is not that great, but if you walk just north of the hotel, to Marriot and Westin, the sand gets better and the beach is wider. The pool gets crowded early and the whole towel card and wristband thing is inconvenient. The hotel is starting to show it's age. I'm sure the hyatt was incredible back in the mid 80's. Our bed was a platform bed and very uncomfortable. If you have a bad back, do not expect good support.

Reviews.Title: “Another 4-star experience”
Reviews.Author: SeaDuck79
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the HR Maui, and we enjoyed ourselves this time as much as in previous stays. I would love to give it a 5, but a few little things showed that they aren't quite up to the Four Seasons/Fairmount level. That's not a big criticism, because they don't pretend to be a 5-star resort. They are a 4-star resort, and do a good job of delivering at that level. Changes from last year: We were told prior to our arrival that the mattresses had been changed out for new ones, but we really didn't notice a difference, either in the bedroom or the sofa bed. We have slept on the Grand Hyatt mattresses in other Hyatt properties, and these were NOT them. They continue to be the only real negative about this property. They now offer a hot egg dish in the Regency Club room at breakfast time. Most of the time, I liked it, and I appreciated being able to start the day off with some protein. A $15 Resort Fee (reduced from $25 due to my Diamond level GP status), which covers several "services" that we didn't plan to use. At all. I resent having to pay for things I don't want, need, or use. But the service was always friendly and competent, and the rest of the grounds was as lovely as it always is. We look forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Management response only the folk who gave 5 stars, ridiculous!”
Reviews.Author: Jona_11
Reviews.Content: Read thru other review, I wonder what kind of management this Hyatt has? Is it kind of ridiculous to see the customer service only reply to people who praise the hotel and totally ignore and complain and concern of other customer who gave them less than 5 Stars rating. They act like it is the customer's fault to give them a bad review. They do not acknowlege any complain and concern. Through out 1165 reviews, Guest Relations Associate only address 5 Star review only!! It made me wonder during our stay if we bring up some issue, how bad they will treat us?

Reviews.Title: “Good, but "Bird Droppings" Health Issue Remains”
Reviews.Author: David_D_GEG
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights in April on a 'post-tax-season' relaxation trip. Nice hotel, great location, good pool. Japengo (high-end sushi restaurant) was very good. The poolside casual restaurant not so good. Mountain view room in the center building had ocean views if you stood on the outside lanai. Only "miss" is the lack of cleanliness of outdoor seating --- open to the elements (and birds), and there does not appear to be a concerted effort to clean up the bird droppings. Mentioned it to the front desk to bring to management's attention early on, and nothing was cleaned during the rest of the trip. Makes for hit or miss seating opportunities if you're looking for ocean view shaded seating, and I'm sure that there are health issues involved as well, since many of the chairs/tables are used for food service in the morning (coffee bar seating) and dinner (Japengo). The only real flaw to an otherwise good stay.

Reviews.Title: “MAHALO - TOP RESORT”
Reviews.Author: TheCaliTraveler
Reviews.Content: Throughout our 4 day stay I kept saying to myself....i LOVE it here. Of course the fresh ocean breeze, tropical foliage, natural plumeria aromas might have something to do with it but I honestly think that resort was what made such a difference. What I LOVED about the resort * The pools were superb. There is one large pool, large enough they allow floaties in it. It also has a fun basketball hoop. This pool flows through a CAVE (yee-ah!) past the pool bar into the other smaller pool which is really just on the way to the awesome adult water slide. * The adult water-slide --- normally they are boring and safe but this one was fantastic. I think I did it 20 times altogether! It is a tube, so its dark, and shoots you out pretty quickly at the bottom. Quick tip: keep your body straight as a board with your back arched....you'll fly! * The gardens around the pools were fantastic; there is a drawbridge over the smaller pool which is pretty cool * Wildlife. Meet Spike and Fluff the birds on the Napali Tower - they are super cool. Then there are the Penguins and the Parrots and the Swans.... Other tips: The beach here isn't very nice and the public beach adjacent that the hotel recommends wasn't very nice either. Either head up towards the Westin or plan a day away from the Hotel. Also, Valet parking was $18/night ... if you are a do-it-yourselfer self parking is free and just a short walk from the main entrance. For anyone who is a shopper there is a Macys in the hotel, or else Whaler's Village is a short walk up the beachwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: njmom4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Spring Break with our 4 children ages 16,14,11 and 8. The location is great, hotel is beautiful, but if you don't go down and reserve a chair by putting your towel and stuff on it by 7:30am you won't get a chair. Everything else about the hotel was great. My kids loved the water slide and waterfall. They also loved the penguins and birds throughout the lobby. We did the star gazing tour one night which was really neat. I would recommend this hotel. We had dinner one night at the restaurant Sonz at Swan Court and it was one of our best meals. We were able to get the family rate which comes with connecting rooms, so the kids are right there and their room is about half price. You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Keith74006
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here before our 5 day condo package started down the road. What a great place. We don't stay at many Hyatts, but decided to give this a try and we were very pleased. It was a bit expensive, but we received a AAA discount which made it a bit better. Location is increadable, and every part of the stay was excellent. Our luggage was delayed in arriving so they set us us with toothbrushes, deoderant, tooth paste, shaving cream, razors, etc... The water main down the road broke and they had to shut off the water to the resort one night, the hotel provided free bottled water to drink that night and all was well by the time we woke up the next morning. This was out of their control. The coffee bar was my favorite place each morning to get a good cup of Starbucks and a view of the ocean. The pool area looked great, but we walked past it each day to the beach which is only about 50 feet further. From our balcony we could see the ocean through the palm trees, but while some people make a big deal of the room location and view, you don't spend much time looking out the window, when you are so close to the sand and sea and can walk out and enjoy it. We will go back to this particular hotel and will try Hyatt at other locations now too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but not fully 5*”
Reviews.Author: Mustang2015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in April 2011 for past of our honeymoon. I will start with the positives first: 1. The staff at this hotel were fantastic - extremely friendly and helpful - especially Jeff on the front desk who was very welcoming and professional. 2. The grounds of this hotel are beautiful - the gardens, waterfalls and wildlife were beautifully maintained and was by far the most attractive hotel on that strip of the island. The location of the hotel was also very good - only a short walk away from other hotel restaurants and the local shopping complex. 3. We booked an Ocean Front room with a balcony and the view was impressive - of both the beach/sea and the hotel gardens! 4. The facilities in the room were very good. The High Speed Internet was reliable, and there was a fridge that you could use for storing your own food/beverages, and a facility to boil water for tea/coffee. 5. We hired our own car and the hotel provided FREE car parking which was fantastic. All other hotels I have stayed at always charge for parking. 6. Finally the Buffet Breakfast was excellent - well worth including this in your room rate as it can set you back $30-40 a day otherwise. The dinner at Swan Court was also delicious - thumbs up for the food. The negatives for the hotel are as follows: 1. The bathroom in our room was very outdated and not at a 5* standard - considering we paid for a Deluxe Ocean Front Room, at a much higher rate than their standard room. The bath/shower was not clean and was showing its age. The bathroom was also too small and cramped and could only have one person in it at a time. 2. The recreational space for the guests around the pool is limited (considering the number of rooms that this hotel has). The pool was always very noisy and you could not enjoy a couple of quiet hours sitting by the pool. Not good for people seeking R&R. 3. The beach front sun loungers can only be used after you pay a rental fee. For a 5* hotel with expensive room rates, it would be nice if the price for these lonugers were included. 4. There are a number of resort taxes that you need to be aware of, and we only found these out during check in/out. Overall this hotel was good and met most of our needs, but not for you if you're looking for 5* perfection and a little R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Still great place”
Reviews.Author: Bobb54
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hyatt , Kaanapali Beach Maui. I have been to this hotel 3 times and originally in 1985 when it was new. It is still a beautiful hotel with a great staff and the best value on the beach for this type of property. While I agree that there is some wear and tear on the carpet in the elevators, some wood moldings around doorways that have nicks here and there overall it is still a very nice hotel with a great pool and location. It is very close to Lahina and Whalers Village ( 15 minute walk) for shopping and eating . The restaurants on site are good but more pricy than those on the beach or in Lahina and Lahina has some great sunset views as well. However the portions are filling and not way out there in price. We stayed on the Regency Club floor water front .The morning breakfast, evening appetizers and snacks were fantastic as well as the service and friendliness of the staff ( shout out to lisaâ€™lani hope I spelt it correct ) . I am told it is now owned by the Marriott but run by Hyatt which originally concerned me since I always put the Hyatt at the top tier of the hotel chain properties. It is still a great place regardless. The beach has a lot of erosion and at low tide difficult to use due to coral, but a short walk down the beach solves that issue if you prefer the beach to pool. The concierge is great booked us a zip line and Helicopter tour with very convenient times or locations. They also have a Scuba program that will allow training in the pool and then a guided dive to about 25 feet with your instructor off of the beach. Rob the instructor was great, took underwater photos, as we saw sea turtles and other tropical fish right off of the hotel. Conversely we left here and went to the Grand Weilea for 3 days to play in the pool there ( I have been there 3 times as well ). At the Grand Weilea , they require all cars are valet parked $20 ( not incl tip), use a computer to print boarding passes $13 ( Hyatt provides for free all set up with all the airlines as well as parking options ) and have lined the activity pool with Cabanas to squeeze yet more out of you after paying $650+ a night to stay there with water view room . The Hyatt has a policy ( and a good one at that ) for the pre-dawn chair grabbers that put a book or towel down as a base of operations and then disappear for hours that they will check and if the chair is vacant an hour or more after they have left a note , they will remove the items and make it available. The beach is long and activities abound. If you are looking for a Hotel in this category that you want to get a bang for your buck when you are spending $550 or more a night, this is the place . My 17 year old said loved it more than Grand Weilea . Well done group at the Maui Hyatt , will see you again! Bob

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this resort, just as pleased”
Reviews.Author: jdspring
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our second stay at this Hyatt, and they continue to please us. We checked in on April 16th with no hassle and stayed until the 23rd. The resort grounds were clean and well kept. The staff was helpful and attentive, as they should be as this is considered a more high end and pricey resort. Every day we were at the pool. The worst part of the resort is not the staff or the facilities, but the guests. Often times, people would leave articles at the pool side lounges to "reserve" them. So if you want to head to the pool, make sure you do so early. Sometimes, we would see these "reserved" chairs remain empty from 8 in the morning until around lunch time. Again, not a complaint about the staff or the Hyatt but more the guests. Also, this is a family resort, so sometimes after we turned in for the night, there were kids running through the hall and screaming at each other, which did take away from our sleep quality. The resort fee had increased since our stay last year, to $25 a room/night. This became somewhat pricey as we had two rooms for the week, spending an additional $400 in fees. That said, you do get access to a coffee bar for that fee as well as wireless internet access in your rooms as no additional cost, which was a change from last year. If I have only one negative, it would be the resort fee, but I understood that fee would exist before going on vacation, so I planned for it. We did dine on site several times. Umalu's is good for informal dinners in the evening when you don't want to walk to Whaler's Village. Their flat bread pizzas are great as well as the pork tacos, certainly recommend those items. Also, dining poolside during the day was a great option and when we return, we plan to do more of that. Also, a new restaurant opened up since our last visit, called Japengo. I had recently dined in the Japengo at the San Diego Hyatt, so I recommended our family go there at least once. Just be warned, the prices are steep but you get what you pay for. Everyone was happy with the food there, even though the tab for 4 of us came out to around $140, with no drinks. My wife said their steamed local, snapper was the best fish she had ever had. I had the cashew chicken which was very good as well. I wouldn't recommend you dine there if you have young kids though, as the food and menu is more grown up. Our resort package included breakfast every day at Swan Court, which is really a great value and a good way to start the day. We did eat breakfast there every day during our stay and we were never disappointed. Just know that birds will come and visit you to try to snack on your leftovers. Some people are disgusted by this, but we had no problem with it. Again, some guests were being bad and throwing food to the birds or allowed their kids to throw food on the ground, which encourages the visits from the feathered friends. Not much the resort can do about guests, other than try to clean up quickly, and they do a good job. The buffet is around $40 a person, which is worth it, but is a better value if you get the breakfast included with your room. Some of the rooms have undergone renovation since our stay last year, which some new furniture, carpets, etc. This was a nice surprise to see the rooms refreshed. Overall, we were very happy with our second stay at this resort, and I am sure when we head to Maui again in the future, we will probably stay at this resort again, as long as the level of service that Hyatt provided remains consistent. The staff did a great job, but we, as travelers, need to do a better job as well.

Reviews.Title: “MUST be 48'' for water lava tube slide”
Reviews.Author: neato123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for babies/little non-swimmers and for older kids. If you have an avid swimmer who loves the beach, the pool and slides, but is under 48 inches...don't disappoint them. Our 6 year old is 47 1/2 inch and although we stated (every day) that we were okay with him going down the slide and he is a great swimmer, the hotel refused (their policy). They told me that he would love the kiddie slide....um, no he did not, too many babies. The beach is very small (eroding)....you have to take a bit of a walk to get to sandy area to play in the surf....it's doable. Great hotel for honeymooners and folks with little ones. The rooms are very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The gem of West-Maui. Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: klingadvisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in-between trips to Vegas and San Francisco as part of our annual vacation so were hoping this resort would offer a relaxing alternative, and it certainly delivered on all levels. Upon arrival we were greeted by over-friendly staff and the check-in lady was extremely courteous and efficient. We were blown away by the foyer and lobby section featuring a giant chandelier, palm trees and a crescendo of tropical birds and plants, to name but a few. The hotel never seemed too busy or felt crowded, and you could easily acquire all types of services offered, from concierge assistance to dining. The restaurants included a Japanese and 2 pacific cuisine options, all offering fairly expansive views over the resort. The main restaurant acted as the buffet hall in the morning and doubled up as their â€˜signatureâ€™ restaurant at night, â€˜Sonzâ€™ (which unfortunately we did not try). The buffet itself was superb, which we of course grew accustomed to every morning! There was a full range of fresh cereals, fruit, breads, cakes, cold and hot foods plus most other foods on request. A feature of this buffet was that the front of the hall looked out onto the hotelâ€™s lake and the robins, ducks and swans all frequently joined us at breakfast time! (hence the name Swan Court I imagine). Although included in our package, this buffet to non-guests of the hotel would set them back $30USD per person, so fairly costly some might say. Once settled we took a leisurely stroll around the grounds and the array of freely-walking penguins, flamingos and â€˜Spikeâ€™ (African Crane) canâ€™t help but to make you smile! Grassy plains, bridges and lush waterfalls adorn the exterior which really made this an idyllic setting, day or night. We particularly favoured the pool area which had the adult pool on one side and the childrenâ€™s equivalent on the opposite side, separated by a cave in the middle (with bar!), in which you could swim though waterfalls to enjoy an underground cocktail in the water! There was a water slide too which would appease the moderate thrill seekers. Our room partially overlooked the ocean by Kaâ€™anapali beach, the only obscurity being some palm trees which we werenâ€™t too belligerent about! The bedroom/lounge and bathroom were all of satisfactory size and the chambermaids did a decent job when required. We were pleased to have a balcony also. The Expedia desk in the hotel (located at top of stairs by Swan Court) offers discounted prices to many of the islands activities and excursions and the staff there were excellent. Resort Fees include a newspaper and access to the tennis courts and gym, which has even more machines/weights than the over-priced one I pay for in England! So to summarise, the Hyatt Regency Resort and Spa in Maui is an idyllic haven of relaxation and bliss, with a plethora of superb service. As the largest hotel along the Kaâ€™anapali beach, this truly is a romantic setting in the heart of paradise, and it fully receives my seal of approval.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lorita688
Reviews.Content: I was in Maui for my wedding and we stayed at this hotel for 7 days. The staff were great and were really accomodating. Since we had a large group staying at the hotel, we were able to get a group rate which was a couple hundred dollars cheaper than the published rate. We were in Hawaii during spring break time and I was a little worried that there would be little kids running around everywhere. To my surprise, this wasn't an issue at all. The grounds at this hotel are beautiful. In my opinion, the hotel has the best grounds out of all of the hotels along that strip. The rooms were spacious, clean, and newly renovated. The beds were also really comfy. We had a mini fridge in our room which was also really nice. We did attend the luau while we were there and I would say save your $100 and spend it on a massage. The food was luke warm and they had a cheesy guy who was hosting the whole thing. The highlight was the firedancer, but that was at the very end. I found myself really bored. The pool area is awesome and they have a separate pool for the kids. The only restaurant I ate at was Umalu which was surprisingly really good. The food is overpriced, but that is the case everywhere in Maui. I also did go to the coffee bar in the lobby in the mornings. Coffee/lattes were good but I would suggest buying breakfast food at Safeway and eating in your room because bagels were $5. This hotel is walking distance to Whaler's Village and there are several restaurants along the walkway that spans down to the Sheraton. Also, the gym is really great! All of the machines had TV's and they also had fitness classes. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spa”
Reviews.Author: RAM07
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in Maui was a beautiful resort with amazing food! The beaches were very nice and the location was great. I loved the spa there. It was a very relaxing trip! The luau was lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Shennine
Reviews.Content: I was very fortunate growing up and travelled the world with my parents ... this was by fair the most beautiful resort I have been at. The landscaping is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: 6533john
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this resort in the end of April. The location and grounds are magnificent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food at all of the resturants is good but not cheap, but it is inline with what you would expect for Hawaii. Everything is very clean and well kept and the stay was just a pleasure. The only items keeping us from rating this a five is the rooms could use some slight TLC. Some of the wallpaper seams are loose as an example. We had some issues with the TV reception that was fixed but it took a couple of calls. Our biggest negitive is the size of the pools and the associated pool area. Because this facility can hold the number of people that it can, the chairs in both the pool areas are on top off one another. Our group had 500 people as an example, and at the high times for the pool, there were not enough lounge chairs and the ones they had are literly inches apart. This was not a big deal for us because everyone knew each other. But if I was a family visiting and had to be this close to a group of strangers, it would feel like Coney Island. Dont let this stop you from going. It was the only slight negitive that we had in a very positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “We were forced to pay resort fee $25!”
Reviews.Author: Kaichih_Hu
Reviews.Content: I am in the Hyatt Maui right now. It's my 1st day here. I am writing this review in the room. I am going to stay here for 3 nights for my honeymoon since tonight, but we are not satisfied about the Hyatt. When checking in, we were told that $25 resort fee is required for EVERYONE! I was not told about this before and after booking. I cannot find the information on their web site. We have NO CHOICE for the resort fee. I don't think it's reasonble. And, the room is facing ... parking lot!! Besides, our room is UNDER the lobby! We are in level 1 and lobby is in level 2. Face to parking lot and lower than lobby!? Are you kidding me? And, actually, TV is useless unless you pay for it. We need to pay for most activities in Hyatt. The most horrible part is, I saw some reviews here and they said the snacks are located above weight sensitive machine?! After seeing the reviews, I saw our snacks, and found it seems that they are truly above some kinds of weight sensitive machine! We might touch some snacks before seeing the review. Now, we are worrying about being charged. Overall, we feel like, we would be charged for almost EVERYTHING and the quality of rooms is not so good. It's just OK. Don't have higher expectation for the Hyatt, or you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon stay in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shauneen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in February as part of our Honeymoon, everything was perfect. The hotel is beautiful, fabulous pools, gardens etc. i loved the flamingos and birds. The food was great in all the restaurants. We went to the Luau in the hotel and had a great night with great food again. All the staff were really friendly and always said hello.We stayed in a resort room, it was spacious and modern. We organised our activities through the hotel and went Whale watching and done the road to Hana trip. We had a fabulous time and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent concierge service!!”
Reviews.Author: BevinDPT
Reviews.Content: The hyatt concierge service was top notch! Heather Lombardi helped us on numerous occassions setting up activies and giving great suggestions! We rode a helicopter, ziplining, scuba diving and had an amazing time!!! Heather made everything so easy, even when a few activities were rained out. Thanks again Heather!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...simply Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: CKWitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I renewed our Vows while in Maui and Priceline.com a Hotel. As I don't get to pick the hotel on priceline but the hotel picks you for the price you want The Hyatt definitely demonstrated how it should be as they treated us like any one of there guests plus more. We priceline a lot of hotels and in my opinion if the hotel accepts your price they should treat you as any other guest...unfortunately I can't say that for other times in other hotels but the Hyatt did!! They noticed that my wife was in a very pretty dress and asked what the occasion was...we told them that we just renewed our vows...after that the receptions did everything she could to accommodate us even giving us an Ocean View!! It was exactly what I was looking for and took our renewal of vows to a whole other level. THANK-YOU HYATT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, beautiful and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodiva3
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is an incredible hotel with terrific service, beautiful lobby and pool areas, large sized and comfortable rooms and a great setting. The service was very good from the bellhops, valet, to the concierge. Food is very good, but expensive. The rooms were clean, quite large and very comfortable. They would be great for a family. The setting is perfect with a fantastic pool and great boardwalk to the main area of kaanapali. The beach area is a little bit small, but still nice. My only complaint...it was a bit crowded at the pool and sometimes hard to find a spot. Overall though a great stay for either couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: PeopleSoft11
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Hyatt-Regency on Maui. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. There are at least six concierges in the lobby to help us plan any activites we wanted to do. They also found a good electric wheelchair/scooter shop who delivered a scooter to the hotel. The hotel lobby is spectacular! There are coconut trees growing in their open-air lobby, warm weather penguins in a pond, pineapples growing there and beautiful parrots on perches. Our room was a full ocean view room with a balcony. It overlooked their huge swimming pool complete with warerfalls. Just beyond the pool was a walking path and then the ocean. The distance from our room to the ocean couldn't have beed more than about 50-75 yards. We ate in their fine dining restaurant the first night we were there. It has enormous doors along one wall that open to a pond with a waterfall and swans swimming in the pond. What a picturesque place to dine! The food was excellent, too. We loved this hotel and hope we will be able to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to have slipped”
Reviews.Author: jturner48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacation every year for 7-8 days in Maui and for the past 4 years we have stayed at the Hyatt in Maui. This year the hotel seems to have slipped in service and quality of food especially at their morning buffet. We have always prepaid for the buffet, but must admit that we skipped it after the 4th day. Food was not that great and the table/utensils were always dirty. I think they made a mistake by eliminating the white table cloths as we found the tables very dirty and sticky. The front desk staff were excellent as usual, but the maid service was not up to their high standards. We will always come back to Maui, but have to think about other hotel options for 2012

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: travelcookie_7
Reviews.Content: After talking with many people who are regular returning guests of this hotel, it made me wonder why am I late to the party! Probably because I thought Maui to be too touristy but have seen the light. We came over from the Big Island and I was pleasantly surprised how beautiful the hotel is and accomodating the employees are to their patrons. We loved swimming in the pools and walking through the lobby to take in the Hawaiian atmosphere. Gorgeous and well kept gardens and trees. We had access to the Regency Club and the food and drink were nicely displayed in comfortable surroundings and people gathered to share their stories which was fun. Karen, Sandy and Spencer helped me with directions for driving to areas we didn't know and had many suggestions for places to visit and restaurants to dine. They went out of their way to make reservations at restaurants and we felt like they were our private concierges and are professional and caring. We ate at Japengo and I had a huge piece of grilled ahi cooked perfectly and my husband had tuna hand roll and sushi with eel. The tuna roll was fabulous but the sushi needed a bit more eel in it. We also ate at Son'Z for dinner and my piece of coffee rubbed filet was delicious and tender and my husbands filet mignon meatballs with pasta was a generous portion. I felt the Diana Ross show tunes for background music was too edgy for this relaxing place and it distracted from the dinning expereince. Service was excellent in both restaurants. One night the room next to ours had a young group that partied most of the night. Finally, I couldn't take the noise any longer and called the front desk who sent security to the room in a short amount of time. The party noise stopped right then and I heard the young men and women apologizing as they walked down the hallway. Good job. I am planning when I can return to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: IslandLover2011
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience with the Hilton in Oahu we were greeted at the Hyatt Regency Maui by one of the valet stewards (I didn't get his name). We wanted to just park the car temporarily because we were going out again and did not want to pay valet fees. The steward offered us parking "gratis" while we settled in. Grade A checkmark #1. Then Janice checked us in at the front desk. She was friendly, made us feel comfortable and welcome and told us of all the amenities of the Hyatt (things the Hilton did not offer). Then she presented us with complimentary waters which we greatly appreciated. Grade A checkmark #2. We found during our stay all of our staff to be helpful and courteous. (Grade A #3). The grounds are breathtaking and well kept. The pool is clean and inviting and because of its design (w/water slide & caves), was exciting for our grandson. (Grade A #4). The orange/lemon infused water pool side at the bar was refreshing & other perks like cold face towels, and complimentary freeze pops (Grade A #5). The location in Kaanapali is perfect for those who love beach activities and centralized access to numerous bars, restaurants and shops. We were so thrilled with our experience we have been advertising ever since. I even told a Delta airline representative to make sure she only "booked" at the Hyatt when she went on vacation. Bravo to the management & staff of Hyatt Maui. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Aweseome property”
Reviews.Author: Promhd
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews about this property but had no issues. Rooms are clean, large. Food at resturants was good. Hotel was great to walk around and staff was very friendly and helpful. Only issue I had was the beach is not real swimmable due to the lava rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Scurry49428
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights in an ocean view suite and loved it. After spending 6 nights at the Hilton Hawaiian Village we came to Maui. What a difference! Not only is the island better but what a difference in hotels. Better pools, better rooms, better service and the regency club at the Hyatt is much better than the Diamond club at the Hilton. The Hyatt in Maui is great for family vacations. The pools are awesome - they allow the parents to relax while their kids are in plain site having fun in the water. The staff at the Hyatt is great. They cater to your every need and always have a smile on their faces. The Regency Club had great breakfasts, snacks and beverages during the day and appetizers and desserts in the evening. The only downside was they no longer provide free drinks in the evening. Overall, this hotel is great, just a notch below the Grand Hyatt in Kuai.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Terrace Luau was fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa102
Reviews.Content: We were entertaining friends & family visiting from out of town. They had decided to attend this luau in Kaanapali. It was a perfect evening. The setting was gorgeous, the entertainers were great, the food was delicious. But most of all the service was fantastic." Blythe" was our server that night and he was professional and kind. He went above and beyond to meet a need (children traveling). Thank you, BLYTHE !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: LovinLifeChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 6 of our nights. We had a wonderful stay! The staff was attentive and the hotel room was very nice room w/ great views. The grounds are amazing from the penguins to the flamingos it was simply spectacular. We had the breakfast included in our rate, and it had anything and everything you could ever want to eat. The pools were fabulous and the little touches really add up and make it that much better (cold towels, freeze pops, etc.), and the Umalu restaurant was great and convenient (we ate there like 4x for lunch!...very yummy food!). They gave us a free bottle of wine & appetizer for our honeymoon, what a nice touch! Would DEFINITELY stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating and spiffing up”
Reviews.Author: 7continentKaren
Reviews.Content: Our room was right out of 1980 when the hotel was built. They clearly did some updating but the overall effect was still 1980. For years I have wanted to stay at this hotel and we got it for $150 per night through Priceline! So, that was good. The hotel gardens are very nice now BUT the two waterslides were closed for repairs. There are NO steps into the adult main pool. One woman got herself down the ladder but was very concerned about hauling herself up as she had just had shoulder surgery. The only steps were in the bar area where you had to swim around the waterfall. Here's the big disappointment: Swan Court. We loved Swan Court and have had brunch there for years even if we did not stay at the hotel. The railings leading from the entrance to the lower seating are cheap painted metal and are extremely chipped. Good grief! That is a star in this hotel. Furniture is sun bleached, breakfast marginal. $28.95! Even the swans stayed away. So, for dinner, we went elsewhere. By and large, the lobby area looks pretty good though some of the statues have been damaged. You can tell it is a Hemmeter project with architectural similarities to the Hilton Waikoloa. We stayed two nights, separated by another stay at Wailea. The first check-in person was very enthusiastic and cheerful but the second, not so much. We were given a certificate for champagne for our anniversary, a nice touch, but were in a Priceline room. View of two parking lots from the two windows. (Did I mention the baby balconies?) Second time, we had a partial ocean view which was nice. Overlooked the luau! Free show from the baby balcony. First check-in resulted in Hyatt Gold Passport points for our meal charges and stay credit. Second time, no. Beds were just OK, nothing like a Westin Heavenly Bed. Rooms still decorated in browns of yore. Average size, new faucets, old furniture. Business center charged a mighty 65 cents per minute to use a computer. For the Priceline price, it was a deal. Maui is very expensive compared to the other islands. For retail of $350, it was a rip. So, I recommend it conditionally.

Reviews.Title: “Many Problems, But This Could Be a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Stephielu
Reviews.Content: In 1980, when I was 12, I visited the Hyatt for one day and never forgot it! The pools, the water slide, the grotto...it was a kid's dream-come-true! One day last June I was surfing around Costco's Travel site, and found a killer deal for the Hyatt on Maui. Without hesitation I purchased 12 nights for my family (son age 9 and daughter age 6). Perhaps I should have done more research because upon arrival we were greeted by the lovely sound of jackhammers and nail guns! The slide was closed, the pool was filthy (broken pump), and the ocean front room I splurged for overlooked the massive construction project! I have to admit that all the construction really did ruin our stay at this marvelous hotel. And the worst part was that the staff (well, some of the staff) were very rude and defensive about it all. When getting towels one day, I asked if anyone knew when the water slide would be fixed, and one of the men behind the counter very rudely said, "we're on a volcano in the middle of the ocean--things don't happen quickly here lady!" Another time I was ready to move hotels because I couldn't take anymore jackhammers, and the woman at the front desk assured me that the construction would stop for the weekend. Her exact words were, "Hang in there one more day!" When one pays a fortune to stay at a nice resort, one should not have to "hang in there!" As it turned out, the construction continued right through the weekend and we even had the added bonus of a pressure washer! Just writing this review is making me angry again! Phew...now that I'm all upset, let me talk about the bright spots: 1. The rooms are gorgeous! We had a Deluxe Ocean Front with 2 beds, and it was perfect for our family of 4. Not crowded at all. LOVED the decor. The rooms were far better than I expected. 2. The Swan Court breakfast is amazing!! It was included in our package (thank goodness--it would have cost our family about $100 a day otherwise!). The kids were in awe and couldn't wait to get up and eat breakfast. Many people complained about the birds in their reviews, but they didn't bother us at all. Provided entertainment for the kids. 3. The parrots, fish ponds, and penguins were adored by the kids. The Hyatt does a great job of letting people feed and play with the animals. We thoroughly enjoyed them. 4. The location is wonderful. Kaanapali Beach is definitely the place to stay with kids. Yes, the Hyatt beach has eroded and it's smaller than the other hotels, but we still had a great time making sand castles and playing there. It never bothered us one little bit. 5. The food was fantastic at all of the restaurants. Umalu makes the best ahi salad and sushi rolls. And anything with the pulled pork was to die for! 6. I think we would have loved the Hyatt if there had not been construction going on. Sure, some of the staff is a little "snooty," but most of them are very friendly and make up for the others. We're actually excited to return next year and see how it is without the chaos and noise. We got a tip that in June Costco usually runs a Kaanapali special, so we're keeping our fingers crossed that it's for the Hyatt. But it will probably be for another resort that will be in the middle of a renovation--hence the great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui One of World's Best Hotels for Romance”
Reviews.Author: porsche74s
Reviews.Content: I've been a guest of the Hyatt Maui since shortly after it was built in 1980. Today it really hasn't changed that much. Yes, the restaurants are different and the night club that used to have a front entrance to the right of the hotel's front door is closed. And there are some signs of age in the hotel which is generally very well maintained, which need to be addressed. For instance, on the 14th floor where we stayed, there is a service room near the elevators that has a wood door frame that has been badly beaten and pounded by service carts, and it needs repairs and paint. At the tops of the painted elevator doors there is some corrosion that needs repair. The carpet in the Swan Court is somewhat dirty and needs to be replaced. But these are just nit-picking things that hotel facilities management ought to notice without my having to bring it to their attention. I just remember this hotel from when it was brand new. It's still a beautiful hotel by any standard. The staff is excellent, the beds are comfortable, and the wrap-around ocean front decks in corner room 1426 make this undoubtedly the best room in the entire hotel. You can see all the way to Lahaina down the coast as well as overlook the pool and waterfalls and 'Umalu poolside restaurant area and ocean. What's to complain about? I love this hotel and highly recommend it to anyone staying in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Brakelights
Reviews.Content: Since we were arriving late on the first night of a six night stay, we made a reservation for the least expensive room in the hotel for the first night, then an oceanview room for the rest of the stay. Upon arrival we were delighted to hear that we were upgraded for the first night and would not have to change rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, the bed comfortable, and the property is large and very well maintained. We will not hesitate to return to the Hyatt for our next stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sunseekeralberta57
Reviews.Content: We were on the Big Island and decided to go spend a few days in Maui. After searching the web I found a deal at the Hyatt at less than half of what it would usually go for. I have to say that at 189.00 a night I was not expecting a great view but pleasantly surprised that we received a partial ocean/garden view. On arrival the staff was extremely helpful. We got to our room and it was very nice, with a beatiful view. The room was very clean and very roomy. The gardens with the birds and koi pond, made for a nice stroll. The beach was nice. I have to say we did not eat at any of the restaurants, because we found them to be over priced. But the short drive into Lahaina to eat was really not a problem. Overall a very nice place to stay, although I don't think I would pay regular price for it.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: codytucker
Reviews.Content: just returned from a stay on maui. first part at the fairmont in wailea which is beyond words in its beauty and the room size and decor. Arriving at the Hyatt we paid for ocean front room which looked out over the pool. The balcony was very small, too small for 2 to sit. Below our rooms were the 2 trees the Marlins roost in at 6pm and then they wake at 6am. The noise is very loud, you can not sleep with windows open. But that was ok since also below us was the restaurant that served breakfast. At 4:15 am they start setting the tables so we were awaken to dishes and glasses being set up. No robes. Pool is congested and you need to get up to save a place if you want a quite spot away from all the people. This is our 8th visit to Maui and our first to the Hyatt. We will probably not be back. The lobby and open area is beautiful and the birds are very entertaining, but for the price and what you experience the Fairmont is such a better way to spend your dollars. Also in the bathroom there is one small counter to set up extras you may acquire such as drinks or snacks. 3/4 of the space was taken by a tray filled w/ mini bar food. if you touch it you pay for it. I called and had the whole thing taken away for our stay so we would have some room for our things. The staff was very nice and certainly went out of their way to make your stay great, but it all depends on what kind of stay you want your visit to Maui to be.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: homer777
Reviews.Content: Prior to discovering the Hyatt Regency in Maui we traveled to various islands throughout the Pacific and Caribbean. This is now our third year in a row staying at this hotel and we have come to the conclusion that there is no reason to look elsewhere in the future. Every aspect of this hotel is outstanding from the grounds, the hotel to the staff. I had a bet with my wife that at least once during our 8 day stay that I would pass a housekeeper without them recognizing us with a smile and greeting. I lost! We highly recommend this hotel and have never experienced anything other than an outstanding stay each time and are already planning our return in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jattcf
Reviews.Content: We booked through a discount website and paid less than half of what was listed for a room. We thoroughly expected to get a parking lot view room, but instead received a man floor partial ocean view/garden view room. We were thrilled with it! My husband thought it may have been because he signed up to be a hyatt gold member at the front desk. We loved the friendly and super helpful concierge, the beach access, the pool and lounge area (plenty of good shade), the in hotel shopping, and especially the restaurants. Sons was pricey, but superb - try the calamari. And Umalus was quite pricey too, but the taco salad is amazing and feeds four for lunch. A very long walk to Whalers Village, but nice in the morning and evenings. Would stay there again in a heartbeat! Thanks for the great stay Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Ants in my car...”
Reviews.Author: wendrz
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the hotel grounds, all the pretty lights in the trees as you arrive and the tour of the birds was great for me and my 3 yo but the service for the most part was awful. We had a massive ant infestation in our rental car on day 3 of our 7 day trip due to the valet parking our rental SUV right on an anthill and after repeated requests they still never cleaned it out. I did not expect such lack of care at what is supposed to be a nice hotel chain. I asked for help on the 2nd day the car was brought to me by the valet full of ants(how could you not see them they where EVERYWHERE even my 3 yo was squishing them while in her car seat) and after waiting for 15 min I just drove off and wiped the car down myself. the next day we were assured they would clean out the car, but again thy brought it back full of ants. Finally they offered to just drive us to our dinner reservation, which they booked for us(yes we did tip the concierge for that) and upon arrival we found out they hosed up and booked us for two nights later(we were leaving the next day). The beds were awful as well, my back still hurts! The kid pool needs some upgrades/replacement of the turtles and dolphin which all showed wear and tear exposing the foam inside(yuck and not sanitary). The only thing I can say we liked is the Cobb salad, the gourmet PB&J we kept ordering from the poolside cafe and their BLT&A was awesome although both were way overpriced. We did have a few nice encounters with the in room dining gentlemen and housekeeping ladies. They were all very kind to my 3 year old and left her lots of chocolates and bird cards and were very fast to respond and thorough to clean up a broken glass in our room which was totally my fault. We also liked the bird tour and feeding the Koi everyday at 0900. I would not stay here again,we only did because my husband was attending a conference there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spa”
Reviews.Author: 1esquire1
Reviews.Content: My family and I weren't guests at the Hyatt. After a terrible experience at the Westin Spa, (See review) a Westin employee referred us to the Hyatt Spa. My daughters and I couldn't have been more pleased. The spa staff was professional, upbeat and full of Aloha, not quite the experience I had at the previous "spa". Due to bad weather we were at this facility over half a day treating ourselves to massages, facials, manicures and pedicures. The staff and management should be commended on the class act that they are!!! We can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for the price. But I would stay in off season next time I go.”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBradley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the begging of the summer time, I think in June but not sure of the exact date. This is traditionally one of the busiest times for Maui visitors and during our stay the hotel was packed, as were all the hotels there. We traveled with business associates and our families of young kids. We each stayed in Ocean View rooms with a King bed. The rooms were large with pull out "bed' couches in each living room. They felt like mini suites. The view was really only from the balcony but when you were out there it was dead ahead and beautiful. However, the hotel is very large and the property on which it is situated has expansive grounds so the ocean is actually pretty far from the hotel rooms in most cases. So, I like to break it down into The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly. So away we go... The Good The rooms we stayed in were clean, smelled clean (important to me as many hotel rooms smell musty or moldy) well furnished and spacious. The room looked recently refurbished, it had nice dark wood floors and plantation shutters that opened up to the Lani. The rooms also had lovely bathrooms. Even though this is called an Ocean view King room, it was very large with a living area. The "Ocean View" is really when you are on the balcony and not to visible from the room. This was fine for us as we were not spending a lot of time in the room. However, be cautious of this because if you are sitting in the room or on the bed their really isn't much of a view. The hotel had plenty of decent restaurants but all were very crowded and service was hit and miss. The cleaning staff, bell service, concierge, etc. all was average as far as service. The Bad If you only travel to Hawaii occasionally you might want to avoid the "peak' months for a hotel such as this one. You have to consider how many rooms they have here and when it is sold out or nearly sold out how many people will be sharing the common areas, such as the beach and the pools. The place place was uncomfortable to me with so many people. The pool was a mess. It actually gave me anxiety to be there. The Ugly OK.. the pool architecture looks really cool with the man made rocks, caves and waterfalls, but send a group of little kids in there and you are asking for trouble . It's hard to keep track of where they are. They get lost fast and the "caves" have slippery, slimy floors that little kids can easily fall on. Mine fell multiple times. I think it would be perfect for the preteens and teens . They all seemed to be having a ball. The kiddie area of the pool. called the Keiki Lagoon ( age 5 and under crowd), again, looks really cool, as it is shallow and has sand like a beach that leads into the pool area. This part of the pool was so over crowded with diaper wearers and the water was really too warm to be comfortable which leads me to the "yucky" part. Here it is ... there are hundreds of people at the pool, and the bathroom, in the cave near the pool is almost always empty or nearly empty. Do I need to explain more? I think not. Hectic is the word I would use to describe the pool scene at the hotel. Another factor for over crowding I believe is that many people walking by on the path from nearby hotels spot the pool and just "crash' it even though they are not guests. There are "guest room police" constantly monitoring the situation, but in the baby pool it was ridiculous. Too many people! And do you want to wait in line everyday for your wrist band to prove you are a guest? I think they have to pool to close to public access, but you can't really move a pool very easily so I suppose that problem is not going to go away. Conclusion: In defense of the hotel, all of the hotels along this strip seem to have the same issues with crowds . We had lunch at the neighboring hotels and it was ditto for the scene. This hotel however seems to have the best pool, with the "cave" bar, waterfalls, and the huge water slide(s) . I plan to bring my kids back to this hotel when they are in the preteen years. I'll grin and bear the crowds, or most likely come back in off season. Also, as far as hotels in Kaanapali area, as apposed to Waliea. I think this is one of the nicest hotels in Kaanapali. Kaanapali has a lot of stuff to do, Waliea, is more quiet and less crowded but is much more expensive. Kaanapali probably makes more sense for most familes. If you do go to Waliea everything, and I mean everthing costs more. So your trip ends up costing a lot more. Could be nearly doulble the price or more, for many things like restaurants, sundries, etc.. If you thought this review was helpful you might want to check out my other reviews. I have reviewed numerous hotels on several Hawaiian Islands and I am always checking out new places all the time. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very small beach but possibly great anyhow”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: If you are the rare beach vacationer who actually likes to sit on the beach, and not near the pool, read on. At first I was horribly disappointed in this hotel. The beach is almost nonexistent in front of the hotel and the shallow waters are entirely lava and hard to walk on. And then, of course, on my last day I figured out how this could be the greatest beach hotel ever. If you walk all the way down to the spa, there is an area of beach connected to the larger, public access beach, where Hyatt has 14 chairs and 5 umbrellas to rent. They are also first come, first serve in the morning. This means that you have a nice, sandy, large, virtually uninhabited beach with the benefits of a chair and an umbrella, all of which you'll probably share with a maximum of 13 people. I never saw any kids here and the noise from the pool area didn't exist. I thought it was as close to a private beach as I'll ever get and I loved it. No bar service but worth a short walk for the peace and quiet. Ask for a room in the Lahaina tower and you'll be closer to your room from this spot too. Hotel itself has a lovely staff and nice facilities. Japengo was awful and I would not eat there but it's a nice location for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: robyn620
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out our experience was first class. We arrived Jan 6 a bit early but were able to get to check-in. Our regency club room had 2 balconies! One we could sit on, the ocean front side, and one walk out only but offered panoramic views of the island. Sliding screens on the doors allowed us to sleep with the doors open. The island breeze and sounds from the ocean were a nice treat. Had not trouble with parking, the spots are very small, nor finding lounges at the pool. Regency club breakfast and evening snacks were a nice addition. Enjoying hors d oeuvres on the balcony before dinner was perfect. Rooms were very clean, The toilet/shower area is very tight but its not in my home so we could "rough it" for a few days. If it means the room is bigger than so be it Buffet breakfast was also included offered a nice selection. Would recommend this hotel to travelers. Great location. The beach is very small but I prefer the pool anyway. Gym facility was also great.

Reviews.Title: “MAUI + HYATT = PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: BAStewart
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Maui, I was a little anxious about where to stay b/c I didn't want to be disappointed. The Hyatt was/is AMAZING!!!! EVERYONE that worked in the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. We were given a room on the first floor in the back of the hotel. Initially, I was kind of let down, but it actually was probably better b/c it was SO quiet and relaxing. Besides, we spent as little time in our room as possible. Beds were very comfortable. Shower and bath area were very clean. The LOCATION of the HYATT was PERFECT....the Hyatt is the southernmost hotel on Ka'anapali Beach, so you get a real feeling that you're completely isolated from the other hotels. THE GROUNDS ARE INCREDIBLE/IMPECCABLE, SO LUSH WITH ALL KINDS OF PLANTS AND TREES AND EXOTIC BIRDS. Utilize the concierge services; they booked trips for us, made reservations for us @ restaurants, printed driving directions for us...IF YOU STAY AT ANY OTHER RESORT ON KA'ANAPALI BEACH, YOU'RE WASTING YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: mahalofromafar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hyatt's from Los Angeles, New York to Singapore and experienced the most "so-so" stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui.
