Are they trying to save money on electricity? If so, they did with our room--I could barely see the toilet or the shower. Come on! 3.) The beach is very rocky and tiny. You pretty much have to walk uphill everywhere on the small stretch of beach. If you want to spend the day at the beach, don't stay here. 4.) I think they should have provided all guests with a welcome lei (like they did for us at the Grand Wailea). It doesn't cost the hotel much, but would have been a nice added touch. 5.) Our room wasn't ready and the hotel was not very accomodating. Yes, they allowed us to leave our bags. But, nobody called us when it was time to check in or anything. They pretty much forgot about us. All in all, I would return to Maui and possibly stay at this hotel. There were a TON of kids there, so I would probably go back with kids next time. It's not a hotel to have a romantic, relaxing vacation. This is a hotel to move, move, move and see stuff. We still loved it, don't get me wrong. It's a very good hotel in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Rennovations for the future”
Reviews.Author: Wez61
Reviews.Content: There is lots going on at the Hyatt on Maui. Some minor inconveniences such as the temporary moving of the Regency Club to the Lobby level and one restaurant being remodeled are more than overshadowed by the people who work there. They are the most customer service oriented group I have ever met. Just open your hearts to them and it will be returned many times over. The Regency Club is in a beautiful area while the old location is being remodeled. It has added the amenity of computers for the convenience of their guests. It may not have the views for a short time, but all of the greatest people in the chain are still there anxious to make sure your stay is all it can be. We spend over 60 nights at Hyatt's and this is our favorite place to come for the past 11 years!

Reviews.Title: “It was heaven on earth!!”
Reviews.Author: eddiebill
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hyatt Maui. Everything from arrival to departure was perfect. At check in we were offered an upgrade which we accepted and were given a room on the top floor with a to die for ocean and sunset view. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We enjoyed afternoon drinks and appetizers at the pool bar. The staff there made great drinks and were very friendly. There was a small issue with our bill but it was corrected immediately as soon as we questioned it. We were there for eight days and we didn't want to leave. It's a great hotel in a fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing resort experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Shitzhuparents
Reviews.Content: We arrived on October 14th after 3 flights, very tired and the staff welcomed us warmly. It was our anniversary, therefore we were treated to a flower leigh, a photo album, a bottle of champagne and complimentary water, which was very thoughtful. Points: Resort lobby was beautiful. Pictures do not come close. The smell of flowers in the air, birds everywhere, and plants galore. All employees greet you wherever you go and offer assistance if needed. Everything you can possible think of is right there in the resort. The grounds were so beautiful that guests from other resorts were walking the gardens and even swimming in the pools because they were so awesome. We have been unable to stop talking about the beauty that surrounded us and the hospitality. Our room was a Deluxe Ocean Front and was exactly as described. We did not have a microwave, but we did not realize that we just needed to request one. The balcony overlooked the pool and the ocean and was stunning. Even had cascading flowers growing in the flower boxes on the balcony. We spent a lot of time out there! Housekeeping was outstanding and tended to our every need. They were very mindful of our privacy (it WAS our anniversary) and very thoughtful. Our room was always spotless. The pools were out of this world. As previously mentioned, guests from other resorts came down to use the pools because they are so unique. The staff waited on us the entire time we were at the pool and made us feel spoiled. The towels were well laundered and very fresh each day. Swan Court is THE place for breakfast. We had an SOS package that included buffet and it was amazing. We have never seen a buffet like it (and my husband travels for work and has been all over to resorts, even on Kuaui and Oauhu). If you can, book a package with the buffet included. Our problem was that we were not hungry for the remainder of the day. We TRIED to eat other meals but we were very full! Oh and the staff at Swan Court treat you like royalty. And we loved the birds! If you leave a plate, they do come, but only if you leave it. They seem to know that you are off to get another plate :) We did try the Umalu buffet, but only once. It is nice if you are in a hurry. Ate dinner at Umalu twice, both times were great. Had the Ahi burger; out of this world good. Plus the live music. Really romantic. Speaking of music, it is playing softly everywhere you go. It is very calming and relaxing. This is THE place to go for romance. We had dinner at Sonz one night and it was great. The staff was all over everything we needed. The wine list is extensive and they also have a nice selection of other spirits. Our bill ran about $128 (we live outside of Chicago so this was a pleasant surprise for gourmet food and service). The Drums Luau is great. A must see. We booked ahead but could have saved money if we booked upon arrival. There is really very little need to leave the resort! They have stores filled with anything you need, a top notch spa and fitness center and access to every activity you could possibly want to book. Parking IS limited, however we stayed 6 nights (10/14/2010-10/202010) and found that we really did not even need a rental car the entire week. Maybe just for one day to drive to the other side of the island. Otherwise, the shuttles will take you everywhere! Overall, we cannot wait to book our next trip! We will not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsPavs
Reviews.Content: There isn't much to say about the Hyatt in Maui. The resort is lovely, the people are friendly and the loaction is ideal. It is the perfect honeymoon location. The only issue is the the food is a little pricey so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort. You could stay and just enjoy this one resort.”
Reviews.Author: mrsomindy
Reviews.Content: But Maui has so many nice places you'll want to see. The pool was great. You can swim up to the bar inside a cave, but no curb side service. You have to get out to get your drink. The waterfalls in the pool are fun. They even had a basketball hoop and several were playing. The kiddy pool had slides and was separate. We had the Breakfast Buffet included and it was perfection. Crispy bacon on a steam table seems to be an oxymoron, it's usually soggy, but not here. Eggs Benedict with salmon. YUM. (twice I added my bacon to my Eggs Benedict.) You sit by the Lagoon and relax and eat. We found a great waitress named Dee and always asked to sit in her station. They were very accommodating. The stores inside the resort were a nice touch. There is a couple of nice art places, and other nice shops. We got a great Koa framed picture They wrapped it nicely for our trip home. The view we had was sunset all the way. The Lanai was a bit small, but we were the only two in the room, so it didn't matter to us. It was relaxing to sit there and watch the sun go down. There is a luau on the same side as the wing we were in, but the music wasn't bad at all. It ended by 8:30. Truth be told, even on the lanai, we couldn't hear it. We walked by the luau and the dancers and singers were great! We wished we had gone. It was the first luau I had seen that had what appeared to be 4 part harmony, and I am a sucker for good harmony. Beds comfy, newspaper next to the door in the morning. Nice to look over at breakfast and find out what was going on in town that day. I like to be connected to the world, even when in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay not far from front street. The...”
Reviews.Author: bmdoss
Reviews.Content: Great stay not far from front street. The excursion desks left a lot to be desired! Be sure to book activities prior to travel... There was a great deal of shady communcation and sales. Overall excellent hotel! Next time we will try a condo to save a bit on food!

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Aloha Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing stay at the Hyatt. It is exactly what a Hawaiian resort should feel like. The property has an open-air, olds school vibe but is very well-maintained and in no means equates to old and run-down. The ocean view combined with the lush landscaping and delicate orchids instantly puts you in the Hawaiian state-of-mind during your entire stay. The rooms look exactly like the pictures on their website and were quite spacious, the beds are very comfortable. In addition to the mini bar fridge, they have a second empty small fridge just for you, which was a very nice bonus as we had a 2-year-old with us. Service was impeccable from check-in to check-out, from valets, servers, bellmen, concierge. Both restaurants served delicious food, there's really no need to leave the resort if you don't want to. Spa was gorgeous, massage was worth the money, and the view from the relaxation room can't be beat. The pools weren't overcrowded, and the beach was practically deserted. We tried a few different beach spots to the left of the hotel and directly in front, all enjoyable with gentle waves and warm water. All the resorts on Kaanapali Beach are connected by an ocean-front walkway that leads to Whalers Village, a shopping/restaurant area. The Hyatt is ideally located at the southern-most point, so it's nicely isolated and doesn't see as much foot traffic. We've stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua in prior visits, which is very nice, but our stay at the Hyatt was quite comparable. The current remodeling was a non-issue, we never heard a thing. We can't wait to return. **Saw a comment from a previous reviewer that the "class" of the hotel seemed lower due to travelers on the Costco package. Yes, we booked our trip through Costco Travel and were quite pleased by the value of the cost, but it wasn't exactly Moetl 6 rates. We still paid $2,500, which was a signficant savings from rack rate, and meant we had more to spend on meals, massages, excursions, etc. In my opinion, being on a budget isn't a bad thing, why wouldn't you want to save 50% off to have the exact same experience? She must've been on a budget, too,since she was expecting Four Seasons guests at a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Best Relaxing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: luvWDW
Reviews.Content: This is a must hotel if you plan on staying in Maui. It is located on the Kaanapali side, so it's near Lahaina. We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean View Room. It overlooked the ocean and kid's area of the pool. We loved that we could leave our sliding door open and listen to the waves at night. It was so relaxing! The service was excellent, as soon as you pulled up to the front. Everyone was very accomodating. My son loved the atrium where you can see various types of parrots, penguins, and koi fish (which you are able to feed by hand at 9:30am every morning). There is a garden area where you can also see flamingos, black geese, and more. The best part of the hotel was the pool! My son loved the pool. The kids area was perfect for little ones. You can relax by the pool while you watch your kids play in this area and order lunch and drinks without having to move from your lounge chair! There was a water slide for the little kids and the "big" kids too:) My husband loved that he could watch a baseball game at the swim up bar and play a game of basketball in the pool. We ate at the Umalu restaurant for dinner one night that overlooks the ocean. The food was excellent! Good variety...we had nachos, maui style tacos, and sushi. Our package included the free breakfast at both the Umalu restaurant and the Swan Court. You will enjoy the views from both places. But beware of the scanvenger birds! They will attack your food if it's left alone for a split second. If you forgot something, don't fret...they have a mini Macy's inside the hotel and the Sundry shop has most everything you would find at a drugstore. Not overly priced either. I could go on and on about this place. The only con about this place is the self-parking area. Yes, we're cheapos about valet. The parking is very tight, and it might be hard to find parking during the busy months. But this is one of the best places we've ever stayed at. I wish I could go back tomorrow! But I will definitely be back sometime in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury relaxation in the sun”
Reviews.Author: Axelariat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 7 nights at Hyatt Regency Hyatt as a honeymoon couple and we cannot recommend it highly enough. We have rated it 5 stars, if we could give it 6 we would. We have never been to a 5 star resort like this before so maybe we are getting a bit carried away, but what can I say - we paid our money and we were impressed! The residents seemed to me mainly 30 something honeymooners and middle aged (40 - 60) couples. There were a few children but not many. A comprehensive review would take too long as the place is huge, but the main reasons we loved it are: 1) Sheer scale and opulence of the building - the lobby is an open courtyard with a coffee bar, koi carp pool, parrots, penguins (yes, penguins), and palm trees several storeys high. It needs to be seen to be believed. Beyond the lobby is a small branch of Macy's, and other shops, mainly high-end souvenir shops. There is a choice of restaurants. There is a water garden outside which is home to flamingos and swans. The hotel grounds cover a huge area. 2) Beautiful scenery. The hotel grounds are lovely - well landscaped, plenty of greenery, several waterfalls so you have the relaxing sound of running water by the pools and bars. All the grass is maintained to putting green standards. Everything is spotless from the pool area to the pathways. 3) Proximity to beach and clean sea - 20 yards from hotel. Step out of the hotel, past the pool, onto the beach. Fantastic. The beach is very narrow outside the Hyatt so any sunbathing needs to be done by the pool really, but walk north along the sand for about 5 to 10 mins and there is a lot of sand for sunbathing. 4) The pool area - very large main pool (the only one we went in although I think there was a smaller one mainly for children) and the best on the Ka'anapali strip from what we saw as we walked past the other hotels. Plenty of sun beds to go round, there was never a problem. Swim under the large waterfall from the pool, into the caves, and there is a bar. There are waitresses walking around the pool asking if you require a drink from Umalu bar which is right next to the pool area. It serves great cocktails, several draught beers, very decent bar food (burgers, onion rings, seafood salad etc) all with a smile from the excellent staff - plus 2 screens showing live sport with the sound muted. Umalu is a lovely place to get some shade and cool down after a while in the sun. Just relax and put all those cocktails on you room bill - you don't have to carry cash around at all! There is a little area separated just off the pool area where you can get a professional massage, we had one and it was really good. There's a shop next to the bar if you want a snack, can of Coke etc - again - put it on your room bill. 5) Our room - plenty of space, clean and well appointed. Our balcony overlooked the hotel's Luau stage so we had Hawaiian music floating through the window each evening as we changed which was very pleasant. 6) The breakfast - breakfast was included in our rate and we were glad it was - never before have I seen a buffet spread like it! You name it, it was there - eggs, bacon, sausages, cereals, fresh fruit, tea, coffee, rice, blueberry cake, banana cake, belgian waffles, pancakes, grilled fish, yoghurt, breads and bagels of every variety, and the list goes on. Truly every taste was catered for. You can eat in Umalu bar and Swan Court, I recommend Swan Court for breakfast particularly. In the evening Swan Court hosts Son'z restaurant which we went to once but to be honest were not overwhelmed by the food (good, but not great considering the prices) so reverted to Umalu in the evenings. Those are the stand out bits for us but there are so many more including the Hawaii weather and the hotel staff, needless to say both were outstanding. It's worth mentioning that the nearest town of Lahaina is too far to walk really. There is also a gym and spa on site which we never used so cannot comment on it. We would recommend Hyatt Regency Maui to coupes mostly, and we hope to return one day. Perfect for relaxation and sun - and they just make it so easy for you. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation at a fantastic resort!”
Reviews.Author: JBGuillet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in mid September and had an absolutely wonderful time. When checking in, the bellman talked to us about things to do around the resort and along Kanipali beach. He genuinely wanted us to have a nice stay. We walked all along Kanipali beach and were of the opinion we were staying at the best resort! Our room was very nice with a partial ocean view. It was kept clean all week and the various sundries supplied were of nice quality. The pool area was absolutely beautiful. Towels were provided and there were plenty of chairs available. We took advantage of the included buffet breakfast each morning which was very good. I highly recommend a package that includes the buffet, which would have been about $70 each day for the two of us if it was not included in the package. We also attended the on-site luau, Drums of the Pacific. It was very good and we both enjoyed it. The food at the resort is top rate and the staff was always helpful. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Capt_T0ny
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this wonderful hotel with my husband in a Regency Club deluxe O.F. room. The staff, including the vallet to Jeff and Jennifer at the front desk, to Steven who showed us to our room, made us feel special. The treatment continued with the spa, towel desk, servers and housekeepers. (thanks for the extra chocolates!) Outstanding customer service, drinks, and food. We had a couples massage and rented a private hale one day. I HIGHLY recommend this. Snacks were included @ the regency club from 6:30am-9pm everyday. The club staff, you guessed it, was outstanding! By far, the best grounds and vibe in Kaananpalli. Not many children present, we left ours at home. but the ones present were having a blast. Anywhere you stay you in Hawaii you will spend a lot on food and drinks, this is a great reason the go with a regency club room level. It's a nice place to relax and grab an included soft drink or snack. We never felt crowed never went thirsty,and we never had a problem finding a lounge chair at the pool. I cried the day we left...I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: opportunity1
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at this resort for one week with our 4 children ages 25 - 16. Everyone of us were happy here. We recommend staying on one of the floors where you are a member of the regency club. this will allow you to enjoy hors d'oeuvres every evening before you go to dinner. Or in our case, a few of the nights the hors d'oeuvres were dinner with just a snack later. Also, every morning we enjoyed the breakfast there, too. There may be other floors that participate in this - but i would check it out. Be sure to stay in the Atrium - Regency Club floors are in the Atrium - the entire experience feels like you are truly on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel if you like Mega-Resorts”
Reviews.Author: travelman1203
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Setember 30th- October 3rd. I found this to be a very nice hotel. Our room was quite spacious and very quiet. We overlooked the "Drums of the Pacific Luau" so I am guessing it may not be that quiet during that performance, but it is over by 9pm. LIke other reviews I have read I do agree the the rooms are a bit dated, but I still found it very comfortable. The pool was very crowded, but we were able to find chairs each day we were there. This is a Maga-Resort, so if you are looking for peace and seclusion at the pool, this is not the place for you. But if you like the fact that you can stop of at Macy's on the way to your room from the pool, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Rickyfromjerseycity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Maui for 9 days in April. We were so impressed by the experience, the room, the view , the restaurants, the service that we booked another 11 day stay in August. It was better that the first visit. There is something abvout the Hyatt thay just draws you back. We booked another 11 days in November as soon as we got home. We fly to Maui from Fort Myers Florida, a very long day of several flights. Well worth the time and effort. From Check in, house keeping, valet parking, restaurant, everything works as it should. This Hotel knows how to please guests and solve problems . Call the front desk and it's done!! But don't expect too many problems. This hotel has it all together. We will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OriginalBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt does not dissapoint. Beautiful place, excellent fitness center, etc... Only complaint is the dumpsters in the road trying to get to the parking lot by our building / Luau. They are unsightly and inconvenient ~ move them as the guests do NOT want to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but be careful about hidden fees and noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PetiteArtist83
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip through the AAA travel agent appointed for Hawaii trips (She's got a whole mess of complaints coming toward her but that's another story) However, I have to say the hotel was very nice when all was said and done, the grounds are beautiful, the pool is immaculate and the food at Umalu was delicious. Along with beautiful views all around, it was very lovely...now for my personal experience.... We went for our honeymoon and stayed at the Hyatt for 6 days. Having never been to Maui I was excited, though I do not like to submerge myself in the whole "tourist" attitude and attire. Kaanapali Beach is the ultimate tourist place and the Hyatt looked like most of the other hotels on the beach resort path. The birds in the lobby are beautiful. I thought they'd be noisy but they take them in at night so you don't have to worry about that. Our first night we got stuck in room 501, right next to the ice machine, with a very narrow door opening that was hard to squeeze us and our luggage through (we are not large people). The problem was that we could hear the ice machine right through the walls in our room. Constant noise like squeaky, running water pipes kept us up at odd intevals throughout the night. It got so bad we went to the lobby at 3:30am and pleaded that they let us change rooms. We were told by a very unhelpful desk worker that the hotel was completely full and the only room we could have was room 101....4 floors down next to that level's ice machine. I find it hard to believe that EVERY single room was filled, as it did not look that crowded the whole time we were there. We weren't looking for an upgrade, we just wanted a nights sleep after a very long flight. We were forced to go back to our room for the remainder of the night until 7am when another desk worker (Jennifer from Pennsylvania) was more helpful towards our problem and moved us to room 1629....a much quieter room with a better layout plan. The rooms in general seem very clean and comfortable. The cleaning crew does a great job and always leaves enough towels and other amenities. Our next surprise was when we were told to go to the Swan Court for our "free" breakfast that was included in our package. That was very nice, I enjoyed watching the little birds that flew in and out of the open air seating area. The service and food was good, but when we got a bill at the end we were shocked. It was over $60 for some fruit and a few strips of bacon and pancakes. We were told that all we had to do was sign it to verify that we got the breakfast. We both found this practice a bit peculiar though and had to question several staff members as well as the front desk management to make sure we wouldn't be recieving a charge at the end of our stay. We still felt obligated to tip our wait staff the usual 15% though, so inflating the charge to $60 made that higher too. Also...the snack bar in the rooms are on a weight sensor. I have never seen this either. My husband put our bag on top of the table next to it and one of the straps knocked off a Starburst package. We had to call the desk (again!) to make sure they knew we hadn't eaten it....no Starburst is worth $3 unless you're having a low blood sugar emergency. The parking in the hotel lot is so compact that you can barely maneuver in and out of the spaces even with small economy vehicles...and opening the car door is a difficult task as well. With most of the cars there probably being rental cars, I bet this is great for the rental companies to inspect to see how many door scratches and dings they can get you for when you return it. There's also limited spaces so if you do go out exploring anywhere on the island you have to come back at a reasonable hour otherwise you may not get a parking space. We had a late dinner one night and came back about 9pm and had to circle the lot for nearly 20 minutes until someone left. Upon checking out we were given a summary of charges and our "resort fee" was listed as $25/day. We were told by our not-so-competent travel agent that the fee was $15/day. Jennifer at the front desk again was very helpful and told us that was the old resort fee, but changed it for us without a fuss. Basically, I loved our trip, glad I got to see Maui, but I think I may try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Regency Maui is the ONLY choice on Ka'anapali Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: cwest2424
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW WOW!!! I can't say enough about the Hyatt Regency Maui. We just got back at midnight and what a week we had!! We are used to going on cruises so I was concerned about how I would like staying at a hotel all week, but WOW, was the Hyatt the place to be! From the minute we stepped onto the property, we were treated like royalty. I will mention Victoria at the front desk by name because she was AWESOME!!! She made us feel at home right away. She had all of our paperwork organized and made check-in very painless. We got a great room on the 6th floor, ocean view. We walked into the room and were amazed by how gorgeous it was and what a view!! Just great! Our package included breakfast and we chose the buffet at Umalu every day and were never disappointed. The pool was great and not overrun by kids or crazy adults. The lounge-chair-saving starts early in the morning, so get your towel and stake out your spot! Dinner is expensive, but what do you expect...it's Maui! However, the food is excellent, so if you decide to eat lunch or dinner at the hotel, it's well worth the price. The shopping gallery is fantastic. Lots of different kinds of stores and even a small Macy's! I told my boyfriend that we didn't even have to leave the resort all week if we didn't want to! They had it all! However, we wanted to go snorkeling and take a sunset dinner cruise, so alas, we left the property! I would recommend booking things on your own as their Concierge service is not that great. Aside from that, definitely go to Whaler's Village for shopping and dinner. You can walk to it from the hotel. We took advantage of a 2 for 1 at the Luau right at the hotel and it was just great! I was concerned because food at Luau's can be gross and the show can be bad, but not so here! The food was excellent, drinks were not watered down, and show was great. STAY HERE!! I'm very picky and I can honestly tell you that you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Genkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in a few hotels in the Kaanapali area over the last six years. Now, whenever we got to Maui (we'll be there in Decemeber 2010), we will stay at the Hyatt. The ground are beautiful, the pools are magnificent and service is spectacular. The rooms are the largest and nicest available for the price on Kaanaplai. Mountain view rooms are great. Very nice views. Ocean rooms are great too, but really...how long are you planning on staying in your room? Save some cash and get a mountain view. If you want to chill out on your lanai with some wine, still a great view to be had. Paying for breakfast is must here. If you can get a deal when you book your trip, do it that way. It will save you money in the long run. Did I say the breakfast is awesome? Well it is. It's a pretty unbelievable spread they have there. The workout facility and spa are great, plus this hotel is at the end of the beach. There's no local access points by it so you're very secluded from the other hotels. For instance, if you were to stay at the Westin, there's foot traffic coming from the left and the right. Black Rock is at the end of the beach which is about a 20 minute walk. Lahaina is about a 5-10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: LauraCain
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 1 week in Maui. The first 5 days were spent at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua and the last 3 at the Hyatt. I had not been to this hotel in 10 years and it is definitely tired. The lobby, while beautiful, is outdated. The rooms are in very bad condition. However, the worst part was the crowdedness. The pool is lovely but you can barely find a chair and when you do, you're practically on top of people! Plus, the price of our room, drinks, food, etc. were just as expensive as they were at the Ritz Carlton. If you have children, this is a great place to stay. Another plus was that part of our package allowed us to eat free breakfast every morning ($30 value pp). If you are a couple looking for quiet and romance, stay in Wailea or at the Ritz Carlton. I'm guessing the hotel will be in better shape after the renovation. Its a shame, because Kaanapali is a wonderful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach, great for families”
Reviews.Author: grlygirl02
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a nice large hotel right on the beach. The grounds are beautiful and it has a great pool area for both adults and kids. The children's section has a sandbox, spray park and waterslide...very entertaining and family friendly. The rooms were kept very clean and were fairly spacious. However, the balconies were so small. There was hardly room for two chairs. Overall it's a very nice hotel, but I'm not sure if its quite worth their regular price of over $300 a night. Go if you can get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing wrong with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Missouri_10
Reviews.Content: We checked in September 27th and out October 4th. First off the minute you pull up everyone there is very helpful. I will say they will nickel and dime you death if you let them. They place a $100 hold on your credit card each day, you can ask however to have this lowered to whatever you can afford. The resort does have $25 per day fee which does suck since it was $15. Every room has a snack tray that is weighted so if you eat anything or move it, it automatically charges your room. Make sure you get a print out of your statement we did have a lot of charges that were not correct. This is the only negative thing I can say about the Hyatt. However I would almost guarantee that all the other hotels are comparable to the fees here. The hotel is very cozy and beautiful, the grounds are gorgeous there are tons of shops inside, birds, flamingos, penguins, bars lots of private sitting areas around tiki torches and firepits. Breakfast is very expensive so I suggest tring to get this included other wise it will cost $60.31 however it is delicious. There are a ton birds that are flying in and out of the breakfast area but we never once had a bird land on our table, where you eat breakfast at half of the room is open to the outside, remember youre on an island. Anytime you eat outside anywhere you run the risk of a fly or bird landing on your table. We did the luau here which is called the Drums of the Pacific, and it was very good and there was tons of food and an open bar. The food tasted fine, we literally heard no one complain about it. I will say if you think you are going to get full on seafood here forget it. Hawaii apparently has a great deal of respect for there marine life so they only fish for specific fish each season so nothing gets over fished or endangered. Right now the only fresh fish the restaraunts serve is Mahi Mahi and Ahi. Drinks are very expensive at the Hyatt, like $12-$17 each they do have a happy hour and Martini specials though. We ended up going to the gas station and buying beer and vodka and hid it in our beach bag then added it to out orange juice. We did suspect that Maui would be expensive but we didnt realiaze how expensive, you can hardly do anything here for under $200 by the time tax is added in. If you plan on doing the Road to Hana you might wait if you plan to see waterfalls. Maui has not had much rain so majority of the waterfalls are dried up we did see a few but they were weak. If you do decide to do the Road to Hana we suggest taking a tour van, the road is extremely dangerous to drive youre up about 2500 feet and the road is very narrow with no gurad rails toward the end. So if you both want to enjoy it and take pictures you need to do the the tour other wise the driver will not see everything because you have to watch the road and drive very careful. We also did a dinner cruise with the Pacific Whale foundation and that was very nice. Definentley do Front st in Lahaina its a lot of fun, tons of shopping and cool places to eat right on the water. The beach at the hotel is practically washed away, we also went up a few hotels, however it was not much better, the tides come in very far everywhere. I really think with in a few years hardly any of the hotels will have much a beach, you could definently never lay a towel out on any of the beaches we saw. All in all our trip was great Maui is so beautiful, expensive but something everyone should experience. We do plan on returning and would gladly return to the hyatt. I would just remind your self if you plan on going here or any where in Maui that you have picked one of the most expensive islands to visit, so go with an open mind and dont be suprised by the costs of things here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: tilii80
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort with the best pool around! Great location right on the beach front. The staff was very helpful anytime we needed anything. We got a great rate that included breakfast and discount tickets to all the shows. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “No beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Sheilahoops
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when I arrived at this hotel to learn there was no beach! The hotel is positioned on the waterfront but there no beach to sit on as it is very eroded. The hotel cannot offer chairs and umbrellas for this setting and we had to go 4 hotels up to the Sheraton and use the public beach. After spending all this money for 6 nights we were extremely disappointed.The rest of the hotel was good except the birds flew in and out of the restaurants while you were eating and would actually land on your table, especially poolside for breakfast. One actually landed on my grandson's plate! I would not go back for these reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, beautiful lobby, beautiful stars, alarmed candy????”
Reviews.Author: MLPdiverRI
Reviews.Content: For the final leg of our 10th anniversary trip to Hawaii, my wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui. After a surprisingly long drive from the airport, we pulled up to valet parking and proceeded to check in. I had requested and received a "based on availability" discount upgrade. We were assigned an oceanfront room on one of the Regency Club floors. This required a room key in the elevator to access the floor as well as the club on the top floor. The pool area is absolutely beautiful and reminded me of a Las Vegas type "we have to outdo our neighbor's property" pool. It has two sections connected by a grotto which houses a bar complete with flat screen TV's. It was fun watching NFL football in the pool! As the pool is between the hotel buildings and the ocean, we had a nice view of the pool as well from our room. We had already been to Maui on our cruise that was part 2 of our trip. We had seen sunrise at Haleakala as a shore excursion, and the only other major touring we were looking to do was the road to Hana. The tour desk in the lobby arranged for us to go with Valley Isle Tours for that trip. I originally considered driving, but we were given a huge SUV by the rental car agency, and I would not have been comfortable driving on that narrow, sometimes treacherous road with its one lane bridges and over 600 curves with that behemoth of a vehicle. The tour desk also booked a "Tour of the Stars". On the roof of one of the hotel buildings at the Hyatt sit two telescopes. For $25, we were led up to the roof - an elevator ride followed by a set of stairs and a hike on a catwalk to the telescopes. Our guide, who seemed quite knowledgeable about astronomy, found some interesting star groups, Jupiter, and eventually the moon for us to view through the telescopes. At the end of the presentation, "Milky Way" and "Starburst" candies were available to the star gazers. Cute, and a nice touch. A recommended activity if you like that sort of thing. Our room included the daily buffet breakfast at the Swan Court restaurant. The restaurant was located on a lagoon with, what else, swans! In addition to the swans, the public areas of the Hyatt had other wildlife such as penguins and parrots. The selection was quite extensive (and expensive - $30 pp if we were paying). The food was good with lots of fresh fruit, (I'm really starting to miss that fresh pineapple every day :-0 ) and even mahi mahi. We had breakfast there each morning of our 4 night stay with the exception of the last, when we ate in the Regency Club. The RC had a much more limited (continental breakfast) selection, but we were able to get in and out quickly before leaving for our flight home. The staff throughout the property from the valets, to the front desk, to the bellmen, was friendly, polite and made a point to address me by name; not unlike those at the Outrigger Reef Waikiki which I recently reviewed. I can only come up with one complaint, but it's (to me, anyway) a major one. In each room there is a minibar and a snack tray. The snack tray is weight sensitive, and we were told that if you remove a Snickers bar for more than 10 seconds, you were automatically charged for it. I can't imagine how much money the hotel spent on these technological marvels that would rival security seen in movies such as "Mission Impossible" and "Return of the Pink Panther." With the Hyatt being a somewhat upscale property, I found it insulting that this device was in the room. Did they really think I was going to take a candy bar and not pay for it? I was afraid to go anywhere near the damn thing! In this high tech age, my wife and I had several devices that needed charging (phones, cameras, ipods, etc.). There was an available outlet behind the tray, but we were unable to use it for fear of disturbing the precious candy and triggering a charge that would need to be disputed. I would have preferred that the tray was not in the room at all, as we had no interest in any of the items it protected like Brinks. Aside from the armored snack tray, the room was quite nice, with a sofa, large flat screen TV with an excellent selection of channels, and a comfortable king size bed. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hyatt, and I would happily stay here again on a future (I hope) visit. Just be careful where you walk around the candy tray! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel! $25 Per Day Resort Fee , not so good!”
Reviews.Author: gec1003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hyatt. The room look old and outdated. Rooms should definitely be upgraded. The pool area and the grounds is the best part. The staff was nice and helpful. The mandatory daily $25 resort fee, is not so good. Only worth it if you use tennis courts, want a newspaper or need internet access. Overall, the stay was ok, not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Old”
Reviews.Author: travelmasterhi
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the Hyatt and we will never return. We checked out after 2 days and it was a complimentary stay. It was horrible even when it was free! The room smelled, it was dirty and old. We had stayed previously at the Hyatt on Kauai and it was fantastic. We have stayed at Motel 6â€™s that are cleaner. The Hyatt needs to completely RENOVATE the rooms including the bathrooms. Here is short list of some of our observations from our stay: Room smells of mildew and dirty socks Handles on sink faucet were loose and fell off in my hand Shower/tub extremely slippery. Thereâ€™s no traction and rubber mat disgusting. Water cut off at least 6 times during our showers There were stains on walls and ceiling of a body-fluid content nature. That really made us nauseous. Asbestos ceilings All moldings and woodwork severely damaged and worn. Furniture old and worn Sheets stained Carpets dirty Elevators had no air conditioning and smelled Save yourself grief and do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay a resort fee when you don't use what it covers????????”
Reviews.Author: maridat6
Reviews.Content: When we booked our stay here, the resort fee was $15, when we got there it had jumped to $25!!!!!! I dont understand why we have to pay it in the first place. When I go on holiday the last thing I think about is a gym or playing Tennis, I have no need to ring any one locally and I don't read the paper. So what I ask is Why did I have to pay it???? The resort was beautiful, the rooms could do with a revamp, especially new carpet which smelt old and stale. Will visit Maui again but will be looking at somewhere else to stay unless the Hyatt removes the resort fee and renovates the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING PLACE WITH BREATHTAKING VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: melinda6277
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this resort. We were there in June of 2009 for our fist ever family vacation in 10 yrs. The grounds are beautiful and breathtaking. The staff were all very helpful. The food is a little pricey but thats to be expected. The pool area is very relaxing. If we ever make it back, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “YES! Loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: Chase41
Reviews.Content: My husband gave it a B+....cuz nothing gets an A with him. But I'll just say that everything was so lovely, easy, pleasant, yummy, service oriented...just great. For personal attention..ask for Gael at the concierge desk...she was incredible! The spa was so relaxing...great staff and incredible body workers...they really know what their doing and it makes such a huge difference when you're on the table. the hotel restaurant Umalu was super yummy. The only ick was that they served Starbucks coffee...ick (but if that's the only drawback I guess all's well, huh?)

Reviews.Title: “Hard to go wrong in Maui...”
Reviews.Author: Mushy187
Reviews.Content: ...but the Hyatt Regency was a fantastic place to stay. We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean Front room (pictures attached showing the view) and we were extremely comfortable during our stay. Compared to some of the resorts closer to Black Rock, the beach outside this resort leaves something to be desired, but it's not a terribly long walk to nicer beaches and the pool at the Hyatt is a great place to spend the day. The service everywhere was great, the food we did eat on the resort was very good, and while I've seen some concerns about the price...it is Maui, and there is very little on this Island that is inexpensive. It seems well set up for travelers with any agenda. While I was surprised at how many families (with children) were staying at the resort, it was not as if the place was overrun with kids. The pools are set up with a waterpark/pool for kids on one side of the grotto and a much larger (deeper) pool on the other side of the grotto geared much more towards adults. The grotto bar itself was a great place to get out of the sun for a little while. The fitness center was more than adequate to fit my needs. We didn't make use of the spa, but I heard quite a few good things about it while we were there. We also went to a Luau at a different resort, but caught a portion of what appeared to be a pretty good show at the Hyatt as well. I would say the hotel grounds (complete with exotic birds) and the pool put the Hyatt in a class of it's own compared to most of the resorts we saw in Lahaina. Like I said in the Title, it's hard to go wrong in Maui (and if you're having a bad time there you are either dying or just stupid), but I would say the Hyatt is a great place to stay on one of the greatest Islands in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PANonna
Reviews.Content: Although it was a very short stay at this hotel (The Hyatt Regency Maui) we enjoyed our time spent there. The hotel grounds were lovely and offered many "quiet" places to meditate and just enjoy the calm beauty of the grounds. Our only disappointment was the food. The Swan Court was fine for breakfast but did not care for the cuisine at Son'z Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: passandshoot
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Hyatt, partial ocean view room. The ambiance of the hotel (the open atrium, the birds, the grounds, etc.) was great. Room was comfortable and very clean. Service was very good. My only complaint is the self-parking; not enough spaces and the spaces are too small. I was told at checkout when I complained about the parking situation that valet ($15 a night) would have parked me for free if the self-park was full...kind of a little late to find that out. But other than that, we enjoyed our time at this facility immensely.

Reviews.Title: “It was so great”
Reviews.Author: csoccerc
Reviews.Content: Went through Costco. Had a great ocean front room. Can't say enough about the place. I just would like to pay a little extra attention to the bar crew. Umalu bar is so great. Glen, Doreen, Richard, Coleen--- great. Spend some time at happy hour. 4 dollar sliders, chips, and onion rings-- what more can you want.....or by the way a 5 dollar Mai Tai. Loved the rrom. I disagree with some who do not like the decore. It was just great. Loved the sunset, loved the location. It was a great stay. =

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: spawar24
Reviews.Content: The ambiance was wonderful! The buffet at swan court was fabulous everyday! Loved the grounds...definitely get the ocean view room if you can...its worth it! Waking up to a spectacular view of the Ocean( and the pool) everyday made all the difference! Service was good as was its location. We also enjoyed the Luau ceremony at the hotel!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Perfect- Complete Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TomRach25
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in September in an Ocean View room on the first floor. As soon as we arrived we were treated like royalty.We were given champagne and Lei's and shown to our room. The room was massive with a beautiful view of the ocean and palm trees. We slept with the patio door open every night and you could hear the ocean in the background whilst sleeping in the comfy bed. The breakfast and Umalu restaurant were outstanding with plenty to choose from. The beach infront gets alot of critiscm however we found it to be perfect with soft white sand and very little waves so you could go out for a number of yards. It was a beautiful blue and at 6:30pm you could see the sunsetting over the island of Maui. Also whilst on the beach infront of the hotel we saw dolphins swimming close to the shore. The resort itself was beautifully landscaped with a fantastic service, everybody was so helpful and friendly. We experienced the oceanside dining which is available at the hotel and it is definately worth every dollar you spend. Excellent food, great views and one of the best desserts I have ever had. If staying here you must book this. Would go back to the hotel every year if I could. Simply outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon on Maui”
Reviews.Author: hfritzinger
Reviews.Content: We did the second leg of our honeymoon on Maui for a different pace than Oahu. Upon arrival, we were told there was no free self-parking and we had to park valet. The staff was trying to deal with a 500-person wedding and luau on Saturday night and was obviously frantic and harried. We were rushed through check-in and had to prompt the front desk to explain our honeymoon benefits as well as the free breakfast that came with our room. We were also told that all king size bed rooms were sold out (despite having reserved ours back in March). Our experience at the Hyatt did improve from here, however, with a nice room and gorgeous pool area. The beach in front of the hotel was deserted so we basically had a private beach which was great. This hotel was on the high-end scale but we felt nickeled and dimed for a lot of things. Despite paying a resort fee, free self-parking was very scare, free wireless internet was not included in our room and our complimentary champagne could only be used in one of their restaurants. We would consider staying here again, but it may not be at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right on. Paradise hotel with tons of birds.”
Reviews.Author: anonymousLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Having just been here for a week on the Cost-co special, I can say that most everything reported on this board is true. TripAdvisor vacationers are on the mark. I wonâ€™t repeat what has been said alreadyâ€¦will try to add new ideas/tips. The Hyatt resort is really kid friendly and great. Kids will not be disappointed. The water slides are fantastic and the hotel meals were delicious. My disappointment was with United (no food on the flight â€“ buy it extra) and no luggage included (buy extra). United was courteous to give us a voucher for $250 for our NEXT flight, but we wonâ€™t be going with them again. Cost-co offered a crazy special for this hotel, under $800 pp and mostly inclusive from LAX. It included a rental car, Hyatt 6 nights, and a ton of extras. Some we used more than others. We did not attend the hula or the cirque show 2 for 1, as previous attendees were disappointed. We did use the Ullu bottomless cups and most of the food we ate for lunch and dinner were charged to our room, and then removed with the $150 voucher at the end of the stay. That was quite a savings with kids eating free, so a lot of meals were included. You have to really watch the Hyatt and your charge card. Upon check out, we noticed several charged that were supposed to be â€œfreeâ€�. Breakfast was included in our package, but they charged us for the kids (kids that eat â€œfreeâ€�) each morning. Thanks to TripAdvisor, I was tipped off beforehand, and asked for a hotel statement the day before we checked out, so I could review the charges, and battle day before leaving. Hyatt Parking: with the huge group from the Cost-co special, there was little free parking, and no parking one night we returned back to the hotel late. When we asked at Valet, the nice guy said â€œjust this once Iâ€™ll let you slide â€“ just one nightâ€� and so we did Valet that night with him. Surprise: That night valet charge ended up on the Hyatt statement tooâ€¦it was taken off after we asked him about it again. At check out, we only used $120 of the $150 free credit, so we ended up w/ a $30 left over, so we went to Macyâ€™s and tried to use it on some clothesâ€¦but no, it wouldnâ€™t work there. Macyâ€™s doesnâ€™t count toward the credit, so I went to the â€œweekendâ€� store and got a summer blue Hyatt bag $29. We liked parasailing with UFO parasail boat. They were very good. At 8 am, while walking to rent the snorkel equipment, we came across the beginning of the roasting of the pig for the Hyatt Luau that night. We found it quite interesting. First they heat the rocks, then put the pig on, then cover him w/ leaves, a wet white cloth, and then the dirt. Not something you see every day. We enjoyed lunch at the barefoot bar on the beach (toes in the sand) just north of the Hyatt and enjoyed the Maui Ocean Center aquarium near the airport. No big whales or dolphins, but it was one of the best weâ€™ve seen. A diver goes in the tank 3 times a day to swim w/ the hammerhead sharks in a huge tank. Very entertaining. They also have an underwater walk-though tunnel to see the bat-rays, etc. Another tipâ€¦instead of paying the $50-$100 for the Hawaiian shirts to bring home, we stopped at Ross on the way to the airport. It was easy to find, and they had flowered Hawaiian shirts (made in Hawaii!) for $14.99. Now thatâ€™s a tip!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, staff, food and beautiful public spaces.”
Reviews.Author: kdandmax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for five nights and were very pleased. The staff, service and food quality were excellent. The public spaces are beautiful and well maintained and the rooms very clean. There isn't much beach here and in some spots erosion is occuring. You will need to suntan in the pool area which does get crowded, but we never had a problem finding a spot. We would suggest getting a room rate with the breakfast package as otherwise breakfast will run you about $30 per person and there really aren't many options within walking or driving distance. We rated this hotel low on the rooms as ours was ocean front and the furniture was showing it's wear and the bathroom was very small and dimly lit.. We somewhat anticipated this as it is an old property. However, during our stay they turned the water off for a few hours one day on our floor in order to begin renovation work on the floor above. So if we go back in fvie years it may look different! There is a very nice promenade at the Hyatt that takes you all the way down past other properties and finally to Whaler's Village where there are many shops, restaurants and a food court. The promenade is right along the beach and is nice to walk at night with all the lights and tikis from the many properties and restaurants. Lahaina is a 20 minute drive away, but be prepared for traffic as the road is under construction.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay for a honeymoon! Do not miss this resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Maui Date of Stay: 8/3-8/5/10, 2 Nights In a nut-shell, a nice Ocean Front Hyatt with excellent amenities and dining. If you are staying on the West End of Maui, this would be a perfect place to stay. Now, for my detailed review: I was eagerly awaiting my stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui, as I had used a Diamond Suite Upgrade Certificate to Upgrade my wife and I to an "Ocean Suite" for our Honeymoon. Upon reaching our "Ocean Suite" on the 4th Floor, I was disappointed. I would not suggest anyone use their Diamond Suite Upgrade Certificates at this resort, as the "Ocean Suite" is far from an "ocean" suite. The room is one large room, a sitting area with television, couch and small desk; then, there is a sliding-door partition that opens into the decent sized bedroom portion. The living area is far from "ocean" front, as the window looks out onto the top of a roof, the luau grounds, hotel parking lot and Highway 30. The only portion of the room that could even conceivably be considered an "ocean" view was the bedroom area, which had a standard balcony overlooking the ocean; however, being on the 4th Floor, the palm trees greatly obstructed this ocean view. Definitely not a good use for a Diamond Suite Upgrade; I would instead suggest that one simply book an ocean front room in the main building, as those are the perfect rooms. Despite that small hiccup in room assignments -- which, I may add, Hyatt Management was extremely wonderful at addressing -- we had an overall good experience at this resort, and the rest of the stay was perfect. I chose the Food and Beverage Diamond Amenity in lieu of points, and selected a nice Canvas Cabernet along with the Fruit and Cheese tray. The Diamond Amenity arrived promptly, and was a very nice presentation. Additionally, the General Manager provided us with a wonderful bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in recognition of our honeymoon. One great this about this hotel is that it allows one many on-site activities and shows. We chose to attend a new show, called "Cirque:Polynesia" that is held on-site, near the tennis courts, as well as the "Drums of the Pacific Luau." Both shows were absolutely amazing! I would highly recommend both shows -- and definitely suggest paying just a little extra for the "VIP Seating" option. "VIP Seating" was only slightly more for each show, and it gave us seating in the first few rows for Cirque, and it allowed us priority entrance to the luau -- with front-row center seating, and first access to the food. Anyone who has been to a luau knows how congested it can be to get in -- everyone lines up and waits for the show at least an hour before, but with "VIP Seating" you don't have to, and you get first crack at the food. It is highly worth your while! Additionally, this Hyatt has a wonderful pool, complete with numerous waterfalls, grottos, a waterslide, and hot tubs. However, the pool chairs do fill up quickly, so if you want to spend a full day at the pool, I would suggest getting there early -- or, do what we did and rent a "Hale" or large tented cabana. For only $150/day, they have two large wooden cabana areas and two large tended cabana areas. The wooden ones were sold out, so we opted for the last remaining tented "Hale." It may seem expensive to some, but it was absolutely worth the money! It is set up in advance with plush towels and an ice chest. The ice chest is full of water and also contains a wonderful fruit tray. The "Hale" sits just above the beach, allowing for easy beach access. It is equipped with two very comfortable and plush wooden reclining chairs, and a small table for food. I was able to stay in and remain cool and shaded, while we pulled a small pool lounger over into the sun for my wife to use. It made for a perfect day, and I would highly recommend it -- but, if you are considering this option, I suggest calling the Concierge to book this before you arrive, as they only have four of these wonderful full cabana areas (whereas they have plenty of the two-seater "half cabanas" that are prevalent throughout the islands) and they book up fast. The Regency Club was very well decorated, and, despite being crowded, we were always able to find a place to sit. Breakfast was the usual continental style, with a different warm entree each morning. The all day cookies and snack were the usual, as were the evening cordials and desserts. Dinner was a well apportioned mix of the usual, with a different hot entree each evening. The Regency Club is located on the top floor of the Main Building, and it offers amazing views of Kaanapali and the surrounding landscape. All in all, despite the initial hiccup regarding my Diamond Suite Upgrade, this was a wonderful place to stay, and I would suggest it for anyone wanting luxury accommodations combined with an incredible pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet on main Kanapali strip”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel92679
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights before checking into a nearby condo. I stay at Hyatt regularly for business and this hotel fully meets Hyatt standards. No, it's not the Ritz, and anyone thinking it is will be disappointed. But, compared to other Kanapali properties like Westin and Marriott "next door," the grounds are much, much better (pools, walking areas, restaurants, public areas). The rooms were fine, about what one should expect for a Hyatt. I gave 5 stars, not because this is a 5 star property like the Ritz or Four Seasons, but because it fully earns the 5 stars for the category it is in which is a very nice hotel class for Hyatt, Sheraton, Marriott, Westin. The Regency Club access (available by paying more, or upgrade, etc) was excellent. A lovely breakfast and evening buffet, complete with complimentary bar drinks helped us save on pricy restaurant bills! Get the Rgency Club level if you can! (Usually offered as a free upgrade to Hyatt Platinum/Diamond levels - or a slight up-charge at time of reservation). Little kids will LOVE the kids pool area, especially the "kiddie" slide. Older kids will enjoy the "adult" slide if they're 48" which is strictly enforced. I think a week here might get boring, but good for several nights before heading to another island, maybe? The one thing I will say about the kiddie pool is that they had a couple turtles and a dolphin play animals that are permanent fixtures for climbing on in the water. They are foam, and I know this because there was some delayed maintenance where the foam was starting to come through the outer layer. Not necessarily a hazard, but a little unkept and annoying - the hotel should repair these so the area is "perfect," versus showing early signs of wear & tear. As for the beach, it is narrow, but quite nice in front of the hotel. The "boardwalk" oceanside is a BEAUTIFUL "must-do" walk that starts at the Hyatt and continues about 3 miles north (but you need to cut through the Westin about 1/2 way to continue towards North Kanapali). Perfect oceanfront path for joggers, strollers, and anyone desiring an amazing oceanfront stroll! The Umualu restaurant was convenient for B,L or D - no, not cheap, but "reasonable" for hotel standards in the area. Loved the sandy seating area at sunset with live music. Our only complaint with this hotel, which in reality was not really the hotel's fault, is that there seemed to be a lot of people there on a Costco "package" trip. You could spot these people because as part of their package, they were given large blue refillable drink bottles for sodas. At times, the pool seemed crowded with a lot of people with the "blue bottles" and at other times, we saw some people that didn't look like they really belonged (appearance & behavior wise) at a 4-star property - go figure, they were carrying their blue bottles around. When we've stayed at this hotel in the past, I remember the crowd as a little more "refined," but it was still a great visit nonetheless. In any event, a great hotel for Kanapali and better than the neighbors (Westin, Marriott, timeshares, etc). Trust me, the people from the other hotels were crashing the Hyatt and it was not the other way around! Also, this hotel, like most, is probably best for several nights, then it's time to move on to Wailea area, or another island. I think more than 4 nights in same spot would be boring when there are so many other terrific areas of Maui and Hawaii to see! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy is the best word to describe this...”
Reviews.Author: Glamint
Reviews.Content: Moldy is the best word to describe this place! Despite being in a no smoking room there are people smoking cigars and cigarettes all around us! The room is old and dirty and smells like mold! And it is over 300 a night for this! I have never written a review before but this place takes the cake. I'll be attempting to book the Marriot or Sheraton tomorrow. And checkin takes FOREVER! Parking is a hassle! I loved the Hyatt in Waikiki but this is really no comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Great Costco Deal”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hyatt booked thru Costco. It included free internet, no resort fee, partial ocean view, intermediate size car, bottomless drink cup and free breakfast buffet. Having stayed there before we knew what to expect. The property is huge, has a lovely pool, but not the best beach. The poolside chair savers were out in force. We were always able to find parking and most kids were back in school. We had a small room with sporadic maid service. We went to nearby beaches, particularly recommend Airport Beach near the Westin Villas. We saw huge turtles at Black Rock close to the shore. We snorkeled at Honolua Bay. We took a sunset sail on the Teralani. We had wonderful weather and hated to leave. Would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Like a postcard”
Reviews.Author: pdxfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui for a week with our children ages 8 and 10. We were very pleased with the property in general. As other reviewers have stated, the grounds and pool were spectacular! The pool is a virtual Hawaiian paradise with waterfalls, caves and grottos and flowers floating around. There is a tube water slide which was a lot of fun also. Keep in mind that the water is deep (9 feet in places) and there are a lot of hidden grottos. Children who are not strong swimmers should be watched carefully, there is no life guard. There is a shallow, sandy area for the little ones, however, that is roped off from the main pool. The hotel uses a towel card system which is very cumbersome; I'm not sure of its purpose. I think a hotel of this caliber should assume you're not going to steal the towels. They use a wrist band to identify hotel guests that are currently using the pool- isn't that enough to fend off outsiders? The staff at the hotel were very friendly and approachable, We felt very much at home, even with our active boys! Breakfast at Swan court or Umalu was great. If you arrive later that 7:30am at Swan Court, you will have to wait for a table. There was never a wait at Umalu. We had an ocean view room on the ground floor. It was fine, though it needed a upgrade. Wallpaper peeling, bathroom fixtures corroded, etc. The walk-in closet was a nice touch. It was very quiet, however, and we slept well. All in all a great trip and we would recommend, particularly for families.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious !!!!”
Reviews.Author: tccan
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Maui this is an absolute MUST. This resort is by far the best place we have ever stayed. From the moment we checked in, we were treated like royalty. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. We were given an early check in & also allowed a late check out. We had a deluxe ocean view room that was heavenly. The king sized bed was the best bed I've ever slept on. The pillows were great & I want to find a couple for our home. Everything was top-notch. This resort is just wonderful. The rooms are extremely clean. Supplies are replenished without having to ask. The room was large & super nice. Once you check in you really don't ever need to leave (not that you would want to) everything you would ever need is here. The breakfast @ the Swan rest. is unbelievable- fresh fruits, anything you could imagine. Umalu -the open air restaurant provided live entertainment nightly. There were penguins, white/black swans, flamingos, etc right on the grounds. The pool is extensive & better than what you would expect. There are tons of shops - even Macy's & also Expedia is onsite to help you plan your activities. If I ever make it back to Maui, this resort without question will be the one we choose :-)

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE HAWAII YOU'VE ALWAYS DREAMED OF...”
Reviews.Author: northshoreboy
Reviews.Content: I came to this resort for my honeymoon and was impressed from the front door onward... Valet staff, check in, housekeeping, room service, pool, food and beverage, amenities, cleanliness, fitness center, and view are OUTSTANDING. I've promised my wife that this would be our vacation place from now on, and we've already booked next year's reservation. THIS HOTEL HAS EVERYTHING YOU WANT FOR THE PERFECT VACATION, and it was hard to leave for the Mainland after staying here.SIMPLY DA BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in bed, water stained walls, dirty balcony and management did NOTHING”
Reviews.Author: jlw110
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the Hyatt came up extremely short with their property in Maui. My husband and I were excited to be in Hawaii for our honeymoon and really looking forward to our stay at the Hyatt, which is generally a name you can trust. After a rather confusing check in (we were told our reservation was cancelled when it had been confirmed 2 days earlier) we were on our way to our room. The lobby was a little dated and felt more old Hawaiian but we were just excited to see the ocean, pool and check out the restaurants the hyatt website raved about. Upon entering the room, it seemed nice. We had an ocean deluxe room. As we got into the room and looking around, suddenly the age of this hotel came through. Not only were the bathrooms mildew ridden, but the walls were covered with water stains and peeling wallpaper. The deck looked as if though it had never been cleaned...the deck floor felt like sticky movie theater floors. To our horror we then saw a bug on the bed pillow...which as you can imagine lead to more bugs in the bed as we took the linens down. The headboard was full of dust. It was just gross! We called the front desk and were only offered a comparable room, but that housekeeping would come up right away to check out our room....housekeeping never came, management never showed a sign they cared about our sad experience even after showing them the bugs. We had a really nice hotel check in woman apologize but she was the only one. We never stayed at the hotel bc of the horrible service and lack of care. We told the hotel we were going to another hotel. They called us a cab and left us with the 30 dollar cab bill. Way to stick it to us hyatt! We ended up staying at the Ritz in kapalua and quickly realized THAT is what a honeymoon should be and surprisingly the cost wasn't that much more. I have always loved every hyatt I stay in with this location obviously being the exception. Don't waste your time and money here until they give the hotel a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Great Costco Deal”
Reviews.Author: EightTrack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Maui because of the great Costco deal. We stayed there in late August of 2010. I rated this hotel as "Very Good" instead of "Excellent" because of the following. 1) Every night, the Hyatt has a luau and every night, self-parking is very limited starting about 430pm. Also, the parking stalls are just wide enough for a mid-size car to park...that's if the other cars are parked within their lines. Even then, only the most skinniest people can get in and out of their cars! 2) As I read the other peoples' reviews, they mentioned to request to be put in a room on the opposite side of the luau because of the luau noise. We were able to get a room away from the luau and were greatly relieved that we only heard the luau drums in the distance. 3) The Umalu restaurant was pricey, and the service was just so-so. The beef filet was very tasty and was a normal portion size. 4) The pool towel system is okay, Yes, you have to trade in a card for your towel, but Hyatt has to keep track of their towels somehow or else people would just not return them. 5) The beach just off the hotel is very rocky. 6) We had friends stay at the Westin Timeshare just north of us. Hyatt should do what that Westin did was have small wetted hand towels in the lobby so that you can cool down your face. I give big kudos for the Westin for this idea! 7) A good idea when booking your hotel stay is to say that it is your anniversary or something special. You may get a free bottle of champagne like we did...(well, it was our anniversary.) 8) The Breakfast Buffet included in the Costco deal is great. You just have to get to the buffet before 730am or else you will be waiting in line for a while. 9) We did not encounter birds swooping down like Afflred Hitchcock's The Birds on unattended tables like other reviewers put down. It is exaggerated. Yes, there were some birds, but the wait staff clean up the unattended tables fairly quickly to mediate the situation. Twice, I also saw an employee put bread crumbs out for the birds on the lawn across from the water pond so that the birds would not bother the guests eating. This was a good idea. 10) So, all in all, the Hyatt is improving. The partial ocean view room that we had appeared like it was refurbished recently, so I guess we lucked out. On the other hand, our other friends staying in an ocean front room in the other building said that their room looked dated. 11) The weight -sensitive snack tray in the room was apparent but was not a problem if you don't touch it. I was told that you have 6 seconds to put back the snack in the exact spot or else you get charged for it. Well, we never touched it, so it wasn't an issue. 12) Internet access was slow. Yes, I would recommend this hotel but it is not Shangri La. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: LimerickHollypop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt for 5 nights of our honeymoon. From the very start, we were made feel very welcome. We arrived at the hotel at about 11.30pm, and the girls at the reception desk (think they were both called Melissa) gave us a bottle of water each, and also gave us a photo album for our honeymoon pictures. They invited us to a honeymooner's evening for the following night, where one of their chef's teach you how to cook a special meal, while you sip on champagne and mingle with othe honeymoon couples. It was a nice touch, which we enjoyed. When we got to out room, there was information left on our bed about all the hotel services, and the activities that take place in the hotel itself. If you were to stay in the hotel for a week, you would still not be stuck for something to do. The room was beautiful, nice and big, nicely air-conditioned, and had a Hawaiin feel to it, which I loved. Breakfast was included in our package, and we could eat at either of their restaurants, but we ate at Umalu every day. It was a buffet style breakfast, and there was plenty of choice. All the food was fresh, and they had the nicest pineapples I have ever tasted. You can see the pool and the ocean while eating, and it's very relaxing. While staying in the Hyatt we did many activities. They have an inhouse concierge, run by Expedia advisors, who help to arrange all sorts of activities during your stay. We did parasailing and jet-skiing, which are both located on the beach, and also did a helicopter ride (about a 35-40minute drive from the hotel) which was breath-taking. I would definitely recommend Blue Hawaiin Helicopters for their tours. We did a one and a half hour tour of the whole island of Maui, and we landed on the top of a mountain half way through to enjoy some pineapple champagne (yum!) while enjoying the scenery. Our pilot was extremely nice and gave us a great tour of the island. We did the Drums of the Pacific Luau, which is based in the hotel, and had a fantastic time. The food and drink was included, and it was delicious! I even took part in a hula dancing lesson! :) We also drove the Road to Hana on one of the days, and the views were just amazing! I've never seen scenery like it. The hotel itself is so beautiful, at night it is lit-up and looks stunning. It is full of wildlife, such as penguins, swans, flamingos, koi fish, etc. It was like paradise, and is probably the nicest place I have ever stayed. We will definitely return to Maui in the future, and will return to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BrightCaravanPark
Reviews.Content: On first impressions an impressive hotel with fabulous lobby , landscaped pool, oceanfront pool bar and great restaurant but having come direct from the fabulous Halekulani at Waikiki we found the Hyatt rooms to be tired and the overall service ordinary. Constantly waiting in lines for reception, breakfast, pool chairs etc. Too many people for the facilities. The Sheraton nearby at Kanapaali looked a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammybeaverton
Reviews.Content: I've wanted to stay at this hotel for years. It turned out to be even more impressive then I had imagined. The beauty of the waterfalls, flowers and exotic animals throughout the property were enchanting. The employees were all so nice and the concierge desk very helpful and informative. I've been in the travel industry for over 30 years so I know the specifics to check out when on a trip and this hotel passed all the tests! I had heard complaints about the lack of beach in front of the hotel, but a very easy walk to either side of the hotel takes you to plenty of sandy shore. It was never an issue. And a "must see" at the hotel is the "Tour Of The Stars" astronomy show! The 14" reflector telescope called "the edge" allows you to view some incredible sites! My group got to see such incredible wonders as Jupiter and all her moons! Had we gone to the show just an hour earlier we could have seen Saturn and her rings! We learned a lot that night about the stars, planets and our moon which was full that night and quite the view through "the edge" telescope! The hotel is also very well equipped to entertain kids of all ages, especially the very young. Friday night we saw a Disney movie being projected on a big screen with fresh hot buttered popcorn and plenty of room for the kids and family to sit and watch. We saw different games being played around the pool areas for the kids and there was a basketball hoop on one side of the pool that saw plenty of playtime. Like I said there was never anytime to feel bored at this hotel! I would definitely chose this hotel again on a future trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel, excellent location, gorgeous views!”
Reviews.Author: likesthebeach8
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of our two week, three island honeymoon vacation. We were greeted by friendly staff that provided us with a cute Hawaii photo album and coupon (with purchase of a meal at the hotel) for a free bottle of champagne in honor of honeymoon. The room was spacious enough. It was an ocean front king room. We didnâ€™t get to see the view until the next morning and we were ecstatic to see nothing but the bright blue Pacific Ocean, palm trees and the island of Molokai. It was breath taking, like a page of calendar. The bed was big and comfortable, but the bathroom was a little bit on the small side. Our room came with a small balcony, but it was sufficient for our needs. There were better places to enjoy the view throughout this gorgeous property.
