Reviews.Author: redshappire
Reviews.Content: its not that expensive, the food is also nice and affordable. room was facing the backyard, but that was fine. breakfast not so much variety. you can take cab to the lahaina shopping area. its not really far.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated for a resort”
Reviews.Author: firehand1
Reviews.Content: I guess I could sum up the stay by the first 30 minutes. They did not have the king sized "bed" that we reserved, so they put us in two queen sized "beds". One of the worst mattresses that I have ever slept on. We went down to the Umalu for a welcome to Hawaii drink and it cost us $27 for a Mai Tai and Strawberry Daquiri. The pool was busy if you wanted a place to lay out and not if you wanted to go swimming. The hot tub when we went to only one time had small children in it and 4 young guys sucking up drinks. On Friday night they had entertainment at the Umalu and then on Saturaday night they had a private party with a DJ that played loudly until 10 PM. Not good. Like in other reviews the breakfast buffet was included but a 15% tip is $18 and we chose to go to Safeway and buy some breakfast items and eat on a nearby beach. The staff was friendly and courteous. I compliment them. This is a great place to stay if you want to do things everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJReeves
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in May at Hyatt Regency Maui. We were so pleased with the hotel grounds, room and food. Only 5 minutes from the town of Lahaina, the hotel is the first along Kanapali beach. We stayed as part of a package deal (three nights for the price of two, with buffet breakfast), and it was a great value. This was seriously the most outstanding buffet breakfast we've ever had. Valued at $30 per person, we only paid a small tip each day and were filled for hours from our delicious meal (omelets, pancakes, fresh fruit and cakes, even miso soup)! The pools were beautiful and refreshing; there wasn't much of a beach right there but we didn't really miss it. The concierge was helpful in booking a snorkeling tour, and at check-in we were even offered a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary! The staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room (partial ocean view) was clean and of optimal size. The resort (there's a $15 a day fee) is very large with a ton of rooms; this is a chain that services many guests. If you want something intimate, this is not your place. If you can get a deal/reasonable rate, this is a lovely spot to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, and still the best on maui!”
Reviews.Author: Cupcake_Lola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of May 2010 and also previously stayed here in September of 2009 for our honeymoon. Both times we had nothing less then an amazing experience with everyone on staff, great comfortable rooms (i want one of the beds!) and each time partial ocean view when we only paid for a terrace room and super quiet. All of the restaurants are excellent but of coarse of the pricier side- Umalu is good for lunch or casual dinner and food and drinks by the pool and sonz has the best breakfast buffet ever- and also nicer upscale for dinner with the best waiters I have ever had every-time we eat there. If you go you have to pre-pay/make sure you have the breakfast buffet included with your stay. We will definitely be returning to this hotel next year, and every year after that for vacation. It doesn't have the best beach in front for swimming but you can walk 5 minutes down the sidewalk to get the to good beach swimming part, and also a nearby resort has good snorkeling spots. But trust me if your staying here, you will not want to go in the ocean but you will want to go for the pool. it is giant, has a water-slide, and waterfalls, and also a swim up bar. It can fill up at the pool pretty fast- but its usually just people laying out tanning and not actually swimming so the actual pool does not get too crowded. Also there is several exotic birds, cranes, flamingos, swans, and 9 penguins (yes! penguins) located in the lobby and in the gardens. They are all beautiful well taken care of animals too, the penguins are our favorite and you can watch them be fed every morning at 930! Also- if the self-parking lot is full which it tends to get at night time they will valet you for free.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 9 hour flight!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs21
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently stayed here for our anniversary. After researching and looking at pictures on Tripadvisor for WEEKS, I finally decided on the Hyatt. I am so glad I did! The pictures simply don't do it justice. The hotel grounds are absolutely beautiful and the view from our room was breathtaking. Spend the extra money for an Oceanfront Room. We slept with our balcony door open every night and fell asleep listening to the crashing waves. Rooms: Our room was better than expected. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was a flat screen TV, which my husband appreciated. The closet/bathroom area was well appointed and there was great water pressure in the shower. There is also and in room safe and refrigerator. Grounds: As I stated, beautiful. Please take a look at my pictures. I tried to capture a little of everything. Pool: Great pool area! Although there were many people there, we never really had a problem finding a good spot. People come down early and claim the Umbrella chairs by placing their towels down. This is supposedly against the rules, but no one enforced it. It wasn't a big deal though. With a sharp eye, you can find a spot. The hotel also offers beachfront cabanas. $25 for a 1/2 day, $50 for the whole day. They come with complimentary ice water (you'll appreciate it) and pineapples. There was also someone walking around passing out freeze pops (for free). Beach: DON'T BE ALARMED! The beach directly in front of the Hyatt sucks! Lots of rocks and coral. I was initially disappointed. However, a quick 3 -5 minute walk along the boardwalk took us to a much better portion of beach! You can also rent cabanas, chairs and umbrellas. Look for the building that says "Water Activities." Everything is 1/2 price after Noon, so we were able to get a cabana for $25 for the whole day! Umbrellas are $8 and chairs are $5! GREAT DEAL Location: Great location. Whalers Village is a quick 10 minute walk along the beach. So is the Westin, the Marriott and a few other hotels. If you're tired or hot, there is a free trolley that will drop you off and pick you up. Breakfast: GET YOUR BREAKFAST INCLUDED! That is, if you like to eat. The breakfast buffet was AWESOME, but for $30/person, I'm glad it was included in our package. Breakfast is served from 6:30-11. Depending on what time you get down there, there may be a line, but we were always seated quickly and never stood in line long. The delay was caused by the hostess checking names on her list to determine who was eating free. Umalu Bar/ Restaurant - GREAT FOOD!!! Everything we had was good. Seriously. You can't go wrong here. Room Service: We ordered a pizza one night and it wasn't bad. I also had cookies and milk and they were pretty good too. Our food was to our room within 20 minutes each time. Staff: Everyone was nice! They even remembered our names! The only negative: The Hyatt is DEAD at night. They have live entertainment at Umalu for a while, but other than that, there is NOTHING going on. If you are looking for the nightlife, this is NOT the hotel for you. If you want to relax and enjoy your companion, it's a great place. We fell asleep in a hammock one night. Very romantic. Drums of the Pacific Luau: Honestly, we didn't go. You can stand on the sidewalk and watch it for free. After viewing a few minutes of it, we decided to pass. I wasn't impressed. For $95/person, I can find something else to do with my money. We don't do buffets, so it wasn't worth it. Gym/Spa: The gym and spa are amazing! I wasn't expecting them to be so nice. You can look out at the ocean while on the treadmill. There's also a steamroom that my hubby enjoyed. He had to pay $15 to use it though. All in all....great hotel. I plan to return to Maui in the future and I absolutely will be at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't second guess your decision!”
Reviews.Author: travelinvarwigs
Reviews.Content: At first, we did! It was our first trip to Hawaii, and decided to only go to Maui for our entire 6 day honeymoon stay. We chose the HRM because of its good reviews on TA. I've finally gotten around to posting my review of it!!! Play by play: Room: We had an oceanfront room which was very roomy until you hit the bathroom. Unbelievable small, basically water closet. For a hotel that exudes romance, I was surprised that the shower was really only meant for one. Loved the balcony, though. Spent some time there just listening to the sounds of the resort and the ocean. Location: Right at the end of the Ka'anapali beach hotel strip. Very close to other hotels, so you won't feel too secluded here. Definifely rent a car (if anything, a convertible). The airport is about an hour drive away and a lot of the great attractions/sites on the island are a good drive from the hotel. A car was a must. Food: We got the breakfast included deal at Son'z though travelocity and BOY was it worth it. My word, just amazing spread of food... the best we'd seen, that's for sure. I couldn't justify paying $60 (or whatever crazy fee their charging now) for it though. The sushi at Cascades was AMAZING... at least in December, when we were there. The Kobe slider at Umalu....... to die for. My word, I don't know what the put in it, but if you're a burger fan, you have to try it! Pool: Wonderful! Pretty darn cool waterfalls, and surprisingly, an amazing little slide! Beach: Ugh, walk a little further up the pathway (about 15-20 min) and hang out on Ka'anapali Beach instead. It is just too small for our taste. Activities: The spa was wonderful, but I can't say much else, since it was our first time at one. We got a couple massage and facial (for me), pedicure (for him!). The jet skis are fun, but waaaaaaay too expensive on the resort. Since the hubby had never jet skiied before we decided to splurge for him. Whaler's Village is just walking distance away... good shopping and dining there. Stop by Leilani's for happy hour drinks and Hula Pie! Also, snorkling within walking distance = Black Rock. It's ok... there are fish, and occasionally turtles. But more exciting, the cliff jumpers! You can join them too! We didnt do the luau at the resort... opted for the Old Lahaina Luau, since it is so popular, and it was our first time. Overall, great honeymoon getaway for a very reasonable price. Unless youre rolling in the dough and can afford the four seasons or grand waliea, this should be your number one choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too big”
Reviews.Author: Lilwojo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights during our honeymoon. And even though the resort is beautiful, it was not exactly what we were looking for. Previous to our stay we had been staying in Kauai's North Shore and was overwhelmed with the peaceful beauty of the land. We arrived on a Saturday at the Hyatt and was taken back by how massive the resort was and how many people were at the pool. If we went back to Maui again, we would stay at a less crowded resort. When trying to select a resort for our Maui stay we went back and forth between the Ritz, Four Seasons and Hyatt. Thinking back, I wish we had picked the Ritz or Four Seasons for our honeymoon. Hope this helps future honeymooners!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Hotel & Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nokiddingColorado
Reviews.Content: It is a shame this hotel is getting some poor reviews- we had a wonderful stay and would return in a heartbeat. The staff was terrific from the moment we stepped on the grounds. Brian, our bellman, gave us tons of useful information on the way to the room. We had a top floor ocean view room with was a bit dated but that was due mainly to the infrastructure of the hotel being built in the 70's. You don't get the big bathroom with 2 sinks & a separate shower. The room was clean and comfortable, had a flat screen TV, comfortable bed, mini fridge & balcony. The Regency Club was great and we got some good tips from Karen. Breakfast was included in our rate & was delicious. Loved the pool, didn't find the wristband-towel thing a big deal-it did appear that possibly some people were hogging the chairs by getting their spot early and then when it was too hot, they disappeared for hours & didn't take their towel off the chair so someone else could use it. I saw the pool staff working to eliminate this issue. We were always able to find a seat. The location is devine- you don't find long stretches of beach like that to walk anywhere else on the island. It is fun to have the other hotels nearby & be able to walk to Whaler's Village for shopping. Also, the Macy's in the hotel is focused entirely on swimsuits/resort clothes. The fitness center has a fantastic ocean front view & we went every morning & never had trouble getting a machine. Fresh cookies, ice water & punch in the lobby all day is a nice touch. Enjoyed the Astronomy Star Show on the roof top one evening. The grounds are beautiful and all in all it is a perfect spot for a fun vacation.

Reviews.Title: “if you are wondering, yes you should”
Reviews.Author: Niffykat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and easy to get around. Macy's was disappointing. The food was great and I am a picky eater. Never went to the beach, pool was nice, water was cold. Drink service was slow.... and at $12 each you would think they would come around more requently. the nightly luau / entertainment was ANNOYING, if you make a reservation, ask to stay away from that side of the hotel... do the helecopter ride,,,, it'll seem expensive to you at first but once you do it, you will realize you would pay every more

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: janineor
Reviews.Content: We had a great 6 night stay at this hotel. We had a fantastic corner room on the top floor so had ocean views and mountain views. Had booked a Regency Club room and it was well worth it as we used the appetisers and desserts (and cocktails) as our evening meal for several nights and also used it during the day for tea/coffee and nibbles. Our only complaint was that there was not enough shade around the pool as we don't like to lay in the sun but do like to swim and relax around the pool. We also thought that internet access should be included in the daily resort fee charged or at least as part of the Regency Club package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHawaiiFan
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 7 night stay in the Ocean Suite (5/9-5/16). We stayed here last year with our 3 and 5 year old (in a regular partial ocean view room), and once again we had a great stay. I've stayed at this hotel several times, and can tell you that the majority of the reivews here on TA are accurate. In short, the standard rooms are a bit dated (popcorn ceilings and gold door knobs), but the beds are excellent, TV's are flatscreens, and bathrooms are fairly updated (small, but granite). The beach is just OK,;you are better off heading North (either walking along the trail, or taking the free Trolley up to Black Rock beach at the Sheraton). The pools, however, are excellent. The hotel website does not do the kids pool justice. It's great for young kids; its a walk-in with a sand bottom, has mutliple places for the kids to sit and play, and has a waterslide (one for kids, and one for adults too!). The hotel staff are excellent. Every afternoon, they came by the kids pool with Otter Pops (popsicles) for the kids, and cold towels for the adults. Also, (and I stay at a lot of Hyatts), this property has the nicest Regency Club I've experienced, both in terms of food & drink offerings, as well as service. Stay here with your family, and I'm certain you will be happy (unless you are one of those people on TA that complain about resort fees, and will be surprised that your beer at the pool bar costs more than it would at the grocery store). Thanks again, Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: FLhurricane
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed at the shabby conditions of this property. Small rooms even smaller bathrooms. Moldy smelling plastic shower curtain. Very dusty and generally not very clean. A chunk was missing from our bathtub, rust rings around the sink faucets. The furniture was so badly banged up it looked like it was a Good Will hand me down. We were treated like children at the pool requiring to give pool cards to receive a tissue thin pool towel. If you needed an extra towel we were told one must og up to the front desk to fill out a form for an extra towel! You also had to wear a hand wrist band to identify you as a patron of the hotel. We had the buffet breakfast plan--what a mistake! We felt like we were in Alfred Hitchcock's "The Birds" as were were attacked daily by birds swooping in to attack our food. Very annoying not to mention unsanitary. I tried on several morning to get an omelet however the line was long and required about a 15 to 20 minute wait. Only one poor chef was trying to make hundreds of omelets. The spa was too small and did not have enough seating in the "relaxation" room--standing room only. Great massage but the facility offers nothing special not even a pool or spa menu. Just a massage and out you go. The fitness center was ok however the air conditioning was broken and the days it was fixed all the machines were taken. Internet a daily expensive charge. They charge a resort fee I don't see what you get besides a newspaper for $15 a day on top of the room rate. For the money go elsewhere. Stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani or the Ritz for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: expo09
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived here to celebrate our honeymoon, come to find out this hotel doesn't guarantee you your room or bed that you pay for in advance, for example we payed for a deluxe ocean front room with a king bed. We got a partial oceanfront room with a queen bed. The front desk acted like this was our problem and not there problem. We even asked to speak with a manager and she wouldnâ€™t even look me in the eye. Trust me we are easy going people, this is the first time we felt it to be necessary and justified to post a bad review. I think this hotel claims to be a 4-5 star hotel, not hardly they are a 3 star hotel. We even had to call a couple times to request to have our room cleaned. This kind of stuff is acceptable when staying at a hundred dollar a night hotel, but not when paying three times that amount.

Reviews.Title: “NO LOYALTY FOR CLUB MEMBERS AT HYATT MAUI”
Reviews.Author: living62
Reviews.Content: it's a sad day when you have to write a negative review about a chain hotel that had always provided world class service. It took several weeks for me to decide if i should write this review but after reading some of the other posts i felt that i had no choice. we are platinum members of the Hyatt chain. we travel frequently , stay on the regency level(yes,even when we pay)and usually travel with at least 2 of our children . I booked a trip for late march into early April back on Feb 1st. with the Hyatt club platinum division for my husband, myself and our 2 younger kids aged 5 & 6. This booking was to be for 6 nights on the regency level at no cost per se but rather paid for "with points"(pretty expensive when you consider that our winter time Hyatt hotel in the Caribbean costs $790 per night). Upon booking i made it clear to the agent that my husband(who is a medical volunteer) had left several days ago in order to help the victims of the earthquake in Haiti and that we would be reuniting in Maui for a well deserved rest and i insisted upon a quiet room with 2 double/queen beds and a ocean view on the regency club level and was told that it would all be taken care of. I followed up on the reservation every few weeks in order to insure against any "problems"( we were meeting up with other families for the holiday on the eve of our arrival to Maui)Furthermore, upon arrival into the Hawaiian Islands our first stop was a short stay at the Hyatt Waikiki (which although dated, was outstanding in terms of service,location and amenities) . The front desk manager took the time to personally phone the "sister resort" since it was written all over my confirmation and he was assured that a "quiet room with 2 double beds and a great view " would be held for us. Well here it comes..... there was a very strong wind on that late march day and we arrived about 45 min later, add in the car rental , and we arrived about 5 pm instead of 3pm(not too bad since holiday dinner was set for 8 pm). Check in was a breeze, i was told by the young man that "indeed it is a very quiet room with a nice view and 2 beds" i was handed a key to the 20th floor (not the 21st which is where the club room is). i asked him why i was not on the 21st floor to which he responded "o don't worry you will be so satisfied". well..... QUIET INDEED IF YOU ARE SITUATED DIRECTLY BENEATH THE CLUB DINING ROOM !! mind you , they begin to set up at 5am and close after 11pm(btw, no view either). I called down to the front desk and was told that due to the spring break the hotel was completely booked and that if i wanted 2 beds that would be my only choice. If i gave up the 2 beds and placed my children on a pull out couch they could put me in another room also on the 20th floor but that was all they could do.. at first i was polite and remained calm but i felt that they were rude and very unapologetic. I had looked up the hotel on trip advisor, and had also noticed that as of late Hyatt has begun to either sell or/and "upgrade" non loyal guests into the regency club and they also unload rooms on various sites. so here i was, a devoted and loyal Hyatt customer with a husband who really deserved a break and 2 cranky kids and a holiday dinner fast approaching with an inadequate room that was most likely "given away as a freebie upgrade to someone who never even stayed at a hyatt but got it for real cheap". A young woman called me and advised me to take the room with the pull out couch since it would be much quieter and that she would place 2 cots in the room and reinstate points for 2 of my nights. The bellman,who was aware of what had happened, left us with our bags on a trolley and disappeared.I pushed the bags around to the other side of the floor and opened our new room. Great view....of the highway, we were glad that we left new york city and flew to Hawaii. The first thing i did was check for bedbugs which unfortunately can be a problem...for others...i can not say i saw a bed bug but the mattress had a rusty stain and i insisted that it be changed. It took a long time to bring the mattress up and when they did the rudeness was beyond ! i again went to look at the mattress whereupon a small ant was crawling across it! i quickly called to the men who brought it up to take a look since i thought i was about to loose my mind (or maybe i was on candid camera?) they were so slow to respond and rude that they did not see it. regardless i had reached the end of my rope. i called My sister to come get our children and take them to the holiday dinner and the men begrudgingly removed the mattress and unfortunately rolled it over my foot with no apology at all. We were about to leave and go to the Ritz Carlton when a wonderful manager appeared, i genuinely think he felt bad and he seemed embarrassed by what we had experienced. The entire housekeeping staff (at least that's what it felt like)came to clean the room, he reinstated all of our points and treated us to dinner and the spa. yet, we indeed missed the holiday with our family(irreplaceable) and we flew hours from the east coast for this. The next morning in the regency club i knew that more than half the people in the club had never before stayed on that level since people were openly discussing it (and if you read prior posts you will see what i mean). there were no tables , you were not allowed to remove alcoholic beverages out of the room (a first for us) and the idea of "nut free" was nowhere to be found (our child is deadly allergic). enough said? The rest of our stay was uneventful,there was no issue finding seats by the pool. The towel policy is a drag but unfortunately people do take advantage of hotel towels. The hot tubs were not hot and yes the gym was filthy and was filled with little kids they need to have someone attending the gym.The food, as at all Hyatt hotels, was delicious.did we enjoy? yes in a way that all people begin to relax and enjoy Hawaii. will we go back? don't think so , not to the Hyatt. It took 6 calls to get my "points" reinstated. When i spoke to someone in corporate i guess they figured i was a small fish in their big pond of corporations etc so who really cares? well Hyatt, in this day and age of financial uncertainty it would behoove you to treat your loyal non corporate customers a wee bit better and maybe you guys can throw in something better than a thread bare yellow towel? for shame!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Match the Hyatt in Kauai”
Reviews.Author: badgerak
Reviews.Content: This is very nice hotel with a fine location on the busy beach strip, if that's your thing. Overall good service and friendly staff; nice shops inside, including a Macy's devoted to swimsuits! The only reason why I'm giving it three stars is that it doesn't come close to matching the design and ambiance of the Kauai Hyatt, where I stayed in 2008. So i was a bit disappointed there. It has a somewhat "dated" feel to it and lacks the landscaping and multiple swimming areas of the one on Kauai. The other odd touch was having showcase areas for species that have nothing to do with Hawaii--penguins and flamingos. The other tip: get to the pool early. Seating appeared to be quite competitive with advance staking out of seats.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort”
Reviews.Author: gldnby
Reviews.Content: My wife, two children ages 6 and 9 and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 6 nights in late April. This is a truly stunning hotel. The lobby is very open and breezy with koi ponds, parrots, and even penguins in the lobby! The views are incredible from everywhere you look. The staff was very helpful and friendly and never seemed "stuffy", despite the high end nature of the resort. I've read other reviews talking about the beach and yes, the beach directly behind the resort is rocky, but if you walk literally 30 seconds in either direction the beach becomes sandy and perfect for swimming or snorkeling. The resort pools were the best we've ever seen. There is a larger adult pool and a kid pool with squirting fountains, waterslides, and sand to play in. This is where we spent most of our pool time. Waterfalls everywhere, even a grotto bar in a cave! The drink prices at the resort are outrageous ($12.50 per cocktail). We had one to indulge, but usually walked along the path to Whalers Village and found many beach front restaurants where Mai Tai's could be had for $3-4 apiece during happy hour as well as cheap food. The rooms in the hotel were clean and comfortable. If you have kids consider asking for a room in the tower close to the children's pool so the hike isn't so long. My only complaint about the room is they have various overpriced food items on a tray in the room ($3 candy bar anyone?) and if you even move the food a bit, you get charged because it's hooked to some type of sensor. The hotel did warn us about this at check in, but it was still annoying because all the food is on a counter above the mini fridge and is kind of in the way. I kept worrying we'd accidentally bump into it and get charged for the items. The resort also has a first class spa with cardio, free weights, and strength training equipment which is great for early morning workouts. Aside from the pricey food and drinks no complaints and we'd definitely go back. This places makes other resorts pale in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “all goes well”
Reviews.Author: redoli
Reviews.Content: We exchanged via a timeshare and our room was a bit tight for 2 adults and 2 kids. Aside from that the hotel delivered everything as promised on their website. The staff were absolutely right on the mark. There was no sense of employee unhappiness at any time which is very important to my wife and I as were are both union and spend lots of time south of the American border where the atmosphere is not always so welcoming. All the support staff were nothing short of 1st class !! Not one experience in 7 days of staff angst!!!. We can't wait to come back and reccomend this property to anyone looking for a outstanding experience. P.S. Dont miss the "Stargazing on the roof" event. The gentlemen guiding this experience is absolutely top shelf. His passion of showing us the stars through his telescopes was truly fantastic. To see the planets and stars from the top of this hotel is not only suprising but wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Stay at Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Runinsun22
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Hyatt for our 25th Anniversary (May 2-9) and we couldn't be any happier with our stay. The hotel is awesome and beatiful. We were skeptical after reading some of the negative reviews, but for someone to not like this hotel, well, it must be someone that is used to pimo luxury. The hotel staff was friendly, and the concierge was great with the excursions. We ate at both the Sonz and Omalu twice and food and service were superb. Someone of the best seafood I've had and well worth the Maui prices. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary and they sent a bottle of champagne to our room, which was great. The grounds of the hotel are paradise, and I can see why the book we picked up at Barnes and Noble named it best Fantasy resort, because that's exaclty what the lobby and gorunds are. The pool, with waterfalls, penguins, swans and decor was unreal. The rooms were quiet and the staff was always willing to help. Yes, the pool chairs get crowded but we never had a problem finding one. Also, get the Swan Court breafast included in whatever deal you get, because it is great and would cost you $30 a piece otherwise. There was always a 15 minute wait no matter what time for breakfast, but well worth it. I checked the grounds of the other 4 resorts next to the Hyatt, and in my humble opinion it has by far the best layout. WE booked our trip through Costco travel and it killed all other travel options including AAA. Here's another tip that I found while on the Island. There's a Costco by the airport, and besides getting cheap Leis and Mac nuts, they have Hyatt gift certificates $100 for $79. You can use those to pay for dinner, or excursions if you charge them to your room. Also, we did the Skyline Ziplines, PWF Molikini snorkel and the road to Hana and they were all awesome. The Old Lahaina Luau is geta too. I must say the stay at thye Hyattt by far exceeded our expectations and we will definitely return. Been to Oahu several times and I like Maui better.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Hyatt for 3 nights and loved it! We got an Oceanfront deluxe which was beautiful, and I thought the amenitites were fine, but I'm not a hugely picky traveler. The bed was really comfy, and room service was good. We got a really great deal through Flight Centre, otherwise we might not have been able to afford it. The pool and bar were really fun, loved the slide and the Mai Tais at happy hour (from 4-6) which left us happy after only 2! The Ale Poke from the bar was delicious too. We also really enjoyed the luau. The Whalers Villlage was only a short walk. Maui was heavenly, and we would definitely stay again at the Hyatt, we had such a great time. The only small criticism I had was that we had to wait about an hr for our room to be ready when we arrived, which was horrible after about 24hrs of straight travel, still wearing clothes appropriate for a much cooler climate. But the wait was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: traveler13879
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is one of the premiere properties in Maui, with lush, beautifully landscaped grounds, including the atrium, restaurants and the pools. We were here for a whole week, and had a tough time leaving...but that was probably more so because we were in Maui, rather than the Hyatt. The rooms was bearable, at best. The bathroom curtain was stale smelling when we first checked in, but it was promptly replaced after a call to housekeeping. The furniture is dated, but who really spends a lot of time inside the room? We had heard about the luau being the best in Maui, and it sure didn't disappoint. The fire dance was spectacular, and so were the other routines. The food was mediocre, but that's Hawaiian cuisine for you ;)... The location is great. Lahaina is a fun town with a whole spectrum of restaurants, shops and art galleries. Unfortunately, the beach strip attached to the hotel is not the greatest of Kaanapaali. Walk/Drive to the Sheraton grounds for the best portion of the beach, near Black Rock. My only other gripe was the lack of free internet access...But that was a blessing in disguise because it kept my wife away from her laptop ;)... Other areas in Maui that we would consider living in on our next trip would be Kapalua and Wailea. All in all, the Hyatt provides a great location and amentities for a first-time Maui traveller. PS>> Ask Paul, the concierge for recommendations. He pointed us to some great local hotspots, traversed by locals and tourists alike. He also gave us excellent tips for booking our excursions, and was always ready with a map to help directionally challenged drivers, such as myself :).

Reviews.Title: “Still Lovely, but Facing Some Challenges”
Reviews.Author: MM90402
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt twice over the last five years. The first time, we really enjoyed the amenities (the place is huge), delicious sushi menu at the lobby bar, huge pool, and lovely location on Kaanapali beach. This time around, we enjoyed the property but ran into a few snags that I think need fixing in the short term. Otherwise, I can see this property going downhill. (1) the high-end restaurant and lobby bar with the great sushi is closed. They have a pretty good restaurant by the pool, but who wants to sit there for any special dinner? We're told the restaurant will re-open in 9 months, but, as we were told, "but, then again, you know how these things go." (2) the valet accidentally gave our rental car to another guest, who took off with it for the day. I realize that many rental cars look alike, but this should never happen. Worse, we had to rent another car for the day and a manager promised that we would be reimbursed for that cost. After nearly a month of promises on the phone and email, it took a call to the manager's manager to finally hear that they were processing the refund. Food and service are very important to me when I travel and I'm concerned that the Hyatt needs to work on both of these.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation because I got a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: AlTexas40
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hyatt Maui for 6 days in April. All of the previous reviews are pretty well spot on. We had a deluxe ocean front room on the 21st floor which was a concierge floor. This was a great benefit as it included a continental breakfast, juice, sodas and snacks all day and then of course happy hour from 5p-7p which was cocktails and appetizers. There was then a dessert service after that. This was a complimentary upgrade that we received when we checked in. The service overall was excellent. Beginning at check in, around the pool, at the buffet (our breakfast buffets were included) until check out, the service was prompt and courteous. The views from our room were spectacular. The pool was very nice and we were out there for several hours every day enjoying mai tais and pina coladas. The people that say you have to get there are 6:30 am..........not sure what they were thinking. We never had a problem finding primo seating at 10am or at 1pm. The chairs are adequate but the towels are the thinnest, most worn beach towels I have ever seen. No prob....we brought some of our own. Like others have said, the location is 5 star but the hotel itself is dated. Low popcorn celings, worn furniture, small rooms and bathroom etc. This is what I expected when I went in and just what I got. If I had been expecting the Four Seasons or paid Four Season's prices, it would have been terrible. Back to the deal we got. I got the hotel for six night (deluxe ocean front) included buffet breakfast for 2, the resort fees and a $100 hotel credit along with an intermediate rental car for $1700 total. So with that in mind, and the fact that we were in Maui (paradise), we had a fabulous vacation. We snokeled Molokini, saw whales, went zip lining and went out for some pretty good meals. So despite the shortcomings of the hotel, the Hyatt Maui provdied us a base for a wonderful time. I would certainly recommend it to families as the children's pool is great and for a group of friends or couples. If it were my honeymoon and I were looking for something upscale, this is not the place. We used the spa and the fitness center on several occassions, both were top notch. In summary, if you get a great deal, this hotel has a lot to offer. However, if your are looking for luxury or as previous posters have suggested spending more than $200 per night....probably would not do it.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but not great. Don't overpay”
Reviews.Author: Squirm
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt. It was like a trip back to the 1970's. I kept thinking I was going to run into the Brady Bunch while there. The rooms are in serious need of updating and are small. I wouldn't go here for serious romance. The balaconies (if you can call them that) are very small and can barely seat two people. But the grounds are beautiful with sounds of waterfalls and waves. There is a mini fridge and coffee maker. The beds are sort of weird looking being low but not very comfortable either. I woke up with a backache every morning, but that went away after moving around. The bathroom isn't anything to write home about either. Stay away from the snack try, there are sensors on it that detect any snack that is lifted from it - beware. The restaurants are okay with decent selection, although somewhat pricey. There is a $15 resort fee for each night (I've seen worse at other places). Overall I would say if your paying more then $200 a night, you're overpaying. It could be a great place once the place is updated (I was told later this year they will start updating it). But the 70's look with the dark wood paneling, low ceilings with popcorn and all the little shops on the ground floor reminded me of the 70's decade. Oh by the way, when you pull up, park in the self parking lot, if you don't want valet parking. I pulled into the valet lot at first and the guy said valet was "free", meaning they will park you car, but expect a nice tip. No thanks, I can park myself.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Lahaina for 6 nights in March-April 2010 as part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were informed that the type of room we had booked was not available. To compensate, we were asked to stay in a lower class room for one night, and were then upgraded to an oceanfront room for the remaining 5 nights. We were also given 2 free tickets to their luau. We were quite happy with this. We also received a complimentary voucher for a bottle of champagne, to be used at any of the restaurants at the hotel. This wasn't much of a perk as we had to spend $100+ for a meal at their overpriced restaurants, just to enjoy a small piccolo of champagne. You would have thought that a hotel of this stature would not be so stingy with their guests considering the amount of money their guests pay to stay with them. The oceanfront room we stayed in for 5 nights was quite nice (if not dated), with a great view of the beach and the ocean. The restaurants at the hotel were expensive, so we mainly ate out at bars and restauraunts down the boardwalk (we highly recommend Longboards, kimo's at Lahaina, and the bar and restaurant in the Marriott hotel - the guys there were great! ) The pool is also quite nice - except you will need to get down there early (6am) for a lounge as people go and put their towels on the lounges and then don't come back for a few hours. The biggest issue we had with this hotel was in relation to debits taken from our credit card without our knowledge or consent - which overshadowed all the good things about this hotel, and ruined the end of our honeymoon. While we were staying at this hotel, a number of 'holds' were placed on one of our credit cards that we were required to give the front desk staff on check in for authorisation. These 'holds' were for random amounts for various purchases which we did not make eg: an online spa store. We did not use this credit card at all during our time in Maui. These 'holds' racked up to over $4000, and we only became aware of them after we left Maui to our next destination, when our card was declined for check in at our next hotel. This left us sick with worry, and ruined the remainder of our honeymoon. To make matters worse another of our credit cards had debits taken from it once we had left the island. It seems that someone was putting meals to the room we were in - even though we had departed. When we tried to call the hotel to get to the bottom of it they did not return our calls and messages - it was only when Hyatt head office stepped in some 2 weeks later that something was done about this. Hyatt head office were great in dealing with this problem, although no acknowledgement was made by them that there are some serious flaws in the way transactions can be made against a room or a persons credit card. We only wanted 3 things from they Hyatt. 1. an apology 2. our credit cards reimbursed and 3. acknowledgement that there are flaws in their system which they should look into so that it did not happen to another guest. We tried to explain this to the Hyatt staff however they refused to acknowledge this issue so to be honest once we had received our credits back we gave up trying to get through to them. All in all, this appalling behaviour on the part of Hyatt Maui overshadowed the good things about this hotel. We would definitely not stay here again. Be careful when you are handing your credit card over to the front desk and check your statements after you leave the hotel to ensure that no charges are added after you depart.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - just not a nice price!”
Reviews.Author: planthenexttrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband at the end of a 10 trip to the Hawaiian islands. For us the Hyatt was our least favourite of the 3 hotels we stayed in - mainly down to a few silly rules and charges. Good things: the room - comfortable, clean, spacious and well furnished - we had a partial ocean view room - but as we were in a corner room, we also had a view of the golf course/mountains, so we got the best of both worlds. View was great, glad I didn't pay extra for an ocean view/front room, as it wouldn't have been worth it. The front desk staff were very helpful/friendly and the lobby, grounds and pool area were all beautiful. Thought the penguins and flamingos were a quirky touch! The cocktails at the pool were delicious, and although at a slight premium, were large sized drinks, so felt OK paying a little more. Bad things: the add on charges - You can't help feeling that they're trying to make a quick buck out of you at every turn, when you've already paid more than enough for the room rate. We went into it knowing about the additional charges, but I think it's a question of value for money - if the hotel had been amazing in every possible way we might have felt a little better about it - but it felt like a lot to pay for what we got. Our room was $262/night including tax - the most expensive hotel of our trip by about $130/night, but we didn't really feel it was $130 better than the other places we stayed. Then there was a further $15/night resort fee - which as far as we could tell covered parking. The other things they say it includes (coffee making/access to the fitness center/daily newspaper/free local calls) are things which most hotels would include in their room rate anyway. They then charge you another $10/night for internet access - which is a bit tight, I think this should be included as part of what the resort fee covers. I think what I'm really saying is that the room rate + resort fee + internet fee of $287/night for this hotel was expensive for what we got - this hotel should be more in the $180 -$200/night range. One morning for breakfast we called by the coffee bar in the lobby and nearly fainted at the prices - $6.50 for a chocolate muffin?!!? We drove the 5 minutes to Safeway and paid less than $6.50 for 2 coffees and two muffins! $6.50 for a chocolate muffin is a rip off, no matter how good the view! The pool towel card/wrist band faff - none of the other hotels we stayed in had this rule - you exchanged your towel card for a pool towel - and then back to a card when you were done, and if you didn't return your cards on check out they billed you $25 for a mangy pool towel! With what they are charging I think they could stretch to letting you have a couple of pool towels without all the hassle of trading them for cards - it wasn't like they were so plush and lovely that you would have wanted to take one. And what if you wanted 2 towels, not one?! They also make you wear a wrist band - so that they can tell you are staying the Hyatt and not one of the neighbouring hotels, but I don't really know why - although the Hyatt had a lovely pool, so did the other hotels - it just seemed like another unnecessary rule. Overall the hotel was fine (just not the spectacular that the price would suggest) - I would stay here again - but only if I got a significantly cheaper room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: labrooks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and had a "Wonderful" time. I was a little concerned about the reviews but we booked this hotel anyway. Glad we did! Perfect location and awesome view of the ocean. Upon arrival we were somewhat disappointed because we didn't get our King size bed as requested but the attendant was very nice, knew we were tired and offered to pay for drinks at the restaurant. We checked in, went down to the restaurant only to find out that our seats were reserved, orders had been placed not only for drinks but for supper as well!! We were starving and pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small but comfortable and the beds were very cozy. We had a Queen and it was fine. The view was amazing! We stayed in room 1416 (Ocean Front). The Swan restaurant was wonderful as well. Don't hesitate to book your stay here. We loved it. We're already planning our return trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “way below my expectation”
Reviews.Author: fay747400
Reviews.Content: First vacation for my family in 2 yrs. Continous problems since arrival. Most of the staffs ok not outstanding or friendly. They are more like machine " Yes sir, No Sir and so on. I booked a Deluxe Ocean Front room but ended up on the Deluxe Trees between Ocean Front roon at level 14 which is the lowest level. of course other rooms are not available because all the deluxe ocean front room are sold out for the entire week i was there hahaha. Not a great view from this room found 2 roaches dead one on the floor and the other just a piece of leg on the table. Amazing to find some of the staff border line rude. On the positive side the pools are outstanding the lobby and the first floor areas are outstanding and cleans. I love the in house Macys Department store. The staffs fail to make this a true 5 stars hotel from the front desk, buffet breakfast staffs, poolside bar servers, housekeeping and concierge services. Our First time using Hyatt hotel this time my wife is right, i should have just stay loyal to the Starwood Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jdspring
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Maui as a late Christmas gift for my family back in December. We took the week of my teenage stepson as the vacation time this go around. The Hyatt was included in package deal from our club store. After booking and seeing reviews here, I was a little depressed that I didn't check on Tripadvisor first, so we were going to hold back judgement until we got to our destination. So the day of our trip comes and flying from the DC area, it is a LONG flight. We arrived at the airport at around 5.00 PM local time. By the time we got the bags and the rental car and made the drive to the hotel, it was about 6.30. Plan on about 45 minutes drive time from the airport to this hotel. We were very impressed as we drove up to the hotel looking at how well the grounds were kept. We dropped off the bags and then parked the car. Parking was a little scarce but found a parking spot behind the resort near the luau area. I think if you park late at night, parking is difficult but not impossible. Just something to plan around. A lot of people come to the luau and take up spaces, but they open up after the luau is over. No big deal. Checking in was a snap, took us about 5 minutes at most. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room overlooking the mountains as well. We did book for a queen bed and double bed, but apparently there were none available, but our 13 year old doesn't mind sleeping on a sleeper sofa. And to be honest, we weren't planning on spending much time in the room other than to sleep at night. We were in Hawaii after all. The room over all was very nice, well decorated. The bathroom was very clean, no mold or other things around. Wife really enjoyed the bath supplies provided (shampoo, conditioner, moisturizer, toothpaste). The grounds of the hotel were magnificant. Birds were abundent all over the grounds. We spent many hours walking around the hotel and along the beach walk to Whaler's village. Breakfast for two of us were included in our package deal, so we ate at Swan Court twice and then at Umalu twice. Swan Court had a better selection, but if you didn't arrive by 8 or 8.30, there was a line to get in. We are early birds and would get there at 7 and maybe had to wait 5 minutes. We did have to pay for our teenagers breakfast, and that would run 35 dollars at Swan Court and about 10 dollars cheaper at Umalu. Yes, it is expensive but it is Hawaii, that is to be expected. I have travled for work to Honolulu in the past, and a continental breakfast at a hotel there ran 25 dollars, so I felt we got our money's worth at the Hyatt. The wait staff was always friendly, as well as housekeeping and other staff we interacted with. They seemed to be happy and in good spirits. The first full day there, we decided to stay on the resort area and be at the pool. The pool facility was great. Posters are right though, the chairs can get taken up quickly, but lack of chairs never kept us from the pool. We were able to find some chairs in the shade every time we went there. Sometimes, couples would offer to move over a chair so my wife and I could lay together, which was very nice. Seems like most guest were very pleasant and were willing to help out. We swam in the big pool, went through the cave to the other side, to the area where the rope bridge was and the big water slide. My stepson and I did do the slide a few times, and it was fun. I think some adults were bashful to try it, but after they saw me to it a half a dozen times, they decided to partake in the activities with the kids. When lunch time came, we looked at eating at the resort, bud didn't care for the prices or selection, so we walked to Whalers Village, which is about a 20 minute walk north of the resort on the walking path. There were better selections and prices to be had there. There is also an ABC store to visit for snacks and light flair. If planning ot leave the resort to dine out, if you go to Whaler's Village, the restaurants start getting packed around 5.30. We always ate an earlyish dinner at around 5.00 to avoid the crowds and the wait. This worked out very well, most of the time we got a table in 10-15 minutes. We tried to go at 7.30 one evening and it was a hour to hour and a half wait. We spent a few days of our week long vacation at the resort and was very happy with it overall. I can't think of one major complaint. The only gripe I have is that they keep a tray of food in the room as well as a stocked fridge with adult beverages. Just don't touch anything or mess with it. If you remove something, it is automatically charged to the room as they are weight sensitive. An accidential bump and a charge to your room could happen. I warned the wife and kid up front, and we had no problems, but smaller kids may be tempted to touch. Also, no free internet in the hotel which was kind of nice, beind disconnected from everyone and work, but some may find that to be a hinderance. This is the first time we have made the trip to Maui and want to go again in the future (too bad it takes like 18 hours of travel time to get there from the east coast). But the distance won't stop us from going back in the future, and the Hyatt will be number one on our list unless we find somewhere else substantially cheaper to stay at. The location, staff, grounds, views were so great, we would certainly enjoy staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A PLACE”
Reviews.Author: NYGOGUY
Reviews.Content: Just back after a week stay. Have to say this was the best ever. Maui is absolutely gorgeous and the hotel is paradise. Read other reviews regarding room accomodations being old an worn. This is true to some extent but not to the extent i read here. It was not bad, could have used a touch here or there but overall, incredible. Had an ocean front room that had the most awesome view. Whale and fish could be seen all day long. Penguins, parrots, flamingos, swans fill the lobby areas. Pineapple growing in the lobby. The Swan Court was great. Food was fantasic. The water in front on the hotel is very rocky but a short walk down the beach brings you to rock free water. Bed was alittle soft for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding/Honeymoon not what I expected =(”
Reviews.Author: aclark032010
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hyatt Maui for our wedding/honeymoon and I was in tears within the first day! The room was small and gross, the bathroom was dirty with mold on the ceiling and on the wall. We stayed in room 612, my husband complained to the actual manager on duty and they supposably cleaned the bathroom top to bottom- they comped up our wedding dinner which was nice but the bathroom was still dirty as you can see the pictures. There was never any self parking available at night time so we had to park somewhere else and walk all the way to the door. We also went to the Luau, which was absolutely a waste of a hundred dollars a person, the waitress we had was rude and called me a bi*ch after she told us we couldn't sit where we picked cause it was reserved- as if we knew!! The grounds of the hotel were absolutely amazing and the breakfast was to die for but the amount of children was crazy! My husband and I weren't able to enjoy a nice relaxing quiet time in the hot tub because it was wall to wall kids and i mean younger than 10 with no adult supervision! The pool attendants didn't seem to enforce this at all. All in all, I would NOT go back to this hotel again!! and the worst part... it was our honeymoon and I was completely disappointed about the lack of customer service and the lack of everything else there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gounds and lovely rooms, just buy more lounge chairs for pool area”
Reviews.Author: amarone6
Reviews.Content: Fabulous tennis program--for both myself , 10 year old son and my 16 year old daughter. Frank Salvador does a great job! Hyatt needs to buy more chairs for pool/beach area---ridiculous to have to go and "save" a chair by 745 am or not have one for the rest of the day! Do not get a room near the luau side of the hotel--gets tiresome hearing luau every night. Had suite and adjoining room for kids--good arrangement. Nice staff--very helpful--beatiful grounds, great location.

Reviews.Title: “My heart stick with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Glittery35
Reviews.Content: beside the bad attitude of the front desk, over all this hotel is wonderful, the restaurant is great, you should eat your dinner in this hotel! I always tell everyone about this hotel, they have shopping area in the lobby, they have the dancing and the waving parrot. they dont have long beaches. but who cares? who want to swim in a big waves? only a good surfer for sure.. they have a great swimming pool and facilities, just go and enjoy the rest. spa not too good compare to other country, but price is still affordable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: sshloss
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Maui Hyatt was wonderful. Our room was a corner suite and had a beautiful oceanfront view. I was a little concerned that the decor would be outdated b/c it was an older hotel but our room was absolutely beautiful. It reminded me of a room right out of a 1950's glam /deco movie set. Lots of bamboo touches but with very large state of the art flat screen TVs. All the carpeting and upholstery was very new and the room was extremely clean and fresh. There was plenty of drawer space and a nice walk in closet. The bathroom was well appointed but with the older style tub. Not a problem..we were not in Maui to sit in the tub. The athletic club was nice and the housekeeping staff was great. My daughter left her i touch and it was turned in and is being mailed to us as we speak. The breakfast buffet was delicious but pricey.. ours was included in the room. Overall it was expensive but worth it ... great beaches plenty of pool chairs. Nice hot tub and a great luau on our last night. (the entertainment was better than the food). One suggestion... at these rates WiFi should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: MinnCouple
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was everything we hoped it would be. The staff was great. The breakfast buffet and any food we ate at Umalu was wonderful. We also had a special anniversary dinner at Son'z that was fabulous. I really miss all the wonderful fresh fish we ate while in Hawaii. The grounds were beautiful, and our POV room was very nice. We enjoyed the view of the mountains as well as the ocean. The pool was nice but only went in there a couple of times since the ocean was so much better. We also enjoyed the sidewalk along the beach and walking to Whaler's Village. Went to the luau and enjoyed the show but didn't think the food was anything special. The self-parking worked out well. Did not really leave the resort very much since it was so beautiful and relaxing there. Would definitely go back to the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a relaxing and romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: GoGauchos
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa! It's right on a nice sandy beach for swimming and other water sports and nice walk from the excellent snorkeling at Black Rock. The pool is spectacular with several waterfalls. It's a short drive to Lahaina but there's so much to do at the resort we never felt like we HAD to go anywhere. At night there the walkway along the beach and hotels lit by torches that is very romantic. All in all, this was a wonderful trip and the perfect place for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical big hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: the_nim
Reviews.Content: Once we decided to go to Maui, there weren't many hotels that had availability on the dates we were going (2-5th of April), and we had to select the Hyatt, and unfortunately ended up paying a ridiculous rate per night. For what we paid for, we did get a room with a view and breakfast, but because of the timing, every day we had to wait at least 30 mins in the breakfast queue! The pool was impossible to get to, all the chairs around were gone and we had to use chairs in an area that was well out of the way - but at least it was quite! It was a fairly relaxing few days - in spite of all the families with the little kids, but we've paid less for a much better experience. Some things we were really disappointed by included lack of free WiFi (for nearly $500 a night, I would have though that should be included!) No complimentary water - in a fairly hot climate, this was ridiculous, we had to buy water from local shops... We used the spa, and though the treatments were really good, the spa itself was pretty basic, and not very relaxing - esp. compared to some of the other "cheaper" spas that we've been to! We only tried the one restaurant - Umalu for lunch, it has a basic selection of stuff, but not worth the price, I guess you pay for the convenience! The breakfast spread is pretty good though, still, not worth $30 a head, we considered ourselves lucky for having booked the breakfast with the room, $60 a day for breakfast is very expensive, even for Hawaii! Overall, unless you can get a good deal and you REALLY want the resort experience, and there's nothing else available, this is okay. Three tips, bring your own water, don't have food there and drive!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is very good, some limitations”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is North of Lahaina in Ka'anapali. We have stayed a number of times for conferences. The rooms are well appointed with a large bar fridge. The bathrooms are mid sized and well appointed. Most rooms have a view of either the mountains/gold course or sea. There are extensive shops in the foyer level, wear you can buy clothing, shoes and snacks. The conference area downstairs is large and well set up. Its either side of the walkway down to the sea front walk. The breakfast buffet by the lagoon is excellent and reasonably priced but get there before 9am on weekends because otherwise you queue up the stairs. We don't eat in the hotel for other meals because of expense/value issues. Its expensive especially wine. In the past we have walked the beach front and found places for dinner but some of these have closed with the recession. This last visit we drove to Lahaina or Wailea or Kapalau to eat in the evenings for better variety and value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq010
Reviews.Content: First, I'll mention that I was concerned about staying here after reading several negative reviews. We were traveling with 2 teenagers and secured what we felt was a great deal, so we decided to take a chance. We were not disappointed!! From the complimentary first night of valet service ( really appreciated after a long flight), to the bottled waters and shell leis given at check in, we were made to feel welcome from the minute we arrived! I had originally booked one room for the 4 of us, planning to see whether we could get a second room at a discount once on site. Alas, they were sold out! I was almost happy to hear it, as it is a sign that things may be improving for Hawaii tourism after a dismal couple of years. So, knowing we might be a bit cramped, we headed to our room, a Deluxe Ocean View on the Regency Club level of the Atrium Tower. I booked Regency Club level because I knew we would have continental breakfast, snacks, drinks, etc. which when you are traveling with teenagers can be a huge money-saver. We were surprised at how nice the room was!! Not worn or tired as many have described. Perhaps some of the rooms have been updated. The view from the lanai was fantastic! We were very pleased. We had a king bed and a pull-out couch and were given a rollaway(no charge) as well. When the couch was opened and the rollaway set up, it was tough to get to the lanai without climbing over them, but we managed, and this was only at night and early morning. Yes the bathroom was smaller than what most luxury hotels have these days, but we didn't come to Maui to sit in the bathroom! The 4 of us had no problem sharing the space(not at the same time, of course!) Husband and son used the fitness center daily and thought it was great. The Hyatt is an easy stroll(10 -15 minutes) from Whaler's Village shops and restaurants, and about a 20 minute walk to Black Rock. I snorkeled there one day, but the reef in front of the Hyatt was beautiful as well. If you walk to between where the first group of blue Cabana chairs ends and the second group starts, there is a sandy entry. As you swim out, follow the reef to your right. There is some really nice coral and a large variety of fish and even some sea turtles! The Hyatt beach is nothing to speak of, but a one minute walk in either direction will find you on a wider beach. The package we purchased from Travelocity (Hyatt Sunshine on Sale) included buffet breakfast for 2 in the Swan Court . At check in, we were told that we could also use the buffet at Umalu, the poolside restaurant if we desired. This worked out perfectly! We would have continental breakfast in the early morning at the Regency Club, then would head to the pool. A couple of hours later, my 16 year old son would be hungry again(you parents of teenage boys know what I'm talking about), so he and whomever else in the family was hungry would go through the buffet line at Umalu (no lines, all self-service so no tipping required) There was lovely outdoor seating and frankly my kids preferred the more casual atmosphere. The only thing it lacked was the omelette station, but there were always a couple of egg dishes from which to choose. When the kids got hungry again (late afternoon), they would head up to the RC for some delicious cookies and a tropical juice or hot chocolate. It was a quick walk from the pool to the elevator, unlike some of the more sprawling hotels. Pool chairs were available as long as you got down there by 9:30 or so, but the prime spots (with some shade) were usually gone much earlier. The pool staff did a pretty good job of tagging unattended chairs with slips of paper noting the time they were observed unattended and I did see them remove towels from those chairs if they were still unattended an hour later. People, can I just make an observation? If everyone took a chair only when they actually needed it, there would be plenty to go around!! There were days when we went on excursions that we did not use chairs, or just used them after we returned in the late afternoon. I can't imagine putting a towel down on a chair KNOWING that I was not going to be using it until hours later. There were days that we did go to the pool early in the morning to get good chairs and then - WE ACTUALLY SAT IN THEM!! If our kids wandered off and didn't come back for awhile, we removed the towels from their chairs so that they could be used by others. It's just simple consideration for others. . .JMHO We loved the pool area at the Hyatt. We had the opportunity to visit some friends at the Grand Wailea during our trip, and the pool area there is insane!! Lots of fun slides and hot tubs and a really cool rope swing, but LOADED with little kids running around unsupervised and row after row after row of chairs around the pool. I wondered whether the kids would feel disappointed with the Hyatt pool after experiencing all of the attractions at the GW- after all, sometimes kids prefer the chaos!! I was really happy when on the way "home" to the Hyatt, one of them said, "That was really fun, but I just like how our hotel is just much more "chill". The other sibling quickly agreed! They had read my mind. One day, while checking in at the pool desk to get towels, I mentioned that I was going to try to get the kids to go down the slide, telling the attendant that they hadn't bothered to do so yet, probably because they were too "cool" to do it. His reply: "Ohhhh no!! Tell them that the slide here was built in the 80s, before all of the safety regulations they have in place now - it's no kiddie slide!" Well, let's just say that they tried it, they loved it, and they used it every day after that, and so did I!! 7 seconds of hurtling at very high speed through the dark, only to be spit out into the 9ft deep section of the pool!! Definitely not for the meek!! The pool, as others have mentioned, did not seem to be heated, but after the initial plunge, it felt really comfortable to us. I didn't hear anyone complain about the pool temperature. There is a grotto bar/cave area that sort of splits the pool into 2 distinct areas - the kiddie area and waterslide, and the more relaxed side of the pool. I thought that was great. It made it easier for those with small kiddies to keep a close eye on them, and at the same time, made the other side of the pool less chaotic. We did eat lunch poolside on some of the days that we didn't venture out. It was pricey (eg. $16 cheeseburger) but plentiful, tasty and convenient. Around 5pm, the RC served cocktails and really yummy appetizers. We would always start there and then head out for dinner. After dinner, we would return for our nightly ritual of dessert at the RC(delicious rotating choices). A couple of nights the apps were enough, and we never made it to dinner! While I am speaking about the Regency Club, let me just mention how WONDERFUL the staff there is!! Sooooo friendly and helpful. There is even a concierge in the club to help you set up dinner, tell you about good beaches, snorkeling spots, etc. A real plus. Sorry for the long post, but I just want to assure those who have booked a room at the Hyatt Regency Maui - DON'T WORRY!! You will love it and you will have a great time!! We sure did. For those who have not yet booked, consider the Regency Level if you can, especially if you have kids. I know that some said they were offered RC room upgrade for $75. That is(much) less than it would cost to feed a family of 4 breakfast at the hotel, and you will get so much more throughout the day. It was also a nice place to go to read the newspaper or just hang out instead of sitting in the room if one wanted to get out of the sun for awhile. I'll point out that when I was pricing this package online, the cost varied (sometimes by thousands of dollars) from day to day and between websites for the very same package. If you don't find a rate you like, keep trying! If you do find a rate you like at the Hyatt - BOOK IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place - See Monica First”
Reviews.Author: Santino49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights for our 10th anniversary and it more than met our expectations. Be sure to visit with Monica at the concierge desk before making any plans. She was extremely helpful in bringing us up to speed on things to do all around the island, making reservations, and all with a great sense of humor and fun. The breakfast buffet is the best I've seen in a long time, but is a little pricey - ours was included with the room. Speaking of t he room, it was clean. Housekeeping was , up to date, and had a wonderful view of the ocean. Housekeeping was there early and often. This is a beach resort, so if you are used to European vacations, this is a real change of pace. If you are looking for a place to relax, watch dancing whales from the beach, you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “A very busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monkeywhistle
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed with our stay at the Hyatt. The rooms are in dire need of renovation. In saying that, they were clean and comfortable and the soft furnishings have been replaced. We had a flat screen tv and a very comfortable bed. It is just an older decor style and looks very worn and tired. It is a very busy hotel with most people spending the day lined up on sun lounges in rows around the pool and on the grass. If you are looking for a quiet romantic holiday then this is not the place for you! We swam with turtles at the beach in front of the hotel which was pretty amazing. The hotel is only about a 5 minute drive from Lahaina. The mahi mahi at Lahaina Fish Company was great. I would not recommend Cheesburger in Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Macjewels
Reviews.Content: We got a terrific deal using an online bidding service and got a reasonable price for a terrific resort. So we expected a nice hotel with a nice pool in a nice location, but not much else. However, we were in for a pleasant surprise. As soon as we got there, we got lei's and complimentary water. Such terrific check-in service, we truly didn't expect to get treated so nicely. Especially since generally if you pay for a bargain room at a great hotel you're stuck in a broom closet. This was not the case here. Our room was conveniently located right in the lobby building, and was clean, spacious, with a large flat screen tv and offered views of the golf course. A few footsteps away were the pool, shopping center and restaurants. Right on the ocean and the beautiful strip of beach, small as it may be, was nice to get some sand under your feet. But the truth is the resort itself was so great, you didn't have to leave for anything, as a matter of fact, the pool was so much fun- we spent 1 of our 3 days enjoying it. Meals are expensive if you stay at the resort. But a short 5 minute drive away is Front St. a local Safeway, the Cannery Mall and a couple of restaurants. Because we had only 3 days, and we did both the Road to Hana and the drive to the Haleakala crater- which killed 2 days, we only got to enjoy the resort for one day. It was very nice to have a day to do so, because pool fun aside, the birds on the grounds were such a pleasure to watch. From swans to penguins, we were certainly entertained! We'd definitely stay here again! And it was almost sad to leave our hotel for our driving adventures, but it was nice to know you were coming back to a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel As Expected!”
Reviews.Author: laura3606
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt with my boyfriend who has "Diamond" status with Hyatt as he travels frequently for work. (Points were used to "pay" for the stay and we had access to the club floor and free breakfast). We were given a partial ocean view with which overlooked the golf course. I had read reviews about the hotel needing updating, especially with the carpet, but didnt find such issues. Our first morning we decided to go to the buffet breakfast due to the great reviews. The line was long but we were seated in about 20 minutes. We were also able to get in for a couples massage at the Moana spa with only 30 minutes notice. They seemed to have a lot of availability despite some of the reviews. The spa was beautiful and the massage good (although probably not worth the almost $400 we spent for both of us). It was also a short scenic walk along the ocean to Whalers Village where we had lunch and shopped. The pool chairs did fill up quickly but we were able to get chairs on the grass overlooking the ocean which was probably a lot more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “The Tennis Program at the Hyatt Enhanced our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bethrgh
Reviews.Content: Frank Salvador and his staff ran excellent drills each weekday, with great tips for players of all levels. Frank also gave my daughter some private lessons, which she enjoyed and were well worth the money. Frank also arranged hitting partners for my daughter (a high-level junior player). All in all the tennis program was the icing on the cake for our family while on Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, we were expecting a nice experience at the Hyatt. As people who tend to be drawn to "off the beaten path places," we had no idea that we would end up enjoying it as much as we did. Most noteworthy... ROOM - Upgrading to the Ocean View room is worth it. We were blown away by our view of the ocean. Initially, we were apprehensive because we thought the room would be noisy (overlooking the pool, etc.). As it turned out, it was completely peaceful all the way around. SERVICE - The people at the hotel could not be any nicer. They were extremely friendly and attentive. We found ourselves commenting (often!) about how friendly - incredibly friendly - everyone was. GROUNDS - A short walk to visit nearby hotels will immediately clue you in that you've picked the best hotel in the area. The grounds are lush and varied. Speaking of the area... Like we did, you probably hear a lot about how over-crowded this stretch (Kaanapali) is. Again, we're not ones for crowds, but the area is truly beautiful and we didn't find it to be overly crowded. Don't let the location sway your decision. FITNESS - The fitness center is reasonably extensive, newer and large enough to accommodate the size of the hotel. You can run on the treadmill and look out onto the ocean. Very cool. MISC. - Self-park is free, Internet can be purchased in your room via T-Mobile. Breakfast lines got a little overbearing but moved quickly.

Reviews.Title: “We really did like the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: toujourstravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui for 10 days towards the end of March and overall were pleased with it. We've been to Maui a few times before but this was our first time staying at this property and were pleasantly surprised with how much we liked it. Our check-in was quick and easy. We pulled up to the driveway and valet takes your car and park it for free until you come back later after checking in to your room. Great touch. We had contacted the hotel prior to our arrival for some requests and thankful that was granted (otherwise would probably have started off the vacation on a cranky note :) Noticed we didn't get the shell lei that others were given upon arrival. I guess not a big deal but we like these little touches that seem inconsequential to some:-) ROOM - Our bellhop was friendly and informative. He went over our room, and even called front desk to lock up the mini-bar fridge for us. There are 2 fridges in the room, one that is stocked up and one empty. All we needed was the empty one, and with small children it's a good idea to lock up the mini-bar fridge. Our room was exactly as what we had booked - partial ocean view. It was located in the Lahaina tower and overlooked the luau area. Not the best view but not the worst either. Some have noted that the luau noise bothered them. It didn't bother us at all since it was over by about 8 or 8:30 pm. In fact, we sat out there for a few minutes to catch the show. The balcony of the room though was tight. Not a place where I would like to lounge and relax. The room itself was decent in size. Although, the Hyatt Waikiki room we had was larger which is surprising b/c space is more of an issue in the Waikiki hotels. We did like how we had a full size couch rather than the chair with ottoman as we had in Waikiki. The bathroom was indeed small as most people have mentioned on this site.
