The food was fresh and variety was good. We ordered lunch a couple of times from Umalu which was also very tasty - we were always able to get serviced at the pool rather quickly. The food is a bit pricey, but not much more than you'd expect at any resort. We split quesadillas for $13...plenty to feed two. It's really the drinks by the pool that will rack up - $12 for a pina colada, etc. We went to Safeway (2 miles away), and bought snacks and alcohol and it was the smartest thing we could have done! They also have happy hour specials at Umalu...appetizers for half off, drink specials, etc. It was a really great trip - the locals were very friendly and helpful to us and the walk to Whalers Village was great! Definitely snorkel down by the Sheraton. And if you have to be laying on the beach, this is not the hotel for you. The beach in front of the Hyatt is about 5' deep - down by Whalers Village it is larger and folks have chairs out. The only thing I didn't feel prepared for when I arrived was the WIND - it is fierce! Bring some paperweights with you to the pool (which is really great, and the slide is fun)!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The stay at hyatt was wonderful. The resort was beautifully maintained. The beach access wa a definite plus. The breakfast buffet was good too. The only one negative point I can think of is that the room bathroom was really small. Even a Best Western has a little more space in their bathrooms. Having said that, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The other amenities more than make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, As You Would Expect”
Reviews.Author: djkrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui for six nights during Thanksgiving Week. It is pretty much exactly what you would expect. It is a beautiful property, well maintained, with a friendly, helpful staff. We had a Deluxe Ocean View room which provided a beautiful view of Lanai, across the ocean and over the resort's pools. Our package included the breakfast buffet, which is outstanding and kept us full until dinner (but costs $30 if not included). The location is excellent, a 15 minute oceanfront walk to the shops and restaurants of Whaler's Village and a short drive (2.5 miles) to the shops and restaurants of Lahaina. On the downside, they really ought to include free wifi in the $15 per day Resort Fee. The self-park spaces (included in the Resort Fee) are very narrow. I never did figure out the towel process at the pool (towel cards that you turn in to get a towel, unless you want more than one towel in which case they put you on a list, and then...). And, of course, this place is pricy. I recognize that these are pretty insignifcant complaints (aside from the price) for an otherwise wonderful resort

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for first timers at Maui”
Reviews.Author: Sam20091000
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at Maui. Kay Ryan at MauiKay.com, our travel consultant, made all the arrangemnt at Hyatt. We had a wonderful experience at the pool, walking around the swan court, watching naughty (evil!) Penguins, and the 40 yr old parrot. Great location, very close Lahina (old town) and very courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: THis hotel suffers from what I call the "priceline phenomena". I did get the room on priceline. Kaanapali is very busy with many large hotels. It reminds me of some large resort areas in Mexico. Not really my idea of a restful vacation. The luau was awesome and worth every penny. They have recently reformatted it so do see it. The food at the luau was suprisingly good. The breakfast buffet was lousy. Take a walk to Whaler's Village and have breakfast there. The rooms were OK. The hotel is kept up as well as one could expect given its age and exposure to salty air. The workout room was very nice but it is irritating to have to pay a resort fee then another fee to access the spa...what is that? But the hotel seems in a bit of disprepair generally and I think this goes hand-in-hand with having to discount your rooms on priceline. Same goes for the Hyatt in Irvine, CA. Overall it is what I would expect from a priceline hotel. But I keep comparing it to one of my favorite hotels, the Hyatt on Kauai, and there is just no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AvidVacationer80
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Hyatt from Nov 10-16. This place was amazing. When we arrived, we received fresh Lei's and excellent service. We stayed on the 19th floor which had amazing views. The property was spacious and beautiful. The only 2 complaints I have is one, the restaraunt Umali (?) was incredibly expensive and the food was not that great and second, one of the ladies st the front desk (cannot remember her name) was pretty rude to us. We only saw her once and for avery short time frame. She worked late at night. Otherwise, everything was perfect. It was very close to the village of Lahaina, where there is so much to do and eat.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: jkauf1979
Reviews.Content: this hotel rocks. the staff was super friendly. they upgraded us from a parking lot view to a deluxe ocean front room for free. the ocean front rooms have a great view and a deck. the lobby is beautiful, they even have penguins hanging out. the have a great little mall with a macy's that has all the swim wear you could want. the only down side is they have a resort fee that is like 15-20 bucks a day that you have to take.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: JBPAlabama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon, in May, and stayed at the Hyatt in Maui. We found the town of Lahaina to be such a fun place to go and eat/ shop. Our favorite place was Penne Pasta, we ate there twice and it was amazing! It is on one of the side streets and it was in our GPS. I highly recommend Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Maui Hawaii Resort”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne72712
Reviews.Content: In June 2009, my brother, myself and my daughter stayed at the Hyatt Regency Resort & Spa at Lahaina HI (Maui). I considered it a pretty good deal. A weeks stay at a the Hyatt Resort in Maui with a partial ocean view, a rental car for the week, and breakfast for 2 each day.. All of this for the same price I paid for a resort in Orlando, FL with no breakfast and no car and no gorgeous beach view. I was very pleased with everything that week - the resort staff were awesome, the rooms were nice, the breakfast was fantastic. I loved just lounging around the pool in the evening with the cool breeze, listening to the live music with a Mai Tai in hand. It was a vacation of the soul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Better service!”
Reviews.Author: jojoP84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a convenient place to everything we wanted to do. The staff was helpful and friendly! Not to mention, the hotel itself was clean and pretty, but did not obstruct the beautiful views of the island, unlike many other hotels. We have since started comparing everywhere we stay to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationguro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days during our honeymoon and loved this hotel - from the decor, animals in the lobby, great staff and delicious food. We walked to the other hotels along the pathway and thought by far the Hyatt was the nicest. We enjoyed a couples massage and the spa which was the perfect way to end our trip. We were impressed with how good the food was for a hotel and ate most of our meals here. The staff was always nice and helpful. The hotel store is expensive so I would suggest getting snacks elsewhere. The pool is great and I liked that there was a separate kids section!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful 4 star hotel. loved the friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Ldfcpa
Reviews.Content: My hubbie and I, both in our late 30s with NO kids, stayed at the Hyatt the last week of Oct. I really enjoyed the friendly staff. Had a small upgrade from a non-view to the golf course/partial ocean view. That was a nice surprise. The staff were there to greet and meet our needs but never bothered us when we were relaxing. The interior is beautiful with it's naturscape design and the grounds are very well kept, including the pools. The only downside is the beach, beautiful but not great for sunbathing. HOWEVER, walk a few steps in either direction and you'll find wide stretches of sandy beach areas. If you enjoy jogging/walking, they have great concrete walkways that run the entire length of the beach area, which also will take you in front of the neighboring resorts. This is great for an early morning stroll. The food at the Hyatt is good. Nice breakfast buffet without the typical buffet crowds. Pricey but good. One tip, if laying poolside, order the firecracker chicken wrap (may want to share this. It's rather large). Anyways, it's very yummy! Regarding the ease of booking excursions: VERY EASY!! Again, loved the service and the friendly, yet non-pushy staff. We did serveral excusions but I highly recommend Captain Steve's snorkeling and the Volcano bike ride. Both were very well ran and offered small groups. I also recommend trying the Spa facilites. If you aren't in the mood for a full treatment, buy a day pass and enjoy the steam room, sauna or hot tub. It's great for the last day when you are waiting around for a late flight. It has a wonderful locker room so you can change right before you leave for the airport and soak up every last minute of relaxation! Overall, Hyatt Maui was exceptional. It meets the 4 star rating and then some. If you enjoy the luxury of a resort yet don't like the "cheesy" poolside games and springbreak crowds, the Hyatt may be for you. I know we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel~!”
Reviews.Author: sfuller111
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd vacation to Maui. Our first and second trip we booked our stay at the Westin, just up the beach. Our third time we decided to try a new spot... wish we had gone here all 3 times! The hotel is beautiful, friendly, fun, amazing food... we learned that unlike the Westin, you can stay on this property for all your meals! After trying many restaurants all around the Kaanapali and Lahaina area, we concluded that the Cascade Restaurant right in the Hyatt was the best! Their sushi rivaled any on the island, and the beach view at night is most romantic. Our kids ranging from 21 to 8 had a wonderful time. We all loved the pool, shops, friendly staff and especially loved that the jet skiing and the parasailing meets right at the beach at Hyatt! Our rooms were large and clean and the room service was always timely and courteous. We tipped our maids each day as it was a very humid week and they changed our sheets every day! 2 of our children were hesitant to go to the Camp Hyatt for kids, but after their first visit they wanted to go back almost every day! They really plan neat events for the kids and the crafts were very cool. I know we will be coming back to Maui again and again, and will not stay anywhere but the Hyatt!.

Reviews.Title: “7 Stays Here in 10 Years & Never Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: MauiMalihini
Reviews.Content: This past September was our 7th stay here and we have never been disappointed at this resort. The customer service is the best that we have experienced at any hotel in the world, being frequent travelers. Jennifer, the guest reception representative, was extra accomodating when she found out that we were there for our 25th anniversary and had a complimentary bottle of champagne delivered to our room. The rooms are decorated in a traditional Hawaiian theme and the beds are heavenly! The Deluxe Ocean Front room has a stunning view, and my favorite room by far. We have always had a clean room with plenty of towels and ammenities restocked daily and we ALWAYS tip our housekeepers for taking care of our needs. The property is exceptional and kept pristine. It is always fun to watch the groundskeepers climb and trim the palm trees! Since our first visit 10 years ago, we have witnessed the beach erosion but that is no fault of the Hyatt Resort's but nature itself. The Hyatt has plenty of pool area and beach front property to compensate and is a fabulous place to relax and watch the whales during whale season (which we have witnessed on 3 of our Spring Break trips to Maui.) Also the bigger beach area is only a short walk north. The Hyatt Resort has come up with a brilliant Towel Exchange Program which we love! In the past, guests would put their towels down to "save" lounge chairs while they swam or got refreshments; however, they never picked them up at the end of their poolside visit so one never knew whether the chairs were still occupied or not. Now each guest upon arrival at the resort receives Towel Exchange Cards in order to pick up beach towels. When your day at the pool or beach concludes, you must turn in your towels to get Towel Exchange Cards for the next day. Now if you see a towel on a chair, you know that a guest is occupying it for that time, because no one leaves without getting their Towel Exchange Cards back. Kudos to whoever solved that problem of inconsiderate people leaving the towels behind and causing confusion for other guests! The new Umalu restaurant and bar is a major improvement for those of us who enjoy the live entertainment in the evenings. (Only wish the entertainers would perform a little later in the evenings though. I think they end at 9:00 maybe.) The bartenders are fun and serve some great drinks! The breakfast buffet in Swan Court is still as exceptional as always, with a vast array of warm and cold buffet items along with an Omelet Chef. Self-parking gets quite crowded in peak season so plan accordingly. The valet desk is always helpful in calling for taxis and will have one arriving for you in a matter of a couple of minutes. The Hyatt Maui Resort has always been a superb experience for us and we look forward to returning in 8 weeks with our family!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Wrigley J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for eight nights. The bed was comfortable and room had a 37" LG flat screen, but the furniture and bath area was pretty dated. The lobby, pool and grounds are beautiful. Half the pool is 6'-9' deep so it doesn't get crowded with a lot of people standing around in the water. Had dinner at Son'z that was fantastic ($150). Good location since it's close to town and also with the river walk right next to the pool. Keep valuables away from the pool and beach. Another couple we spoke to got their wallets stolen on the first day while in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and grounds....but”
Reviews.Author: kev'n'JJ
Reviews.Content: After reading a mixed bag of comments, I couldn't agree more that the hotel is in a fabulous location and the grounds are beautiful. The rooms, we had a full ocean view and on the positive side this was lovely. On the negative, the rooms and bathroom are very outdated and not particularly cleaned that well. This did not ruin by any way the holiday as we were never going to be sitting in the room all day! The Sushi bar was not very nice, but the buffet breakfast was good, excellent range of all sorts of food. The pool areas are lovely, a little crowded at times and was very annoying to watch people bag a chair with a towel and then disappear for hours whilst others didn't have a seat. Didn't go to the Luau Show in the hotel, the venue for it looked a little disappointing and there was not a pig in the ground to be seen!!! I think the hotel thrives on it's reputation and location, personally I would not stay here again unless it had a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: clubcar165
Reviews.Content: It's been over 5 years since my last visit to the Hyatt Maui, It was a great property then and still is. The facility is outstanding, I don't understand the petty complaints of the property, it's not a condo but a hotel and the rooms are very accommodating My wife and I travel extensively and this property is very good. Travelers need to understand you are the customer, if your not happy with the room or the view ask for another. The restaurants on the facility are quite good. We never had a problem with pool lounge chairs but I did see a couple of travelers out early in the morning staking out locations. If your a Costco member look for specials; airfare, breakfast, ocean view, resort fee, resort credits of $150.00, and 2 for 1 luau from Los Angeles $2850.00.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Days in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ju-jubes
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel accomodation of our 3-Hawaiian Isand adventure. In terms of the room, it was quite standard. Nothing stood out in a bad way so that's a good sign. The hotel itself was quite impressive. Colorful birds, penguins & flowers everywhere you walked. It was definitely a treat for the eyes. We didn't get a chance to canoodle at the pool as we were set on heading out to the beaches but the pool was nice enough, towel exchange was present, etc. There was a mandatory resort fee (about $20) that gave you access to their fitness center and towel exchange for the pool. The gym was quite nice but do go out for a morning job along the beach (something I wish I put in time for). The only real complaint I had with the "hotel" was one valet parking attendant who seemed to really hate her job. It showed and wasn't a very appealing interaction for us (travellers who expected pleasant and friendly?). Aside from that, the hotel delivered in what was expected from the glitz of Hawaii to the simplicity of stolen moments for lovers. I'd recommend it for those looking for a "nice hotel". Side note: the spa shampoo and lotion they supplied for the rooms was aromatically delicious. It kept my skin feeling nice, soft and the lingering smell of mango was truly decadent.

Reviews.Title: “Most spectacular location & lobby ever”
Reviews.Author: M-Deutsch
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for us to this fabulous hotel. The location is great and the pool, spa & grounds are spectacular. It seemed to us that the focus on service had worsened some. The room was great with a private balcony overlooking the Pacific & walk-in closet as well as great bathroom. It was cleaned well & promptly each day. You could spend your whole time at the resort and feel like you had a great getaway, but it also is in a great location to explore most all of Maui. The concierge helped us locate good activties as well as great food. In general, you can't beat this as a spot for a pampered & fun vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but read about pool issues”
Reviews.Author: DMPCanton_MI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, would definitely stay there again. Gorgeous lobby and grounds, great rooms, clean, good service, although the bathroom/shower is a little small and outdated. We were on our honeymoon and got complimentary champagne when we mentioned it. Two things to consider. First, they have a kiddie pool and adult pool, however there were tons of kids in the adult pool, which isn't a big deal however it does affect peace and quite etc at times. Second, guests put their towels on the pool chairs early in the AM and leave back for their rooms, even though there is a 60 minute limit to unoccupied chairs. This is never enforced so it difficult to find space at the pool even if you arrive early. You can't find a chair, but there are lots of towels, sandles and books gettting lots of sun instead of you!! Finally, great breakfast buffet, definitely pay the extra for the room to include this breakfast (free daily vs $30 per person otherwise!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: hdembski
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best Resorts on Maui save for the Ritz Carlton. Gorgeous grounds, lobby, pool, near the Ocean. I had partial ocean view, spectacular, be awakened to tropical birds and the pounding surf. Deals can't be beat such as third night free and get the breakfast included, great breakfast buffett, you won't need to eat lunch. For activities use the expedia folks, very helpfull. Just go here and you won't want to go anywhere else. I stayed at the Outrigger in Oahu and it made that place look like a dump

Reviews.Title: “holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: globetrottersLeeds
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a warm welcome. The staff were friendly and efficient, we were able to go to our room when we arrived. The pool was awesome with waterfalls and interconnected parts where the children could play but quite separate from the adults, if that was your wish. The gardens in this hotel were outstanding particularly the oriental garden where flamingoes and swans were a joy to watch. Swan Court was a beautiful venue for breakfast where we enjoyed sampling the large choice of options available. The staff could not have worked harder to make our stay enjoyable and restful. Be prepared to pay quite alot for meals and drinks, as you would expect from this above average resort. Breakfast cost 30 dollars plus tip. Two drinks at the pool could cost 24 dollars plus tips. Our only disappointment was when we booked a table at the Sushi Restaurant. We arrived ( according to the staff) ten and a half minutes early !!! and told to wait elswhere. This was rude and unacceptable. We got our table twenty minutes late but the food proved to be wonderful. This was one lady having a bad day I guess. All in all this was an absolutely wonderful holiday the best part was the parrots talking to you as you passed by and all the birds, penguins. Just one tip DONT TOUCH THE MINI BAR!!!! If you pick it up for a few seconds you are charged..

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel......Location......wow!”
Reviews.Author: jorjess
Reviews.Content: This was the end of our trip so we decided to spend a bit more. It was expensive, very expensive, but you got what you paid for. The layout and grounds are nothing short of magnificent. Pools.....waterslide......grounds....etc. The staff were all eager to help and friendly. I recommend asking for the upgrade to the top floor where breakfast, drinks, hors douvres and supper were included. It was well worth the extra and the staff that served you were fantastic and family friendly. If I had the money I would stay there as often as I could!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Napili tower stinks of smoke”
Reviews.Author: Kailuagrinds
Reviews.Content: Before you book- Napili tower is smoking and Lahaina tower is non smoking. We were booked in the Napili tower by mistake - I should"ve known because when we got in the elevators, the smell was of vomit, smoke and dirty feet- disgusting- when we got to our room it stunk of smoke. The staff graciously moved us to the Lahaina tower where we had a lovely 5 days. Bathrooms need an upgrade- tub drained very slowly, water pressure poor. Be aware- the little tray of goodies is on a 8 second delay- so if you pick one up you will be charged for the item- ( $3 for M/M's). One place to eat bfast- very pricey- go venture out for a cheaper bfast. Staff was nice- lots of aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for relaxed holiday”
Reviews.Author: jojo2128
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 21-30 Sept for the second part of our trip (and our honeymoon) to Hawaii, having arrived from Halekulani Hotel in Waikiki on Oahu. We knew not to expect the same standard of hotel and quality as the Halekulani and so we beared this in mind when we arrived. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a gorgeous lobby with parrots, penguins and tropical fish and were truly stunned. However at check in, they had us booked in for a room with two double beds - not really necessary since we were on our honeymoon. Once this was sorted out, we were offered an upgrade to an ocean view room and given our leis as well as a voucher for our celebratory champagne. The porter who took us to our room was very helpful and told us of things to do around Ka'anaplili as well as in the hotel. The room itself was a little disappointing - mainly due to the bathroom, which is tiny! And the hairs that we found in the bath tub were very disconcerting, but this was the only time this happened during our stay. The dressing area was nice and spacious and the walk in wardrobe and the complimentary safe was a nice touch, as was the fridge for us to store our drinks and light snacks. The bed was very comfortable and we had absolutley no problemsd with insects etc and the lounge area was also comfortable with a large flat screen TV. The view was the best part of this room, despite the disappointingly small lanai with its tiny chairs and table. We were able to look down at the lush greenery and flamingos whilst also watching sunset every evening from there. The hotel itself was nice, and the surroundings lovely, the penguins (especially the baby penguin) were always a joy to watch. At the poolside we were always able to get chairs and it was a bit tiresome having to wear the wristbands everyday, but I usually took mine off if I wasn't going down the slide that day. The poolside itslef is very fun with waterfalls and the slide was scary at first but much fun thereafter! Kids will definitley be entertained. We ate Sonz every morning as breakfast was included in our package and the food was nice, the omelttes were made to order and always very tasty. The selection overall was varied and there was always something for everyone. Yes there are numerous birds but my husband and I used to alternate going to the buffet so that the birds wouldnt land on our table and start eating at the remains. We ate there twice in the evening and it was nice to see a server from the UK whom we talked to for a while and she gave us great tips on what to do and where to go. Umalu was probably our favourite place to eat by far. The quesadillas were delicious and the cocktails were all well prepared and moresome. The bar at Umalu was also our preferred place to have drinks in the evening and the bar staff were always great to talk to. We even got a complimentary drink on our last drink. On our last night we went to see the Cirque Polynesia show and this was a brilliant show. My husband even got himself up on the stage playing the drums. The only issue I have with the hotel is the size of the bathroom, the tub was small and you were always squeezed in there. Yes the decor could do with updating but it wasn't a real problem as the room itself was a nice size. The only reason I would not return to this hotel is beacsue the resort itslef is very quiet. You can get a free shuttle to Whalers Village but it is just as easy to walk (as we always did) and there are frequent buses to Lahaina until 8.45pm, but we didn't go there much as we preferred the restaurants around the resort area.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel. Bad honemoon hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beth5496
Reviews.Content: Just like the Hyatt in Kauai, we were disappointed with the Hyatt in Maui. The location was reminiscent of a strip of hotels on Myrtle Beach or Miami. The beach at the hotel is nice but you can't really walk in it bc of sharp rocks. There isn't much sand to sit on either. Pool is neat but there are children everywhere. Even in late September, we were inundated with families and small children. This hotel had only one hot tub and no "adults only" section. There were kids in the hot tub along with other honeymooners who looked so annoyed and most got out after a couple minutes of small kids with their clueless parents splashing about. Not very honeymoon-esque. The only place to have adults-only kind of romance and relaxation is the room, so why spend $500 per night?? The hotel reception area and lobby feel like a time warp. It's just a little strange and hard to describe, but I did enjoy the parrots, penguins and flamingos walking about on the grounds. Parking is a pain, too. The lot is close enough to the reception area so we opted to self-park and save ourselves $10/night, but the spaces are so narrow and there are so many cars taking up 2 spots so one night we had no choice but to valet. We had a pretty good room on the 19th floor overlooking the beach. On a nightly and sometimes daily basis, we had hte displeasure of having our room fill up wiht cigar smoke from a nearby room, so we had to close our 2 patio doors. Not cool. When we called the front desk to complain, they said they'd "look into it" since it's a non-smoking hotel, but the cigar smoke was there every day and night. Thanks to our rude neighbor for ruining our delightful Hawaiian air! The restaurant, Sonz at Swan Court was REALLY good. Delicious, quiet dinner and good service. They have the breakfast buffet in that same restaurant in the morning, and it's pretty good, but they need to offer more variety day-to-day for the folks who are there for more than a night or two. Get your snorkel gear off the resort property. We were fools and paid $20/day EACH for snorkle gear -- the same stuff that local places charge $5/day for. You have to go up to Black Rock Beach at the Sheraton to get good snorkeling near the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui”
Reviews.Author: bonitafamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean. Good location. Rooms could use an update. Pools were large and did not seem crowded even though it was Spring Break. Food and beverage selection were good near pool. Great take out selection. Buffet breakfast was included with room. It would have been pricey for the selection if it had not been included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery but Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishys
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights in Honolulu (great) we checked into the Hyatt Regency Maui as the 2nd leg of a Perillo Tour. On first sight, the place was beautiful. Seeing the ocean right as we stood in the open air lobby was impressive. The landscaping was beautiful - lush plants, birds, penguins, cranes all on the grounds. Then we tried to check in. Even though we arrived after the 3 PM check in time, our room wasn't ready. So we milled about while the others on our tour went to their rooms. When the room was finally ready, I was disappointed to see such a small room - a couch, desk, platform bead, dresser with TV on top. The bathroom set up was awkwardly small. I didn't get the sense that it was all that clean as well and while we didn't see cockroaches others in our tour group did!!! Our room was suppose to be "ocean view" you had to stand on the balcony and stretch your neck to see a glimpse of the ocean through the lush greenery. The pool was huge and we were able to get chairs without a problem and the set up seemed to keep small children away from the couples traveling without kids (nice!). The first night we had a dinner reservation at Cascades (on the premises). We arrived 5 minutes before our time and were told there'd be a 15 minute wait. We sat and watched as people without reservations were told the same thing! Then, they were seated before us. The food was unremarkable and the service was slow. The second night we went to the Luau on the grounds - an ok dinner show but the food was fair. We were packed in so tight at the tables, it was hard to get up & down. (There were approximately 350 - 400 people at this thing). Breakfast every day was at Swans Court. The buffet was large, but there wasn't one day (of 3) where there were waffles/pancakes available. They ran out every day! The other thing was the birds that flew in and out of the restaurant constantly. The staff tried to shoo them away, but they'd land on tables, chairs, plates(!) continuously. If they landed on your plate the staff took the plate away, and back to the buffet you'd go. No wonder they'd run out of food. We were suppose to receive a bottle of champagne for our anniversary on the first night. We got it (only after our tour guide inquired about it) on our last night. There is no beach to speak of - just a small strip of sand just beyond the pool. If you walk down the path a bit, you'll get to a bigger patch of sand where they rent jet ski's and other water sports. The scenery around this hotel is really beautiful, but I'm sure there are hotels where you'd get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I had imagined”
Reviews.Author: LandlockedN
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a Maui Hotel that had a great location and just the right amount of amenities. I wasn't interested in paying for "show," but I didn't want to feel like I'd missed something either. Who knows, this could be my only trip to Maui. We wanted to relax, be treated well, and get a feel for the Maui experience without spending more than necessary. We also wanted to be close to the "off-campus" things we wanted to do (sa. scuba diving.) We were blown away. This "campus" has enough going on that you could stay on site and be entertained for weeks! But, it's still understated, elegant, and serene. You can walk to other hotels/restaurants/entertainment along the river walk, take part in the Cirque show, shop, drink mai tais in the lagoon-style pool, stroll (my favorite) through the bird sanctuary/gardens, hang on the beach,..... and much more. Or, just be at peace with the beautiful scenery, ocean breezes, and room service, all at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious living!”
Reviews.Author: OregonCoastFanatic
Reviews.Content: Using our points we stayed 6 days and the staff graciously gave us a room facing the ocean when my husband said his wife would sure enjoy that. The only drawback was the bed. Mattress felt like a board on a box spring (no give for the hips, rock hard but not in a good supportive way). The service was impeccable, breakfasts in the club room were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Two_Travel_Bugs_WI
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to Hawaii for our honeymoon in June of 2008. We stayed at The Hyatt Regency Maui for about a week, and it was the most glorious week of our lives. True, we were living off the high of marrying our best friend, but the Hyatt certainly kept the sentiment going! Beautiful, clean, spacious rooms with gorgeous ocean views. Amazing gardens and grounds. Lovely pool. Great beachside cabanas to rent for the day. The restaurants were GREAT. We at at the resort nearly every night, not really finding a reason to leave the luxury we had there. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, especially with booking tours or getting recommendations for things to do. I highly recommend this resort to anyone, but especially those looking for a romantic paradise in amazing Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort in the Heart of Kaanapali Beach!”
Reviews.Author: TwinDaddy69
Reviews.Content: This Resort has it all: pools (with waterslide and waterfalls); gourmet restaurants; beautiful gardens; exotic animals (including penguins!); luxury spa; oceanfront with sand; proximity to both the heart of Kaanapali Beach and Lahaina. We went on the Family Vacation Package which included daily buffet breakfast for all 4 of us in the Swan Court Dining room, $150 dining credit, kids eat free with paying adults at most restaurants, and 7th night free! We took full advantage and ate most of our meals at the hotel--a great savings!

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: esayasene
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel at an okay location. It is located right on the beach but not much of a beach there. I was a little dissapointed with the lack of employees there. For a hotel rated 4-5 stars, I expected better service. I found myself standing at the front desk waiting at times because no one was there. The hotel has a big pool split by a cave with waterfalls that you can swim through. They even have slides. The downfall is that they make you use towel cards to get towels. You can't have more than one. If you fail to return your towel card, they will charge you $25 for each. I think thats a little ghetto. There was only one server out at the pool taking orders. I was a little annoyed with Hyatt Vacations, they told me that daily breakfast was included which wasn't. On the first morning, I spent half an hour talking to 3 different people to fix the error. They even had to call me back to give me a response to the issue. The food there was average, nothing fantastic. I had better food outside the hotel. Make sure you rent a car for Maui. It's really easy to get around. Nothing is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value, honeymoon factory”
Reviews.Author: truthteller_9
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. We stayed here on our honeymoon for a week and found ourselves standing in line for checking in, queueing every morning to be seated for breakfast, dismissive staff, tagged every morning for use of the pool, hundreds of people, mediocre rooms and what I will remember forever is the bird droppings everywhere! The breakfast room and all the dining rooms are open air so everywhere you sit there are bird droppings! Watch the backs of the chairs!. It puts you off your food. There are literally hundreds of people here and you're treated like a number. There are copious amounts of food here for breakfast and lunch and dinner portions are huge but although it looks good there is little or no flavour due to poor quality ingredients -fruit and veg with no flavour. Meals are expensive too. Also there is a daily charge for parking and gym whether you use them or not. There is no luxury and its not a romantic place, I was very happy to be leaving after a week, in fact I couldn't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Would have never stayed here had I known....”
Reviews.Author: meri7681
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not worth the money..the only thing going for it was location. I cannot believe they classify themselves as a hyatt!! If you close your shades you would have thought you were in some broken down travelodge. We had mold on our walls, pubic hair on the toilet seat, and saw many a cockroach..ewww. Anyway we were on our honeymoon, and when I opened the hotel room I actually cried. We checked out a few days later, and that was only because we had prebooked activities in the area. The all included breakfast buffet...more than once we went down to find that there were empty servers, and when coffee was being pured out a carafe there was about an inch of dust on the top..Call me picky but we were spending a lot of money for this!! When we called our travel agebt she was apologetic and we got a cll from the resort manager to meet her downstairs to talk about it. We found her and she listened for about 30 seconds before telling us she "had to run, she was late for a meeting". We were here for our honeymoon and were quite dissapointed. Not to mention we never "collected" out bottle of champagne that we had to first go get our coupon for and order dinner first because " it just worked better for them this way": Whatever, this place is a dump and I wouldnt recommend it to anyone for the money. We checked out stayed in the Htel Hana Maui and the Four Seasons, and we enjoed our honeymoon the way it should have been... Please take my advice, dont stay here..enjoy your time elsewhere, they will just treat you like you are a room #... and I promise I am not a picky person, this place is gross...

Reviews.Title: “Beauty all must see.”
Reviews.Author: tccw
Reviews.Content: First of all having breakfast ask for Esther she is a great server. The staff are very informitive and friendly. All the rooms are as clean as can be. The shows at the hotel were great. Room for everyone at the pool. Ask before you go to shows though cameras may not be allowed and it is not on all brochures. Pleasant Holidays booked a lot of our excursions and they are also on site at the hotel. You won't be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyKimSL
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Maui was exactly what we expected. Upon check in, they immediately acknowledged that we were honeymooners, chatted with us about the wedding and our trip, and promptly upgraded our room. The staff was very attentive and seemed to be genuinely interested in fulfilling our needs. The grounds were gorgeous! Penguins, swans, flamingos and birdsâ€¦it was a tropical paradise. The pool was huge with plenty of lounge chairs. There were lots of chairs that were already claimed, but we never had a problem getting two together. The water slide is awesomeâ€¦definitely not just for kids! The grotto was pretty cool with a bar and TVs. The beach at this specific hotel isnâ€™t good for swimming or laying out, but walk a little way and youâ€™ll find what youâ€™re looking for. The snorkeling at Black Rock is awesome! The rooms were nice. The beds and pillows were so very comfortable! The bathrooms are very small (standard bathtub and toilet in the same little room), but the vanity area is certainly comfortable for two. If youâ€™re looking for a garden tub with a separate shower, this isnâ€™t the hotel for you. If you donâ€™t mind sacrificing that one little thing (which I did), I think youâ€™ll be happy! All in all, though, we had no problem with the room. The food was great, but expensive. We had complimentary breakfast, which I would strongly recommend (for two of us, breakfast would have been $60 per day). The breakfast buffet was fantastic! Anything you could think of was available to you and all of it was delicious! Lunch and dinner at Umalu and the other restaurants was pricey, but I would recommend the Furikake Stix as a snack. Theyâ€™re awesome! Things you definitely want to try: MauiDownhill bike tour to Haleakala, Cool Cat CafÃ© for some great burgers and the Luau. We went snorkeling on our own and saw great things at Black Rock. Our honeymoon was absolutely perfect and the hotel amenities and staff played a large part in our satisfaction. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This review is for Åªmalu - It's great!”
Reviews.Author: Sonomamon
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Hyatt, so Åªmalu was very convenient. They give you lots of food for your money, and it's good food! The Kuala Pork Quesadilla was great! The onion rings are excellent. I ordered the chicken nuggets and fries and got about a dozen tasty chicken nuggets on a mountain of fries. My wife enjoyed the Grilled Mahi Ceasar Salad with Anchovies (and she doesn't even usually like anchovies). She said they were the freshest ever. The pizza was also very good (and filling). The service is very good, and they have live music every night. The drinks are also good. Try the Landslide! The Banana Martini is very good. As is the Mango special they had for $8. The Mango Dream was ok, but heavier. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds amazing, room was just okay”
Reviews.Author: mor6an
Reviews.Content: WHen you pull up to the hotel it is BEAUTIFUL. Everything about the grounds is amazing and it is well taken care of. There are store that are open late so if you forget anything you can always walk around in the lobby and buy stuff. There is also a MACY's in the lobby. If you are interested laying on the beach... NOT POSSIBLE here with a beach chair. the water is so rough and the waves hit almost right where the tiny sand beach is. YOu can put a towel down but no beach chairs. The water is NOT calm nor is it a place where you can take a dip- pool only at this hotel. Our room was just okay..... It was our honeymoon so I would have liked something a little better. We also stayed in Kauai at the HYatt which was about 100% better than this hotel. I"m not really all that picky when it comes to hotel rooms since we really don't spend all that much time in the room but I was very disappointed for the $. It definitely needs a renovation. The bathroom (toilet and shower) were literally on top of each other which was awkward trying to get out of the shower and getting out of the bathroom you had to squeeze to open the door past the toilet. There were ants in our room- a lot of them. We didn't complain so I'm not sure what they would have done about it. I jsut didn't really care all that much but if I saw them near the bed I woudl have. Not sure how you get aunts on the 11th floor? The bar next to the pool is really cool and they have live music playing during the week. We sat at the bar a lot. they make the best Lava Flows ever. Also, the location of this hotel was good. We rented a car which is greatly recommend to everyone and the town of Laheina (sp?) is only about a 3 min drive. It's adorable and so much to do including food, drinks, clothes, etc. For the money, the Sheraton which we walked past looked much nicer but I didn't see the rooms. They have a much nicer beach where they sell snorkeling gear at black rock. If we ever make it back we will go to the sheraton or stay in the town on Laheina. THe spa is VERY ncie here but it's on the other side of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: jc11235
Reviews.Content: We got a tremendous deal at the Hyatt. I was going to bid on priceline, but then found a deal on the website which was almost as good, so I went with that to be sure of getting this hotel as we have always had great experiences with Hyatt. The lobby was stunning with all the wildlife â€“ there were always people stopped by the penguins â€“ the kids loved them! There were also some nice shops in the lobby. The grounds were spectacular with flamingos etc. Checkin was fine, and as a Gold Passport member our 2 rooms were upgraded to a 2 bedroom Ocean front suite. We had a tremendous view of Kaanapali beach, and at night were lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves on the beachâ€¦..awesome!! The suite was very comfortable â€“ I had been a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. It was a decent size â€“ our 2 bed suite was essentially a one bedroom suite and a communicating room, where you had a single â€œfront doorâ€�. Furnishings were nice and fresh. There was an empty refridgerator for our drinks. Large flat screen TVs. As others have said there is a tray of chocolates left out with a motion sensor. We moved something by mistake, and got charged for it â€“ but they promptly refunded the charge. (I suggest you ask the staff to remove it if you are not intending using it). Bathrooms were fine but the plastic shower curtain somehow cheapened them! Large walk in closet. Lovely coco mango toiletries. The pool area was very crowded. Not the pool itself, but the chairs. They were packed VERY close together, and had towels draped on them by 8-9am. Many of those chairs were then not used all morning â€“ the pool staff were to busy! When we arrived at the pool early afternoon, we were able to get a cabana for $25, as all the chairs were all â€œtakenâ€�, though quite often all the cabanas got booked. They are right at the waterâ€™s edge and have a glorious view. There are also 2 Ocean Hales which you can rent for $250 for the day â€“ away from the crowds, and they provide a coolbox with fruit and water and loads of extra towels. We liked the restaurants there. Breakfast at Swan Court was tremendous â€“ fantastic choice at the buffet. We ate at both Cascades and Sonz â€“ they were really excellent â€“ both food and service! We tried room service one evening which was very prompt and nicely presented, reasonable selection of food was served hot! We were less impressed with the casual dining options â€“ left waiting over 20 minutes at Cascades Grill and then served some inedible food by staff who were totally indifferent to what they were doing. We also used the Regency Club â€“ nice breakfast there, not as varied as at Swan Court but good nonetheless. Also snacks at other times, not really enough to replace a meal, but enough to keep you going. Front desk staff/concierges all very helpful and professional. We went for valet parking, and it was well worth it â€“ it was very efficient and we never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes for our car. We also did the â€œTour of the Skiesâ€� where you are taken to the roof of the hotel to look through three telescopes. I was disappointed with the â€œastronomerâ€� who was not especially knowledgeable. He was also cranky, and impatient with the childrenâ€™s questions. The telescopes themselves were impressive, and the tour was still well worth doing given how clear the skies are in Hawaii. The hotel was crowded as it was peak season, but we still really enjoyed our time there. My only criticism is that a number of staff donâ€™t seem to realise they were working in a top hotel. DH and I were walking through the lobby one evening and a porter with an empty luggage cart was walking towards us - rather than go to one side he carried on straight at us and we both had to step out of his way â€“ minor details like this reminded us it wasnâ€™t a 5 star hotel. A nice family hotel, the lack of beach isnâ€™t a problem as it is not far to walk to one. Regency Club was nice, but not sure I would pay extra for it. The smarter restaurants on site were really excellent, less impressed with the casual dining options. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: khanebutt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hyatt for our honeymoon! It was so great. We loved the pool! It was so big and beautiful and spacious! The flowers were gorgeous! We loved the cave swim up bar! The food was wonderful and we loved the transportaion that took us to town!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: Griswalds4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, 2 young children & our 7 month old baby in May this year and i honestly could not fault it. Our room was spacious, well appointed with quality fittings, the king size bed was beautiful and one of the most comfortable i had ever slept in. The staff were very helpful, friendly & accommodating. We asked to move to a ground floor room and this request was met with no fuss at all. The grounds of the hotel are huge and quite stunning, the bird life is quite special and the children LOVED it. Ditto the kids pool area with water slides, water falls and toddler pool. If you are looking for a great hotel for children AND adults then i really would recommend the Hyatt. Location is perfect, right on the beach, amazing sunsets, nice stroll to local restaurants and The Whalers Village for a bit of retail therapy. For dinner we loved Leilani's & The Hula Grill. Lunch at the Hyatt was good too, try the Umalas grill, again cant fault it. Overall we loved the traditional style of the Hyatt, lots of solid wood, perfect lawns, plant life and an amazing art collection. By the way if you are like me and you have young children and the thought of high rise is too scary then request a ground floor room in the Terrace wing. This was perfect for us, not stressful and room for kids to run around on the lawns directly in front of the rooms. There's a kids club too. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: future5s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Maui and it was simply amazing. We booked our vacation through our travel agent and could not have been happier! Upon arrival we were greeted with 2 fresh flower leis, a complementary bottle of champagne & a keepsake photo ablum. The entire staff from the front desk clerks to the waitresses pool side was extremely friendly and accomodiating, none of our needs went unmet. The grounds are breathtaking and the hotel ammenities unmatched. A bonus perk at this hotel was the in house Expedia represenatives office located just down the hallway from the main lobby. We were able to book a ton of adventerous & relaxing excursions right from our hotel. My husband and I booked a helicopter ride, The Road to Hana tour, snorkling, mountain biking, zipplining and hiking - each tour included lunch and most picked us up right at the hotel. We also enjoyed a couples massage in the ocean side cabanas that was the perfect way to end our vacation. Although the room was a tad small for such an extended vacation, we didn't mind since we were out and about enjoying all Hawaii has to offer most of the time. We had dinner at 3 of the on site restaurants, each with a differnty style cuisine that was mouthwatering! We couldn't have been happier with our choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get the right room”
Reviews.Author: belllyjean
Reviews.Content: My husband and booked this hotel through our travel agent 10 months in advance we had a reservation from a partial ocean view to an ocean view...or something like that. When we checked in (after a really long flight full of honeymooners) the hotel didn't have our room right as our travel agent had made a mistake in booking. The staff was not helpful with this one bit and couldn't care less that this was wrong. They treated us like we were trying to trick them out of a room. The lady finally said they would put us in the same view room but with 2 beds, not the king we booked, as they had to save those for the people who had actually booked them (oh, you mean like us????) When we checked into the room we were really disappointed in the accomodations. It was just you're generic hotel room with 2 crummy beds and an Ok view of the far away beach but mostly the gardens below. Our hearts sank as we wondered if the trip we'd been planning for over a year was being ruined from the start. We spent the first day calling the travel agent, and talking with the manager of the hotel who finally agreed to hold a room with a king sized bed for us the next day (as they had already checked in all those rooms). So we stayed packed and upset that first day and had to stay out the next morning until 3pm when they had our real room ready and WOW, what a difference that made. The room with the king sized bed had a much better feel, even though the room size was the same you just had way more room and a little sofa and table in there. The view was amazing from the opposite tower. You could see the entire ocean, hotel grounds and the mountains. We spent lots of time on the balacony enjoying it all. We had breakfast buffet included in our package and that's the only was I would actually use the buffet. It was really good, lots of variety and well stocked and maintained but really overpriced for $30 each. Maybe splurge one day but find somewhere else the rest. It did seem like most people had it included though as it was pretty busy. They did get you seated fairly quickly and the location was beautiful, right on the pond with swans swimming around and birds flying all over the place. The staff wasn't overly friendly here and service was lacking and we were always left wondering do you tip during a buffet? The beach was our next stop but the beach infront of the hotel we were told in "non-swimmable" though we did see some people in there. There is a reef that runs right along the front with keeps you out of it for the most part and at times there is not sandy beach area there and the waves were kind of rough in that area. We went knowing this so it wasn't a big surprise for us. So we walked down awhile until we found nice sandy area. The only problem is that you have no chairs to use then. I don't know if the other hotels would rent to you or not, we didn't try to find out. Sitting on the sand with just the towel was hard in some spots because the wind blows the sand right onto you, like being sandblasted. We walked down to black rock usually (near the sheraton) and the wind wasn't a problem there and the snorkeling was the best there. After that we tried the pool, but good luck finding a chair. Very little shade available and even fewer chairs. I think my Ymca has more chairs around their pool. When someone finally would get up we'd hover over them until they left. Pool service was lousy if you can even get the ONE server to come over to you. We waited one hour one day and she never came over to us. Once we did get her attention the food and drinks were good but overpriced but who cares when your sitting in the sun. They do have someone coming around with free ice pops and cold towels so that was really nice. The pool itself is realy nice and not very crowded (makes you wonder where all those people who have their towels on the chairs are) Deep in some places and shallow in others. The do have a bar in the pool but it's not a swim up bar, you have to walk around to it in the pool. The slide is super fast and a little scary because it's in the dark. The pool itself is open until 11pm but we never saw anyone in it after 7pm, always meant to go but just ran out of time. We did eat dinner one night at the hotel and it was pretty good though expensive. The staff was very friendly there. I found the men on staff at the hotel all to be very helpful and attentive but the women all seemed to have a chip on their shoulder for some reason. There were alot of honeymooners there and I felt like that's who they really cater too. At times I felt like just another number the staff had to deal with. The truth is anyone going to Hawaii is going for some special reason or another and should be treated that way. All in all, this was a pretty nice hotel, the room was nice and quiet and had a great view, the cleaning staff always seemed friendly and left us fresh towels, extra shampoo, body wash and lotion. There are also lots of shops on the main level with everything from childrens items to bathing suits, gifts, postcards anything you might need, though bring lot so suntan lotion as they charge twice what it cost everywhere else! You really have no need to leave the hotel, but you will, there is so much to do there!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Quality- BIG TIME”
Reviews.Author: MCTravellers23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at MANY hotels of varying types and not have led me to be more disappointed then this one. The grounds are AMAZING and the staff is very pleasant and friendly! However, we went here for our honeymoon and we checked out the same day as we checked in due to the quality of the rooms. We were shown three different room with the same results! They were dirty, dusty, and run down. In addition, decor wise it is very old and motel-like and very dark. We just couldn't bring ourselves to stay there under those conditions on our honeymoon. We are not picky hotel stayers and we really found this one under par! The grounds, i believe, give it the rating of 4 stars but we do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Hotels in Wailea are worth the $$ (that's where we ended up going and losing out on the money we put down on the Hyatt unfortunately(

Reviews.Title: “rooms need refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: foodnfinance
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting this hotel on Kaanapali beach for over 15 years. We love the ppol and the location. The last few visits have been increasingly disappointing. First they shut down the upper nice semi indoor lunch area. They don't have enough coverd chairs, so if you want shade you better reserve your spot by 7:30 am. What disappointed us the most however was the condition of the rooms. We had to change rooms each of the last 2 years. Last year it was ants and noisy plumbing. This year the sliding door wouldn't open and the condition of the room overall was poor. The faucet semi operational, one phone broken etc. This resort need to shut down and refurbish and redecorate all the rooms, its just been way too long. ( especially for these prices! )

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: xizziz
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Orbitz. We booked a deluxe ocean view, which showed full view of the ocean in front of our room. This room was like $400 per night. We were really looking forward to our stay. The room showed a separate sitting room by the sliding doors leading out to the ocean view. Upon arrival, we were placed in a "regular" room with 2 beds, crt television - and only 1 at that, no frills whatsoever - like staying in a motel 8. The view outside our sliding door was bushes. We had to walk outside to look to the right to see the ocean. Of course I was very disappointed and wished to be given some kind of compensation as $400 a night was crazy. I could have gotten the same type thing anywhere else for $100 per night so why was I paying this crazy price. I wanted to check out upon arrival due to my disatisfaction and was told my money was non-refundable due to the fact that I booked with Orbitz - I would have to contact them - well - folks - if you have ever dealth with Orbitz - you know how that went! So we spent 8 nights at $400 per night and the whole trip was a complete disaster. My son stayed at a very nice time share condo for about a hundred dollars less a night. So when you go to Hawaii, look very hard and know exactly what you are getting. Do not book through an online travel site or you are stuck! Geez, what more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: orangefan44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui for 7 days and for the most part it was a very relaxing, enjoyable vacation. We chose the Hyatt for the location and had gotten and excellent promotion through the Hyatt Gold Passport program. On our previous trip to Maui we stayed at the Rennaissance Wailea Beach, which has since been torn down. We couldn't have asked for a better stay at the Renaissance, but it was quite a drive to everywhere. This is what brought us to Kaanapali. The Hyatt sits at the southern most end of Kaanapali beach, which is nice as it is away from much of the hussle and bussle of the busy resort and shopping areas to the north. The resort is vast with gorgeous pools, gardens and facilities. Room: We had a partial oceanview room on one of the upper floors of the Atrium (center) town. The room was nicely furnished with a king bed, LCD TV, desk, ipod alarm clock, refrigerator, safe, sitting area and lanai. The outside lanai has a view of the Kaanapali South golf course to the left and the ocean/Lahaina harbor to the right. Straight ahead was the West Maui mountains and the Lahaina tower. You could tell that the hotel is older as I noticed some scuff marks and scratches on the wood on the furniture. However, the room was kept nice and clean. The bathrooms are on the small side and the tub/shower are very basic for a hotel. The sink had just a single basin, not two like many hotels. The walk in closet was nice with ample storage. The "Hyatt Grand Bed" is a platform style bed with no box spring. Allthough it was very comfortable, it was difficult to get used to as bed the only came up to my knees when standing next to it (I am 6' 3"). Overall the room was nice and comfortable, but it definitely a "hotel room", and I expected something a little larger and more upscale for a resort of this caliber. Ammeneties/Facilities: This is what really makes this hotel shine. The large open air lobby is gorgeous, with parrots, tropical birds and other wildlife exhibits. The penguins were by far the most fun to watch. The pool facilities were awesome. The main pool is large with depths from 3'-9' and connects to the smaller pool and kids lagoon via swim through cave, complete with a pool bar and waterfalls on each end. The 150' lava tube waterslide was extrememly fun and very, very fast. We enjoyed sitting by the pool many days, however there is not much shade. We did browse through the onsite shops which includes a Macy's, and various other shops. There is a convenience type store on site which was nice as we needed to buy additional sunscreen. They also sell souveniers, beer, wine & liquour but is a bit pricey. We used the self-parking which is completentary (valet is $12 per day). Other reviews I read are critical of the parking. We did not have any issues. The spots are small, and many people did not park between the lines which made tjhe spots tighter. However, if you are a decent driver and know how to use your side mirrors, you shouldn't have a problem. We did not use the spa or fitness facilites. I did jog in the morning along the beach path which was very nice. Beach: The beach directy in front of the hotel is narrow and can be a little rocky. However, it is still very nice. A few steps to the south is a beach activities desk with onsite Parasailing and Jetski companies in addition to snorkel and boogie board rentals. A short 5-10 minute walk to the north and the beach opens up to a nice wide white sand beach. If you keep walking just past the Sheraton is Black Rock with has some real nice snorkeling. Restaurants/Food: Our package included a complementary breakfast buffet at Swan Court. The buffet was quite good with various sections including cold and hot items. At times there was quite long line to be seated. Also, they do change a few of the hot selections daily, but I would have prefered more variety. For example, many of the items stayed the same which I got sick of quite fast. Some corned beef hash or grits would have been a nice addition instead of the same roasted potatos every day. We ate most of our other meals off-site as the restaurants onsite are expensive. We did however eat lunch one day at Umalu which was quite good. Staff: For the most part the hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. We had an issue with one of our room keys one day after returning from the pool and became locked out of our room. The staff person was very attentive and quickly came up to let us in and provided us a new key. However, at times some of the staff's friendlyness seemed "fake". Also, they like if you spend money at the hotel. A couple of times, I sensed attitude from one of the pool waitresses when I didn't order anything or if I brought my own drink to the pool. Also, the (Japaneese) hostess staff at the Swan Court breakfast seemed to give seating preference to their fellow Japaneese. Many times the Japaneese couples and families would be seating up front next to the water, where the Americans would be seated in a corner or the back, regarless of when they arrived. The front desk staff was friendly, however it would have been nice if they informed me of the guest facilites which could be used after check-out (i.e. to freshen up after using the pool before an evening flight) prior to checking out as we had a 9pm flight. The staff at the pool and beach activities desk were great. Overall, it was a great stay. The few critizisms above are minor compared to how much we enjoyed our stay. I would definitely stay here again. I have listed some tips below for future Maui vacationers: 1. Stock up on snacks and beverages at the Safeway in the Lahaina Canery Mall to save money. It is about 2 miles down the road from the Hyatt. We purchased bottled water, Gatorage and beer. It was much cheaper ($17 for 12-pack of local lager vs. $7 for 1 draft at the pool bar, or $2 for a pepsi from the machine) and convienent to have it in your in room fridge. 2. Check out the area restaurants. The hotel restaurants are quite pricey, but there are many alternatives just a short drive to Lahaina, or walk up the beach path to Whaler's Village which are just as good if not better. 3. Back in to the Hyatt parking spots. It is much easier to fit (straight) into the small spots. 4. Golf: As an avid golfer, I considered playing a round at the Royal Kaanapali course, but decided against it because of the cost ($190 greens fee + $85 club rental). I am now glad that I choose not play. Allthough well maintained, the course is very flat, has little vegetation, and runs alongside 2 main roads and the Sugarcane Train tracks. Throughout my stay, I only saw a handfull of golfers on the course, so others must have felt the same as me. If you want to golf, the courses at Wailea are much much nicer (and less expensive), but it is a long drive to south Maui from Kaanapali. 5. Take a drive up the northern Maui coastline. It is quite beautiful and much less traveled than the Hana Highway. Check out snorkeling at Honolua Bay, the Nakaele Blowhole and the various senic lookouts and pull offs along this curvey road which is just a short drive from Kaanapali. 6. A nice place to visit on your last day if you have an evening flight is the Maui Ocean Center. It is in Maalea, which is on your way back to the airport. 7. If you plan to use the wireless internet access at the Hyatt, sign up for T-Mobile hotspot ahead of time. This is who the Hyatt's service is though. You can get plans or pre-paid cards which will save you money (Hyatt charges $24 per day). I got lucky and found a promo code online for a 30 day free trial.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice acommodations and facilities”
Reviews.Author: kimwipes
Reviews.Content: We booked the Maui Hyatt Regency mountain view room throught priceline for what I considered a good deal at $140 a night. Upon check in we were offered a Regency Club Partial Ocean View for an extra $75 a night and took it. So we ended up on a 21st floor room with a great view [partial] of the ocean and Lahaina. The grounds were very well kept, the pool/slide area was fun for all the family and compares well to that of the other resorts in the Kaanapali area. Staff was very helpful accommodating our requests always. They extended our check out a bit but since our flight wasn't until 10pm we had to vacate the room. No problem then, you can hang out and relax by the pool, and use their very private locker rooms to securely stow your valuables and take a shower before hitting the road. The conduct various activities during the day, so if you happen to hang by the hotel you can sign up for things like a free lei-making class, which you get to keep. My daughters enjoyed this very much, and saved us this expense. Our room was nice, big and roomy. Showed some signs of age in little details. Hated the sliding doors without locks in the bathroom, kids kept opening them while you're doing your business. Room came equipped with safe and refrigerator, which was nice. We did not experience any noise level, our room in the 21st floor on the main tower was very quiet. Maybe the open-center design helps here. The only thing we could hear was lots of birds in the morning - I think it was the big parrots on the ground, but it wasn't a big deal. Regency Club: for a family of 4 (2 kids, 8 &9) I thought that the $75 regency club upgrade was an excellent value. Besides the partial ocean view upgrade on the two top floors (which might be worth the $75 to some, not me), it included continental breakfast, cocktails and appetizers 5pm-7pm and dessert/cordials at 7:30-9pm. Breakfast consisted of a variety of pastries, boiled eggs, smoked salmon, cereal, tropicana-like juices and fresh fruit and did not change at all. Appetizers were always the same (antipasto, cheese, bread) except for an additional item that changed daily (we had prosciutto, chicken lettuce wraps, etc). Desserts changed daily, an assortment of chocolate cakes, chocolate-covered strawberries, tiramisu, cheesecake. Additionally you can stop by anytime of the day (6:30am-9pm) for drinks (expresso, soda, water) and snacks (nuts, cookies) For the 4 of us, I think we got an excellent value. We stopped every day for breakfast before leaving the hotel and usually made back to the hotel by 6pm, so we got 4-6 alcoholic drinks every night, and we almost always skipped dinner thanks to the great appetizers and desserts (we are not big on dinner). In addition, they encouraged us to stock up on drinks for all of our day trips and received boxed snacks from them (literally boxes of macademia chocolates, caramel popcorn and even potato chips) - this just saved us trips to the shopping center and money! The regency club staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful (ie, the gave us one of those CD describing sights along the road to Hana when we mentioned we were going there). The only thing I really hate about this hotel (and others like it) is this trend to charge a $15 resort fee. While I did use their fitness center twice (and BTW, running along the beach here is a must-do if you like running), I felt they shouldn't have this sort of hidden fee, just roll it into the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal325
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving the hotel, we were greeted with leis and super friendly staff upon checkin. Our room was waiting for us with champagne for our honeymoon. The room was spacious and clean, but we were stuck with a view of the parking lot. But the hotel is super quiet and a fantastic pool. The pool was key since there isn't much beach to lay on on this beach strip...unless you walk to the end to black rock beach. The food was exceptional! Full breakfast buffet was included in our package, what a dream! (I don't recall eating lunch). The tennis courts are well attended by both the hotel staff and guests. Only negative is they make you wear their stash of tennis shoes, ewww! This hotel is also close to the Old Lahaina Luau, which is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SavannahJoe
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an 8-day vacation at the Hyatt Regency on Maui and it was truly outstanding. First, the physical plant of the hotel is immaculate. Lobby, restaurants and lounges, and guest rooms were fresh and nicely appointed. Service was also terrific. From Emily, a great front desk agent from Pittsburgh, to Mr. Victor and all of the extra touches poolside. The kids AND mom and dad were thrilled with the frozen popscicles handed out each after noon to all at the pool. Later, cold/scented towels were also presented. Our 8-year old loved Camp Hyatt and Brian did a nice job there with the kids. Our meals and drinks, mostly served outside were delightful and tasted great. and room service also did a nice job. Our housekeepers were on their game all week and we had absolutely no complaints. Expedia concierge staff were extremely helpful in pre-planning our trip and having everything (helicpoter ride, luau, Sugar Cane Train) all in order upon arrival. There's plenty of good competition in Ka'annapali but the Hyatt will not only exceed your expectations but will provide you with the ideal vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: singlemomtravelor
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was perfect for us. We had a room on the bottom level close to the pool and really enjoyed the waterfalls and two slides. They have a cute little kiddie lagoon that is very shallow and coated with sand/small pebbles. Although it was made for children under 8, my 12 year old enjoyed it too. There is a long cave you cross through when you leave the kiddie lagoon that is about 4 feet deep. Inside the cave is the grotto bar for adults, but it is over to the side, and there is a pretty big area for swimming inside the cave. On the other side of the cave is a large additional pool, which is suited more for adults and older children. There is a small game room by the pool and they show a movie pool-side on Saturday nights, complete with popcorn. The hotel is beautiful and has some shopping, but there is a 15 minute beach walk behind the hotel that ends up at the Whalers Beach Front Mall. Whalers has quite a bit to choose from, including some great restaurants. If you don't want to walk there is a free trolley that will take you from the front of the hotel to Whalers. My daughter's favorite thing in the hotel were the animals-cranes, African penguins, and parrots. The food was resort-expensive, but the kid's menu was around $7.00 and filling for a 12 year old. Room service offered a substantial and yummy $19.00 pizza for adults. There is also a small convenience store in the hotel with chips, beer, and sodas. The service was exceptional, especially the desk staff, and the rooms were excellent. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelsWife09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights at the beginning of August. I was just amazed when I walked into the atrium and saw how beautiful this hotel was. The wildlife was incredible and I spent hours just walking around viewing everything. Check in was easy and quick and the staff was greayt. We even got into our room before noon without a probable. We tried a couple of the restaraunts and loved Sonz although it was very expensive. Our view was amazing and the pool was great. My only issue was there were more families here than I thought there would be and children were everywhere. I have nothing againts kids, but was looking for something quieter for my honeymoon. Rooms were nice, didn't like the low bed and my husband who is almost 7 feet tall had a hard time getting off the bed and sitting on it.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: Flowergirl811
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! I paid for only a basic room but was upgraded to a partial ocean view which was good (the 8th tower). Parking was a nightmare however, but if the lot was full they valet parked my rental for free. Air conditioning was not great but enough so we could sleep. Bed was comfortable and room clean. Customer service was excellent. The folks at the front were extremely helpful with travel plans, restaurant reservations, etc. There are also some wonderful activities you can book for your kids, every day. You must take in the Luau at the hotel. It was even better than the Old Luhaina one that is so highly rated. The food at the hotel's luau is better and so is the show. Breakfast can be had right at the hotel too. The Umalu Market has a continental breakfast for $10.00 for adult and $5.00 for children (cold breakfast and you can only go through once). For the hot breakfast it's $18.95 and I think $10.00 for kids (can go back as much as you want). Kimo's was amazing and even better than Mama's Fish House we thought. You must try the prime rib! Had we known just how good the food was there we would've eaten there every night! But parking is horrendous! But we got a hint that if you tip the valet parking guy at Longi's $5.00 he will park your car in their lot. There is also free parking in that lot from 3:00 pm - 5:00 pm. You must also go to the Luluani's Shaved Ice Shop just down the street. Best shaved ice ever! Hula Grill at Whaler's Village was great for lunch or dinner. Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina was great too and happy hour drinks good and cheap (Happy hour started at 2 pm). We never had a problem parking there. At the start of your stay book the shuttle from the hotel for your trip to the airport to go back home as it will cost you almost $90.00 for a cab. Great jewellery at Maui Gifts on Front Street. Also cheap clothing shopping there too at Leola's and Maui Clothing Company. Crazy Shirts at Whaler's Village also has some cute shirts at good prices. Great shopping at Macy's too right in the hotel. For a unique gifts check out Maui Hands. Also the Cannery Mall in Lahaina has a little shop that has unique Maui made gifts at cheap prices. Buy food at Safeway to store in your in room fridge for lunch and snacks and also stock up on water while there. Pool is open to swim till 11:00 pm each night to swim and walk the boardwalk at night for a fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Three years in a row at the Hyatt Maui...and hopefully more to come!”
Reviews.Author: riley51
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful vacation at the Hyatt Regency Maui. We have stayed at the Hyatt now three years in a row and we felt this was our best stay yet! We checked in and had a wonderful room this year in the Lahaina tower, overlooking the swan court and waterfalls, with a spectacular view of the ocean.
