We enjoyed beautiful sunset views from our lanai as well as plenty of star gazing late at night once we were back at the hotel for the evening. We really enjoyed the new poolside restaurant Umalu. We had our breakfast there most mornings and also enjoyed dinner there once the first evening we arrived. It has a great varied menu. The kids enjoyed grabbing a quick snack or drink on their own at the snack bar inside Umalu for lunch while we were poolside daily. There was also daily entertainment playing outside the restaurant during the afternoons and evenings and it was great to swim at the wonderful pool and listen to the music. The hotel staff is always very accomodating and friendly and they do a great job keeping the hotel grounds looking immaculately groomed. We were sad to leave but had such a great time and are already thinking about next year's return to the Hyatt Regency Maui!

Reviews.Title: “we come back again and again...”
Reviews.Author: lillyg
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed here 3 times in the past 5 years. The staff here is always attentive and helpful with a great aloha spirit. The rooms are well-kept and beds always comfortable. Yes, some of the furniture is not brand new, but it is not worn. The grounds are peaceful and beautiful. The kiddie pool is unsurpassed. The hotel is very child-friendly but never overrun by kids. There's probably not a bad room view on the entire property: rooms either face the ocean, the West Maui mountains, or the lush grounds surrounding the pool. Dining is excellent. Yes, this is a resort and dining prices reflect it. But the hotel does provide small refrigerators in the rooms and Lahaina Cannery Mall is nearby. The only negative to this property is the beach: it's not suitable for swimming or snorkeling. But Napili and Kapalua Bay are just a short drive north.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: The property is in the Kaapalua Resort area about 5 minutes from JHM and 40 minutes from OGG. Check in took a bit of time despite 4 staff at the front. They were very friendly and quite helpful. Lines can get long in the mid-afternoon. Self parking can be found on the left of the main entrance and also in the back if you are staying in the Lahaina tower. The property is quite large with three main towers. The shops, including a Macy's, are in the Lahaina tower. The pool is in the middle of the property. The pool is sweet with a swim up bar and a water slide. The kiddie area is cute and lots of kids! Penguins are also in a pool on the property. There is some renovation going on. The gym is open 24 hours and is in a separate building. At least 6 treadmills, 6 ellipticals, 4 bikes. There is a yoga room. Weight machines and free weights with water coolers. Always busy in the morning and late afternoon. The restaurants were good, but somewhat expensive. Drinks were great but quite expensive as well. The ocean front rooms in the Lahaina tower were just awesome. Views of Lanai and Hawaii from our balcony. We could lean out and just barely catch the sunset, but it would be better from the beach with views of Molokai and Oahu. We were also able to see a turtle in the water just a few feet from the beach as well! We could also see the luau show for free....sorry guys about not paying! They provide an in-room refrigerator in addition to the one holding the bar. This was great for holding the groceries we purchased. There is a lot to do and also, if you want, just laze at the pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hyatt!!”
Reviews.Author: donna506
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Maui Resort is just amazing. Absolutely beautiful - pure perfection; gorgeous rooms; unbelievable views; delicious food & drinks (although costly); try a lava flow (delicious drink); friendly & most accommodating staff. Parasailing right off the beach. Romantic walks along the beach (although not very suitable for swimming) & a great boardwalk path along all the hotels to Whalers Village for shopping/dining & sunset cruises. Unbelievable sunsets. Very easy to get to all outside activities. Highly recommend getting the breakfast deal included - delicious buffet with serene views great way to start the day. No better place than the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort if visiting the Lahaina area. Hope to visit again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: dinibell
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Maui is like a dream. First of all the staff are friendly and very helpful. Upon arrival (celebrating my husband and my 25th anniversary) it sounds like you are walking into a nature preserve instead of a lobby. There are gorgeous flora and fauna and even miniature penquins! Very lush and elegant as were the rooms. The room was very large with a very large vanity area, which is important to me and a walk-in closet! The 360 degree views from anywhere in the hotel are amazing. The pool is large enough to find a spot of your own and complete with waterfalls. We actually picked up beach chairs at K-Mart near the airport and used them to beach hop in Kaanapali. The Hyatt has a small beach but just walk a few feet and the beach gets larger and is beautiful. (Check out Napili Bay, very beautiful as well).. The breakfast is amazing as was lunch at the poolside restaurant. We went to the luau that is right at the Hyatt, also would highly recommend. All in all, a perfect stay. Thanks so much Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: Renee24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt while in Maui for our honeymoon. The hotel is huge and beautiful. We picked it based on friend's recommendations. We loved the grounds and the pool. The rooms were clean, but nothing fancy. We didn't like the beach (it's rocky and you can't really swim there), the parking situation and the noise. There were a lot of families and kids. Since it was our first time in Maui, it was good to be close to all the action, but next time around we'll definitely look for some place more low key in the Wailea area. We opted to self park for free which was sometimes a struggle. The smaller of the two lots (which was closest to our room) was often full, which meant we had to park in a far away lot and walk. Normally that wouldn't be a big deal, but after being out and about all day and coming back tired, it was kind of annoying. The Hyatt was close to Lahina Harbor were a lot of activities and restaurants are based, so that was nice. Also our package included the daily breakfast buffet. It really wasn't that good. The food was mediocre and the lines to dine at the buffet were long. We'd recommend grabbing breakfast somewhere away from the resort. Also, the buffet turns into a restaurant called Sonz's at night. It's absolutely terrible. Avoid it at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstandin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HuskyJazz
Reviews.Content: I admit I don't go to a lot of large hotels, but this hotel was outstanding. The rooms were decorated rather nice. Much better then any hotel I have ever stayed in. The gardens were beautiful. The beach had some decent size waves coming in. However, on low tide there was a lot of rock and coral that you could easily get hurt on. I recommend some sort of swimming shoes if it is low tide. The pool was very nice and even though we didn't have our kids, the kiddie pool looked outstanding. The hotel was just a few miles from shopping and some nice places to eat. Definatly recommend Cheeseburger paradise, but not Bubba Gump. Service was horrible there. The food at the hotel was great and the staff was excellent as well. I was not a big fan of one of the bartenders, but that was because my LIT was not worth a darn. A little pricie, but your in hawaii so what do you expect. Looks and decor was five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magical stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TexasTandE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel on our honeymooon 23 years ago, and our teenagers (13, 14 and a friend who's 15) were so excited to return after years of looking at our honeymoon photo albums. The place truly has not changed one bit, and it's just as romantic and magical as it ever was. It is Old Hawaii - and we love this place! We reserved an Ocean Suite (ironically we were on the same floor just a few doors down from our honeymoon room!) which was two bedrooms and a small living room area with 3 balconies. Spectacular views and very quiet at the end of the hallway! My A+ notes: 1-The staff is amazing! We had the pleasure of working with the 2 very BEST concierges EVER - Jeffre Naniola and Paul. After a colosal Hertz bait and switch nightmare, Jeffre went to work and took care of our rental car problem. He was poetry in motion!!! (Go with Alamo on Maui - they were wonderful!) 2-The restaurants are outstanding, and the food/drinks are superb. Breakfast buffet was included with our suite, and it is awesome! 3-The wildlife at the hotel - there are penguins, tropical birds, koi fish, swans, flamingos - you name it! 4-The pool is beautiful! The waterfalls and the swim up bar inside the cave are very cool. 5 - Location - perfect location - close enough to Lahaina, and far enough from anything else. 6 - Gardens and artwork are wonderful! Lush flowers and greenery everywhere. 7 - The luau and the tour of the stars on the hotel rooftop were very fun. Food was excellent at the luau (probably the best luau food I've had.) Downside - they line up people on the sidewalk in the sun for like 30 minutes before it opens and it appears most people are sweaty and not happy. (We had teenagers for that!) 8 - The workout facility is awesome! My daughter enjoyed the spa and thought it was great. The views onto the ocean are second to none in the fitness room! 9 - Comfy beds and a variety of pillows. 10 - Never waited for an elevator for more than 30 seconds. 11- Serene, open air lobby full of gorgeous statues. 12 - Nice flat screen TVs in the rooms, with small fridges in the rooms also. 13- Superb housekeeping - completed by noon everyday. Replenished towels frequently. Nightly turndown was great - they always left several extra chocolates for the kids. 14 - Nice sized balconies with furniture on them. 15 - Can't forget to mention bartenders Kiki, Andy and Richard at the Umalu. Not only did they fix awesome drinks, they are just cool guys who love to talk and visit over lunch. My D- Notes: 1-Bathrooms are small 2-The beach that was there 23 years ago on our honeymoon is no longer there. You can get out and walk on it, but there is not room for chairs behind the hotel on the beach. The pool area is where all the chairs are, and if you want shade, you must get your towels at 7:30am when the towel bar opens and lay out your towels. Otherwise by 8am the shade is taken, and it's slim pickings for empty chairs. 3 - My husband said the towels were rough, but that did not bother me. I don't like big fluffy towels so I was happy with the towels. 4 - This Hyatt is very beautiful and very romantic. However, it is also an older hotel. The furniture- in some places, not all - is probably due for a re-do. 5 - No lei greeting on arrival. 6 - I had booked several things before the trip via the online concierge - all were received and confirmed repeatedly. Not one single reservation was correct - every thing I took the time to plan was either in their system as the wrong date or time or something - despite my printed out emails in hand from Hyatt. Same with the breakfast included - everyday they had us down for 4, and we were 5. Everyday they said they would correct it, and everyday it was the same thing over and over. Those little details did bug me, but they weren't a big deal once corrected. Tip - if you plan to stay here, and I highly recommend you do, just call either Jeffre or Paul and book everything with them (including your rent car if you decide to do that - those guys are INCREDIBLE!) Recommendations (Other than booking everything through Jeffre or Paul)-- West Maui Parasailing Hula Girl Snorkeling Lahaina Grill (expensive but one of the best dinners EVER!) Longhi's (same as above - expensive but superb!)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation”
Reviews.Author: Cruising2012
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous location on Ka'anapli Beach, great restaurants close by, convenient to Lahaina and rest of Maui, beautiful open atrium, huge pools, open air restaurants and bars, relaxing sounds of the surf hitting the beach at night, great luau, just an incredible spot. Our son got his scuba certification while we where there, did 6 dives in 5 days, including a wreck dive to 64 feet. Very memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Rooms are lacking”
Reviews.Author: BugsySFBayArea
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review on Trip Advisor, but felt obligated since I rely on it so heavily for my pre-trip planning. The hotel grounds were beautiful. Swan Court, where the breakfast buffet is, was stunning. The rooms---not so much. They really are dated. My brother, who works in the hospitality business and came over to visit one day, completely agreed. The bed was older and very low to the ground, the coffee table was dinged, the bathroom was dated, etc. It's time for a refresh Hyatt. One other item. I have some mobility issues. Access to the pool has not been updated since prior to ADA compliance laws. Therefore, there are two flights of stairs to climb up and down in order to get to the pool. I wasn't aware of this prior to booking our stay. Just be warned if you're traveling with someone who has any sort of disability.

Reviews.Title: “rooms no way 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: og4
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review but use them all the time to make sure I get exactly what I am looking for.. in this case I am disapointed in the Hyatt.. the grounds are very nice and the location is fine, but the rooms.. hardly a 4 star hotel they are in serious need of a upgrade, they smelled of cigarrete and the second day I found a dead coachroam in the bathroom, I asked for the cleaning service to go up as fast as possible they took two hours.. almost every day the cleaning service was there around 2:00pm.. for me this is late since I have a two year old that needs her naps.. the spa not a big deal nice views but not as beatiful as other spas I have been.. by the way the forgot about my appointment waited in their waiting room for half an hour until someone passed by to see what had happened.. I had to cancel since I really did not have time to wait.. they did apologize and sent me strawberries that night.. but still I think I should mention.. the food is very good, the service is good (except for the cleaning group) the beach towel system they follow somewhat of a pain.. I wanted this vacation to be special but the hotel disspaointed me because of the rooms.. probably just expected more.. Luau was very nice and worth seeing it..

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: ndm0981
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in Kaanapali was a great honeymoon for us. The hotel itself was spotless and very well kept. We were a little concerned with the resort as we were looking for a couples only resort. That was not a problem at all! They have seperate pools and areas, which are on the other side of the resort, for children so you really don't even notice. The restaurants are wonderful. It's within close driving distance to many other restaurants and excursion locations. The only negative thing that I might say is that the beach is very narrow but not a big deal unless you are going to lay out on the beach. We will for sure visit them again!

Reviews.Title: “If you love the beach, this location is not for you!”
Reviews.Author: docrph
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the room (old and the bed was not comfortable at all). Also we enjoy spending time at the beach and this was really not as expected. They had a really small area with cabana's that were impossible to get and stood on a small hill by the hotel. If you want to have a nice, quick breakfast at the hotel - leave an extra 30 min because you will be surprised by the line that is there was there every morning. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dated - yes, but still good value”
Reviews.Author: scottjh
Reviews.Content: The reviews that call for updating are right. There is a tired feel about the hotel. But the plantings and exotic birds throughout are still pretty interesting. The bed was very comfortable and the shower, while small, had a great shower head and great water pressure. The fitness center was really nice and the beach walk out front was the perfect place to watch the sunset. Only here for one night and we ate in the cascade restaurant. The poke was really good as was the balancde of our light sushi meal. But the breeze was good and the wait staff attentive so all was good.

Reviews.Title: “So very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: A6027
Reviews.Content: This is a very dated hotel and the rooms are in desperate need of renovating. Our hearts sunk when we saw the room. Dated carpet and old wooden furniture. The bathrooms are very small, the shower is over the bath and the toilet is not seperate. We had been to two other islands previously and both of the hotels there were beautiful and we thought we had done our homework on the Maui hotels but we were so disappointed. The pool area is large but the sun lounges are packed in like sardines in a can with hardly any shade. I am sorry but I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: mnerius
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed two nights at the Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach - and we wish it was longer! The hotel is amazing and beautiful; we can't say enough good things about it. Upon arrival the front desk upgraded us to a full ocean view with two balconies - the room was so incredible sometimes we didn't want to leave! The Concierge Jeffrie was great! He booked us for the Hyatt Luau (gave us VIP access) and for a tour with Mauiscape Helicopter (great tour as well). Go see Jeffrie - he won't disappoint you! The pools are amazing - swimming at night in the grotto is so much fun! The hotel's location is towards the end of the walking path on Kaanapali, so the foot traffic is much less at this hotel, which can be nice. The fitness center is great - all updated equipment with beach front views! We will be coming back to this great hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MauiDivers
Reviews.Content: Tried Umalu at the Hyatt and the food is incredible. Casual atmosphere with great service. You have to try the Mahi taco's for lunch and the taro crusted Mahi for dinner. I could eat there everyday there's so much to choose from. Oh and the poke nachos, I've never heard of it before and it's fabulous if you love raw fish!! Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fifth time at this property; never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: WORLDLYLADY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui the first week of May. Once again, wonderful service, great room, great everything! I can't understand why some nitpick this hotel. As for those who are dissatisfied with the partial ocean view rooms, you need to request the Napili tower if you want a good partial o/v. I too wouldn't want to overlook the cemetery, so stay away from the Lahaina tower. We always request either the atrium tower or the Napili. On our last stay we were on a Priceline deal, so we already had a pretty good deal going of $185 per night. While checking in, the front desk informed us that we were in a golf/mountain room [they upgraded us automatically again, for the 5th time] so we inquired about upgrading to a deluxe ocean room in the atrium tower, so we paid an additional $80 per night to upgrade to this fantastic room. Ordinarily we don't pay for upgrades, but because we got such a great deal to begin with, the overall price of $265 per night for a deluxe ocean room was an excellent deal, especially since that room would have cost us $450 had we booked directly with Hyatt or $400 per night via any other package deal. For us, that made the trip special. We were on the 19th floor and the bathroom was even a little nicer, with extra storage and drawers. Housekeeping was prompt every day. The new pool bar/restaurant Umalu was a disappointment, but only because they increased their prices exhorbitantly. We loved the old pool snack bar/restaurant much more. Due to the price gouging, we went off-campus every day to CJ's Comfort Zone and brought our food back to the hotel, or we went next door to the Marriott and brought back food from their snack bar. Other than that minor flaw, the trip was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Already Looking Forward to My Next Visit!”
Reviews.Author: beanweb24
Reviews.Content: On my past two visits, I stayed in Kihei and Wailea. This time I decided to try another part of the island, and decided on the Hyatt...and it is now my new #1 favorite place to stay. The pool is large (but not huge) and there is a separate pool for kids as well. There were still kids in the non-kiddie pool, but I found them to be amazingly well behaved with not a lot of screaming, thrashing about, etc. Mostly the pool was full of people relaxing under the waterfalls, reading a book along the edge, or floating on a mat. I also thought the pool service was fantastic. They offer free water, otter pops, and frozen towels, and you never have to wait too long to be asked if you want a refill on your cocktail. If you do go to the Hyatt, note that there is a different drink on special every day, and it pays to ask what it is. Drinks are normally $11-$12, but the "specials" were only $8 a piece. I used the gym on a daily basis and was very pleased. There was a good number of treadmills, bikes, and elliptical machines, in addition to a fitness studio and lots of weight machines. I also took a few of the fitness courses at a cost of $10/each and really enjoyed them. I also indulged in a 90 minute hot stone massage with Helena my first morning there...fantastic spa experience. The ladies locker room is on the small side, but extremely nice with wet and dry saunas, a jacuzzi, and showers. The relaxation room post-massage was located oceanfront and I could have easily stayed in there for half the day. Parking (self parking) was free but the parking spots were ridiculously small. I loved that I could walk to Whalers Village in about 13 minutes. There is also a free trolley that runs between Whalers Village and the Hyatt - you can pick up a schedule at the concierge desk. The grounds of the Hyatt were really lovely - just a gorgeous property. The rooms themselves did not have the same "wow factor" that the grounds had. I had an ocean view with a great view (in the atrium tower), and I was impressed by all of the storage space (drawers, small walk in closet, etc) as well as the extra empty minifridge so I could stock with my own stuff. The carpet did probably need replacing and the quality of the furnishings was just slightly above average, but it was extremely clean and well equipped/laid out.. Overall, I was more than thrilled with the Hyatt, and am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: CASUNLOVER_7
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the memorial weekend. It is a beautiful resort with excellent service. We had a suite with an ocean view and two balconies. The room was very well appointed with everything you might need to make your stay comfortable. The kids loved the pool, especially my 12 year old. We loved being walking distance to Whalers Village and Black Rock with some of the best snorkeling on the island! Truman, my husband's company contact at the resort went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable! Thanks Truman! You are the best! There is really nothing bad I can say about this resort. I marked value a little lower because the restaurants were expensive but you have to expect that staying in a resort. We did eat at Umalu one night and the food was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but left underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: rwc_traveler_9
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt specifically for the pool water slide since my daughter just reached the magic 4 ft. height to go on the big slide. You can imagine our disappointment when we learned that it was under repair for the next 5 weeks. There is no mention of that on their website, nor did they respond when I complained about it. Pros: - beautiful grounds and pool - most employees we encountered were great (front desk just fair) - Kids Club has great service and really friendly employees -great breakfast buffet (but get it as part of a package) Cons weren't huge, but numerous enough to leave me feeling nickeled and dimed enough to have an overall negative impact. - the response to our disappointment about the pool slide closure was indifference. - the policy on the snack tray was ridiculous that if you even MOVE an item on the tray then you are automatically charged. They did come and remove the snacks after I called, but this is just a ridiculous practice. - 'partial' ocean views are just that, and you see a cemetery, the busy road and the parking lot as well as the ocean view once you're on your balcony and leaning out. In other hotels, I was upgraded automatically, but the front desk clerk didn't seem particularly interested in going out of her way to make sure we had a good time. -Partial ocean views will hear the nightly luau - rooms and bathrooms need updating -I never figured out what I was getting for a daily $15 resort fee on top of my bill - dial up?? Are they kidding me? All in all, most of our issues could have been resolved with better customer service from the front desk in particular. Since it's in an unbeatable location, with a beautiful lobby and pool, I'd recommend to a friend with the caveats above in the hopes they could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: GordKend
Reviews.Content: We decide to treat ourselves to a one night stay at th Hyatt after walking by and seeing the grounds. We were staying at another property on Maui but left one night early and got a great rate to stay at the Hyatt. We thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay. My 8 year old daughter loved the pool and and walking through the property to look at the wildlife. Although we only booked a Mountainview room, the front desk upgraded us to a oceanview room at no charge as the were not full. Not sure our Budget would allow for a full 7 night stay at this property but we are very happy to have experienced the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Overrated!!! Nice Grounds, but Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: TrustMe7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently stayed at this Hotel. I couldn't wait to find a place to post a review. I have to say right off the bat that the grounds are beautiful. They can't be beat when it comes to the scenery and the nice gardens and animals. But there comes the problem. It was so disgusting that they don't have any type of nets to catch the birds in the restaurant. The birds will sit on your table - disease! They will eat from your plate and hop around your feet. They land on the clean dishes and silverware and then the staff will serve you that same dish! I've seen it done! The water they served smelled like a bird took a crap in the glass. I'm telling you, don't eat at their restaurants. The Rooms need updating. For what they are charging you, you could get TONS more for your money at a TRUMP location. Their TV's are crappy, their sheets and bedding aren't what you are paying for. The place is very loud when you try to sleep! The room doors are very heavy and there is nothing that slows the closing of them. When they are shutting, they SLAM! You will hear the other guests doors slam! I promise you! Not to mention that the walls are paper thin! Talk quietly, or your next door neighbor will hear you. Especially if you are in the shower. The prices are way too expensive. That is a lesson I learned about staying at places such as the Hyatt. I will not do it again. $60 for a breakfast for 2. $40 for a Tuna sandwich. I could go on.....SAVE YOUR MONEY, go to a smaller scale hotel that is more updated, better, and that have affordable prices. STAY AT A CLEAN HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: norainmama
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you have young children. We have a 2 and 4 year old and they absolutely loved the kids pool area and waterslide. I can't believe how much fun they had. My 4 year old spent hours going down the slide. My 2 year old spent hours digging in the sand area and loved the water spout area as well. The layout of the kids pool/sand/slide area was perfect. The pictures on the hotel website does not do it justice. They had plenty of lawnchairs so you could lay and relax and still watch your kids. The "adult" pool was also very nice with plenty of chairs. The one downside is that the beach right off the hotel wasn't great. It has a lot of coral that washed up on the sand so that the kids didn't want to walk and be on the sand right there. We just walked up the path a few hundred feet by the next hotel and did our beach time there. The service was great. We ordered room service a few times and they had quoted us 30 minutes and after 30 minutes on the dot they called and said it would be 10 more minutes. Once they arrived 10 minutes later, they had a box of chocolates in hand for our inconvienance. Rooms were a nice size, but you want to make sure you are at the end of the hall so that you don't hear all of the foot traffic all night long. The fitness center was also amazing. The ocean view from the fitness center made you want to come and work out. The spa at the hotel was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good / Rooms need Updating”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl5
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 4 times, this time for 9 nights. Positves 1) Great location 2) Beautiful Atrium Lobby and Well kept clean grounds 3) Friendly wonderful helpful staff 4) Great Breakfast Buffet 4) Comfy Beds 5) Addition of Umala Bar Restaurant GREAT 6) Clean rooms. Negatives 1) I realize this is an older hotel but for what we pay the rooms and bathrooms can use some major updating, bathrooms majorly small, need new sinks and bath fixtures, balconies small 2) this was my 4th stay and for 9 nights and they would not upgrade us even though hotel was not at full capacity 3) our room had musty odor and we had to keep the slifding glass door open to get fresh air in Hyatt really needs to upgrade and update the rooms and bathrooms otherwise GREAT place. Also the Otter Pops at the pool ROCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “wow a place to be revived and refreshed," our own little piece of heaven"”
Reviews.Author: trinidadlucky
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and scenic entrance and lobby area.Great service and pleasant staff to meet and greet on arrival.It was very late when we got there and we were made to feel that it did not matter we were well treated from the start with pleasant smiles,it was great to finally reach!!! From the morning the staff called us by our names;which made us feel extra special. Wonderful!! is the only way to describe the way the Chief Chef , Swan Court manager and staff , Umalu manager and staff,and events manager and staff made our stay. Thank You for a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced with no service”
Reviews.Author: ShutterbugTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. We were completely unimpressed. The hotel is beautiful in the common areas, but that's where it ends. Upon arrival, only SOME of the guests received leis, while others were ignored by the valets entirely. The receptionist checking us in barely looked at me, and even had a flirtatious conversation with another staffer while I was waiting there. The first room we had was in what they called the garden, but it was almost a sub-level. The room reaked of mold, and it turned out to be the couch. We requested a change and they did move us to a higher level with no moldy couch. We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. One of the days were were gone, we returned to find the door to our room ajar. Thankfully nothing was missing, but we called security. They found out that the guy who checks the mini bar had left it open. There was not much of an apology. We did receive a small basket of food as an apology, some of which was expired. The pool was insanely busy and getting poolside food or drink service demanded a significant wait. The food here was outrageous, even by Hawaii's standards. One night we had dinner at the restaurant next to the pool. It took 45 min. to be seated (and there were open tables ) and then took 75 min. to get the food. Again, there was a half-hearted apology, no discount on the food and the food was not worth what we paid for it. The positives of this hotel were that it was pretty in the common areas, and the private beach. You could easily access the beach from the resort and it was very well kept. Also, I hear that during the whale migration you can see the whales (and some dolphins) go through the area right from the beach. We did like Ka'anapali. It's about 45-60 min. from the airport because there is so much traffic in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt has it All”
Reviews.Author: Dirtbag35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club (KBC) on the same trip and prior to staying at the Hyatt...NO COMPARISON! The Hyatt had everything we needed and our 3.5 yr old had the absolute best time in the swimming pools. We were not notified by the broker - Robert [--] - that the KBC swimming pool would be under renovations during our stay which was the main reason we stayed there. We will definately stay at the Hyatt next time for the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing- 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Pd41
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay here at the Hyatt. Great rooms, service, but a little on the expensive side (but I mean come on, your in the middle of paradise and you're staying at a Hyatt). There are so many things to do in Maui. The Hyatt made our stay great, they were so professional. The only downside to the Hyatt is their section of the beach. Kaanapali beach is the 2-mile long beach in front of the Hyatt. The Hyatt has a not-so-great section of the beach; there are rocks, and the sand starts to get incorporated into the water and makes it nasty. There are a few moments of where the water is calm and it is good fro snorkeling, but overall there is a better location for you to go for a beach. It is not that far away, about a 5-10 minute walk to the north of the Hyatt to Black Rock. Black Rock is the north end of Kaanapali beach. It has crystal-clear water, and AMAZING, and I mean AMAZING snorkeling. It just seems that you visited a whole different beach, but you are still on the same beach. You can try the Hyatt's beach, but it is skinny and not that great; however, Black Rock is wide beach with amazing snorkeling and you can see many types of colorful fish. AND THAT'S JUST THE BEACH! The rooms at the Hyatt are spacious, nice, and very comfortable (your regular Hyatt, but with upgrades). The lobby is an open-air lobby and lets wildlife come in. There are amazing grounds at the Hyatt, and the pool is amazing. The waterfalls, slides, it is all great! The Hyatt has a great fitness center and is just a 5-10 minute car ride from the city of Lahaina. You'll just have to go to Lahaina to see what it looks like. It is a really cool city, with AMAZING LITTLE SHOPS and RESTAURANTS; oh, I almost forgot, you have to go to the Old Lahaina Luau. Do not go to the Hyatt's luau. GO TO THE OLD LAHAINA LUAU. IT IS AMAZING. Also go to the Haleakala sunrise, it is EXTRAORDINARY. You will never see anything like it. But, do not take a tour. Go by yourself, it is so much more convenient. You also need to do the Road to Hana. It does have a ton of hair-pin turns and bridges, but it is absolutely exquisite. Over all, if I were you I would take my advice because I had a absolutely great time here at Maui.

Reviews.Title: “This is a top class resort!”
Reviews.Author: supertravel24
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Beautiful grounds, amazing pool, great rooms with luxurious beds. If you are looking for a top class experience on Maui, this is the place! All of the staff are friendly and helpful. I am a sushi enthusiast, and the sushi bar at cascades is really great, and relatively inexpensive compared to all the other dining options in the area. All in all, a top class experience. Just skip the hotel luau. All of the other luaus in the area are better. Try one of them instead. Don't skip the breakfast buffet! Do it at least once. It is so good, and you deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “All we dreamt of and more”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsMaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights, it was the best vacation ever! The staff was courteous and friendly, grounds and common area were incredible, atmosphere was laid back and relaxing. Had dinner nightly poolside and was not disappointed. Buffet was so-so but adequate. Room had a gorgeous view but was somewhat small. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: DCSCS
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort. Something for everyone and outstanding service. Our family just got back April 13,09 and had a wonderul time. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Canadianangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the Hyatt for a week of rest and relaxation and were not disappointed! We arrived rather late in the evening and were pleasantly surprised to find that the pictures we had seen did not do this hotel justice. The open air lobby alone was AMAZING. Beautiful, lush, tropical. We were greeted and treated like old friends from the moment we stepped on the property. Check in was a breeze and we were soon off to our room where our luggage was delivered just after we arrived there. The next morning was such a treat. Still not used to the time change, I was awake by 5 and greeted by the sounds of tropical birds chirping and waves gently pounding. Ah, that's the way to wake up in the morning. Had coffee out on the lanai and enjoyed sunrise while looking at the gorgeous ocean and palm trees. Breakfast was always great at Swan Court...especially liked the eggs benedict. Lunch was usually at Umalu...huge portions there! A small fries is enough for 2 to share. Enourmous salads, yummy burgers, sandwiches, wraps, fish tacos. We had dinner at both Cascades Sushi Bar and Grill and Son'z at Swan Court. The sushi is very good at Cascades. Son'z had impeccable service. They made me a special drink...the best drink I had on my whole trip...some yummy strawberry, fresh coconut, mango concoction. The food was amazing. The banana french toast dessert was so delicious. By far one of our favourite dinners...liked it better than the Lahaina Grill which everyone raves about. For my husband's birthday I surprised him with the oceanfront dinner...it was set up in a private tent by the beach with romantic music, candlelight, leis; unbelievable. The food was simply amazing; by far the best dinner of the trip...worth every penny! So many courses...my eggplant appetizer was dinner portion and to die for. It was in the most delicate pastry. Unbelievably good. Every course was outstanding. Loved the coconut creme brulee served in a coconut shell as well. YUM! We booked a whalewatching cruise with the concierge on the Hula Girl. Fabulous brand new catamaran. Great food, friendly crew, saw lots of humpback whales and had a great time. The catamaran leaves from Kaanapali beach so that made it convenient as well. Highly recommended! The concierge also arranged a private helicopter to come pick us up for a 1 hr tour from the roof of the Hyatt. WOW! That was an experience of a lifetime. So worth it. Thumbs up to the concierge at the Hyatt! Loved lounging at the pool...yes the pool is cold when you first get in but SO refreshing on a hot day. There were always plenty of loungers for everyone so none of the madness in reserving chairs at dawn. We did rent a beach hale on our last day and thoroughly enjoyed it. There was a cooler full of bottled water and a fruit plate when we arrived. It is a very peaceful spot and a great place to really unwind and relax as you watch the waves crash on the beach. The kids area looked like a lot of fun too. I know my kids would love it! The grounds of the Hyatt are amazing. Waterfalls, streams, a pond; there are parrots, penguins, flamingos, swans, etc...it's a tropical paradise. The shops were great too...went elsewhere to get souvenirs but ended up returning to buy them at the Hyatt. We stayed in a deluxe oceanfront room and were happy with the accomodations. Can't beat that view! Room service did an amazing job cleaning rooms. The dressing area was particularily nice. Also, I am horribly allergic to mosquitos and get bitten everywhere I go. NO BITES here which is fantastic. Room service was good; they set everything up with linens; very elegant. The staff here are exceptional. They always call you by name and throughout the week you really feel like you get to know them. In every aspect the staff went above and beyond to ensure we were having a fabulous time. When it was time to go home I was so sad...it really felt like I was leaving home. I would come back in a heartbeat! Next time we might even bring the kids.....maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: srbjsim
Reviews.Content: All I can stay is that this hotel is great! We checked in the hotel on 3/31-4/7 2009 and were given an upgrade to Partial Oceanview room, a free breakfast and 2 for 1 luau ticket that we did used. By the way, the Drums of the Pacific luau was fantistic!. We had the breakfast which was included in with a room rate at Swan Court and it was very good. I would recommend getting the breakfast. I would also agree with other posts about the parking situation. The parking spaces are so small that I would also recommend having a compact car for Maui. I can't understand how anyone could post a negative review on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: glowinghearts
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hyatt on the Kanapali Coast of Maui was absolutely outstanding! We worked out every morning with Frank at the beautiful tennis centre and he was a phenomenal coach. The staff got to know us during our 1 week stay which made us feel right at home. The food was exquisite, the service was amazing, our partial ocean view room had a spectacular view of Lahaina, the local mountains, and the ocean. The beach was only steps from the pool, and the pool with the great water slide and water falls was the perfect size for everyone. The Hyatt is a gem of a property and we feel so lucky to have had the chance to experience Maui in 5 star comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class.”
Reviews.Author: mmartinAtlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for four nights in early April with our ten year old. The atrium lobby is pretty elegant, and our child was entranced with the penguins, huge koi, crowned crane, parrots, etc. The pool was also elegant with the tall waterfall and grotto. The kids' area served the littler kids very well, and the long slide was fun for the big kids and adults. One complaint: the only hot tub was large and not very hot, so in reality it was a heated pool stuffed with children. Not very relaxing. And there is no adults only pool. Live music at the pool was nice, when you wanted music, but there was no where (by a pool) to get away from the music and kid noise when you wanted peace and quiet. Our room was spacious. We liked having an empty (not mini-bar) refrigerator and fold out bed (in a king room). The "terrace view" room did overlook a parking lot, but we still enjoyed a great partial ocean view for the killer sunsets. There were some odd things for a resort aiming for this star rating. For example, the king sized bed had a reading lamp on only one side. Also, the hotel offered some nice freebies, like a hula demonstration. The problem is that the fliers that announced the time and place never mentioned that the demonstration would only take place if someone pre-registered for it. We were disappointed to wait around only to find out no one was coming. And, I was not pleased to walk to the spa for a steam only to find a sign that it was closing early for a private event. Given the price we paid, we were really pleased with our stay overall. We got an even better rate for the Wailea Marriott, though, and liked it at least as well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven”
Reviews.Author: WantstoTravelWorld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in 2007 and were impressed beyond belief. We arrived quite late on our first night after flying non-stop from New York and the service at the front desk was quite pleasant and greeted us with open arms. Our room was only supposed to be partial ocean view, but the way the balcony faced left us viewing the ocean in it's entirety. The resort is beautiful and the pool and location were perfect. I am usually a late sleeper, but awoke early every morning feeling refreshed and revitalized after sleeping on the comfortable beds and hearing the sound of the waves crashing all night long. We had the buffet breakfast each morning, which was included in our stay, and ate so much!!!! We took a walk each day after breakfast on the beach and it was nice and quiet at that time. The food in the resort was amazing but the best meal we had was in Lahaina at Aloha Mixed Plate, our meal totaled around 10 dollars for the two of us. We had asked the people who worked the valet parking at the hotel and they steered us in the right direction! We also attended the luau at the hotel and were impressed with the quality of food and mai tais. All we have to say is that the hotel and trip were amazing and we are looking to save up, because it is quite expensive, and return quite soon! I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service all the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: joglen10
Reviews.Content: Hyatt never disappointed us. The food was excellent, service is superb and the amenities are really great. My wife and I enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this resort for families and honeymooners. It's really wonderful. We also watched the Lu'au - Drums of the Pacific and its really fantastic. Go and spent vacation in Hyatt, its really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jpedeprincipal
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hyatt at Kanapali. The hotel was superb. The room was great and the service was outstanding. The concierge was especially excellent. If you have any questions, they are there to help and assist. The grounds are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, great pool for the kids, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pdxrlk
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (10) and I just returned from a week's stay at the Hyatt. We have fairly high standards, and they were exceeded at the Hyatt, from the setting, through the beautiful grounds, the fun pool, to the quality of the food and service. We walked up the Ka'anapali beach past the Marriott, the Westin, the Sheraton, and were happy we chose the Hyatt over these alternatives. Some recommendations: 1. Make Luau reservations upon your arrival. Apparently the two best luaus are in Lahiana, and we missed our chance for those. 2. Stock up on water and drinks from the nearby Safeway in Lahaina, to avoid a massive drink charge. Mixed drinks are about $12 at the resort. 3. We found the nearby town, Lahaina, to be a pretty tacky. We enjoyed a stroll through the town window shopping, but after 2 hours we tried to avoid Lahiana. 4. If you want to go whale watching (incredible) just walk up the beach to the Westin - they have a chartered service which picks you up directly on the beach. 5. This is a family resort. If you are expecting a jacuzzi not filled with kids, try someplace else (maybe the Ritz up the coast?). On the other hand, the children were all very well behaved, and our son said this was "the best vacation ever". 6. Hammocks! 7. Road to Hana. A bit of a let down, it took far too much time for too little return, but there were some nice sights. We live in a part of the country with incredible waterfalls (better than those on the road to Hana). If you make the trip, get an early start. Stop at the state park near Hana (beautiful rocky coast) and the cascading pools which are after Hana. The road is very, very rugged. 8. Try the fish tacos in the Umalu restaurant. Splurge at the sushi restaraunt - just beautiful plush surroundings and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great property for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: CLHouston
Reviews.Content: What I was really impressed with this hotel was its excellent and detail oriented services. Staffs carry such a friendly and warm attitude. I felt they truly paid attention to make customers happy. I was very thrilled. I shipped a flat box of snorkel and swimming equipment to Hyatt. At check-in, they reminded me that they had it. Front desk was very accommodating. They did not push to sell an upgrade. When I asked if I could pay an upgrade, they offered a free one instead. When I went to my room and requested my shipment, it was delivered immediately. Bell boy was very nice. Service at the pool was excellent. Rooms are tastefully decorated. Hallways and surroundings are clean and nicely maintained. The hotel is situated at the south end of the beach walk. The beach in front of the hotel is rocky. From the hotel to walk to Black Rock is about 1 mile long with Whaler Village in the middle. The hotel has a very nice and beautiful pool. But water was minimally warm so no one was using it. However, kids didn't care. Kid's pool was more crowded. It has a little slide and a few pool toys. My kid had a lot of fun. He also enjoyed the penguins and parrots in the lobby. I would definitely stay at this hotel, again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Smoke Free Resort”
Reviews.Author: IowaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: To get the negative out of the way, put simply, this is not a smoke free resort and if you expect otherwise, you may find significant annoyances. For instance there is a "smokers bench" and ash tray about 20 feet outside of the front door on the sidewalk to the self-park area. Perhaps another incentive to get valet parking! More to the point, when our neighbor on a non smoking floor decided to start smoking on his balcony the staff's response to us was that we should just tell him when we are going to have our door open so that he could stop smoking then. Only after three complaints and only after I went directly to the manager on duty, did they, at our suggestion move us to another room, a request they had earlier rejected because, as they put it, "you aren't the ones violating our policies." However, after it became clear that they were not about to ask the violator of the policy to move to their smoking floor (yes, apparently, they have a smoking floor!) they relented and moved us to the Regency Club floor and provided a night's free lodging as a courtesy. At that point I considered that matter resolved to my satisfaction but probably still worth a caution to others who are as annoyed by smoking as my wife and I are. Now the good points. I doubt whether there is a bad view in the hotel. In fact, after they moved us to the Regency Club floor we decided a lesser view room on the Regency Club floor would have been a greater value than the premium view we had reserved on a regular floor. The Regency Club offers wonderful amenities and a very attentive staff. It really is a B&B atmosphere within the hotel. The whale watching both from the beach and from the balcony of our room was astounding. The breakfast buffet was certainly adequate. And a variety of restaurants on site can be supplemented easily within the area. This was our first visit to Maui so it would be hard for us to rate how value for the dollar compares with similar resorts on the island. Overall, though, it struck us that for the price we paid and the service we received an "average" rating is probably even a little generous.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency in Maui -- Was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travelChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 6 nights in October for our honeymoon. The hotel is amazing as well as the staff. Everyone is very friendly. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package, and I would highly recommend this for anyone who is considering this option. The reason being is that if you're staying in Kannapali, there isn't much option for breakfast unless you want to take a walk to Whaler's Village. There is a small food court as well as a few restaurants @ Whalers Village. Or you could get in the car and drive to Lahaina which isnt' too far away either. There is not much beach to this hotel. If you want to be at a beach, stay at the Sheraton instead. The pool is the cool part of the hotel. Very nice grounds with tropical animals all over. The rooms are decent, although it probably could use another renovation. No complaints though. In terms of activities, I do recommend visiting the little activity shop right by the buffet. One person can help you coordinate all activities for your stay. Definitely do the sunrise at Haleakala and if you're adventurous, you must do the bike down. It's amazing and definitely scary at first, but you get the hang of it after you pass a couple of curves. The view of the sunrise is unbelievable...you have to dress warmly though!! The view from the bike down is a definite can't miss either. We also drove to Hana as well and also took the boat ride for the snorkeling adventure at Molokai. We also visited the Spa at the Hyatt and I do have to admit that it was extremely pricey for the service we received. I think it was over $400 for the both of us to get a one hour couples massage. I'm not sure if there are any other hotels that would offer something a bit cheaper? We didn't do much research on this. We're total foodies so the places that we loved to eat was Mama's Fish House. Yes, expensive, but the food is wonderful. If you're a sushi person, go to Sansei. Old Lahaina Luau is definitely an experience you don't want to miss, but the food is average. I've heard some folks say that if you go to Aloha Mixed Plate, the food the serve there is leftover from the Luau! Aloha Mixed Plate is SUPER cheap, plus you get a nice view of the beach. Don't expect fine dining though. One place I would totally avoid is Lelani's in Whaler's VIllage. We were advised to go there from the person that coordinated all of our activities at the hotel. This was the only suggestion that we were completely disappointed with. I think we would have rather eaten at McDonald's. The bill was over $100 and the food sucked so bad. I had a side of brocoli with my fish, and I swear they just reheated frozen brocoli!!! I will never forget that. If I'm paying $30+ for a dinner entree, I would at least expect fresh vegetables!! All in all, Maui was such a wonderful place to go for a honeymoon. The only thing we didn't get to do was head down to Wailea. I hear the Fairmont there is superb. If we go back, I think that would be where we would like to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Flawless”
Reviews.Author: MiamiW
Reviews.Content: Often times we each have an idea of the perfect vacation and we hope that our Travel Agent â€œdials upâ€� that perfect scenario for us to unwind, reset and plan our new and improved â€œtakeâ€� on our day-to-day lives upon our return to civilization. Well, in March, 2009, I could not have needed this type of â€œVacation Therapyâ€� more so I contacted my Travel Agent (Fran at â€œProtravel Internationalâ€�) and told her what I was seeking. Without hesitation she recommended the â€œHyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa.â€� So, I went for a one (1) week stay in mid-March, 2009 and I can honestly say that it was as spectacular, relaxing and memorable as any brochure claims it is. I had a partial Ocean-View room and it was totally worth the few extra dollars because sitting on the balcony watching the Sunset while reading was as cool as you fantasize it to be. The grounds were immaculate and completely focused on â€œchilling outâ€� with an active pool but also a walkway along the beach to a quieter area if that is what you desired. The Hyatt is at one end of the stretch of luxury hotels in Maui and the walkway along the beach gives you a very nice view of each Hotel as well as the gorgeous background of the Ocean. I guess it is what you make of it but how can it ever be bad when the starting point and ingredients are pool, beach, Ocean and gorgeous Sunsets? I did different things each day but they were all somehow related to the Hyatt. For example, shortly after my arrival I introduced myself to the Tennis Pro (â€œFrankâ€�) and I explained that I was just looking for someone to hit with a few times during my one week stay so that I could exercise a bit. Frank immediately made me feel comfortable and he worked out a schedule for me and I think that in addition to enjoying hitting with each other we started to hang out a bit and it was fun. He offered me tips â€“ and I can certainly use them â€“ but he seemed to know exactly when to be the â€œtennis proâ€� and when to simply be a â€œhitting companion.â€� The setting where the tennis courts are situated is SO beautiful and relaxing. There is nothing like getting up early to hit tennis balls at 8 AM in Maui and feel yourself slowly come alive to the sound of a solidly hit tennis ball mixed in with birds chirping and other wildlife wake-up in the background. I brought my own tennis racket but you neednâ€™t bring yours as Frank seemed to have a wide variety of rackets. I also quizzed Frank about some daytrips I should take and he gave me excellent advice â€“ along with a Map pointing out the joints I must check out. All in all â€“ the tennis part was a major highlight of my week. I also went on a snorkeling half day trip on the Hyattâ€™s â€œHula Girlâ€� boat and that was pure perfection. The boat is almost brand new, the lunch was great and the crew was extremely professional and safety conscious but also very laid back and cool. If I had to diagram how I would want such a snorkeling trip to go â€“ well â€“ they stole the playbook! Breakfast at the Hyatt was a totally adequate Buffet in an amazingly beautiful setting which was half inside and half outside with birds flying in and out. I believe my breakfast was included in the travel package I had and I made it there about half of the days because on the other days I slept-in. Hey, I was on vacation so â€¦. I had dinner my last night at the Hyattâ€™s beautiful ocean-view restaurant and it also was perfect. The food was great, the setting was fantastic and the service was excellent. There were always two (2) Concierge-like people at the front of the Hyatt offering advice on things to do and answering any questions about the Hyatt or about Maui. I found these folks to be extremely knowledge and detail-oriented. They even set me up with a Golf Trip to the island of Lanaâ€™i which included taking a ferry and renting clubs and they facilitated everything without any problems. I did have a situation or two where there was a slight mistake by the hotel staff such as a missed wake-up call but the Hotelâ€™s response to my compliant was so cool that it wound up being more of a â€œbonding experienceâ€� and I left the Hyatt with even more confidence in trusting them with my valuable vacation time. (In the missed Wake-Up call circumstance the Hotel Operator felt so bad that she sent me a tasty basket of chocolate and in another situation one of the Assistant Hotel Mangers gave me free access to the Spa.) In terms of the Spa, I did not get around to checking it out until my last day and that was a mistake because it is AMAZING. The â€œrelaxation roomâ€� is picturesque as it is â€œenclosedâ€� but also open in the front where lying on a lounge chair would have you facing out into the Ocean with the fresh ocean air blowing in to refresh you. I did not get a Spa Treatment but I was told they have approximately 15 treatment rooms so I got the feeling that there would not be a long wait. However, I did very much enjoy just hanging out and relaxing in that room. I could go on and on but I think you get the picture. The only negative comment I have is that the interior of my Guest Room seemed a bit dated and while I had a spacious room the interior room inside the bathroom which contained the toilet and Shower was VERY small. It was so small that there was barely room in-between the toilet and the shower and that seemed very much out of place for such a luxurious Hotel. All in all, though, I would trust the Hyatt in Maui withy my Vacation Time as it was near PERFECTION.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BellaDonnainDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui for 3 nights during our trip to Maui. It is beautiful. The rooms were nicely furnished, there is a walk-in closet in our regular sized rooms. The hotel is new and updated and kept very clean which is important to me. The swimming pool is the best pool on that strip of resorts in Maui. There is a children's water slide. We ate at all the restaurants on the resort. The food was good but kind of pricey. The workout room has a good amount of equipment for a hotel, the view is gorgeous when you are on the stationary bikes and treadmills looking out onto the water. The hotel offers boogie board and snorkel rentals but again, it is expensive. The things that I did not like about staying on the resort: Parking-overcrowded. It was also a long walk from the room to the parking lot. Beach-the hotel has beach access but that part of the beach is not the best, go up north several resorts on the strip and the beach is much better. Pros outweigh cons in this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy resort, beautiful grounds, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: bryntrips
Reviews.Content: Our first staff interaction at the Hyatt was a great introduction to the property. A friendly young reception staffer, Thomas, overheard that we were on our honeymoon and upgraded us from our basic, terrace-view (read: parking lot view) room to an ocean-view room on the 3rd floor. Then he gave us a keepsake bamboo photo album, an invitation to a honeymooners-only cooking class at the resort restaurant for the following night, and a coupon for a free bottle of champagne at any of the resort's restaurants while we were there. It made us feel very welcomed from the very beginning of our stay. Our room itself was nicely laid out, with wonderful-smelling toiletries, comfortable bed, lovely furniture and a nice lanai with view of the gorgeous landscaping and the beach. A lot of time has been spent thinking about how to decorate the calming, comfortable rooms. The beach at the resort is one of the smaller and most sloping of those on Kaanapali Beach, and because it was lined with pieces of coral that had broken off the reef, as well as coral hidden just under the sand on the coast, it was kind of unpleasant to swim on the beach (plus we had crappy weather when we were there, so we didn't much want to). But the other beaches north of the Hyatt, walkable on the lovely paved ocean path, are much better--wider, with more room for towels and sand castles and swimming. The pool is really fun, with a slide and a cave-grotto, and lots of other fun places to explore. It was very cold, though, so we didn't spend much time in the pool because it wasn't especially warm when we were there. The location is great--just 10 minutes-drive north of Lahaina, where there are lots of restaurants and a nice town to explore, and right on Kaanapali beach, where you can walk to probably 20 restaurants and a hundred stores. Great people-watching from the pool chairs facing the ocean and the ocean walk. It's also a beautiful drive to take the road north of Kaanapali Beach that curves around the northernmost part of West Maui before going back to Kahului--much more scenic (and terrifying, in parts) than the overrated and overtraveled road to Hana, plus you actually GET somewhere instead of having to turn around at the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “we would go back”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes1chicago
Reviews.Content: The service was great in all areas of the hotel. The views from our room was wonderful even though it faced the parking lot. There is no way to make the grounds there not look nice. The rooms were nicer than had depicted in the pictures as well. All areas of dining were reasonably priced. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful, Quiet Retreat.........2/18/09-2/22/09”
Reviews.Author: mauigrays88
Reviews.Content: We have been staying with the Hyatt since 1988 and even with all the changes, the charm, service and location still call us. Jennifer at the Lobby began our trip with her comfortable personality and desire to please. Jeffre, at the Concierge Desk, was willing to go the extra mile. Although you noticed signs of the recession, Banyan Bar and Spats, no longer, the Hyatt still delivered on much needed tranquility without the barrage of sales and commercial hype that you found as you walked towards Whaler's Village. Without feeling like you were in a zoo atmosphere, you were able to watch the sunset and feel like it was just for you. We knew to park our own car and since traveling light carry our own luggage to the room, to avoid extra charges. A new restaurant off site, The Melting Pot, is a must visit. A totally different dining experience...expect to stay for two hours...have the waiter explain the process with the choosing of meals. The Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach is the perfect retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby...good rooms...average service ...bad inroom dining”
Reviews.Author: eve33Newyork
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and exquisitely pretty... the pools are nice and the kids really enjoyed the waterfalls....the lobby is a pleasure to walk into....Rooms are ok ...ours faced the ocean and had a very pretty view... was worth paying extra for.... Swan restaurant is great for breakfast... serenely pretty with the swans ...good choices for food.... In room dining is really bad... small portions...very expensive and bad quality.... Pool side dining is ok.. i guess....nice portion and decent prices.....if you don't want to go out and rest by the pool it is not a bad idea..... The SPA is nice ...went for deep tissue massage... expensive and the staff could have been friendlier .... Staff needs to learn to be nicer.....the business center people are out right rude...not helpful at all

Reviews.Title: “As nice as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: hulahunny
Reviews.Content: We have been to this property many times and it was as nice as we had remembered. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and is a very nice addition to our room price as a Diamond member. The staff are very accommodating and worked hard to ensure that our stay was memorable. We had some plumbing problems on our second day. We reported the problem and the maintenance staff was right there to fix it. Unfortunately, the problem wasn't fixed and our toilet continued to leak from the bottom on the third day. Again we reported the problem and assumed it was fixed when we returned from the beach. Sadly it wasn't fixed and day four brought the same problems. This time we talked to the front desk manager and she recommended that we change rooms. There is nothing worse than to change rooms mid-way through the stay. We packed up and the bell man promptly came with our new room keys and a cart to transfer our bags. We were pleasantly surprised to see our new room was better than our original room. The front desk staff was also very accommodating at providing compensation for our inconvenience. The hotel pools are huge and the slide is always entertaining. The only downside to this property is the fact that the beach at the hotel is very rocky and not conducive to swimming. There is a lovely beach walk however, that will take you to the beach at the Westin where you can easily swim free of coral. I highly recommend this property. The rooms could use an update, but the staff are great, the valet is very efficient and the wait times are minimal, the front desk staff are outstanding and the wait staff at the Swan Court are always pleasant and ready to serve. In fact, there are several staff in the Swan Court that have been there for many years and are there every year when we visit. That speaks volumes. Overall, this place can't be beat. Even if we have Hilton points to use at the Grand Wailea and can stay for free, we opt for the Hyatt and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the weston Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kdekime
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the views, the service, the room. Everything about our stay was wonderful . The hotel is in the beach and it has a great beach walk/ running trail. The food is expensive , but there is a place called the whalers village right next door to the hotel (on the trail) that has more reasonably priced food. I highly reccomend taking the gemini whale watching tour. You can save 10 percent if you book online. The service at this hotel is great everyone is so friendly. Hawaii is a great place to visit, or better yet live.

Reviews.Title: “best pool in lahaina”
Reviews.Author: chrisandmikey
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at the hyatt. the hotel had two large pools that were joined by a swim-up bar that was located in a cave. the staff was very accomodating and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. we saw a luau at our hotel which was amazing, very entertaining. couples from other hotels came to this luau because they heard it was the best. do not miss it. Shopping and nightlife was located 10 min car ride away in Lahaina. we went there for dinner almost every night. fyi, the locals that we met when we were in waikiki said they vacation at this hyatt in maui quite frequently. we now know why.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: coolcat3
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort on every trip to Hawaii, and it has always been a wonderful visit. The grounds are incredibly beautiful, with lush landscaping and colorful birds everywhere. The pool is amazing, with waterfalls and a swim-up bar. This place really makes you feel like you're in paradise. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. The rooms are nice and clean, and the views from the ocean front rooms are fantastic. There are many shops in the resort, which is very convenient. There's also nightly entertainment, and an excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and location”
Reviews.Author: IowaBigBobDavenport
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week with for a company vacation from a supplier. The trip over and back was long but 5000 miles is not done at the snap of a finger. The rooms were clean and the staff was helpful from the maid service to the bartenders. The worst I can say is "I ATE TOO MUCH!" The prices for the bar and at Umulu were higher than the value received, but the better restaurants had a nicer atmosphere and quality of food. I guess the one bad thing was the shower walls were dirty and soap scum was on them, but I just kept my hands off the walls and forget to mention it to the desk. We went to Pearl Harbor for the tour and I recommend doing a tour rather than flying over and getting a rental car on your own. The traffic in Honolulu is bad and if you don'y know where you are going- Forget it. Arizona and Missouri were awesome and very sobering. Did whale watchin out of Lahaina, Slip 11 charter, and recommend them, cost under $40 each. Saw LOTS of whales, I do highly recommend seeing them, they are awesome also. Did Ruth Chris Steakhouse inj Lahaina and the food was GREAT. Others in party went to Molokini to snorkel and they were happy.and took helicopter over Hana and crater. I probably won't return to Hawaii as once is enough and I saw what I wanted to. Take the Trolly, FREE, to Whaler's Village and get on local bus, $1.00, to other destinations if you have time. It is fun to mingle with the locals and see what you don't see at the tourist traps. ABC stores are best for cheap souveniors which will end up in someone's yard sale next year anyway. Excpect to pay high dollar everywhere as everything has to be shipped or flown in. And YES, the bars need to stay open longer at the property. Now, go have a great vaca!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SuzyandAndy
Reviews.Content: Maui was the second stop on our honeymoon after leaving Los Angeles. We had wanted to make our honeymoon the most amazing experience of our lives and I can say, 5 months on, that I want to go back tomorrow. The hotel was fantastic, the staff are friendly and cant do enough for you. The food at the resturants was first class, a bit pricey, but worth it. We used the free trolley bus to take us to the bus stop where we got the Maui Bus into Lahaina. This bus was the best value for money we had, clean and punctual. We loved the hotel. Our room was a terrace room, looked out onto the Luau and to the mountains. In the morning we were awoken by the sun coming over the mountains. Perfect start to our married life, in one of the most perfect locations. The pool was cool and after braving the waterfall we were in the cave having our cocktails. We then strolled down the beach to the surf lessions. Unfortunately we couldnt go out on a boat ride due to the sea conditions but settled on the ocean centre instead! Road to Hana was great, however, a bit hairy, its called divorce road!. Loved it and if i could afford to go back tomorrow i would.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Planetekarl
Reviews.Content: Imagine you're walking down a perfect beach. The sea's kissing your feet. It's a warm sunny morning and it's your first day there. You're about to find a small path to a wonderful paradise...The Hyatt Regency. We arrive at this place late morning walking from our hotel (see other review). We sit down and order drinks, and more drinks. Talk about last night's experience and say to ourselves : "This is where we want to stay." The girls leave us and come back a few minutes later : "We're staying here". The had negociated everything. They picked us up at our other hotel, greeted us with flowers, provided the nicest friendly service available, a great room with a great view of the ocean, and everything else. We spent the next eight days in paradise. We will never forget the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort overall”
Reviews.Author: MandB31
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. Setting is absolutely awesome. Most gorgeous lobby I have ever seen. Staff was terrific. Our booking agent failed to properly book our trip, but the assistant manager at the Hyatt went out of her way to make up for the travel agency's mistakes. The pools were wonderful and, although we were there over Thanksgiving, the water never seemed too crowded (although it was difficult to find a chair by the pool, at times.) The pools wind their way through various formations and waterfalls. There is a very long slide that is not terribly steep and accomodates adults, as well as children. There is a beach area in front of the spa, although the water isn't that clear. However, that is true of the entire beachfront strip in this area of Maui. On the downside, the rooms are very small, although decently appointed. Food is overpriced and we had two bad experiences at the Umalu Restaurant: At lunch, our waiter disappeared after taking our order. The hostess was not at all helpful. Another waitperson saw us sitting there forever and eventually grabbed our food for us, which was, by then, ice cold. We decided to return for dinner to give the restaurant a second chance. It was a Thanksgiving buffet and the turkey consisted of a pan of dark meat remnants. It was the most unappetizing Thanksgiving display I have ever seen--and costly. Overall, a good experience at this hotel, but don't expect much from the rooms and avoid Umalu's--unless efforts have been made the improve the service there. Shopping arcade on ground floor was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Typical”
Reviews.Author: scooterfly
Reviews.Content: The grounds are awesome and the lobby is quite impressive. All of the employees are gracious and kind too! We booked a deluxe ocean view room and specified no smoking. That was critical as I'm allergic to smoke. Our room was a typical room, nothing deluxe about it. Our view was of the kids pool and all the noise that comes with a kids pool. Our room was non smoking but our neighbors balcony was not. They chain smoked next door and pretty much ruined our use of the balcony. Being a platinum member I was hoping for an "upgrade" to a room with a view that I paid for (the ocean) but no luck. I think for us, flying over 10 hours from the midwest to get here, then having the hotel give us a smoking kiddy pool view room for the "deluxe ocean view" price will prevent us from returning. Another issue was the pool area. People were hogging all the lounge chairs the staff does nothing about it. Sort of like being on a cheap cruise with limited seating. The parking is different since it is one of the very few things that aren't charged for but if the lot is full (as is usually the case) you have to valet for $20/night. If you beg the valet will remove the charge but it's a hassle. One thing to do for sure is the roof top star gazing, awesome views and great insight From Bob.

Reviews.Title: “Tennis”
Reviews.Author: furilla
Reviews.Content: Tennis If you are a tennis enthusiast you should try out the Tennis facility located at the Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach. The facility is exceptional with everything you will need to fully enjoy yourself. Tennis shoes and rackets are provided if you didn't bring your own. The facility and the mountain view as a backdrop is something that you won't find in too many places. You don't need to be a guest to use this facility and the prices are very reasonable ($30 for a 1 hour clinic). The Tennis pro (Frank Salvador) was excellent. Frank provides daily clinics focusing on a different aspect of the game each day. You will feel comfortable no matter your level. You can also get private lessons with Frank (highly recommended) or Frank can help you get set up with other players equal to your skill level. I highly recommend attending this facility you won't be disappointed. Ed Furilla ______________

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency was great for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: clee82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 7 days for our honeymoon October 5-12, 2008 and we thought it was wonderful for what we paid. The open air lobby has parrots, penguins, and cranes which was a surprise. We received an upgraded ocean view with a bottle of champagne because it was our honeymoon which was an added benefit. The pool was amazing, although, you have to get out there early to claim a chair close to the pool and the attendants will take your towels if you leave them there more than an hour.
