The kids pool was fun even for adults with their waterslide. The rooms are updated and very "Hawaiian" and the bed was especially comfortable. The restaurants there are slightly over-rated but convienent. The breakfast buffet at the Swan Court is expensive but you have a great view (especially romantic at night) and there are a lot of choices. One downside is that there are a ton of birds flying around for scraps because it's also open air. The food for dinner is limited but I would suggest any fish dish on their menu. If you come for your honeymoon, this is the location for the "honeymooners reception." My husband and I were told that this is where we enjoy free cocktails and hor deurves. The truth is that they hand you one glass of wine or champagne and then you are seated with other honeymooners to enjoy 3 pieces of items featured on their menu. It's not open bar and it's not enough to equate to an appetizer--so skip it. The best part of the hotel is it's location. There's a sidewalk that will take you past all the other resorts and to the area's shopping center. The hotel was worth what we paid, $1500 for the week but when we go back to Maui, we are going to stay in Wailea. It's a lot less touristy but a lot more expensive. Tips: Buy a A3h gold card for $30. I got the tip from frommer's--the 1st of every month, they sell excursion tickets for 50% off! We both snorkeled for $90, we both biked for half $45, so it cost $30 but saved us $150. Recommendations: Stay in Wailea, play a round of golf at Kapalua-(twilight rates are about $100 cheaper) and have dinner at the Pineapple Grill, watch the sunrise and bike down Haleakala, skip the Molokini Crater (there aren't that many things to see underwater, rent a car and only drive about half of the road to Hana, there's nothing there when you get there and it will make you car sick.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return, even though kids' pool was great”
Reviews.Author: letstravel99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for over a week with our 3 young children and although the kids' pool was great, the hotel rooms were awful and not what you would expect for a Hyatt. Grant it, I was expecting it to be a step down from where we usually stay (The Grand Wailea) but I didn't anticipate it to be so far below in quality and service. Our bathroom smelled like a sewer - it was so awful we had to keep the door closed at all times. The tub/toilet area was very cramped, which made it very difficult to bathe the kids. And the sink area was very dark. The carpet was gross (I hated to let my baby crawl around on it) and the pull-out couch was disgusting. The rooms were old and felt dirty and tired. The grounds were okay; it was fun to have wildlife there (penguins, flamingoes, and cranes). But the beach there is basically non-existant. It is difficult to access (esp. with kids) b/c the property is elevated above the beach and so you have to jump down/off a small cliff. And once down on the very small beach, the water is murky and full of seaweed and lava rocks. No fun. We had to walk down several hotels in order to get in the water. The pools were fun - the adult water slide is very fun and the kids' pool is designed in such a way that the kids can play independently. That was good. But overall, I find Kaanapali to be way inferior to the Wailea area. It is so much more commercial and crowded. I was surprised with all the noise - from the airtraffic to the boat traffic to all the tourists walking the beach path (who, by the way, fail to move aside for joggers, etc...). I will never stay on this side of the island again. The only reason we left Grand Wailea was b/c the closed the pools for construction.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tennis at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Karin3
Reviews.Content: Hi there We just came back from 10 days in Maui and had a wonderful time. We stayed at the Grand Wailea and the Marriott Maui Ocean Club.... both were fantastic. I am writing my review on the Tennis pro and facility at the Hyatt which was next door to the Marriott. I played each day and took a lesson or a clinic each day as well. Frank Salvador is the Director of Tennis and the head pro at the Hyatt. I would highly recommend going to the tennis facility and playing with Frank if you are staying in the Kaanapali area!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place on Maui”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelwithyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt in February 2008 and liked it so much we came back for my birthday in October of the same year. The staff bent over backwards to give us a room in the location we wanted. Brunch was included in our package and while pretty similar each day, it was always good. The service in the restaurants on site was prompt and the food delicious. The grounds are well maintained and we never had any problems finding a lounge chair at the pool. The location is perfect for walking to Whaler's Village or just down the beachwalk. Lots of choices of restaurants along the way. I am looking forward to my next visit to the Hyatt, hopefully in early 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Not Horrible, but Not Fantastic Either...”
Reviews.Author: sonnyjane
Reviews.Content: Like many others have mentioned here, after reading many of the reviews, I was nervous about my decision to choose this hotel. It is rated a four-star hotel, but I don't know that I could say that in good faith after my stay. Upon arrival we received leis and upon learning it was our honeymoon were given a free photo album. They also sent a bottle of champagne up to the room which was much appreciated. Unfortunately our room was directly (and I cannot emphasize enough how directly) above the luau stage, and so we were "treated" to the very very very loud luau from 5-8 pm for seven consecutive nights. Luckily we were usually out to dinner during that time so we could escape. We also found some crushed up Dorito's and a spider web on the floor, which reminded me of some other reviews here, but I didn't even care to ask for a new room since I had already unpacked. I was also a bit upset because we valeted the car for $20 the first night after being told that there was "very limited parking", but once we discovered the virtually abandoned free self-parking lot, we never valeted the car again. You can tell that this hotel, like all of them right now in Maui, are being hit hard by this economy. Restaurants that normally require reservations sat virtually empty and allowed walk-ins. We arranged for a romantic dinner at the hotel's fine dining restaurant, Son'z, and I was disappointed to find that there were only 2 servers for about 15 tables. Service was devastatingly slow, and the food only so/so. We found much better restaurants off-site. I wanted to drink and enjoy my honeymoon but all three of the hotel's restaurants had such slow service that I was never even asked if I wanted a second drink until we were ready for the check. This was actually true of most the restaurants we visited...I think the pace in Maui is just much much slower than ours. The only other disappointment was that the pool had insufficient seating. All of the seats were taken by 8:30 am, so we only visited the pool once during our week-long stay. The pool policy was that you only leave a towel unattended for 60 minutes to reserve a seat, which I think was ridiculous because that's what happened to all of the seats...someone scouted before breakfast and then left the seat "saved", for much longer than an hour I might add. I didn't appreciate that at all. For what we paid, about $500/$600 for the cheapest room during peak season, I would have expected so much more. The location was good, as it was close to all the restaurants, but if you want a better caliber of hotel, I'd suggest the Wailea 5-stars instead.

Reviews.Title: “Need to be Aware...”
Reviews.Author: Awalkinthepark
Reviews.Content: Please be aware of this hotel based on what you are accustomed to. If you do not travel often or you are ok with staying at an Econo Lodge, Red Roof Inn, Days Inn or a Super 8 motel â€“ then you would think the Hyatt Regency Maui is a grand hotel (compared to what you are accustomed to). However, if you are used to staying at real 3 stars or above (4 or 5 star) hotels, then this place is definitely not for you! This hotel, although it is rated 4 stars and Conde Nast had the nerve to put it on the â€˜top Maui hotels listâ€™, it is more like a 2 star hotel in terms of quality, cleanliness and customer service. My husband and I would compare it to a very bad Embassy Suites (in fact the Hyattâ€™s atrium has the same motif). We have stayed at several very nice hotels and this Hyatt was not even comparable to a $150 - $250 per night hotel room (and it cost much more)!! Firstly, the service was less than desirable. We tried not to complain since it was our Xmas holiday trip with our two children, but it was unbearable and we could not hold out much longer. Our room was not cleaned properly (no vacuuming, bath room not sanitized nor cleaned thoroughly) for several days. Only after we escalated the issue to the housekeeping management was the room prepared in a presentable fashion during the daily cleaning (and we are not the type of hotel patrons that trash a room since we keep our things very orderly and tidy). The restaurant, SonZ, inside the hotel is not a part of the Hyatt. I would strongly discourage anyone from eating dinner at this place! They brought us dinner rolls that were literally not cooked (you could pull the bread apart and see all of the gummy yeast!), and the focaccia bread served with the rolls was stale and very hard! We did not dine there once we experienced this mess, and promptly left the restaurant. The atrium grounds and the pool area (particularly the waterslide and kids pool area) are good for families since there are many exotic birds and pool toys that children can enjoy. Other than that, the hotel is a dump! If the service was better, it may have compensated for the less-than-good quality hotel cleanliness, but the service was awful and not what youâ€™d expect from a Hyatt. The Asian statues around the hotel lobby area were not even dusted since you could see the excessive dust build up on the statues and pedestal stands. The large windows in the rooms and throughout the hotelâ€™s common areas were also not cleaned regularly and we even spotted several big cob-webs that were evident that the spiders had been living there for quite some time! PLEASE do yourself a favor and stay at a really nice place if you are planning a trip to Maui. We went to visit the Four Seasons and this hotel truly lives up to theâ€˜5â€™ star status it has been bequeathed. Believe me, depending on what you are accustomed to, it will be worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: c0reyann
Reviews.Content: First of all, NEVER EVER BOOK WITH EXPEDIA! Gah! The headaches! The Hyatt was amazing! From arrival to departure, we felt pampered and taken care of. The grounds are amazing and so well kept! I never got a chance to enjoy the pools but they looked divine. I also absolutely LOVED the wildlife in the resort. The food was pricey but was always good - the pizza from room service is amazing! The breakfast buffet wasn't free for us - and boy was that price steep ($35/pp). Not worth it unless you eat a lot or have the voucher IMHO. The rooms were nice and roomy - we had the Deluxe Ocean View which had a couch, coffee table, chairs and dining table, large king bed and a bathroom area with mini bar, fridge and coffee maker. Although a bit tired, it was still a nice room and the balcony couldn't be any better!!! We would absolutely return here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy camper”
Reviews.Author: cperrywebrat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel and thought the grounds were beautiful, very very nice. However when we finally reached our room, it was not much different than a Holiday Inn, or Best Western, just a simple room with a couple of beds and a table and a couple of chairs, no flat screen just archaic crt, ?? what are we paying for. I booked a deluxe ocean view with a separate sitting area, was told the separate sitting area was the table and chairs in the room. The free breakfast buffet is very nice, but if you are looking for nice accomodations in your room, look elsewhere, or sleep in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “There for Tennis and R&R”
Reviews.Author: Aloha46
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after 7 glorious days in Ka'anapali. Overall it was a fabulous experience; we thoroughly enjoyed the recreation amenities (tennis courts, daily tennis clinics, beach, health club, spa and pools) and were pleasantly surprised with the quality of food offered at various restaurants on the property and at the Regency Club. Food: the convenience of 4 restaurants (including Weeping Banyon cafe) right at the hotel made it easy to enjoy a variety of food without having to wander off the grounds. We particularly enjoyed the light lunch menu featured at Umalu (alongside the pool) as there were a number of interesting choices (share plates and salads) each of which was prepared with the freshest ingredients. (Try the Hawaiian poke nachos!) Sonz in Swan Court was the other favorite; we tried three (delicious!) fish dishes and had an outstanding rack of lamb. Don't miss the last page of their wine and spirits menu as it has a few "interesting surprises". ;-) While the rooms themselves were VERY clean; they do appear somewhat "tired" and in need of updating. BUT we found that the atrium tower with open air foyer, the grounds, the beach, and recreation amenities were impeccably maintained or groomed. The variety of birds and vegetation on the property provided much interest while we toured the grounds. The Aloha spirit prevails at the Hyatt in Ka'anapali! We found the staff to be so friendly and accomodating; always went out of their way to make us "feel at home" by treating us like royalty! The tennis staff, Regency Club attendants, pool staff and front desk personnel made our stay one of the best vacations we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: YD73
Reviews.Content: amazing pools, waterfalls, service, and amazing views of the most beautiful place on earth. you hawaiians are truly the luckiest people on earth!!! amazing trip we had. we will go back for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lorikat723
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Maui about every 8 months since 1993. I have never stayed at the Hyatt but had been to the Restaurants (Swan Court has been a long time favorite) and walked around the grounds many times. I had looked forward to my first stay at the Hyatt, wanting to feel pampered and indulged by the Hyatt atmosphere. The hotel lobby and grounds are always lovely and were no disappointment this time, however as we were checking in, I noticed the torches weren't lit. I just figured maybe it was a bit early or something. The rooms were large enough, but I was taken aback by the decor and the very old, very bulky tv in the room. No flat screen, no DVD player, no Stereo. I thought this was the Hyatt?!? It doesn't matter that we are in Maui.and won't spend much time in the room... these things are common place in hotel rooms accross the world now. The Hyatt should be state of the art for the prices they charge and because they have a certain reputation....that they will loose if their other hotels are going down the tubes like this one is.! I've stayed at many of the resorts on the island and many condo's. Even the Sheraton has nicer furniture in their rooms then this place. Our in-room hair dryer sparked and almost caught on fire when we tried to use it.....I haven't seen a hair dryer like that in 10 years...again...I thought I paid for the Hyatt ....the grounds, althpough lovely, were never lit up the entire week we were there. No Torches were lit except those directly near the open restaurants or lounges. But coming up the drive and along the walking paths thpoughout the property...the torches were never lit! So when you went for a walk around the proerty at night....some of the unlit paths led nowhere. Isn't that what we think of when we think of Hawaii?? moonlit walks along a torch lit boardwalk? We asked several times why they weren't lit but never got a straight answer. It wasn't too windy....quite the contrarty...besides....those torches can handle a lot of wind. Anyway...I won't stay there again. At least I know now....For Kaanapali....I'll stick with the Sheraton for the quality of their rooms and their service even if their grounds don't measure up to the Hyatt.. For Wailea....stick with the Fairmonth Kea Lani or Four Seasons. The service at Hyatt was immpeccable though.

Reviews.Title: “U'malu will definitely impress you!!!”
Reviews.Author: sapphire_36
Reviews.Content: We visited the beaches of Ka'anapaali several times during our 2-week stay in Maui and dined at some of the restaurants lining the beachside path. The first time there we tried the Hula Grill. It was about 12:30pm and the atmosphere there was buzzing. We were welcomed by a friendly hostess who seated us right away. I have no allergies or conditions or anything but unfortunately I'm VERY particular about food!! The Hula Grill menu had a good selection of items that listed all the ingredients and sauces involved. That is a huge plus for me. i had the thai pizza without cheese and it was exactly what I was looking for. The service was good. The second time we only wanted a snack so we had bagels with jam and chai lattes from the cafe in the Whalers village. What a nice man behind the counter!!! Made conversation with us while our order was being prepared and was genuinely interested in us. Of course the coffees and bagels were perfect, hard to go wrong there. The third visit to Ka'anapaali we lunched at U'malu lounge at the Hyatt Regency. It was a nice walk down the path and we were curious to see what the hype was about the pool. What a sight. The pool is for hotel guests only and guests were branded by bright yellow bracelets so we didn't get to try the swim-up Grotto Bar for a drink but we found U'malu shortly after. It wasn't crowded at all for 1pm. We thought there might be a hungrier lunch crowd. But a break from the usual noise was nice and the energy was still there since U'malu is next to the pool. AWESOME FOOD!!! I was skeptical as I always am about places I've not read about but I took a chance and ordered the Firecracker Chicken Wrap without onions, tomatoes, or ranch. I didn't think it came with a side as it didn't mention on the menu that sides accompanied the lunch items. So i ordered a small basket of fries (at $6!! oops!) the waiter repeated our orders word for word and that really put me at ease. You don't know how many times I've had Mcdonalds mess up my wraps even though I say word for word "no sauce, no cheese, just chicken-lettuce-and-tortilla" and I'll get mayo on it and no lettuce. The wrap was perfect!! And it actually came with taro chips (I think they were house-made potato chips with taro fibres in them) which were delicious. I felt guilty ordering fries too, the basket is MASSIVE you'd need to share with at least 3 others!!! The waiter was attentive and made conversation with us when he came to check how that food was. I wish I'd ordered salad, my boyfriend had salad with his sandwich and it was the kind I like at home. Just mixed greens, no tomato or croutons or anything else on it. And not the crummy iceberg salads you sometimes get! Also his mai tai was practically a double so even though cocktails are $10 and up you're getting your dollar's worth. They come in pretty large cups. So if your guidebook mentions this place you should go because I'm very critical and this place impressed the pants off me. I also recommend Beach Bums lounge in Ma'alaea. Good selection of american food and kalua bbq meat dishes. $2 beers and $4 mai tais at happy hour!! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Come here for an amazing Kaanapali experience”
Reviews.Author: Hazel123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing. The grounds are incredible, with the highlight being the exotic bird exhibits that adorn the oceanside of the property. Among other highlights are the beautiful pool; the coffee bar, which is perfect for a light bite in the morning; the oceanside path connecting the property to its neighboring hotels; and the fitness center, which is clean, well-equipped and stocked with cold towels and jugs of refreshing lemon water. The adjacent hotel properties in this area of Kaanapali provide good options for dining and nightlife within easy walking distance, meaning you could easily go a day or two of your trip without driving. The only minor con is the lack of a substantial beachfront, but you can walk 2 minutes south on the oceanside path to a great beach if you need some time in the sand & surf.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ralph1014
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7 night stay (Nov 12 - 19) at the Hyatt Maui for our 25th wedding anniversary. 10 years earlier we had stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Kauai and were totally impressed. The Grand Hyatt in Maui did not disappoint. I actually liked the hotel in Maui a little better because there were more activities to do being close to other hotels and Lahaina. I'll start with the negatives, though these are relatively immaterial. Not crazy about the $15 per day resort fee which primarily covers use of the fitness center (which we used a lot). Had one instance where I could not find a parking place, but parked off to the side next to some hedges anyway. Check-in was a little slow (only 2 people at the check-in desk), especially after traveling 12 hours. Bathroom (tub and toilet area) a little cramped. That's about it. On the positives which overwhelm the negatives. Excellent service and staff. Friendly, helpful, and always greet you. Hotel upgraded us to a deluxe ocean view room on one of the upper floors. Bottle of champagne greeted us. The hotel and grounds are enormous but beautiful. Plants, gardens, streams, waterfalls all like a little garden of Eden. Balcony view of ocean, Lanai and pool are stunning. Though pricey as you might expect, the restaurants and food were great. I would recommend having the breakfast buffet included in the price of your trip if you can because it is very expensive separately ($30 per head). Loved the pool and poolside bar. Lot's of chairs but you have to arrive pretty early in the day to snag a couple. Normally have live music from 4-6 pm and 7-9 pm each day. Fitness center is top notch for a hotel. Spa is equally good. Both my wife and I had massages and utilized the spa. Great boardwalk next to beach for walking down to other hotels (Hyatt is the best) and checking out restaurants like Hula Grille and Leilani's and the Whaler's Village Shopping center. The hotel also has plenty of shopping such as Macy's. Lot of good discounts in there. Overall, you really can't go wrong with the Hyatt unless there is some construction going on which there wasn't. Expect to spend money, however it is beautiful and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: mdrand
Reviews.Content: The experience we have had at Hyatt was amazing. Everything started well from our first moment at the reception. First impressions matter ! We were greeted by two members of staff and serviced immediately. The interior of the hotel was grandieuse and very impressive. The facilities of the hotel are perfect. The guests can find everything on site. There are 4 restaurants serving different kind of menus. Sanzo's lakeside restaurant is a must. The pool area is the biggest and best we have ever seen. The bar staff is helpful and always on site to serve you drinks and snacks. From the pool area you can walk to other resorts on Ka'anapali along the beach way. The concierge is always willing to arrange events for you and they have a great deal of offers in hand. The hotel has the best garden of all resorts in Lahaina and it is also host to a number of birds, parrots even penguins ! In one word A M A Z I N G !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristalynn25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 6 nights during our honeymoon. I was a little nervous, as I had read mixed reviews on here, but I was plesantly surprised! We both LOVED the Hyatt! The pool was awesome and my husband who is a kid at heart loved the waterslide. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the bottle of champagne they sent up for our honeymoon and we also recieved an upgrade to a partial ocean view! The beach in front of the Hyatt is nothing special, but we walked down past Whaler's village and used the beach there. We had dinner one night at Sonz and were very impressed with the food. It is a romantic atmosphere and the fish was outstanding! The room was clean and we had an amazing view from our balcony. We loved having a drink while watching the sunset. Overall, we had an excellent stay at the Hyatt and would go back again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “9.5 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: daleski007
Reviews.Content: My wife, two sons (ages 11 and 12), and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent 9-night stay at the Maui Hyatt. The room was a standard partial ocean view room on the 5th floor. Decor and amenities were nice but we missed the HDTV. The room for the shower and WC was a tad small (but really, how much time does one need to spend there) though the separate area for the sink and mini-fridge was appreciated. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. What dropped the Hyatt a half point was housekeeping's lack of providing washcloths EVERY day they serviced the room. Each morning my wife or I would have to call housekeeping or chase down the housekeeper to get fresh washcloths. We never did figure out why housekeeping wouldn't provide clean washcloths (they did provide clean bath and hand towels). Perhaps the daily tip I left for housekeeping wasn't sufficient. The grounds were gorgeous. My boys loved the wildlife (penguins, "Spike" the African crane and his buddy, the swans in Swan Court, flamingos, koi, and the often very talkative parrots in the lobby. The art was very much appreciated. We also loved the very large pool at the Hyatt. We spent most of our time on the "kids side" of the pool (the one with the 150-foot covered waterslide). We found it very nice; it was uncrowded and offered shade or sun at one's discretion. The only time I spent on the "adult side" was during the scuba lesson. I also found that the Grotto lounge in between the two sides was a very nice place to have a beer and watch the baseball playoffs or college/pro football w/o having to exit the pool. My entire family enjoyed having the workout room on site. It was very well equiped (the loaner headphones are a nice touch) and never crowded. The on-site restaurants, though expensive, were very good to excellent. The food, service, and ambiance at Sonz for dinner was outstanding; for breakfast, it was very good. As others have noted, room service was quick, the meals were hot, and the food was good. (On two nights, we went next door to Longboards at the Marriot for dinner. The food was less expensive and it was very good. The service there was also very good and the singer was outstanding.) My personal favorite was the coffee and tea vendor who was there at 6:00 a.m. when I went looking for that first cup of coffee. Although breakfast (normally between 8 and 8:30) was usually crowded and we had a bit of a wait (never more than 10 minutes), we never had a wait or felt rushed for dinner. Service at check in, and by bell staff, restaurant/bar staff, room service staff, pool attendants, and parking valets was outstanding (see comment about housekeeping earlier). Having stores on-site was also helpful when shopping urges struck. My wife and I probably spent a tad more than we should have at Macy's. Also, having an Expedia shop on site made if very easy to arrange horse-back riding, snuba, submarine, and helicoptor trips. The little mini-market on the lobby level proved to be invaluable more than once by providing sunscreen, aloe, gift items, Diet Coke with lime flavoring, snacks, adult beverages, and such. Take advantage of the little red card the store gives you (one "stamp" for every $5 of purchases). If you're like us, you'll be surprised by how much you shop there and how quickly you can earn a bonus goodie or two. Unlike others who mentioned having problems with parking there, we never were unable to find a parking space (we had to find one big enough for the Jeep we rented...the spaces are kind of narrow and some people don't know how to park in a single space). That may have been due to our being back at the Hyatt by 8:30 p.m. each night and that, per one staff person, the hotel was only about 70 percent occupied while we were there (October 12 - 21). I'd recommend the Hyatt gladly to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Even Better the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: Indyhoya
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in mid-October. My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and liked it so much we came back 2 years later. Could not have made a better decision Grounds - awesome, as many others have mentioned. Unbelievably well maintained, beautiful gardens, just a relaxing environment from the minute you walk through the door. Only drawback (if I had to nitpick) is the sheer size of the place. It's huge, but they use the space very well. Shops are nice to have, as is the Expedia desk on-site Rooms - we were in a partial ocean view near the water side of the hotel on a high floor. Could see a lot of ocean from the balcony and the rest was golf course / mountains. For as little time as you spend in a hotel room in Maui, it was more than sufficient. Rooms are clean and pretty big, bed very comfortable, and it was nice to have both a couch (which I believe is a pullout bed) and an empty mini-fridge. Pool - as good as any hotel I've ever seen. Large, clean, plenty of chairs, right next to the ocean, and the waterslide is fun (even for adults). It's a definite plus to have the kids' pool on the other side of the grotto. Provides a great natural buffer from noise. The new uMalu restaurant is open and is a great improvement. Food is great, the place itself looks great, and prices aren't any more outrageous than any other pool-side service at a decent resort. Half price bloody mary's from 9-11 are a nice touch and they're very good Location - path along the Kaanapali hotels is nice and Whaler's Village is a pretty painless 20 minute walk. Lahaina is an easy drive, and if you're a golfer you are very close to the courses. Service - everyone was great to us. Did not walk by one Hyatt employee that didn't smile or give an "aloha." I've traveled a lot and have never found hospitality like in Hawaii. They get it. Food - Cascades good but not as good as the last time we ate there. Still love the setting and sitting in the chairs near the bar for a drink. Sushi was very good, steak just OK. -Sonz was just not worth the price. Service was great, menu looks very enticing, but the pasta dishes were just OK and the value is not the best -uMalu (see above) - huge upgrade from old Pavilion restaurant and it's finally done. Fits in beautifully with the property. But $4 for a Diet Coke? Really? Parking - yes it can fill up due to the luau, but getting the valet for free is fair compensation, right? If this is your prime complaint you had a great vacation. Overall - heaven. Honestly, unless you are staying at the Four Seasons everywhere you travel I don't know what else you could want. The Hyatt gets it right in just about every respect. Should make a great stay for just about anyone Few suggestions - stop at Kmart or somewhere similar on your way in from the airport and pick up drinks, snacks, sunscreen, etc. Will save you a few bucks (do not buy this stuff in the hotel sundry shop. Prices are laughable) Check out Wailea for half a day - Shops at Wailea are very nice, Longhi's has great food, you can park at the Four Seasons and wander through it and the Grand Wailea next door to see how the upper class vacations (I'd still take the Hyatt). The drive down is not bad and we found it worth a few hours Drive up the northwest coast and around to the natural blowhole. Can be a poor man's (without the waterfalls) Hana trip for those with motion sick spouses

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: BananaLana
Reviews.Content: I went here with my family and chose to visit Maui at last min. On ariving the lobby was bare but clean and I was given a lei on arrival (very nice). The first room we were put in was very nice, great very but the wrong room, we were changed quickly but were put then on the bottom floor where there was work being done our whole stay near the elevator. The hotel was great with exotic animals throughout the hotel and jungle like lobby. The pools were great and not too busy for April! The only problem was the beach was not swimable in this area but if you have a relaxing walk down the beach you can swim..

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: bankerlady53
Reviews.Content: This vacation was our 5th visit to Hawaii & the Island of Maui. Our 4th stay at the Hyatt Regency. This hotel Always Maintains an Extremely High Standard of Customer Satisfaction. From the Greetings in the Lobby. to the Staff at the Swan Court , and the Housekeeping Staff, we always are made to feel, treasured guest on the resort . We had room service one night and our order was delivered Hot, Fast and Delicious! Breakfast each morning was marvelous , and enhanced by the attentive staff. Our Ocean view room had two balconies, one full ocean front with Moloki and Lanai in view, the other provided a view towards the mountains. Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great time on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Derek_NYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui from 9/22-9/28 for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. We both thought the hotel was very nice, however, once we traveled to the Grand Hyatt in Kauai we realized the Hyatt Maui is a good hotel, but not as great as the Hyatt in Kauai. The rooms were very nice and spacious. Though we did have a problem with our AC (we had to be moved, to a free upgraded ocean view room!) we didn't let that bother us. Both rooms we stayed in were great and we never had any other issues. My wife loved the lotions and such that they provided. The grounds are very nice and in September they are not crowded at all. We always got good spots at the pool, no matter when we went down to get them. We got to taste the new poolside restaurant which was very good. Some prices are inflated here, but that is to be expected in the resorts, if you walk to Whalers Village you will find things much cheaper, especially drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel ,crowded pool, nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: bespoketravel
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a huge hotel , the grounds are beautiful and the hotel has a very nice art collection. The rooms are clean and spacious. This is a typical Hawaiian luxury chain hotel, The food is Ok but the restaurants are crowded. The pool is jammed with teenagers , it is not very relaxing to sit at the pool ,everybody is on top of one another, not enough space, make sure you get up early to even find a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Week at the Hyatt Regency Maui”
Reviews.Author: PSLB
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort. It was our second stay in 2 years and was even better than the first time. The service was superb, room clean, staff friendly and helpful, grounds beautiful, and food excellent. We stayed in a partial ocean view room (we were upgraded by the hotel upon arrival) in the north tower. The room was spacious and comfortable. The lanai, with table and chairs and flower planters separating the apartments, overlooked the ocean. The pool is as gorgeous at it appears to be in the photos. We had no problem getting lounge chairs next to the pool. We swam at the beach (the water was as warm or warmer than the pool!) and snorkeled right off the Hyatt as well as at Black Rock, a 20 min. walk up the beach walk. The snorkelling was great. Don't miss the breakfasts at Son'z at Swan Court. Tables overlook a pond with waterfall, with the namesake swans paddling around.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui - Slightly Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: LondonPollyanna
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Maui was generally pleasant â€“ the hotel was clean and the staff were courteous. However, we were underwhelmed on arrival, after assuming it would be a luxurious honeymoon destination. It wasnâ€™t â€“ it was average. The hotel needs a bit of a revamp; it looks seriously 70s with the avocado paint everywhere! Our room was supposed to be non-smoking, but had a strong cigarette whiff. The pool area was very nice, as was the beach front and garden areas. The prices for everything in the hotel were inflated - you're paying London prices for a beer, for example. The biggest annoyance was the 'mandatory supplemental charge' of $15 a day for things like tea and coffee in your room, a daily newspaper and use of the tennis courts. I couldn't find any reference to this charge in the small print, and frankly I would have assumed it to be included, or at the least certainly NOT mandatory! Also, we were charged $20 a day for valet parking â€“ but after pointing out that we didn't have a car this was removed from our bill. Overall, I wouldnâ€™t have bothered paying the extra for the Hyatt. If Iâ€™d have known I would have booked into the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Resort a bit further down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lintytrenchcoat
Reviews.Content: Came here on our Honeymoon, and had a great time. Rooms were up to date and clean, the staff were very nice and helpful, and the grounds are spectacular. Great location and they were very organized with brunch and towels and all the little things. I would definitely recommend this hotel (and I'm a travel agent so my expectations are high)

Reviews.Title: “Still beautiful after all these years”
Reviews.Author: LavaJava96
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 6 days 5 nights. It has been over 10 years since we have stayed here for our honeymoon. We thought the entrance/lobby seemed older but was still very beautiful. Breakfast was wonderful, exactly as I remembered. There was a line, but we got seated very quickly. The view was beautiful, and the buffet was a nice selection. Children 4 and under gets to eat the buffet for free. So, my younger son ate for free and my older son just ordered off of the kidsâ€™ menu. The rooms were updated, and well organized. Ours had two beds, a queen, and a double, and it was very comfortable. We each received a lei upon arriving, and we got upgraded to oceanfront. The room had a refrigerator, as well as a walk in closet with a safe. There are free self parking spots, but only if you get there by 7:30-8:00PM. After that, good luck finding a spot! We had a very hard time finding parking one night, but my husband was able to get complimentary valet because there were no spots left. So, it really is a non-issue. The gym is great! Itâ€™s a bit far to get to (you need to walk on the beachwalk in order to get access to it), but they had very nice new machines, and a great ocean view, too. The gym is covered in the $15 resort fee. Since we were paying this fee, we figured we might as well work out, and come home looking hot! Haha. The hotel is located about a 10 minute beach walk to The Whaler (stores and shops), as well as a 15 minute beach walk to Black Rock (a famous snorkeling destination), so it is a convenient location! And you can check out all the other hotels along the way, as you walk. Here are my negatives about the hotelâ€¦ We thought the pool was extremely crowded. When we went (at end of August), it was packed! I felt the chairs were pushed side by side (touching) next to each other, as well as pushed right up against the pool, as well as all the way out to the walkway. I felt as though I was in a movie theatre trying to get through to my seat. I could be a little biased since we had just arrived from the Hyatt Kauai, which had a more spacious and relaxed pool area. The pool is still stunning after all these years... it just seemed much more crowded than back then.. The Hyatt Maui pool was cold! It was not heated enough (at least not in comparison to the wonderful Hyatt Kauai pool), and there was only one Jacuzzi and the temperature of the Jacuzzi was only warm (like bathwater). The Jacuzzi needs to be hotter! And the Jacuzzi is situated near the kids section, so there are a lot of kids in it. I can see how couples might not like it, but my kids sure did! I did not like the kids pool section because we had a bad experience on our first day there. There was an unsupervised unruly kid who kept throwing sand or splashing at my childrenâ€™s faces. Then there was another young kid who tried to submerge my little 5 year old sonâ€™s heads underwater as my son was trying to swim and tread water. The parents were either on their cell phones, or just didnâ€™t care. Unfortunately, after that incident, and seeing how crazy crowded it was, we tried to avoid the pool during peak times, or swam on the other side instead. Don't let me put you off though, we did see lots of honeymooners who looked very happy swimming around. . But in comparison to the Hyatt Kauai, I thought the Hyatt Mauiâ€™s public areas were definitely more stunning. My children really liked the Hyatt Maui - they loved the pool, the penguins, the cranes, flamingoes, and macaws.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: susanu
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews on Trip Advisor, I was a little worried about my decision to stay at the Hyatt. No Worries - we really liked everything about the Hyatt! We had booked the least expensive room type - and the room we were given was just great. It overlooked the garden area and the pool, and we could even glimpse some of the ocean. With the balcony doors open, you could hear the sound of the waves. The room itself had one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in, plus a sofa & coffee table, chest and a desk - a fairly spacious room. The balcony was large enough for a table and 2 chairs and felt very private and secluded with all the surrounding greenery. There was a big walk-in closet with safe and a coffeemaker. Best of all, there was a refrigerator in addition to the minibar. There's a nearby Safeway on the way to Lahaina, and we kept the fridge stocked with cold drinks. It wasn't a fancy room, but it had everything we needed and we enjoyed it very much. When we vacation, we usually have a big breakfast and then skip lunch - so I purchased a package with daily breakfast buffet included. The buffet is terrific (though I wouldn't have wanted to pay for it a la carte!), with a big selection of cold and hot dishes and omelets made to order. We would walk early every morning and then go to breakfast, and there was never a wait. But by 8:30 am, the lines start to get long - so go early. We liked the Kaanipali location. There's a nice walk along the ocean that passes all the hotels and Whaler's Village (an area of restaurant/shops. There are 2 golf courses - nice but not great, and you get free rounds for touring the Marriott time share next door. If golf is important on your vacation, you probably already know you want to be at Kapalua or Wailea (assuming you're willing to pay the prices!). The pool at the Hyatt is huge and gorgeous, so if you're into tanning, it's a terrific place. The beach is not much, but all the beaches on Maui are public, so you can walk towards Whaler's Village where other hotels have broader beaches, or drive to a really nice beach (like Fleming in Kapalua). Parking is tight, but we always found a place in the public parking lots (valet parking the evening we arrived was complimentary - nice touch!). The hotel is centrally located, but you will really want a car to get around the island and out to different restaurants. As for restaurants, they're all expensive, but I'd skip the overpriced hotel restaurants and the overrated Lahaina Grill. We loved the Plantation House, IO Restaurant, and Mama's Fish House (which isn't nearly as far away as the concierge will tell you...) What didn't we like? I felt ripped-off by the recommendations of the concierge and the extremely expensive and boring sunset cruise he booked for us. Walk along the beach and pick up some brochures for activities before you book the expensive ones the concierge will recommend. All in all, we loved the Hyatt and would certainly stay there again if we went back to Maui (we probably won't because we much prefer the Big Island and Kauai).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful scenery, great kiddie pool”
Reviews.Author: emtoothfxr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt 9/8-9/14. The weather was about 86 degrees, sunny and breezy. We initially had reserved a partial-ocean view room but upgraded to a full ocean view once we found out it was only a 25% ocean view. What we ended up with was right in the center of the main building with an unobstructed view of the ocean and the main pool. It was gorgeous. The room was nothing special but the grounds are lush and well maintained. The kids loved the wildlife in and around the lobby area. In the mornings you can feed the fish in the pond. They are huge and take the food from your hand. We spent most of our time at the kiddie pool. Perfect temperature, shallow enough for toddlers, fun kiddie slide. There is also a dark tunnel waterslide for bigger kids and adults. It was a blast! A little scary the first time then loads of fun. Nice Pina Coladas and popsicles poolside. We also used the fitness center and the spa often. The gym faces the ocean view and has nice equipment with TV monitors so you can watch or listen and look at the view if you like. Nice ice cold towels to cool yourself down after your workout or you can go into the spa next door, small but pleasant. The food in the hotel is alright, nothing too memorable. We particularly liked the Cascade Grille. Nice seared Ahi entree, the sushi was just ok. Everywhere is kid-friendly though and they always had kiddie menus and crayons for our 2 and 3 yr. olds. We thought the staff was very friendly, especially the groundskeepers and housekeeping staff. ..always an "Aloha" in the hall. Peggy in the Activities office was super friendly and set us up for a helicopter tour. We used Air Maui and took a great 45 minute flight around West Maui. Snorkeling is great over at Black Rock in front of the Sheraton. Lots of other snorkelers but that didn't scare the fish away. Overall, we loved it. Great week to go, not crowded at all, all of the summer crowds gone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel- Average Service”
Reviews.Author: TwoSox
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful grounds, open atrium, upscale shops, and a terrific pool. I am glad I booked at a deep discount. The service of the employees is only borderline friendly, and when the highlite of the hotel is clean room service, well, that tell you something. Many reviews complain that this hotel has no beach, but if you are out and about, Maui has so many beaches this is no detraction. The pool, ambiance, and grounds are the best part of our visit to this hotel. Prepare to pay $10 just to use a float device. The staff was only borderline friendly and helpful. The front desk is totally about driving hotel revenue, period. There have also been many comments about the parking here, I found out there are actually two parking lots here you can use to avaid the $20 valet fee per day. The largest parking lot is where employees park, go figure? Parking was always full, and congested. The rooms look like the were decorated in the 90's, not bad mind you, just not the most modern, especially for an expensive hyatt. Room staff was top notch, very clean. Would I stay there again? I think there are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyNottingham
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and I can honestly say both Maui and this hotel are heaven on earth, from the moment we walked in we felt we were in total luxury! The staff were all very friendly and professional and we were given a free bottle of champagne the night after our arrival and some great advice about the local area. The hotel foyer is open to the sky and has parrots, penguins and huge palm trees with wildlife all around the hotel, the views from the bars out onto the sea were breath taking and after a long flight the cocktails were fabulous! The restaurants in the Hyatt were so good we had to really force ourselves to try other places, the fresh fish was delicious as was the sushi, in fact we didnâ€™t have one meal we didnâ€™t thoroughly enjoy! Breakfast in Swann Court is glorious, although Iâ€™d advice against the buffet as it is ridiculously huge and the normal menu is very extensive. The hotel is situated about 45 minuteâ€™s form the airport and you will need to hire a car to get around. We wanted to go diving so used the hotels car rental company and were very pleased with the service and the price. We noticed that everyone is advised to drive the â€œRoad to Hanaâ€� which is a perilous drive for hours and hours with nothing at the end of it, everyone we spoke to who had done it felt the same as us â€¦donâ€™t bother. We had to decide between that and the volcano and I think weâ€™d have preferred the latter. The hotel Luau was very pretty dire and very much aimed at tourist rather than having any authenticity, it did have a very good bit at the end and it did have a free bar. There are some lovely shops in the hotel and at the Whalers Village just a short walk away. For more shopping you require a car. Our room was a partial ocean view with one balcony facing the ocean with palm trees and the second balcony facing the mountains with the rainbows and clouds rolling down (we had fabulous weather too!)â€¦it was spectacular. In the evening staff light torches around the hotel and you can sit watching the sunset in the hammocks by the beachâ€¦it really is phenomenal. This hotel is amazing, Maui is beautiful and for a honeymoon this hotel ticked every boxâ€¦we can not wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemyfamily68
Reviews.Content: OK It's been over a year since we stayed here but I have to tell you how much we loved this place and why. First of all it was our first trip to HI and this hotel was everything and more that we invisioned of a Hawaiian hotel. Gracious valets and bellmen, BEAUTIFUL grounds and hotel interior, fabulous food, etc. The lobby is stunning. I was shocked and in awe of the open lobby with it's parrots on perches and the koi and penguins. Just fabulous! The staff are great people. The rooms were fabulous too. They are modern but with that hawaiin feel. Our room was a partial ocean view but it was wonderful. Now let's get to the real reason why I loved this place. My hubby and I went out sight seeing and while we were out we went to the "Olivine Pools". It was great until we got pounded by a 30 ft. rogue wave that sent me skidding down appx. 15ft of lava rock. I was terribly hurt. By the time we climbed back up the hill (1/4ml) to our car and drove the 30 mins. back to the hotel I was almost passed out. When we arrived at the hotel the valets took one look at me and immediately got help to take me down to the hotels INFIRMARY! Yes they have a doctor on premisses! He took me directly back to a room. Dressed my wounds as best he could, gave me some pain meds and called the ambulance. They were there in appx. 25 mins. The hospital is back near the airport. After all of that ordeal, spending the day in the emergency room, when we returned to the hotel the staff was just great. The helped me around the hotel, gave me crutches from the infirmary to use, gave us complimentary beverages. The waiter even prepared my breakfasts for me as I waited at the table. This place was absolutely wonderful! Now this year when we returned to Maui we stayed at the Westin ONLY because we saw on the Regency's site that during the time we would have been there, construction would have been going on. I can tell you though that the next visit and stay will be at the Regency. The Westin was very nice but nothing comapred to the Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Family Holiday in Maui”
Reviews.Author: KAGDEVON
Reviews.Content: Our excitement about visiting Maui was somewhat dented when we were stuck at the back of the plane from Honolulu where there were no windows, so we saw nothing of the island until we left the airport. However, when the hotel receptionist at the Hyatt Regency heard our story she upgraded our room to a partial ocean view to ensure that we saw the best of Maui whilst we were there. We were also given an orchid lei (flower garland) each, so that's what I call a good start! The hotel is located at Kaanapali beach about 40 minutes bus shuttle ride from the airport. The beach is fabulous to look at but there is a very strong wave action and rocks just under the surf zone outside the hotel, so we stuck to the pool area instead of swimming and snorkelling in the sea. We were there as a family of four (two kids, aged 13 and 10) and had just left a busy week in Waikiki, so we knew this was going to be more laid back and relaxing. The kids spent most of their time playing in the extensive pool (and fast water slide) but my eldest also had a go at scuba diving for the first time with my husband. They trained in the pool with a very friendly tutor and then within the hour they were diving off the reef outside the hotel for about 40 minutes, where they saw a turtle chomping on the coral amongst many coloured fish. She hasn't stopped grinning yet and it was the highlight of the whole holiday for her! The hotel IS expensive in terms of food and drink but you can buy drinks at the local ABC store (about 15 minutes walk along the beach at Whaler's Village) and then keep them in your own fridge if you like. There is also a cheap food court and other places to eat at the Village with a range of prices. The smoothies by the pool are lovely but are more like milkshakes, costing about $7. Everything in Hawaii seems to start early compared to the UK or Europe, so for the whole two weeks we were there we got up before 7.00am for breakfast (which wasn't a hardship to be honest). There were big queues at the Swan Court breakfast but mainly after 7.15am, so be warned if you don't fancy a wait. The breakfast buffet was $30 (half price for kids under 12) but it was amazing - pretty much everything you could think of including smoked salmon, banana bread, an omlette station, fried fish and fresh fruit. Yum! Loungers immediately around the pool were typically taken very early but then again, maybe these people like getting soaked by other people's kids! We sat facing the ocean on sun loungers slightly further away from the pool and were very happy with the location. During the day, an attendant would come around with free ice popsicles and cold flannels which were very welcome, as well as the usual attentive bar staff asking if you would like any drinks. The rooms were good but not excellent, they could do with a refurbish but we weren't disappointed and coped without having a flat-screen TV. We booked several tours via the Expedia desk in the hotel and these were excellent: Pam was the best ambassador a place could have and made sure we had a great time and even sorted out our return shuttle link. What a star! We went on the 'Four Winds' snorkel glass-bottomed boat trip to Molokini which was amazing - a really friendly crew, bagel breakfast and BBQ lunch and then you get to see your snorkel trip on the way back because they send a diver down to record it on DVD. Fabulous! We also hired a car and did 'The Road to Hana'. It took 6 hours to get there and fortunately no car sickness (it's VERY twisty)! Take your insect repellent if you plan on stopping anywhere - the whole point of going - as we forgot ours and suffered. Duh. On our last night we went to the hotel's luau 'the Drums of the Pacific' which was excellent with a big choice of buffet food (as much as you can eat) and a free bar. The entertainment was top class and the kids loved it too. We were so sad to leave but would definitely recommend it for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation place”
Reviews.Author: NJCh
Reviews.Content: It is our first time to Hawaii. We are a family with two kids. We booked Hyatt Maui through Hawaiian Airline Inter-island package for 3 nights in late August. We had booked a deluxe ocean view room, but when we checked in, they said our room was not available. After some complaints, we were upgraded to a deluxe suite in Lahaina tower with a big living room, 3 balconies, 1 and half bathrooms, two big flat TVs, Bose Stereo and very nice furniture. I like the hardwood floor in the living room and the big bed in the bedroom. They gave us rollaway bed for kids. Views from 5th floor are spectacular, especially at sunset. Our kids loved this resort. Beautiful ground with animals and wonderful pools with waterfalls and waterslides. We did Luau at Hyatt, food was OK, but almost no service and you had to wait outside around 4:15PM to get decent seats, or pay VIP price. We enjoyed the show especially the fire dance, but one Luau is enough for us and wonâ€™t do it again. We also did Star Tour one night and it was a great experience, I recommend it if you like to watch stars at night. Not a problem for us to self parking during our stay. I also did self laundry at the hotel, clean facility with $2 per load. Breakfast was included in our rates for two adults only, but needed to wait 10 minutes each morning. Same food everyday and it got bored by the end, not worth it if you have to pay $30/per head. My daughter did a hair wrap by the pool, expensive $65 plus tax and tip, but she loved it. One night, we walked to Hula Grill in Whalers Village shopping center for dinner and really enjoyed the beach walk. Restaunts in Hyatt are very expensive. You have better choices in Lahaina 10 minutes away. We had a really nice stay in Hyatt and I think the suite did make a difference too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: LadyofHaig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui for 6 days from 6th Aug to 12th Aug, my husband and I and our two teenage daughters. To be honest we were a little disappointed when we first arrived at the hotel but to be fair we had just spent 4 days at the Grand Hyatt on Kauai and the two should probably not be compared. After settling in we throughly enjoyed our stay here. We had a Deluxe Oceanfront room on the 20th floor which overlooked the pool, beach and construction site so we had a good view of what was happening. Our room bathroom area and lanai though not large were perfectly comfortable. We had a queen and a double bed in the room but requested a roll away bed to avoid any sleepless nights ( the Grand Hyatt had two queen beds) All the beds including the roll away were very comfortable. The pool is well designed with waterfalls, a cave with a bar in the middle and a children's area and water slide on the other side.We were never bothered by the construction, they have live music by the pool when the men are working and it seems that they have gone to a lot of trouble to minimise noise. My one complaint was the amount of pool chairs stacked side by side right up to the edge of the pool making it hard to get in and out of the water. Guests would "reserve" chairs first thing in the morning by putting their towel's out on a chair then leave. There were signs warning guests not to do this. We ended up sitting / lying on our towels on the grass behind the path as there never seemed to be any "available" chairs, we were happy to do this as we had some shade and some space. The gardens are lovely and the birds ( swans, flamingos, penguins and parrots ) a delight, especially Roger the parrot who waves goodbye with his claw. All the staff that we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. As many reviewers have mentioned a lift was out of order while we were there but we never found this to be a problem, a lift always came straight away. As for the beach in front of the Hyatt, a short walk down the beachwalk to Whalers Village and the beach down here is great for swimming. We had breakfast at Swan Court and there always seemed to be a line but it did seem to move rather quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon at The Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: YankeeFan217
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt From Aug. 11th--18th 2008 for our honeymoon. First of all, the scenery at this hotel is beautiful. They had tons of flowers,palm trees,and animals at his hotel. They have penguins,pink flamingos, koi fish,black swans,white swans, and parrots.They also have stores in the resort too.Like Macy's,Sunglass Hut, Expedia for excursions,Sandle Store, Camera Store,Art Work Store,Jewelry Store, and of course a couple of nic- nat stores.The pool at the Hyatt was awsome too.It goes from 3 feet to 9 feet deep.They had two water slides,one for the real little ones and one for the big kids.(Yup we enjoyed the big slide) They also have a grotto bar under the waterfalls too.The pool water was heated to a nice temperature,not to hot nor not to cold. We booked our hotel with the buffet breakfast included.They had so much food in the morning to chose from everyday that we never left there with an empty stomach.(If you are going to eat breakfast everyday,I would purchase the buffet breakfast with your hotel as a combo,because the breakfast is $30.00 a person.)They had a Play Room for kids(so the adults could go places,like the LUAU) to play Pool,air hockey,and other games that they have. The room was always clean. They had have 2 refrigerators,one for the pop,beer,and water,(that you can take anytime for a price) or you can you use the other one for yourself to use.The staff was always nice. The next day,we sat down with Expedia and booked our Excusions.(Thank You Jamie) We planned out our whole week of excusions. :) :) :) We also went to the LUAU at the Hyatt, which was great food by the way and a great show too. There is a mandatory $15.00 tax inclusive,per room,per day resort fee.The resort fee includes: access charges for 1-800 and 1-888 phone numbers,local calls,in-room coffee and tea,one hour court time per day at the tennis center,daily admission for two,to the oceanfront Moana Athletic Club,and the daily local mewspaper. (Which I think should be included in the price) Oh Well...This was a GREAT Hotel to stay at for our honeymoon if you don't mind the kids being around. We didn't even know they were there. When we return for our 10 year anniversary or earlier,we are going to stay at the Hyatt Regency again. Thanks :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Tennis Pro, Frank , is the best!”
Reviews.Author: carnivalife
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an awesome stay at the Hyatt in Lahaina. The hotel was beautiful, clean and staff was excellent. The grounds were outstanding, very lovely beach, and activities galore. We enjoyed music by the poolside all day, and the town of Lahaina by night...great food, art and music. The tennis pro was outstanding. Frank is very knowledgable, experienced and has a great sense of humor. It is the first time ever, that our kids asked to come back for more lessons. No surprise that meals anywhere were very expensive, so budget for that or shop at the local markets. The hotel had refridgerators in each room. Also, the scuba instructors were top notch. If you are not certified, do it here for excellent and timely instruction. The local airport, (Not Kahalui), is only 4-5 miles away. don't go too early, as there is nothing there (not even a coke machine), and check in is fast. Finally, don't forget to explore the island. There is too much too see! The Dodsons, Alamogordo, NM

Reviews.Title: “Ready t go back”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly101865
Reviews.Content: I have to say we did sooo much research before we choose the Hyatt. And, afte some of the reviews we were a little scared. It was not our first choice, we were thinking Westin, Sheraton, or Marriott. We are sooo glad we chose the Hyatt. We have stayed at other very nice hotels (Ritz, Boston) and this was just as nice but diff. atmosphere. The grounds are beautiful, the lobby breathtaking, pool is wonderful. We did have a small room issue when we got there. But, they were very happy to let us look at a couple other rooms and choose the one we wanted. We had deluxe ocean view rm. 828 Napilli tower...great room with a great view. I can NEVER sleep in a hotel (only in the Ritz) did I sleep like a baby.......I think these beds beat that!! They are heavenly! Our couples massage (Hot Stone) was out of this world, I felt like I was floating when we left there. We never had a prob. with chairs at the pool and we always at break. first at Sonz. I woke up and couldnt wait to go eat it was great. Yes, there are small birds flying around and if you dont know better and leave your plate they will swarm...it is actually kind of funny to watch and we always knew who the new guests were. But, the waiters come right away and take the plate away. If you have to get up, just use your napkin to cover your plate and you should be good. We also did Warren & Annabells Magic show...hilarious! Helicopter tour ( 1 hr ) great views, Sunset sail on the Hyatts boat.. .I was so scared but it was awsome. Ate at Capische'..very very good, Mamas fish house....so so, Tropica...excellent with a sunset view. Kimos on Front Street...very good. Willing to answer any questions, just ask and i got plenty of pics. Alreay planning on going back for whale season with the kids....cant wait

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer78
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review, but we had such a bad experience here on our honeymoon (first week of Aug'08) that I decided it was necessary to warn others before considering staying here yourself. Here are all the issues we had with the hotel: 1. Had to switch rooms 3 times. We booked an ocean view room and they put us into a partial ocean view room and lied to us saying this was ocean view. Especially annoying considering how much we had to pay to stay in this hotel. 2. The second room we got actually was ocean view and had two nice balconies. The problem with this room was that we saw a cocroach when we came back to the room at night as well as pieces of a twizzler and M&Ms by the dresser and curtains. 3. The rooms and hotel are run down and in desperate need of an upgrade. Drapes are stained, tvs are old and get terrible reception, carpet is stained, etc... Also, in the tower we stayed in which is the main one, one of the elevators is out and based on what I was told from the bell hop, it will be out for 3 months then they will be doing the same to the other elevators. In other words, for a long time 1 of 3 elevators will not be operating causing long waits just to go back and forth to your room. 4. They rip you off with a lot of hidden fees. $15 resort fee per day + $20 fee per day for valet parking. Self-parking is not really an option here since there are very few spots. 5. The pool is extremely crowded and unless you get a chair by 8AM you will have problems finding one. Also the chairs are very close together and hardly any have shade or some covering over them like other hotels. If you're on your honeymoon or just looking to relax by the pool, watch out. There are a ton of kids here that take over all parts of the pool. No section for just adults exists. 6. There is construction right next to the pool with noise you can hear being drowned out by loud music they have playing to cover up the noise. This area also takes up a decent portion of the area around the pool. 7. The beach is a joke. Hardly any sand and very rocky. We walked to the other side of Kannapali Beach where the Sheraton is (which by the way is a much nicer resort). Bottom line, we made a huge mistake spending our honeymoon here and paying the outrageous prices for this hotel and getting very little for our money other than a lot of stress. This hotel is the complete opposite of the Grand Hyatt Kauai which is what a resort should be like and what this place is not.

Reviews.Title: “Positive stay”
Reviews.Author: skm2004
Reviews.Content: Arrived and informed about valet/self parking. We chose self and never had a problem finding parking( stay was only 3 nights). Checked in and paid an unbelievable low price for an upgrade to ocean front regency club suite.Elevators worked fine( they have a bowl of candy there everyday?!)( we used the stairs for exercise), room was 21st floor atrium tower, corner suite with 2 balconies, sitting area , king bed, frig, robes, twin sinks, evening turn-down service. Toilet and shower together in a VERY small space. Mauna Loa candy and photo album arrived compliments of management.Regency club includes evening snacks and cocktails, morning continental breakfast, afternoon cookies and drinks. It was perfect! The hotel is wonderful to walk around in with all the birds, plants, bridges, pool is fantastic with waterfalls,swim up bar in grotto, a sand beach ,swinging bridge, kiddy area, deepest area of pool is 9 feet, juccuzi near pool. Had lunch at only restaurant opened besides pool area, both had chicken salads that were ok, that was our only meal at the Hyatt.The construction everyone is talking about is at the pool, they are building another restaurant, it does not impact the hotel stay at all in my opinion. After walking the path towards Whalers Village, realized Hyatt has no beach, just a small area to the left of the resort, that is where the fitness center is( huge, modern), and also where to go for jet-skis.Hammocks on the grounds, cabanas for rent, both are great for watching the sunset. Only one day the pool police were in force. They first place a note on your chaise of the time and state that your belongings will be removed in one hour, it took about two hours for this to happen as the couple next to us came back just in time as they came around. We agreed with them to watch each other for the day.Heard construction noise but with the pool music, waterfalls, etcâ€¦ it drowned it out, plus we were sitting right next to it, very few shaded areas.Arm bands are given to you when you get pool towels Cold towels and ice pops passed around the pool. The hotel has a Macys which has tons of bathing suits, + mens and women resort wear.Viewed a wedding near the flamingo area one day, they beat drums, blow conch shell, looked very nice. We did laundry one day, $2 wash,$2 dry, soap for purchase.Lobby level. A very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt is Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: bowman67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt from July 28-August 4 for our honeymoon. We did a ton of research on the different resorts on Kaanapali Beach, and went with the Hyatt despite the mixed reviews we read on Trip Advisor. We cannot imagine how anyone could dislike this place! From the moment we walked in, the staff treated us very kindly (even though they don't do room upgrades for honeymooners) and the grounds were beyond beautiful. Our partial ocean view room had a great view of half mountains, half ocean, which was fine for us. Here are some of the things we were impressed by: Pool: Oh my gosh! This was the best pool at any resort we've ever stayed at. It is HUGE, it's right next to the ocean, and it's surrounded by plants, palm trees and flowers. The temperature of the water was perfect. There were tons of chairs (brand new, too), although by 10:00 it did get pretty crowded (we put towels and magazines on 2 chairs each morning around 8:00 before going to breakfast, even though you're "not supposed" to do that). The construction at the poolside Pavillion restaurant hardly bothered us at all. There were plenty of other options for poolside drinks and food. Food: Breakfast at Swan Court (only option) is incredible. Luckily, in our package through Apple Vacations, we had ours included - if you don't, it's $30.00 a day. But the selection is amazing, and the location is awesome! It's all open air, and it's right by a pretty pond with waterfalls and swans. We ate at all the other restaurants at the hotel. Cascades was an awesome view and wonderful food. (We often went there for just a drink, too.) Spats Trattoria was very good, but the most expensive meal we had in Maui, and it's closing in September. The pooside "snack shack" that served burgers, sandwiches and salads by the pool was good too, although pretty pricey. Our favorite place to have a drink before/after dinner was the Weeping Banyon, which is a coffee bar by morning and bar bar by night. In all, we found all the food and drinks at the hotel to be excellent. Yes, it is expensive, but it wasn't beyond what we expected since it is Maui. The portions were huge which helped justify some of the cost :). Room: Our room was very nice, seemed updated, and was very clean. The king size bed was very comfortable, as were the linens. I liked that there was a seperate sink area outside of the bathroom so that I could get ready while my husband showered. The tile in the bathroom was very nice, and we liked the granite coutertops. We had no problems with our room at all. Staff: Everyone from the concierge to the people working by the pool to the activities help desk were extremely accomodating and friendly. They had plenty of advice and maps for us. Beach: It is true that there is not a huge beach in front of the Hyatt, but there is some. We enjoyed jumping waves in the ocean and sitting on the beach at night. All beaches in Hawaii are public (even in front of hotels) so if you're looking for a huge beach, you could go a little ways down. We did have oceanside massages in little cabanas, which was well worth it! The boardwalk down Kaanapali Beach starts at the Hyatt and goes all the way down past the Marriott, Kaanapali Alli, Westin and Sheraton, and is a beatiful walk to Whaler's Village where we ate a couple times. In all, we would HIGHLY recommend this resort to anyone planning to stay on Maui! We will definitely return in the future, and can't imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff & facility at the Hyatt----Surfing Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: SanMo
Reviews.Content: My teen and I went mainstream for this impulse trip to Maui. The Hyatt is large scale and corporate for me but I have to say that I enjoyed it as a corporate & sanitized cultural experience! It's strange, sickening and a bit twisted to see all these mainland people who traveled thousands of miles to an Island & ocean paradise sitting/laying with their backs to the beach/ocean and facing a hotel and pool. Having made that observation, it's a beautiful property, the rooms were terrific and the air conditioning works well. The outstanding staff are all extremely friendly, positive and professional. Room service, pool and the related beach/ocean activities are all well above average. The spa is excellent. It's close-by to Lahaina, but too far to walk. However, it's on the public bus route ($1.00) from Whalers Village. Surfed Lahaina harbor several times (a left; knee to chest-high). It's a mellow wave and sorta crowded inside due to the surf schools/students. Outside is good as well as just over to the other side of the the harbor. Respect the locals--wait your turn--don't drop-in--hoot for them and give a positive vibe. The local hassle will become non-existent and changes to friendly. I rented my board at Outrageous Surf...A friendly & low-key shop to rent boards or get lessons (although I only rented). Enjoy the Hyatt but remember to face the beach every now and then...It's why you've come all this way. It's great for families, teens and lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Musicfamily
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best Hotel I have ever been to. My wife and I for our Honeymoon had the package with the breakfast buffet in the Swan Court. Just amazing. We ate at Spats Trattoria one night and the food was excellent and a lot cheaper than expected. It was still expensive but so where near as expensive as I thought it was going to be. Great room service, Amenities among other things. The massage at spa Moana was amazing. The beach right out front was okay but just a short walk (2 min) and the beach was great. the pool was awesome especially the water slide. We also loved the "Zoo" they had there. You can easily charge drinks to your room. The best Hotel Ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SEMFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in June for our 10th anniversary and loved it. Before the trip we regularly read the Trip Advisor reviews and were very prepared for what to expect during our stay. The Hyatt met or exceded all of our expectations. First of all, the hotel grounds are beautiful. The landscaping in meticulous and we enjoyed all of the different wildlife (birds, swans, penguins, etc.). The pool area looked very nice but we really didn't spend any time in the pool area. Instead we chose to spend our time exploring Maui as this was my first trip to Hawaii. There really isn't a beach at the Hyatt but we spent time at many of the other beaches on the island, so that didn't bother us. The hotel room was clean and I did not think the bathroom area was too small as did some of the other reviewers. After all, it is a hotel! The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on! We had a beautiful view from our Deluxe Oceanview room. The TV may have been 15 years old as others have said, but we weren't there to watch TV so that didn't bother us. We had the breakfast package and found the buffet very nice. They have everything from fruit and pastries to hot dishes (including Mahi-Mahi!). I found the service to be very good at the breakfast buffet. Some mornings the lines seemed long, but moved very quickly. The one thing that we were not prepared for were the birds at the breakfast. They were everywhere and even took some food off our table one morning. They were cute to watch but also tended to be a little annoying as they were all over the restaurant. We didn't eat at the other hotel restaurants so I can't comment on their food or prices. As many other viewers have mentioned, the elevators and parking were our biggest issues with the hotel. If you read the reviews the elevators have been a problem for months and were still not working well during our stay. Even though there was only 1 elevator working in Tower 2 during most of our trip we really didn't find the waiting time to be too long. The parking lots are crowded with narrow spaces and valet parking is expensive. We were always able to find a parking space in the self-parking lots but sometimes had to circle around and wait until someone else left. Fortunately we were always able to find a spot and did not have to use the valet. All-in-all we had a wonderful stay. This hotel may not be the Ritz-Carlton but it was what I expected a 4 star hotel on Maui to be. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: DBChicago01
