Overall our stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui was outstanding and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. A special thanks to the housekeeping staff for the excellent job they did everyday. Final rating: 9.2 Naterooâ€™s out of 10. Add a micro and free internet and all the stars I have will go to the Hyatt. Good Job. I recommend: Taking a drive to the blowhole at Nakalele Point. Bring the video camera and hike all the way down to the blowhole. Just be careful on those rocks! If you go to Hana plan on making it an all day adventure. Forget about going to the Garden of Eden â€“ at $10 per person itâ€™s a rip-off. Do see the volcano. We didnâ€™t see it at sunrise but it is awesome at 11am also. We would be happy to answer any questionsâ€¦.kmnm4@mchsi.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Hyatt after a 5 night stay at the Sheraton Maui. Checkin was smooth, my only complaint was that the checkin desk was so dreary! It was so different from the rest of the hotel. I wish they would put in a nice cheerful fish tank. Anyway, we were "terrace view" but it actually was partial ocean view...we were on the third floor in the Napali building. Our balcony overlooked the walkway leading to the pool/beach. The hotel is beautiful. I didn't interact with the staff that much, but everyone seemed friendly. Our room was very nice, upscale polynesian furniture. The bathroom was great: Seperate toilet and shower and a room for sink, bar area, and a seperate closet to stash your junk. I did a trip report on fodors/talk under "beachkomer". It has a lot of details about our trip. The pool was nice, smaller that I thought it was going to be. There is not a useable beach, but the lawn area next to the beach was nice and relaxing. Casscades restaurant was the only one we ate at, and had two great meals. We didn't do the luau. I would love to stay here again, IF the price is good! The hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: 4pa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon from Oct 23-Oct 30. It was not worth it....granted the grounds are beautiful...but everything else is extremely lacking. The staff was not too friendly, we checked in only to find our 'partial ocean view' was one of a rooftop, other tower and crane. You could only see the ocean if you went out on the balcony and looked over. I called to ask about it and they said that is the best they had, would not upgrade us unless we paid. I would have never opted for a partial ocean view to look at that every day!!! That night, we heard the band clear as day in our room (DON'T stay in the Atrium tower either!!!)...we heard every foot step on the tile hallways and the people next to us opening and closing their doors. I called our travel agent the next day and she called the hotel and nothing was done about it. The band played every night and the noise just echoed in the atrium....they stopped by 10pm, but when you are on vacation and want to relax, I am not paying to hear a band play, I am paying for a quiet, nice room....and in Maui there are ALOT of early adventures people go on and like to get up early...it was awful! The other main gripe I have besides all the noise is the resort fee...you pat $15 every day for access to the fitness area and basically nothing else....you have to pay extra for valet parking($12 per night) otherwise you have to self park your car...which we didn't mind and were glad to do, only to find out that you have to hunt for a parking space each time and all the spaces are cramped because they only give you two tiny lots to choose from for all those cars!!!...you also have to pay to get chairs on the beach...otherwise you can get a chair by the pool which was insanely crowded..it reminded me of the pools in Vegas...they cram you all around and there is NO space between chairs...also no fridge in the room....you have to call and ask and be put on a wait list for it... I honestly wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone...it was NOT worth what we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: trvellinggrandma
Reviews.Content: We were awe-struck as soon as we entered the lobby! It was an open aired atrium with sweet smelling flora, palm trees and birds. The rooms were nice and the beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in. Sonz's Swan court restaraunt was delicious, especially if you like fish. I recommend the opakapaka! The breakfast buffet was awesome! Best coffee we have ever had. The penguins and the cranes were a little overboard, but fun to watch. The beach in front of the hotel was not the best. But you could walk a little way up to Ka'anapali beach that was just great. The service was excelent. The concierge you get you what you needed very quickly and make dinner reservations wherever you wanted to go. This place was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Maui but not to the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MGTB
Reviews.Content: Overall the Hyatt is a very visually impressive hotel, the grounds are lush and well maintained and the rooms look over a golf course and mountains to the back and the ocean to the front. Also the foyer is factastic with palm trees and parrots and water features. We arrived (extremely jet-lagged) at around midday having requested an early check-in but we told they were still preparing the room and it would not be ready until earliest 2pm and guaranteed at 3pm. We went to Whaler's Village for some food and came back at 3pm to be told it was not yet ready. The concierge took pity on us and managed to get us our keys at around 3.10 but this was still disappointing. We had a King Ocean View room which was a corner room with 2 balconies, one looking to the side with table and chairs and another narrow balcony looking over the ocean. The room was very spacious and cool, it is was beginning to look a bit worn but was very pleasant and the bed was extremely comfortable. Our main gripe was the food - it was incredibly expensive and not worth the money. We were not at all impressed with the breakfast, it was a case of quantity over quality and I found it difficult to eat anything bar cereal and fruit. We also ate in Pavillion, Son'z and Spats. We would only return to Son'z where the setting was incredibly romantic and the food was excellent, however the service was overfamiliar, loud and generally much too casual for the standard of restaurant and put a blemish on an otherwise wonderful night. The food in the other places was barely mediocre. We spent our days by the pool. The beach in front of the hotel is sandy and clean but narrow and there are only 10 cabanas which have to be rented for $40 per day. The pool is therefore incredibly crowded and noisy as they pack in as many loungers as possible. We would definately return to Maui although we would not stay at the Hyatt again. It was a reasonably pleasant stay but the hotel is over-priced, very busy and the service is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel. They saved my vacation.”
Reviews.Author: studiorack
Reviews.Content: I've always liked Hyatts, but I had originally booked myself at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel since I wanted to save some money on the Oceanfront room. When I arrived there, I found that it was a terrible mistake, a vacation nightmare place. The type that any vacationer hopes to avoid. I promptly made arrangements at the Hyatt and they accomidated me and even upgraded my room when they found out what had happened. They turned a potentially terrible vacation into a wonderful one. Had we been stuck in the other hotel, my vacation memories would have been far different. The rooms were clean, up to date and very well maintained. Slept very well at night. The place is wonderful to walk through with nice decor and layout. We enjoyed the pool, the food was great, and the shops were convenient. I can't think of anything bad about this place. The only two things that I detracted from the experience is the very limited number of self parking spaces and the $15 manditory resort fee. These were very minor compared to all the pluses. I'd recommend it to anyone staying in West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Also Loved the Hyatt in Maui”
Reviews.Author: pcorad
Reviews.Content: We booked our honeymoon through Costco (1 week in the Maui Hyatt and 1 week at the Kauai Hyatt). It was much more affordable than various travel websites and travel agents. Iâ€™ll defer to all the excellent things mentioned in the other reviews. My main criteria for an excellent room: dark, quiet, comfortable bed. The Hyatt exceeds on all counts. The bed was very scrumptious, with a down or down like comforter. So nice. We had a lovely view of the gardens and the ocean. The room was spacious and clean. Did I mention dark and quiet? In the hall, I could hear whiny kids across the hall, but never in our bedroom. We hit Costco and Kmart coming off the plane and stocked up on bottled water, reef shoes, Hawaiian shirts, PB&J, bread, wine, beer, etc. We drove into Lahina and rented snorkel gear for the week at the first store we saw (Front St on the right). Great guys. Great rates. We kept the gear in the trunk of the rental car all week. We drove and snorkeled all up the coast (Black Rock, Kapaluha Bay, etc), and did a great 4.5 hour trip on the Kaanapali Kai catamaran. This was a great trip up the coast to Honalua Bay, where we saw turtles, squid, Moray Eels and more. We lived by the book â€œMaui Revealedâ€�. We got soaked taking the long hike to the Blow Hole. Were amazed at the Olivine Pools. Had a great meal ($$$) at Pacifico. Enjoyed cheap, good Mexican at Cilantro and deep dish pizza at BJs. Did not enjoy some cheap eats in Lahina (Bubba Gump, Cheeseburger in Paradiseâ€¦ all smelled like they hadnâ€™t been cleaned in 20 years. There is public parking on each end of the Hyatt resort. If the lot near the entrance was full, we found space at the far lot by the Luau facility. We didnâ€™t mind the walking. They have gorgeous tennis facilities that no one uses (I did!).

Reviews.Title: “who needs the four seasons?”
Reviews.Author: spamwakanabi
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations. The "mountain view room", with private lanai, had a partial view of the ocean. The bellman ordered an in room refrigerator for us (great for the budget conscious). The bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping was thorough and generous with toiletries. The breakfast buffet (which was free because it was included in the vacation package) was delicious. Otherwise, there are many inexpensive places to eat close by (buy a guide book i.e Maui Revealed). After having the same waitress for 10 days, on our last morning, she gave us a farewell gifts of chocolates and macadamia popcorn! The hotel grounds are spectacular. Penguines, swans, parrots, cranes, flamingos all live happily on the lush grounds. There is a $15 daily resort fee, so take advantage of their excellent fitness center. The pool is great with waterfalls, swim upbar and waterslide. The outdoor jacuzzi also has a waterfall. The beach is fantastic. Softer sand in front of the fitness center or further north. Be sure to snorkel and wave to all the sea turtles and fish! There are great shops at the hotel (i.e Macy's) but you can also walk along an oceanside footpath to the Whaler's Village (shopping center). I could go on and on! Who needs the Four Seasons when nirvana is at the Hyatt?

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but some things that I didn't like”
Reviews.Author: kevinfromnj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt in Kaanapali for a week on our honeymoon. It was overall great. There was a slight problem with our room (two doubles instead of a king), but that was taken care of the second day of our stay - and we were offered an ocean view for no charge. We were happy with the partial ocean view and mountain view room - with two balconies - so went with that and not the ocean view, but we appreciated the courtesy they showed. The room was excellent - and we saved money by getting a free refrigerator brought in - there's a Safeway food store nearby. The people at the front desk were great. Friendly, courteous, and very informative. The Hyatt is composed of several large hotel buildings connected seamlessly by long hallways with stores and stairs to the outside. The main lobby is open to the weather - with great plants and animals (exotic birds and penguins). The activities/concierge folks at the Hyatt were way too biased, obviously trying to sell their favored vendors and not doing much to share info about free activities. We picked up "Maui Revealed" and used it to guide what we did. We, for instance, went with the Old Lahaina Luau rather than the one at the Hyatt. It was more authentic and impressive all around. We loved the open bar - and for $1 took a bus from nearby Whalers Village (15 min. walk) to and from the luau in Lahaina, getting off at the Cannery Mall. Although too much like salespeople, when we did use the concierge/activities folks at the Hyatt, they were good - we used them for the bike ride down the volcano and parasailing. They put it right on the bill - and seemed to save us a few dollars. We loved the included breakfast at the Hyatt - at Swanz restaurant. The buffet was full of fresh food - dozens of options each morning. The restaurant is fancy - it's surrounded by a pond with several swans. The grounds at the Hyatt are absolutely exceptional - the best in an area of Maui that is very nice to begin with. The pool is huge with waterfalls, water slides, shady areas, and a bar. We brought our own beer and snacks from the convenience store on site and drank for a fraction of the price while watching the sunset. The beach in front of the Hyatt is lacking, but there are great beaches 5 minutes away. We went to Black Rock, which is near the Sheraton at the end of the beach walkway in Kaanapalli. We saw two large sea turtles while snorkeling!! The most absurd policy of the Hyatt is the requirement that beach lounges (two side-by-side) cost $40 per day to rent. The $15 per day resort charge, which is never directly mentioned, suggests that the Hyatt management could use a course in honesty in advertising. I forgave them on that because we got a good deal, and I likely would have made a lot of noise if I wasn't on my honeymoon. The price for rental of snorkeling equipment was likewise usurious and when I asked why it was so much, the worker lied to me about the Hyatt including more than other companies. We went to Snorkel Bob's in Lahaina and we got great beach chairs and guidance - and still saved money. Topping off our great experience with that company was advice related to the environment, including how to be an eco-friendly tourist. In addition to Black Rock, a sacred rock outcropping near the Hyatt, we went to Big Beach off Makena Alanui Road in South Maui, a 45 minute ride that was worthwhile. The Spa was not cheap, but compared to mainland charges, fair in its pricing ($140 for an hour massage). The spa facilities are first rate - including the ocean-front "relaxation room." The facilities are available without the pricier massages, etc. for $15 per day. The exercise facilities (which are under the spa - also beachfront) are included, so you could have a good day of exercising then relaxing in the jacuzzi, steam room, etc., for just $15 extra. That's not cheap, but worth it if you're looking to really, really relax. There are several things about the Hyatt I would change, but it is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. The few things I would change relate to their policies, not the facilities or the people who work there (other than the biased concierges).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fffaaazzz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui for five nights in late September 2006. Last December, 2005 we stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea. We loved both Hotels, but considering cost, value, and ambiance, we prefer the Hyatt over the Four Seasons. The Hyatt has much larger grounds and doesnâ€™t seem as crowded. We also felt there were many more things to do on this part of Maui, and we liked the fact that we were close to Lahaina. The Hyatt seemed to have much more of an adult atmosphere. The Four Seasons caters to kidsâ€¦very rich kidsâ€¦ and we found ourselves competing with their nannies in the early morning for the best cabanas. You have rent cabanas at the Hyatt, and the Hyatt cabanas are not nearly as nice, but again we didnâ€™t feel like we were crowded like we did at the Four Seasons. The Hyatt does have a kids section of their pool, but the pool is so big, you donâ€™t even notice. Also, the Hyatt pool service is not nearly as good as the Four Seasons; but we really didnâ€™t miss it. If youâ€™re a honeymooner, I would definitely recommend the Hyatt over the Four Seasons. Actually, if you have kids, I would also recommend the Hyatt over the Four Seasons. Again, weâ€™ve stayed at both hotels, and the Hyatt is by far a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TinaP624
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Hyatt Maui. I gasped when I entered my room. It was spectacular! I had 2 lanais with a wrap around ocean view and nightly sunset! My room had a very comfortable king bed and a sitting area with a couch that converted to a bed. I couldn't have been more pleased. The grounds are airy and very tropical. Good restaurants and wonderful breakfast buffet. The only down side were the additional charges that I was made aware of upon check-in. You would think that the money they charge per night for the room was enough. There is a $15.00 a day resort fee, as well as a $12.00 valet parking fee. I would have parked the car myself but could never find the public lot. I was told it was quite a distance away from the property. So if you stay 7 days, you can count on close to another $200 on your charge when you check out. Plus all the other charges you put on your room just for convenience --- like spa, luau, dinner, drinks, etc. I traveled as a single for the first time. I can say that I truly had a wonderful and relaxing time. The grounds are exquisite and peaceful. I enjoyed the walk every day to Whalers Village, where you can get cheaper food as well as do your souvenir shopping. Go later in the afternoon so you get a post card view of the sunset! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: bcuinohio
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. The pool was one of the best I have ever seen at a hotel. The grounds are well kept. The employees are very friendly. The room was nice and clean. It is a true luxury hotel. The only complaint that I have is the parking. In the evening, the two self park lots fill up. It is very difficult to find a spot to park. They do not require guests to place anything in thei car showing that they are staying at the Hyatt. Anyone can park there and the hotel staff has no way of knowing if the cars belong to registered guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, but could be perfect”
Reviews.Author: epluribusunum
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a stellar 16 nights stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and SPA. Booked a deluxe oceanfront room located in the main building with access to the Regency Club where we enjoyed breakfast, cookies, snacks,â€¦ This was my fourth stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui, check-in went through smoothly just as the other times. Itâ€™s unbelievable how everybody with the hotel staff is so friendly and helpful, from the front desk lady, to the Regency Club staff, the swimming pool staff or the cleaning lady. They are all ready and willing to walk the extra mile to support your needs. The swimming pool (state-of-the art, with 2 water slides), garden, lobby, and all the public areas are extremely well kept though the property isnâ€™t brand new. Our room was on the 19th floor with a stunning view over the swimming pool area, the beach and the Pacific Ocean, of course. Believe me the only thing better then a sunset in Maui is the sunset you get the day after, and from our room we had a first row seat for the show. The room itself is well dimensioned with a reasonably sized bathroom and walk-in closet. The balcony is great to stare at the ocean during sunset or simply to take a relaxing break during a â€œtoughâ€� spent on the beach. The fact is that nothing stands out in the room, except for the awesome view. I do agree that thereâ€™s not too much beach left in front of the property, but itâ€™s also true that at 5-10 minutes walking distance you can find some very nice spots for swimming, snorkeling or just basking in the sun. Regarding the hotelâ€™s restaurant Iâ€™ve been pretty disappointed: food at Pavillion is really overpriced, for a quick and casual lunch, make yourself a favor and walk to the Marriott, food there is better and reasonably priced. Swan Court is good for breakfast or dinner. Dinner at Spats Trattoria is good but pricey and by the way, being in beautiful Maui, who on Earth want to dine underground, windowless? I suggest dining at the Whalers Village or at Lahaina (10 minutes from the hotel by car). This hotel itself offers some good shopping too: I had a great time shopping at Macyâ€™s and you can walk yourself through a kind of galleria with more than 20 shops. The Hyatt Regency Resort and Spa itâ€™s definitely me favorite vacation spot, everything in the hotel is awesome, but could be perfect if only they improve their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Hawaii....”
Reviews.Author: sicminded
Reviews.Content: Upgraded our room to a better view for free. Place was nice. Pool was great. Staff was great. Park in the parking lot if you can find a spot, otherwise you have to valet. (can get expensive). A mile down the road is a nice indoor mall that has a good selection of food for the same prices as the mainland. The shops are good there too! We were able to get a fridge in our room and stock it with water and sodas and some food. They also have microwaves available. We have a teenager and a 7 year old (both girls) and they had a blast. We had a rollaway brought to the room for free too, so they each had their own beds. The pool is ginormous, split in two seperated by a tunnel/waterfall, one side for adults/juniors and the other for kids with slides and sand. Hyatt has an onsite 24/7 Urgent care too. This place is great for Families in my opinion. We traveled to the Aquarium one day and had a great time. Lots of neat stuff the kids will enjoy. Spankdogg is gonna love it here! =)

Reviews.Title: “High Marks for Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Fe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui for several days while my husband was running in the Maui Marathon. I researched the hotels in Kaanapali area with attention to those being teenager friendly, ameneties and relatively quiet in light of the hustle and bustle of the marathon atmosphere. The hotel was clean, but not spotless. The rooms were somewhat dated and I would have liked the room to be larger especially since our teenagers were with us. The bathroom was especially crowded. The bathroom amenities and towels were first-rate as was the bedding. We had an in-room coffee machine. We opted for the Regency Club floor, partial ocean view and were entirely happy. The Club breakfast room offers fruit and juices, an nice espresso machine, hot cooked oatmeal, cereals/milk, bagels, toast and bottled water. We would take several waters for our trips away from the resort. At around noon they provided beverages and snacks and in the evening they have appetizers, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, veggies trays, and cheese/fruit trays with crackers. We aren't big eaters and found the fare entirely adequate. We ate at Cascades once and found the food to be average. The Swan Court was expensive and often had a line to get seated. The pool area was very nice. There is very little "crowd control" and I suspected that many of the lounge chairs were being occupied by guests from other resorts or locals. The chairs became scarce at about noon. You can rent a cabana on the beach and even have a massage in one of the beach spa cabanas. The waiters/waitresses were great...friendly, prompt, and engaging. There is a food area and bar where you can purchase sandwiches, burgers, et al and very expensive. There is a narrow beach in front of the hotel, not safe for swimming and not large enough to sunbathe. Immediately north about a 15 minute walk away is the very nice Kaanapali beach, great for swimming, boarding and sunning. Whaler's Village, a shopping and dining area is about a 20 minute walk. The best part of the resort was the Fitness Center, nice machines, free weights and treadmills...open 24/7 for those of us from east of Hawaii who are still waking up to our time zone. The resort sports a Catamaran, the Kiele V. We took an evening cruise and snorkel trip with the crew and were duly impressed. Michael and Amy were especially admirable crew members! Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. The staff in the Regency Club was especially helpful in offering the local's perspective in things to do and not do while on the island. The hotel is nicely placed away from the activity at Whaler's Village and in close proximity to Lahaina for shopping/eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Maui”
Reviews.Author: Schluh
Reviews.Content: First let me say I love Hawaii but after this trip figure I am more of an Oahu girl. Maui is too uppity and expensive for my taste BUT if you like Maui you will love this hotel. It is on the southern part of Ka'anipali and closest to Lahaina. The beach is great, the pool is amazing with its waterslide (never crowded) and the service was very nice. They have valet but also a close by parking lot so you don't have to bother with it all the time. You can walk to the Whaler's Village (shopping is great there...crazy shirts, Cinnamon Girl, Hula Grill). You have a view of the sunset from this resort and some of the pictures we took look like postcards. Amazing. The rooms are large and since it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a partial ocean view. I can't think of one negative...well...it is very pricey. One thing that confused me was that no one was on the beach! Everyone was at the pool...now...Atlanta has a ton of nice pools but I came here for a BEACH. I guess the good thing is we had a ton of privacy and no screaming kids on the shore. It was like a private beach just for us. Make sure if you do go here...check out the beach...that is what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for just one night after a wonderful two weeks in Hawaii. Unfortunately one night wasnt enough for us to really experience the resort. What we did find was excellent service from the valet and front desk staff, a beautifully appointed room (thanks for the upgrade to ocean view) and a lovely buffet breakfast in the Swan Court. A few surprises, the place is enormous so finding lounge chairs in the early afternoon not very easy and you are packed in tight, the outdoor "fast food" restaurant was great, yet expensive as expected and tthere really is no beach in front of the resort so that was a disappointment. We were also surprised to find a Macy's (a small one) on the site. Maui is extremely expensive and quite frankly if I was to stay there again, would find a condo type place with a good beach. And I agree with previous posters, the daily resort fee is insane.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive”
Reviews.Author: A2theK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt from Aug 18-22 bfore going on to Big Island. The hotel is beautiful and extremely well kept. The pool is fantatstic. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The drinks and food at the hotel were very expensive though. We ended up going to Front st. every night for dinner. The only real negative thing I have to say about the hotel itself is they charge you a mandatory resort fee of I think it was $19 a day for basically nothing. It included gym access for 2 (there were 4 of us in our room), and free coffee and tea in the room (but only if you were a gold passport member), and some other useless amenities. At $400 a night this kind of stuff should be included in the price or optional not extra. Other than that, I loved it there and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced But Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mickey63
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The grounds, the lobby, and the pool areas are top tens. However the rooms are just o.k. The beds are very comfortable, but that is about it. The prices range from $250 a night down to around $650. For that amount I would look around for a good deal on a condo in the same area, and come over to the Hyatt for the day. Plus if you don not pay extra for the oceanveiw rooms it is not worth it. There are several places nearby that have just as good of a location, and veiws. Also I would have to say that the staff is just average, not unfriendly, but also not the most helpful. For the best advise on places to stay buy the book Maui Revealed, they have great advise on everything in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: HCL-Davis
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was a great place and by far the best resort we have had ever stayed. We had a mountain view room for one week. Clean, well-maintained, generous size bathroom, and VERY comfortable beds. We had one episode where I guess a circuit breaker tripped in the night, but in calling the front desk, it was restarted in less than five minutes. It is very kid-friendly and my three year old daughter had a marvelous time. Getting poolside space can be challenging especially if you show up later in the morning. I would say that by 11am during the weekends or on a forecasted relatively cloudless day, almost all poolside chair / loungers were taken. Not much problem for us since our daughter was up at 9am each day eager to swim, but I can see how this can be somewhat troublesome for couples who want to get up later in the day. We also took advantage of the on-property spa and exercise facilities. The spa was beautiful and had excellent staff for our treatments. Pricey for the services - my wife and I had both massages and facials and cost was about 3-4x more than comparable treatments elsewhere - but we both thought it was worth it because of its location and the experience of the being pampered in Maui. Exercise facilities were state-of-the-art and most of the equipment was working properly. Last, food on the premises was good-very good but also pricey and if you're not absolutely exhausted, it would be better to go over to Whaler's Village for your meals. Luau was pretty good. Overall, our family had a wonderful experience. Our daughter who is four now is still raving about how her best vacation was at Maui and the Hyatt no doubt contributed to this experience. I think that if you are looking for value this is not the place...you have to be in the mind-set that you are splurging on a great resort and that as with most resorts, you'll have to pay resort prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jrsIII
Reviews.Content: Great beach front hotel with all the adminities of a five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Hyatt!!”
Reviews.Author: Girefamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt with our two children age 9 and 12 for 6 wonderful nights from the 17-23 of August. This is our third stay at the Hyatt in the last few years, and as always we can't wait to go back! We had booked a partial ocean view and upgraded to a deluxe ocean view. Danny at the front desk hooked us up one floor from the top on the very end of the building with a fridge and a roll away in about 5 minutes. Needless to say the view was AWESOME!! We had coffee on the lanai every morning, and watched the sun set over the pacific every evening! The bed was so comfortable, and the roll away had my kids fighting over who got to sleep in it next!! Our rooms came with free breakfast, and a kids eat free plan which was just great. The pool is wonderful, and even though the hotel was nearly full, it never felt crowded or chaotic! The kids looked forward to their daily smoothie at the Pavilions bar. The staff NEVER talked down to the kids or acted like they weren't worthy of the same service that the adults were. Really made them feel special, and cemented them as future Hyatt clients! Everyone at this property was super friendly, and so helpful. My son wanted to know "Why can't everyone in California be as nice as the people who work at the Hyatt?" I will concede that the beach in front of the Hyatt isn't great, good snorkeling if you don't mind a bit of a swim, but with a mile of Kaanapali beach stretching out to the north, it's not hard to find a great place to swim or play on the sand!! We left the Hyatt and went to the Grand Wailea for two nights, and if we hadn't already paid for the rooms, we'd have left the Grand and returned to the Hyatt immediately. It seemed snobby and customer service was moderate at best. The grounds are gorgeous, pools amazing, food incredible, and location perfect. If you're looking for a hotel that feels luxurious with genuine people and great customer service instead of pretentious glitz, you can't do any better than the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Salazars
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Hyatt in Kaanapali. We were told by others that it was a family friendly resort and the pools were supposed to be amazing. We were somewhat dissappointed with our original room in the Napili Tower which overlooked a construction site. We requested 2 beds and had only one. We upgraded to the Club level and a full oceanfront view. The room was on the small side and was older and came with cottage cheese ceilings. The closets were small and everyday the water pressure in the shower would get so low that the water would actually shut off for 10 seconds. The concierge in the club level was not too helpful in making reservations off site. Poolside service was below average and it took a long time to get someone's attention to order. There was a serious problem getting chairs at the pool. People would come down to the pool and "reserve" them with a towel, then leave for several hours to get breakfast. It is not fair to those who are at the pool and want a seat. The chairs were old with plastic backing and the towels were old and crunchy. Room service for a bowl of ice cream for my young daughters was estimated at 1 hour. when we finished the ice cream, the tray was placed outside our room. Later the next afternoon, the tray was still outside our room with crusty old ice cream, plates and a cup of chocolate sauce - totally unacceptable. We've been fortunate enough to travel to 5 star resorts, including the One and Only Palmilla. For the amount of money we spent for a family of 4, we would have been better off at the One and Only Palmilla where exceptional service is the norm.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hyatt and want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jenvaughn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 8 nights at the Hyatt Regency in Maui. This was our first family trip to Hawaii and we all agree we should go back next summer. We stayed on the regency club level with a lounge offering continental breakfast every morning. There were the usual items (toast, bagels, cold cereal, juice, milk) but also a large variety of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, various coffees, including cappuccino, and fresh oatmeal, not packets. There was also a concierge in the lounge to arrange an activity when needed or simply offer suggestions. In the early evening, the lounge opened to serve complimentary cocktails and a variety of delicious hors d'oeurves. Needless to say, after that we didn't always need a full dinner. Our room was spacious and we had a balcony from which we enjoyed the view. The beds were comfortable, with plenty of pillows. We all slept comfortably with the sound of the waves in the background. The size of the pool was impressive. The Hyatt has over 800 rooms which were sold out during our stay but the pool never felt or looked overcrowded. They never ran out of fresh towels poolside like other places we've stayed. Our older kids enjoyed the waterslide and the deeper parts of the pool (9 feet). There was a separate pool for younger children complete with a sandy beach, small waterslide and water spouts. Our 1 year old was intrigued by the water spouts coming out of the ground. The staff was very courteous, friendly and accommodating. Service was excellent. Poolside servers were attentive and food orders were filled quickly which is important when children are involved. There were plenty of food options and the kids menu was great. Food was always delicious. Room service orders were accurate, delivered in a timely fashion and always the proper temperatures, an item which I'm very particular about. For anyone who plans on dining in one of the hotel restaurants, I strongly recommend reservations. On one occasion, the wait was so long it was quicker to return to our room and order room service. There was plenty of shopping just a brief walk away in the Whalers Village. There is even a Macy's onsite. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to feel pampered in a relaxing, resort environment. For those with kids, this is definitely a family friendly environment. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Exurbanite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for just two nights, Aug. 5th and 6th, as we were spending the rest of our stay in a much larger condo. However, I wanted my kids to have the large resort hotel experience with the nice pools and waterslide, so we decided to spend two nights here before checking into our condo. We had booked a Regency Club Partial Ocean view, and upon arrival were upgraded to a full ocean view. Very pleasant front desk and bell staff. Our bellman was very informative. Our room was one floor below the Regency Club level, but both floors require a room key to operate the elevator to those floors. (A little bit of a hassle if you forget your key like my kids did and were planning to just knock on the door.) Our room was #2127 and it was gorgeous - a corner room with two balconies, one with a full view of the mountains and the other a direct (but southernly view) of the ocean. We could see the ocean without having to step out on our lanai. The room decor is very attractive, and furnished like you would see on the hotel website, with a king bed and a sofa which opens up into a sofabed. A little tight for four people but we were expecting this. The king bed was very comfortable, and the rest of the furnishings very attractive. We had a cot and a mini fridge sent up, and they arrived very quickly. The cot was huge and took up a lot of room. The bathroom was very attractive, however the tub and toilet are in the same room together and it is a little tight in there. However the sink and make up area are very spacious and have a marble top. A hair dryer is provided. Two bathrobes were provided as well. There is a mirrored closet door which made it easier for me to put my makeup on than doing it at the sink. The shampoo, conditioner, soaps, and lotions are all from the spa, and are to die for - really good quality products that smell incredible. The room also has an optional HP Printer that you can use to print your digital camera photos - the paper and ink cartridge are provided for a cost of $29.00. You just insert the camera card in it. We did not use it but thought it was a nice option if you want to print your photos. The TV has internet service and a keyboard which we did not use either. The Regency Club is well worth the extra money in my opinion - all four of us got free breakfast both days, and the evening snacks and cocktails were well worth it. They had huge sandwiches and plenty of food to make dinner out of it for at least one night. Plus you can go up there all day and get drinks and sodas. the Regency room is very pleasant with it's own concierge, who booked some tours for us while we were there having breakfast. We found the tours a little cheaper going through the concierge, than in the regular tour brochures. There is a little booklet the Hyatt Regency puts out with their own tour list, and it does pay to go through them. We booked a catamaran sunset cruise on the hotel sailboat, and saved $10 a person going through the concierge. Anyway, we felt the Regency club was well worth the extra cost, as meals are very expensive in Hawaii, and we got breakfast for four two days in a row, free sodas and drinks all day long, and even made dinner out of it one night. I feel it was a real convenience and saved us quite a bit of money. We were very impressed with the Hyatt's pool area, and my children, 12 and 14, just loved the waterslide. We also swam in the ocean several times, and the fact that the hotel does not have much beach is not a big deal, there are so few people on it anyway. The water was warm and clear, but the bottom quickly gives way to rock and coral, so I would advise bringing a pair of cheap water shoes (we bought some at KMart when we came in from the airport.) The pool area is just beautiful, and we never had a problem getting a chair, as they seemed to be plentiful. My husband and I got the couples massage under the cabana by the ocean, and it was very relaxing and a wonderful experience. If you get a massage, you also get free use of the spa for the day, so my husband took advantage of that. My 12 year old son decided to get his hair cut there, and we got a wonderful "surfers" haircut from Ingrid at the spa. The stores located adjacent to the Hyatt kept my 14 year old busy in the evening, and seemed to offer a nice array of shops. She particularly liked the Macy's bathing suit store. The kids also enjoyed the penguins in the lobby, as well as the parrot and koi fish ponds. They were just so bowled over by all the wildlife on the property. My husband and daughter ate at Spatts one night, and really enjoyed their meal there. We had a wonderful time at the Hyatt, and found it to be a fabulous property, fulfilling every dream and expectation we had. It is truly luxurious, and a place that will leave you with great memories of Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Comfort”
Reviews.Author: kph
Reviews.Content: We recently arrived at the Marriott Ocean Club only to find that we had arrived a day early. It being at 100% capacity, we took the opportunity to stay next door and are we glad we did! The Hyatt Regency property on Kaanapali Beach may be one of the oldest properties, but it still exudes Hawaiian charm and makes you feel like you have really gotten away. The lobby area architecture is noteworthy and the location on the beach amazing. Admittedly, it can be a bit crowded, but they manage very well for its popularity. Staff needs a little work... perhaps the hotel is successful regardless of their attitude(s), regardless, not nearly as warm or as interested as other Hawaii properties we have stay at. My wife did like the Spa, right on the beach. We would try this hotel again... the place is what we liked most about it. If the staff are still poor the next time around, it will be off our last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: slamdunk09
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hyatt Maui. After 4 days first in Oahu, the Hyatt was a fabulous retreat and exactly what we expected from Hawaii. The grounds are gorgeous--we drove all over Maui checking out other hotels, and by far, the Hyatt is the most lush and beautiful. We had a deluxe oceanview room with fabulous views of ocean, Lanai, and the pool area. Rooms were very comfortable. Although the hotel was full, it never felt crowded (unlike our stay in Waikiki). The pool is great--again, never felt crowded. We also never had a problem getting a chair, even in the middle of the day, though it was obvious that some people planted their towels early in the day and came much later. (Note to those folks--don't do it--not necessary and rude!!) Good service at the pool area--great pina coladas! Swan Court breakfast was very nice. We also had several dinners at Cascades--great sushi and unbelievable atmosphere--outdoors with great views of sunset. We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau and highly recommend it. Also ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise--great burgers, and the Hula Grill near Whalers Village--also great. Overall, fabulous property--can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Maui - Beauitiful”
Reviews.Author: JANJ1225
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Hyatt July 20-23th. The decor absoutely gorgeous! The rooms are not the largest I've stayed in but for (6) girls (2 - rooms) we were comfortable (we added a roll away bed in each room). I felt that the front desk staff and hostesses at the Restaurants could benefit from a refresher "hospitality" course. I have only positive comments regarding the valet staff and their service - EXCELLENT! Our waiter "JJ" and the cuisine at Son'z - AWESOME! The mango martini - excellent recommendation by our waiter. The other staff at Son'z professional, friendly and helpful. Again, the hostesses would never work for me. The beach is small but very nice. The pool and grounds are beautiful and well maintained. We found a couple bugs in our bathrooms. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. We visited Maui the last 3 days of our trip as we'd stayed on Oahu and the Big Island pior to Maui. The Royal Lahaina Luau - very good! The coastal drive - gorgeous! When renting your vehilcle get the GPS system - it is helpful and saves time. The Maui sunsets "amazing". Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pauliejerry
Reviews.Content: I would faithfully read the Trip Advisor reviews from travelers to Maui and the Hyat t Regency Maui. These reviews proved to be 100% accurate! We stayed there May 18-26. Everything was absolutley wonderful! Hotel was gorgeous, beds were fabulous, food was a bit pricey; we had our daughter's wedding dinner at the Italian restaurant there and were not really impressed with the food and service. The front desk staff were the friendliest we have ever encountered. We ate at Whaler's Village...Leliani's was the best. We also ate at Bubba Gump's and Hard Rock, where the food was good as it always is in those places. Shopping in Lahaina was fun, especially the Christian Lassen Galleria. The best deals for clothing was at the Maui Mall near the airport. Same shirts as in Lahaina, but 1/2 the price. We went to Iao Valley and the windsurfing beach and Road to Hana. All were worth the time...so beautiful and captivating. We had been to Maui in 1975 and were surprised to see all the changes. Some of our party stayed at the Royal Lahaina and had a good experience, especially with the free incentives given them. We all went to the Royal Lahaina Luau and it was great! The host made us all feel so welcome and the food and drinks were really good. Thank you so much for Trip Advisor...we will never travel without first checking out what fellow travelers say!

Reviews.Title: “Family with 18yr.old and 16y. all loved Paradise”
Reviews.Author: rafecf
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hyatt July 17th thru 23rd. Our stay was perfect. Remember to all----you are on a island not the mainland of the USA. We thought the hotel was beautiful. We also stayed on the 22nd floor. We found the wait staff everywhere to be extra gracious. We have 2 highschool children that loved everything also. All wait staff were gracious to them as well. The only area in the room that was small was the balcony, but when you learn what real estate sells for in Maui you will understand!!!!!!!!!!!!!The Regancy Club floor was excellent. The restaurants were expensive---similar to Las Vegas prices. We spent 2 days prior at the Bellagio in Las Vegas and prices were extremely high there with no beach atmosphere!!!!We ate at the Hyatt 5 nights and found dinner to be most enjoyable. The sunsets at 7:15 p.m. were spectaular. We went on the Sunrise tour and the 36 mile bike ride down to be life changing---it felt like the world was just beginning. It was beauitiful. We also took a tour with 2 other people to Hana and the seven pools. I would suggest taking a tour for this they take you the back roads and it only takes 2 hours rather than 4. The hike through the bamboo trees and up to the rain forest was also great. We spent one afternoon in Lahina. It reminded us of Key Weest. Cheesburgers in Paradise was our spot for lunch that my 18yr. old loved. The beaches were beautiful----come on you are in Hawaii. My son went boogie boarding everyday. The only 2 areas that I would complain about if any was the Hyatt's Luai was a very expensive tourist trap. If you have traveled to Mexico or any Carribean Island you will see the same show. The food was average and you were packed in like cattle. Skip the Luai. I always wanted to see one and felt like we were on a Cruise ship. The only other area is all meals are very expensive. We have travelled to Europe almost every summer and have been to most of the Carribean, and Mexico and these meal prices were very high. There is no where else to to go unless you want to eat at Subway, McDonalds.....but why go to Maui!!!!!!!!!!!!All in all we loved the trip and loved the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aceybee
Reviews.Content: We arrived back from Maui yesterday and had a great time. Our room was very expensive and very small. It was elegant and nicely decorated, but for $600 I expected a better place. We had a cockroach in our room and maintenance sprayed which left a bad smell. The Regency Club was great. The staff was great. They were so accommodating. We really enjoyed all of the food and the service. We had a really good time and did enjoy the pool. The chairs are cheapies, but there are alot of them. The pool and grounds were well kept. Overall I would recommend this hotel, but not to pay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and couldn't wait to get back to the Hilton on the Big Island!”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDAGirl1965
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice to look at but..... The rooms were so tight we bumped into each other ALL the time. We were on the top floor conceige floor with free foods served for members of Hyatt. They had really nice stuff to eat and it of course helps with cost. It just had that made up feeling. I missed the natural lava flows of the Hilton, the boats, shops. It just didnt have the same feel. The room furniture was very nice stylish and comfortable. But too tight even on the balcony! Everyone was snotty especially the conciege staff. Absolutely rude. We just ignore everyone and left the hotel as much as possible. It's too built up and forget getting a place to sit at the pool or a drink brought to you. Maui has changed unbelievably for the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt on Maui -- GOOD STUFF!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our honeymoon on Maui and Kauai. We stayed at the Hyatt's on both islands. The Maui property, I will agree with another comment, is def not as spectacular as the one on Kauai, however, it is still a beautifully maintained property with a friendly staff and fantastic pool! We also found the bed to be VERY VERY comfortable!! Upon our arrival, we were immediately upgraded to a ocean deluxe room. We looked over the ocean and the pool. I will say the view is great, however, the beach wasn't particularly made for swimmiing. If you walked the 40 yards to the Sheraton or Marriott beach, that was a different story. Plenty of space for all beachgoers on all 3 properties. The food, yes, is a bit overpriced. What do you expect? You're in Hawaii at a giant chain resort. That's par for the course. The breakfast buffett (which was included in our package) was wonderful though. Had something different every morning and for lunch ventured to Lahaina or down the path to Whaler's Village (VERY VERY CONVENIENT AND FUN SPOT) to grab something. No big deal at all. Overall, we were very pleased with the Hyatt. But again, once we saw the property on Kauai, it blew the Maui Hyatt away. However, these are 2 different islands with different cultures and "speeds" so it was nice to have a more "hopping" spot and then retreat to the more calm Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui is just Ok - The Hyatt Regency Level Staff is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Maui from June 27th â€“ July 2nd before going to Honolulu. I must say I am surprised by all the raves, I believe the Hyatt Kauai is the Best Hyatt in the entire Hawaiian Islands. As you can tell I was disappointed when I arrived at the Hyatt Regency on Maui. Drive from Kahului to Kaâ€™anapali: I think the State of Hawaii and the County of Maui should spend some money on the development of better ways to get to West Maui. When you rent a car and look at the timeline it will take you to drive to Kaâ€™anapali or Kapalua, it says it will take you 45 â€“ 60 minutes driving time. However, it does not include the traffic jams you encounter in Lahaina. It took me 2 hours to get to the Hyatt. Only 1 road in and outâ€¦ How whacked is that? Hyatt: I think overall, most of the disappointment was due to the fact I felt the hotel was really showing its age. I stayed at the Regency Level on the 22nd floor overlooking the Kaâ€™anapali South Golf Course. The Regency Club and itâ€™s staff was great and added to stay. However, if you are on the 22nd floor the elevators are slow and will take forever to get to. Speaking about the Elevators â€“ Itâ€™s Dark and Humid, you will need your Regency Club Card to get to the 22nd floor. The reason I mention this, itâ€™s dark and you need to have it in hand to slide into the slot. Restaurants: Overpriced and the food is just OK. Checkout some of the restaurants in Lahaina, I think you will be very surprised without the $$$. Luau Show: Met some friends at the Drums of the Pacific, since we could not get into the Old Lahaina Luau. We had experienced other luauâ€™s on Kauai and Oahu, so we wanted to try the VIP treatment. We were given a table near the stage under this tree that kept dropping things on our table. When we went to the Luau Buffet, we found the food to be exceptional, however the numerous flies kept us from enjoying our meal. Our waiter â€œJoeâ€� told us it only happens during the summer???? That did not make sense. Pools: The pools were PACKED full of old lounge chairs that were inches apart. The beach was rocky and murky. Golf: The only Course Open was the South Course, since the North is being redone. Slow Play and over used greens. I played at several courses at Kapalua (Bay & Plantation) and Wailea (Gold & Emerald), which was out of this world. Other Activities: Para Sail â€“ You need to book this a day or two in advance. Overall the Kaanapali area did not feel very "Hawaii". If you are looking to stay on this Island here are a few tips. For some of you looking for the sun without all the traffic, I would suggest the Wailea area and all itâ€™s beautiful Hotels. If you are looking for cooler climate with some clouds, but beautiful views, try Kapalua and the Ritz. However, for those looking to stay in the Kaâ€™anapali area, check out the Sheraton - it looked really nice from the outside and their beach area was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, we were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OhioBuckeye8
Reviews.Content: I must say that reading through the other reviews, I am surprised by all the raves. Let me begin by saying that my new husband and I started our honeymoon on Kauai at the Grand Hyatt Resort and Spa and were blown away by that property. It was absolutely an amazing resort. So, we were disappointed when we arrived at the Hyatt Regency on Maui. I think overall, most of the disappointment was due to the fact that the grounds and the hotel were not nearly as manicured as Kauai. I felt the hotel was really showing its age. Sure, I have seen worse, but coming from somewhere 20 times better made it hard to remember that. It would have helped if we felt the staff was accomodating, but in fact we found them rude and curt. Furthermore, we were only offered rooms by the elevator shafts which were noisy. The cleaning staff also had some sort of work room by the elevators and all we heard all day were carts and doors banging around. The pools were PACKED full of old lounge chairs that were inches apart. The beach was rocky and murky. I did have a very nice lomi lomi massage in the spa and the workout facility looked nice a big, but I gave myself a week off from that. As with almost anything in Hawaii, the food and beverage at the Hyatt were overpriced for their calibur, but that is just something we got used to. Overall the Kaanapali area did not feel very "Hawaii" - many fewer "aloha's" and alot more rudeness. If you are looking to stay in this area, check out the Sheraton - it looked really nice from the outside and their beach area was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Westin”
Reviews.Author: Jamieagogo
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this site, and all the great advice here, we changed our reservations from the Westin to the Hyatt at the last minute and we are so grateful we did. We hadn't been to Maui in years and previously always stayed at the Westin. Then, a very thoughtful reviewer mentioned how the Westin was now overrun with kids due to the timeshare boom there - and how the Hyatt seems to "isolate the kids to their own pool area and absorb them with their large grounds" making them a non issue. I got a laugh out of that but it is a very apt description. We walked down to the Westin a few times on the way to Whaler's village (really fun shopping there) and it looked like Disneyland~ I am not exaggerating when I say that I must have seen about 25 kids for every adult running around there. The arrival was great at the Hyatt, the staff is so friendly and we loved the lei greeting and the grand lobby. Be sure to use valet when you arrive or you will miss the lei greeting. And the first night of valet is free, and then soars to something like $25 per night. After that, park yourself, it's a breeze and then you don't have to wait in line for your car each time you want to leave as well. We were offered a deluxe ocean view upgrade for $75 and said yes, and it was so worth it. Absolutely made a world of difference to my husband and I but neither set of our parents would do it, and stared out at the parking lot instead. We had the free buffet breakfast - used the AAA discount when we booked online, and the best room rate I saw available as well ($325 nightly). I never found the Swan Court Breakfast deal anywhere else and believe me, I looked. It meant the world to our discount-oriented parents, possibly their favorite part of this high end vacation. It is scrumptious and elegant and a great way to start the day. If you have to pay yourself, it is $25 per person. If the line is long when you get there, donâ€™t worry, it moves really fast. I saw the line up the stairs on Sunday and was seated and eating within 15 minutes. Anyway, as I mentioned, the Whaler's village is great, and if the walk back to the hotel in the heat seems daunting, there are free busses back to the hotels that run out front of the center. We happened on to that by mistake and were so pleased - it was really, really hot the week we were there. They said about 85 - 87 degrees but we were actually uncomfortable everyday between about 10 am and 4 pm, but because of our parents, we couldnâ€™t really do the pool or beach. We snuck off a few times and the beach outside the Hyatt may not be the best, but walk just a little bit down and itâ€™s fine, the ocean was wonderful and we went in every chance we got. We loved Warren and Annabelleâ€™s went there mainly for our parents but we really loved it. Check out the review in Maui Revealed, it is right on. And the place is adorable, and each person gets their own plate of â€˜appetizersâ€™, huge and more than enough, followed by gigantic desserts. We asked for fresh fruit instead and they were accommodating. You spend about an hour in this beautiful â€˜salonâ€™, watching a piano show and eating, and then the awesome show is in an intimate 78 person theatre. We had a party of six and they saved us 6 seats together, and made sure we had a lovely table together. It was fancier and better than I have seen reviewed on this site. We went on a dinner cruise, but didnâ€™t love it, could be because we frequently go on San Francisco Bay and the Maui ones donâ€™t compare. Cheeseburger in Paradise was about $100 for 6 with only 2 drinks, it's just ok, and if you sit upstairs in the bar, it will be loud because of the band. A trip to Grand Wailea was nice they have some great art in their lovely lobby, and we had a superb lunch at Longhi's there - at the mall. I hear that it has gone down in quality (used to be a favorite of ours) but lunch is fractions of the price and we loved the lobster cannelloni. Also had dinner at the Cascades at the hotel and it was perfect but try to get a table outside if you can, as a larger party we were stuck inside and wished we werenâ€™t. Food is top notch fusion and the best meal we had in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: jhhoffmann2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 nights in Hawaii in June to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary, with half of those nights at the Hyatt on Maui. It was our first true vacation without the kids in 18 years, so we wanted someplace to relax and spend some quality, romantic time together in a first-class location. Without a doubt, this was the right place. When we booked the trip through American Airlines Vacations, we indicated this was an anniversary trip, and when the Hyatt noted that fact at check-in we were upgraded to an oceanfront room. The room was very nice, the view was incredible, and we enjoyed literally everything about our stay. We stayed on property much of the time during the trip, visiting the spa, hitting all the shops, trying all the restaurants, lounging on the beach and swimming in the pool. We also attended the luau right at the Hyatt and took the snorkel tour and sunset cruise on their sailboat. It was the first time we had ever done the spa experience at a resort, and it was great. Very relaxing experience. All the restaurants were good, particularly Cascade's for dinner (where we sat outdoors) and breakfast at Sonz. The snorkel tour was fun and the sunset cruise was as well. We got pretty wet on the sunset cruise, though, so dress casually if you go. The luau was terrific; we opted for the VIP seating and it was definitely worth it. Didn't have to wait in line standing in the hot sun, the waiters brought us drinks at our table, and we got to eat first. Good food, too. The concierge/activity desk was very helpful as we set up our outings for the week. Johanna was wonderful. In fact, every employee at the Hyatt was helpful, friendly and courteous. We used valet parking (for the convertible; worth the extra for this, too) when we first arrived but self-parked later because the lot was close. Overall, we spent a good deal of money on this trip and had high hopes and expectations. The Hyatt exceeded every expectation, and we enjoyed a fabulous five-star experience. My wife and I loved every minute and will definitely return. We recommend this resort highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaciEugene
Reviews.Content: Like the other review, I have been busy and haven't posted my review until now. My (now) fiance and I stayed at the hotel November of 2005. We loved it so much that we barely left the hotel! The service was great, grounds (especially the pool) was beautiful and the room clean and large. It was a short walk to a nice beach where we would scuba dive and swim with the turtles. You could also scuba at the beach in front of the hotel...but it was too hard to get past the pool to get there! We did take the advice of other reviews and went to the Lahaina Luau instead of the local hotel luaus. You won't be disappointed. Food and entertainment were well worth the trip in town. I seriously can't say enough good things about this hotel. I'm ready to go back now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Beyond Words”
Reviews.Author: kay4maui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Maui June 5th - June 12th and had a wonderful time! This hotel is beyond words. The property is beautiful with all of its foliage, art work, and birds. And clean, clean, clean. The grass strip next to the ocean's edge is now my favorite place on earth. My son loved tossing the football with his dad on the grass, a memory I'll always cherish. We never had any problems with parking, noise, or crowds. The pools, waterfalls, and water slide are fabulous! Perfect temp, too! There were no problems finding chairs at the pool, and there was a nice mix of families (we brought our two kids ages 10 & 13), honeymooners, and anniversary folks. The Hyatt's location at the end of resort strip is perfect. Not too busy!! We loved the beach in front of the Hyatt and swam there often. No problems with smells or other oddities others have mentioned about the water. We did not find the beach too small. The daily breakfast buffet was incredible; we ate their every morning. My husband and I's buffet were included in our package, and our son's buffet was free every day because of his age (10). The buffet included made-to-order omlettes, three kinds of sausages, scrambled eggs, toast, muffins, breads, pancakes, french toast, waffles, apple crepes, cheese blitzes (with strawberry sauce), eggs benedict, bacon, fruit...I could go on and on. Who could ever get tired of that selection?? We loved our room in the Napili tower third floor overlooking foliage and the ocean (Room 318). Note, however, that the smoking floor is the fourth floor and we could occasionally smell cigar and cigarette smoke. Next time we'll ask for a room on a higher floor. Also note that the beds sit on large wooden platforms with big corners. I rammed my ankle into it a few times and came home with a bruised, and slightly swollen ankle. I used towels to cover the corners but later learned that the Hyatt has pads available to cover the corners. Ask for the pads! After looking walking by other properties, we were glad we changed to the Hyatt from the Westin before departing. As others have mentioned, the Westin seemed busy (partly due to location, layout, and size of the property) and appeared dated. In our opinion, the Hyatt is a notch above the Westin but is still comfortable to stay at (not stuffy). We did not feel nickeled-and-dimed at all. Our refrigerator and roll-away came up with our luggage (no extra charge). Prices for other things were what we would expect to pay at a resort island. I would highly recommend the luau and the Tour of the Stars! Wow, both were incredible. I hope my review helps others with their lodging decisions. You can't go wrong at this Hyatt! I am still feeling sad from having to leave and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Kanaapali”
Reviews.Author: travelgrems
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt definitely exceeded our expectations. We did extensive research on where to stay in Kanaapali- and upon checking out other properties nearby, were extremely happy with our choice. The Hyatt is upscale yet tropical- they take great pride in the uptake of the hotel, especially the beautiful gardens. While this is a large resort, there is never a shortage of chairs by the pool- or on the lawn nearby over looking the ocean. We walked the entire beach walk and definitely thought that the ambiance and beauty of the property far exceeded the others- the Westin was a distant second, but seemed much more hectic and not as lush and tropical. The Sheraton did not look that nice, even thought had a great location on Black Sand beach- you can easily walk there from the Hyatt- so we were actually happy to be away from the crowds that snorkel there during the day. The rooms were very nice, with the exception of the check-in experience. We arrived late from the West Coast and were met by a rude front desk who informed us that there were no more Partial Ocean view rooms left with king beds. This was quite annoying to argue about at midnight after a long trip- particularly after I confirmed our view and bed type numerous times via phone and received email confimations from the hotel the week before arrival. She was quite unapologetic- to the point of rude- definitely no "aloha spirit" there. Upon complaining the next day- we were informed that they do not guarantee bedding type only view (this seems ridiculous...). However, this front desk associate was much friendlier and offered to upgrade us to a deluxe ocean with a king for no extra cost- but we would have to wait until the following day. It was worth the wait, since our room on the 18th floor of the Napili Tower was fabulous- with a gorgeous view and breeze, even being set above the pool- we could hear the waves crashing at night. The rooms are very well kept and incoroprate some local flavor while still being high end. The beds and linens were great and housekeeping was very prompt and did a great job. We ate breakfast in the room every morning on our lanai - storing some light yogurt, juice and fruit in our mini fridge that we requested. Otherwise the service was good- not excellent, but given that this a larger resort there is no hand holding here like the Four Seasons. However, there is an activity booking center on-site and Jeffrey at the concierge desk was wonderful- giving us some honest local advice. This resort offers a multitude of restaurants, but there are so many other great ones nearby in Whalers Village and otherwise (Sansei, Hula Grill, Mama's, etc- that there is no need to stay at the hotel every night). We had the breakfast buffet at Swan Court a couple days, which was pricey but good. The pool food is good and we thought rooms service (definitely worth a sunset dinner on the lanai if you have an ocean view) was very tasty and worth the cost. The gym at the Hyatt is excellent- providing cold cloths, chilled lemon water and some great views from the machines. The pools and waterslide were fun (even for us with no kids!) -- the only thing is that pool chairs could have been upgraded, since quite a bit of them are broken and did not have any cushions. Definitely utilize the beach walk for some excercize or a stroll to dinner. Also, we never utilized the valet and never had any problems using the self park. Enjoy, the Hyatt is definitely the pick of the crop in this part of the island!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt is awsome!”
Reviews.Author: luvntravelin
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay at the Hyatt. It is a beautiful resort in a great location. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. The breakfast buffet is yummy! The Swan Court where the buffet is served is so pretty. Great service there also. The Pavillion by the pool is a great place to grab lunch. Good quesadillas, burgers, and salads. The drinks here are good too! Loved the Blue Hawaii. We enjoyed walking the beachwalk also. We could not have been happier with our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 6 out of 10 days of our honeymoon. We had a great time there! Our room ocean view room was on the top floor in the Napaali towers. It was very quiet, the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable, and we had a great view. The second day we were there, they sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne and gave us a photo album for pictures. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and well kept. The pools were nice, but very crowded with all ages. My husband enjoyed the pools and slides. We lounged by the hotel near the beach one afternoon, and a waitress was available to serve food and drinks. The beach, however is just a narrow strip of sand, but just a few minute walk will take you to a wider beach, and there's great snorkling near black rock in front of the Sheraton(but it was also very crowded). The breakfast buffet at Swan Court was very good, especially the pancakes, fruits, and eggs benedict. The atmosphere there was beautiful. The fitness center was nice. Cardio equipment with TV's for each, weights, cold water, towels, and enough space to work out in. The only disappointment at the Hyatt, was the Luau, which was overpriced, and crowded, and although it says all-you-can-eat buffet, when we got up to get seconds, the food had already been taken away. The food was very good, however. They only served drinks before we ate and after that, the waiter didn't come by. I've been to much better Luau's at different hotels. Lahaina in general, is very crowded, but we had a great time at the Hyatt. We did stay at the Fairmont in Wailea, which is a beautiful area of Maui, but I enjoyed the Hyatt's accomodations much more than the Fairmont. In terms of restaurants, our favorite place was Mama's fish house in Paia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Nice upscale local flavor.”
Reviews.Author: To'ere
Reviews.Content: I should have posted this back in September of 2005, shortly after I returned. But I've been so busy with my new job that I was unable to. My wife and I love to travel, but with the births of our sons, we've scaled back a bit. This was the first major vacation for my whole family. We split our time in Maui between this hotel, and the Grand Wailea. We chose these two hotels because of their water features which are important for those of us with kids! This hotel is wonderful! My wife was born and raised in Hawaii so we've stayed in the islands quite a bit. This is one of the best hotels in Maui, IMHO, due to its prime location in Ka'anapali, and some very nice amenities. Given my exposure to the Hawaiian culture (I even drum now for a Hula troop run by my wife's sister), I can honestly say this hotel has a lot of the Hawaiian flavor. Being there felt like I was distinctively in Hawaii. It's not the newest of hotels, but they do a great job at keeping it up quite nicely. It was very clean and decently maintained. The rooms were not elaborate nor luxerious compared to other hotels in which we've stayed, but were very comfortable for my wife and me and our two boys (ages 3 and 1 at the time). The pool and grounds were fantastic! The grounds were very lush and very Hawaiian! (As opposed to other hotels which have Hawaiian themes, but are still very "European". Walking on the "rope bridge" through the gardens reminded me of my drive years ago along the winding road to Hana (in Maui). They also had live birds and a wonderful coi pond which captured my boys' attentions and imaginations. I can't stop raving about this hotel, and I've stayed at some of the best in Maui (The Ritz in Kapalua and the Grand in Wailea). While the rooms and infrastructure really aren't even on the same page as the Ritz or the Grand, all of the other intangibles move it right up there with this five star hotels. Great job! We'll be back and will take this over the Ritz. The Grand is another story altogether.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the hyatt with another couple in december 2005,we loved every minute of it.the hotel was perfect,the people are very helpful and friendly,we were not ready to leave after our week there.it was our first trip to hawaii,sice then we have visited oahu,there is no comparison.maui is very beautiful and the hyatt is what you dream hawaii will be when you get there.everthing was perfect from the time we arrived until we sadly departed for home

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was great!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine504
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful first trip to Maui and we could not have picked a better hotel. We celebrated our 10th Anniversary on this trip and brought our 4 1/2 year old daughter. The Hyatt is beautiful -- from the waterfalls at the pools to the flamingos and swans on the grounds. The room was great and the beds are unbelievably comfortable. We never had a problem finding chairs at the pool. The main pool connects to the kiddie pool by way of waterfalls and a grotto bar. It was fabulous. It never seemed terribly crowded and there were not tons of kids. The service at the hotel was excellent. Eveyone who works there is friendly and are happy to help with anything you need. They also have several shops including Macy's, a sandal shop and a photo shop. I cannot think of one thing that we did not like about this hotel. We'd definitely stay there again. The Swan Court breakfast buffet at the hotel is nice and there was a big variety. We ate at the pool restaurant for lunch twice. We ususally went to Lahaina to eat. Lahaina Coolers was our favorite breakfast spot (best french toast ever). Bubba Gumps and Cheeseburger in Paradise are great for lunch or dinner. A definite must for dinner is Mama's Fish House. It is about an hour away from the Hyatt but well worth the drive. Everything they serve that night is caught earlier that day. Not only was the food great, but the atmosphere of the restaurant is unbelievable. Make your reservations before you get to Maui and ask for a table by the window. Also, try to get there early to take pictures on the beach before your reservation. The view is wonderful. The town that you drive through (Paia) is quaint. I wish we could have stopped. Also , nearby there's an Ocenarium and a park with bumper boats and a miniature golf course, which our daughter loved. We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau. Make sure to make your reservations for this luau as soon as you book your Maui trip. It's extremely hard to get a reservation. The food, service and the show were excellent. We had an great time and are looking forward to our next trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Pure heaven after a terrible Marriott Lihue stay!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel29
Reviews.Content: We paid an arm and a leg to stay there, but it was worth every penny after a rough stay at the Marriott in Kauai. We upgraded to an oceanfront room, and it was pure heaven listening to the waves crashing. The pool and slide was a blast, and my husband loved watching the basketball playoffs on a flatscreen in the bar in the cave/pool. If you're a AAA member, Hyatt is offering free breakfast right now, so be sure and book that way. It ended up being a $50 daily value in Maui, which helped when we were paying $450 a day for our room! The grounds are pretty, and they have lots of shops, even a small Macys. Other than breakfast, we did not eat there, but they have a few options. Their gym is amazing, a little bit of a hike down the Kaanapali path, but so worth it with all of their great equipment. They offer chilled towels and water with oranges for/after your workout, which I loved. Headphones are also available to plug into the Cardio theater type equipment. We would definitely go back, hopefully just not at the last minute prices! Also, although the hotel location says Lahaina, you are in Kaanapali, just at the tail end, but still within walking distance to Whalers Village.
