The adjacent beach is pretty non-existent at this time...you can walk 5 minutes to your left to find a nice beach. Service at the hotel was wonderful, prompt responses from housekeeping for extra pillows, towels. We had the package which included brunch (for 2 only- though they would mark extra #'s on the voucher for the kids when we asked )..brunch was very nice at both the Swan Court (table service with self-serve brunch) or the Pavillion with a more casual set up. Be sure to check out Napili Beach & Kapalua Beach just a very short drive north- both completely kid friendly surf, gorgeous beaches! You MUST buy the book "MAUI REVEALED" , the ultimate guidebook by Andrew Doughty ..unbaised reviews of beaches, hotels,restaurants, activities,shopping...awesome maps & these guys are right on in their reviews and "hidden treassures" of the island. We went on an incredible hike on the road to Hana( @ 6 1/2 miles from the start )most people don't know about but they recommened and ate at restaurants we would not have known about. Everyone advertises themselves as the best...do yourself a favor & check out this easy read book & consider their opinions. (they also have one for the other islands) They give the Hyatt the highest honor " a real gem"... I'll review the Marriot under the other reviews for that hotel...All in all we highly recommend this place. May we suggest a stop at the Walmart by the airport to pick up cases of water (great for the car to have when going around the island), snacks and pool noodles which we used at the pool & snorkeling at Kapalua, Napili and Ulua beaches all great for kids:) ALOHA!!!! the Causey Family, Brea California

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Maui...not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon from October 29th through November 4th and we were disappointed. Yes the grounds are beautiful but after staying at the Mauna Lani Bay on the BI we were spoiled. The valet parkers were down right rude and threw our luggage unto the curb, we never used them again, we just self parked. At check-in the the hotel worker, Noah, was defintely lacking any aloha spirit. He kept trying to get us to upgrade our room to ocean view for $70 extra a night and told us those rooms go for $700/night; we later found out he lied to us, those rooms are much cheaper than that plus a friend of mine was staying there the same week and they only wanted $40 a night extra from them for an upgrade. Our room was horrible. The carpet was stained, the bathroom had an order, our partial ocean view was on partial if you leaned over the balcony, the wallpaper was dirty and peeling and our sheets were dirty. We called down to the front desk to have our sheets changed and they came right away but we felt the women were talking about us because they kept giving us looks the whole time. Don't even get me started on the pool area. We had to walk around fro 15 minutes until we found empty chairs at the kids section. We felt like we were at an amusement park, people are practically laying on top of each other at the pool. We did notice that each day there were less and less people at the pool and it was easier to get chairs and the last day the pool was practically empty. The hotel also nickel and dimes you to death. There is a $15/day resort fee that covers 1 hour of tennis, in-room coffee, a newspaper, and the gym. Valet parking is an extra $10 per night. No offense but i shouldn't have to pay $15/day for a paper I didn't want, coffee I didn't use, and tennis and the gym we didn't go to. If people want that than they could charge them extra but shouldn't charge everyone. Overall we just weren't happy at all. Also, the Swan Court was closed for most of our stay but they finally opened for breakfast the last two days. That was beautiful and having the breakfast included was well worth it. We met about 5 other couples on their honeymoons at the Hyatt and all of them hated it and were very disappointed. When we go back to Maui we will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll feel so welcome here!”
Reviews.Author: utjz1232
Reviews.Content: The staff here absolutely goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. From the front desk, to the bellmen, to the valet parking attendants, to the pool attendants, all were friendly, helpful and truly went above and beyond to make you feel like a valued customer. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful. There are koi ponds, penguins, macaws & beautiful flowers everywhere. The hotel itself is what I would call an "open air" hotel, meaning it is like an atrium. Once you step out of your room you look down on the ponds & flowers etc. or look up to the blue Maui sky. There are many colorful flowers growing on each floor of the hotel that are so beautiful to look up at if you are on a lower floor. The only problem we had happened to us our first afternoon there as my husband, son & I tried to take a nap. We were awaken by what sounded like a jackhammer in the room above us. And it kept going and going. I finally got up and found a note that had been slipped under our door informing us that they were renovating the penthouse suite which was directly above our room. And sorry for the inconvenience, but the work would contine from 9-5 for the next two weeks! I was quite irked that this was not disclosed to us upon check-in. In my opinion, they should not have checked people into any of the rooms immediately surrounding the "construction zone." So I called the front desk to complain. Since we were staying on the 21st floor of the Regency Club (w/ a parital ocean view) and there were no other rooms available on the Regency Club floor with that view, we were upgraded to the 15th floor with a full ocean view. We still had access to the Regency Club, but just weren't on the higher floor. So we were happy with the way they rectified the situation. I found out that it is totally worth the money to have an ocean front room as opposed to a partial ocean view. So worth the extra money! I would also recommend doing the Regency Club, as many times the hors d'oeuvres sufficed for dinner and the continental breakfast was more than enough each morning. Plus all drinks are free, be it alcohol, soda, bottled water, coffee or tea. The staff at the R.C. is warm, friendly and accommodating. Since we only paid for our lunches & dinner one time during our 5 day stay we saved big time on food. And you know how expensive food is in Maui. R.C. is definitely worth it. Plus it was never crowded there. And since you're up on the top floor, you look out over the ocean and you can go outside on the lanai to eat if you like. It's a very nice & comfortable way to begin or end your day. I can't speak to any of the restaurants on property because we ate at the Regency Club. For lunch we walked the short distance to Whaler's Village. If you like fish tacos, Leilani's serves fantastic fish tacos. Even my husband who doesn't like fish devoured them. They come original or cajun & both are good. Leilani's (at Whaler's Village) is right on the beach. Makes a real fun place to people watch & enjoy the ocean view. So even with the misstep with our first room, I felt satisfied they made up for it by moving us to an ocean front room, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I can't wait to return to Maui. We had such a fun vacation. I will without question return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have been visiting the hawaiian islands since 1989 and positively rate the hyatt regency maui as the " best of the best." they are one of the few hotel chains that have the "aloha spirit." every employee we met, during our 11 day stay greeted us warmly and always with a hugh smile. everything else simply falls into place after that from the perfection of room service to the front desk. tourist wait all year for a relaxing vacation only to find the hotel they booked had a terrible staff. well, here's your "paradise inside of paradise." my wife and i will stay no where else as long as we continue to visit the islands...i have nothing to say that is negative nor do i have anything to add to the perfection this hotel and its staff brings to each and every guest. do yourselves a hugh favor and stay at the hyatt maui for 7 or more days and you'll never go anywhere else. thank you hyatt maui for your warmth and professionism. mahalo and see you once again in may 2006..

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: camars777
Reviews.Content: To say that the Maui Hyatt Regency was a little bit of heaven is an understatement. This hotel is absolutely magnificent. I have been to quite a few luxury hotels in my time but this one surpassed my wildest dreams. My daughter (age 18) and I stayed here in October for 9 days and we were just delighted. When we arrived, we expected a mountain view but they gave us a partial ocean view. The grounds, pool, restaurants, etc were beyond belief. The staff was friendly, courteous and always attentive. I can't wait to go back!!! I am a writer but I can't begin to adequately describe the sheer beauty of this paradise-inspired setting. Maui has activities for everyone. It is a calm, peaceful island and, from what we understand, it is one of the safest places on earth. Aloha, Maui and Hyatt staff, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but where's the beach?”
Reviews.Author: from20850
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great. They even gave us a double room upgrade and a bottle of champagne for being honeymooners! The grounds are beautiful, adorned with a dozen or so exotic birds and the pool is huge with a cool design. Our only complaint was the beach. Unlike the 100-yard-deep, white sand beach we enjoyed on the Big Island, the beach here averaged 10 feet deep and was angled sharply toward the water. It was just enough to lay down. Also, the beach (or maybe it was just the water) smelled awful. The only other negative was that everything we did (the drive to Hana, snorkeling, the bike ride down the volcano) are all 30-60 min from Lahaina. Next time I think we'd stay father south.

Reviews.Title: “Base camp for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: typhoonsurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week along with most of our guests for our wedding. Originally booked a Regency club partial ocean view and upgraded to total ocean view for $70 per night. Pro's: Regency Club - free breakfast was pretty good, afternoon snack was very weak, evening snack was pretty good Spa - massages and treatments were excellent Grounds - very clean, not a circus, excellent pool, clean beach Staff - very friendly, concierge actually bailed us out with a last minute limo need. Excellent room service staff, it was refreshing to have them tell you upon delivery that the gratuity/service charge was already included instead of just hiding it like some hotels. Cons: Room was a little dated, wall paper slightly peeling. All in all, this place is worth the money

Reviews.Title: “1st class resort”
Reviews.Author: belfast-jj
Reviews.Content: We had booked a mountain view - but at check-in was decided to upgrade to a Regency club room - full ocean view. And were very impressed - use of the Regency club concierge - breakfast in the morning - snacks midday and a light supper at night with wine and beers. The Hotel was very clean and well kept - we decided to try out one of the Hales at the beach $100 for the whole day - with a fruit plate and water/ice included. Cascades Restaurant was very nice - and Spats the other Restaurant onsite was average. Good selection of shops onsite - it was also helpful to have a laundry room. Staff were really helpful and nice. The beach is a bit of a let-down as its very small - but overall the location is very good. Its only 10/15 mins from Kapalula airport ( which we used so much handier ) Valet parking was very reasonable at $10 a day and $34 for a weeks high-speed internet access also. If anyone has any questions drop me an email. jj....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt from September 5 through September 11 this year. We read reviews of so many hotels, and were a little nervous about the Hyatt, but were very happy we chose to stay there in the end. We walked through some of the other resorts, and it definitely seemed like the nicest place on Ka'anapali. From the moment we arrived, the service was excellent. We had booked a mountain/golf view room, but were "upgraded" to a partial oceanview. It overlooked a parking lot, but had a decent view of the ocean. (If the parking lot had been noisy, we would have asked to move, but we didn't have any problems.) The bellhop was extremely polite and friendly, as were the valets and the people at the front desk. The room was very pretty and a nice size, and the bed was very comfy. Our bellhop arranged to get us a minifridge without us even having to ask. The hotel is at the end of Ka'anapali, close to Lahaina, which was nice for two reasons. First, there was not as much pedestrian traffic in front of the hotel, because it is at the end of the beach and the beach walkway. Second, it was a breeze to get to Lahaina, maybe a five to ten minute drive. The beach in front of the hotel is not the greatest because of the rocks, but a five minute walk takes care of that problem. The grounds are beautiful, with lots of tropical flowers and birds. The pool is AWESOME. We never had a problem finding a chair at any time of day. There were a few kids, but they mainly stayed in the children's pool area. (It probably helped that we went in September after school had started.) We had fun with the water slide, and enjoyed sitting by the pool with a book and a drink, overlooking the ocean. We got a couples' massage at Spa Moana, which was great. The spa staff were OK (not super friendly), but our massage therapists were wonderful. We did aromatherapy, but next time, I think I would try lomi-lomi. We got a daily breakfast buffet with our package, which I would definitely recommend. Go with the jet lag and get there early, because a line forms if you go after 8:00. (It does move quickly, though). The restaurant, the Swan Court, overlooks a pond with a waterfall, and we were seated right next to the pond every day. The food is good, but we would not have paid for it for more than one day if it hadn't been included in our package. Our biggest dilemma was where on Maui to stay -- Kapalua, Wailea, or Ka'anapali. We finally chose Ka'anapali because it seemed to be close both to the beach and to nightlife and other activities. Plus, we saw several negative reviews about the Ritz, which the second main option we were considering. While I think Ka'anapali was a good choice for us (we are in our twenties and are not big golfers), I must say that the Kapalua area was breathtakingly beautiful. We drove by the Ritz on our first night there and almost had second thoughts. If we went back, we might split our time between Kapalua and Ka'anapali, especailly since Kapalua is only about ten minutes away. That said, I am glad we stayed at the Hyatt. It was beautiful, had a great pool, and was a fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I as been a pleasure to stayed in that fantastic hotel ,the service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exquisce fantastic, and peopl are give a very best service, very freindly in evry dpartment, the show is very nice , but need more Tahitiennes dance, the spa is very good, the food is fantastic,a bit pricy but, if you want the best you have to paye for it, all the best and see you soon, jmde villers and christian devillers

Reviews.Title: “Too Kid-Friendly for Us”
Reviews.Author: katk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are a childless couple who were looking for a romantic trip to Maui, and this resort is more geared toward families with children than adults without kids. Couples without children were the minority- all of the kids running wild really annoyed us, especially at the pool area, which is seemingly designed for kids only. In fact, I think adults were outnumbered by children here. The families in rooms on either side of us were really loud, and screaming kids woke us up each morning before 8 am. It is definitely a perfect family resort. Children aside, we enjoyed the breakfast served at Swan Court each morning. The Cascades restaurant was ambient and the food was better then average for Maui/Lahaina area. The frozen drinks here are amazing, and are served poolside. Try the Lahaina Lemonade. It is a must to reserve the beachfront cabanas- do it the day you get there, and for the duration of your trip. Overall, the staff was very nice. The beach in front of the hotel features murky water, and dangerous tides and coral. On our first day, my husband accidentally brushed against some coral in the water, and we had to visit the Dr's office in the hotel. Coral cuts must be treated immediately with antibiotics, the Dr. told us, because it is rife with staph and other bacteria. One amazing feature of this resort is the great Dr.'s office onsite- we were very grateful for it. Snorkelling at Black Rock is amazing! Skip the luau- it was only marginally entertaining, and the food was revolting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit pricey...”
Reviews.Author: shoes7000
Reviews.Content: Originally, we were staying at the Maui Prince Hotel but decided to upgrade because it is on the far southern end of the west coast and didn't seem like there was much to do nearby. Plus, it didnt have a "resort feel" to it. Arriving at the Hyatt on our Honeymoon, we discovered how beautiful the grounds were immediately. The flowers, trees and animals were perfectly arranged. Unfortunately, we had to wait in line for the valet to accept my key for the car(valet people were hard at work but there was only a couple of them for all of the guests, also it costs 10bucs a day + tip each time which I felt a little obligated to do...it worked out to about 16-20bucs/day). Each time we used the car we called down in advance to have the car pulled around, it was never there...plus a 15-20minute wait due to staffing issues...I felt bad so I tipped them anyway. Also, we had to wait in line for 25 minutes to check-in(not very pleasant when you have just taken a 13hr flight). Seems like a consistent problem because everyday we walked by there always seemed to be a line. We received Leis when we finally reached the desk as well as a complimentary bottle of champagne when we get settled in..which was very nice! ROOMS: Very nice. They didn't have any king sized beds(even though our package was for honeymooners and requested a king) so they gave us a double and a queen which actually was ok with us, oh well! Othewise, the rooms were great. The minibar was nice to have in the room but I would prefer to have just an empty fridge so we could put things in(the mini bar was stuffed). The resort fee for 15bucs is RIDICULOUS. You get a free paper,1hr at the tennis courts, free local calling(so I can call all of my friends in Maui=0), coffee maker in the room, entrance fee to the gym...Didnt include internet access. They have an outsourced internet company if you need access with their computer...$5 to sign in + $1 per minute. A bit pricey for me but you can go to Lahaina at one of the internet shops and do it much cheaper. POOL: Very nice. The water falls were great and the slide was soo much fun. All adults in this line...yep that much fun! They make you wear a wristband for some reason as well...so dont forget! There was shallow as well as deep parts in the pool and a separate pool for the kids(very nice). There wasn't any problem getting chairs by the pool assuming you were there before 10am. Otherwise you would have a tough time. Other than that, it was so nice sitting by the pool having some expensive drinks($9-$11 for frozen drinks) POOL BAR: It was located between 2 waterfalls under a rock structure( sounds cool but not once you see it). 3-4 people there at one time the most, otherwise empty. And you had to get out of the pool to get a drink. They need to redesign that area of the resort. FOOD: BREAKFAST: Swan Court($23.95 buffet) was open only for breakfast at the time and you had a long wait if you got there any later than 700am. Otherwise there were between 35-40 people in line and a 30-45min wait...nice once you got in(landscape and food were very nice) but not worth the wait after just getting up. LUNCH: There is a place next to the pool where you can get sandwiches(PB&J $6.50, Tunasalad $8.50, and burgers($11)...etc. Otherwise, you can get served at your chair by the pool which was nice. DINNER: A couple of restaurants on the premise which were nice but not incredible. The italian restaurant SPATS was good and had much to offer. The waiter was very helpful with our bottle of wine and we enjoyed the atmosphere. There is a long walkway that extends behind a bunch of resorts that borders on the beach that has quite a few restaurants(Leilani's,Hula Grill, Rusty Harpoon(food and service very poor)and shops(Whalers Village). A wonderful evening stroll to and from dinner. I highly suggest going just before sunset...an amazing view! As for gathering places to meet other couples...it really doesnt have any. We had just come from the Marriot in Kaui and thought how nice it was to bump into other couples at the bar and talk...not so much at the Hyatt. There is a small bar next to the pool but it has only 5 chairs up against a wall with a TV overhead that you cant see. They need a central location for a swim up pool bar...resorts that have this makes afternoons soo much fun. BEACH: Narrow. You will have to walk either way for the beach to get wider which wasnt a big problem at all. WATER Warm and clear but you can only walk out into the water for about 10ft...then the rocks hurt your feet but you can go either way and the beach to avoid it. LOCATION: Great for traveling to Lahaina. About a $12 cab ride. Great bars, food and tons of shops. Also tons of activites there! The Hyatt is a beautiful place that you will enjoy to the fullest if you arent concerned about money in the least bit. Otherwise, it starts to wear on you after droping between $350-500/day(drinks +food). I hope this helps! If you have any questions, please shoot me an email and I wil help you as much as I can! Mark PS: Everyone should buy Maui Revealed! Excellent book that tells everything you need to know...we bought 3 of them for 3 diff islands...very objective and exact.

Reviews.Title: “Less than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Thorgils
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Maui certainly has a good deal going for it: beautiful grounds, a great location at Ka'anapali within easy walk of the other resorts and Whaler's Village, reasonably well-kept facilities, etc. But unlike most of the competing properties in this price range that we've stayed in previously on Maui, Kauai'i, and the Big Island, I wouldn't return here. There were just too many irritations caused mostly by inadequate attention to detail by management, such as a long wait to check in (no priority for Gold Passport members, although there were few other people checking in when we arrived, just a shortage of front desk staff), long waits every morning for breakfast at the Swan Court, and the postage stamp-sized self-parking lot that's always full. And this was low season -- one hesitates to imagine what the hotel must be like at busier times of the year. Our "de luxe" ocean view room was comfortable but not remarkable in any way, and the bathroom was cramped and unvented.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tischman
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui Resort for our honeymoon Sept 24 - Oct 1st absolutely wonderful I will try not to repeat other reviews if you want to stay at a place with a big beach then this is not the area for you.. be warned the dry beach at high tide is nonexistent... which was fine with us..... the pool area is awesome... you can always walk down or up the beach for more area on beach for football/sports fans... about a 15 minute walk down the walkway parallel to the beach is the Rusty Harpoon (in whalers village).. went their 7am on Sunday and they had every NFL game on... of course you could not bring in your coffee and they would not serve until they opened at 8am.. but they had a very impressive selection of tvs.... and the Bengals won... who dey!!! we bought Maui Jim sunglasses on our first day... at $150 each... well worth the view of Hawaii we recommend: a helicopter ride (we did west side of Maui bike ride down the volcano (we did the 7:30am, most do the sunrise) go to Lahaina and eat at Kimos, cheeseburger in paradise, hard rock cafe, bubba gump shrimp, etc we had the regency club upgrade which included breakfast: cereal, bagels, toast etc, lunch was just cookies or brownies, dinner time was 5pm to 7pm, different appetizers and open bar, so save some room for all you can drink and eat... so we did not eat at any expensive Hyatt restaurants we heard that the Hyatt had the best Laui out of all the hotels but we did the OLD Lahaina Luau.... this is the best.. book early ****and if there is one thing you should book before leaving for Hawaii.... Warren and Annabelles Magic show in Lahaina... we laughed for 2 hours... do NOT miss this... two shows per nite, under 100 people per show... Warren Gibson is great.... we did not have a problem with parking, the valet parking was $10 per nite.. which we used for the 1st nite... then moved car into rear parking lot..... I can see how parking could be a problem... 806 rooms and around 400 free parking spots and 400 valet parking spots the internet at the business center (I did not bring laptop) is $5 for access and then $1 per minute.. ouch!!! so go into Lahaina..... drinks are expensive at the pool bar... $9 plus tax for pina colada... if you want a lei at airport with your special one, arrange before trip also, I good touch is having flowers delivered to room before hand it was totally an awesome experience

Reviews.Title: “Way Below average-Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Aug 25, 2005, our first time to Hawaii and after reading many reviews I expected to be awe struck, I was not. Indeed the lobby is initally grand with the outdoor/indoor effect with the tropical plants and animals, but upon closer inspection it looks like it has not been updated since the 1980's; uncared for wood trim and fading mirrors. I expected the high prices but not the unhelpful disposition of some of the staff, my family and I booked with a package deal and they treated us like free loaders, I assume because our package included such things as breakfast, room upgrade and rental car, maybe if we were paying alacart they would have been more gracious, but in my opinion they need extra training in hospitality. I have been to plenty of hotels in the Carribean and feel the staffs to be far more courteous and friendly and the hotels to be more modern and updated. I was highly disappointed in the Hyatt. I have to say the few reviews I read before my trip that gave poor reviews about the Hyatt were quite accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at the Westin Villas or Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Hyatt, but our 6th trip to Maui. We love Maui. I must say that the staff is very friendly and helpful, with exception of the very first person we encountered who was courteous but for some reason put us on a smoking floor and in a smoking room. The bellman asked if we were smokers and took immediate action and contacted the front desk and took us to another room on another floor right away. I was disappointed with the rooms because they aren't cheap and it seemed that they were musty smelling and the bathroom floors were sticky. Another problem for me was the air-conditioning which were not working properly for my satisfaction. It was quite humid in Maui: the upper 80's to lower 90's and the room had the sun shining in on it in the morning. When I contacted the engineering dept. to come and look at it they said everything was fine, and offered to send an electrical fan. We spent 24 hours in this room then switched to another room next door and had the same problem with the air-conditioner then later that night the entire building's (Lahina Tower) air-conditioning system shut down due to a chiller problem. They got it up and running but it never got cooler than 75 degrees in the room. The bathroom didn't have a vent or venting system so when you took a shower all of the steam went into the room area which created some more heat... you get the picture. I did complain but they never offered to move us to another building because it looked like the hotel was sold out. The grounds are lovely with beautiful gardens, ponds, and waterfalls. It appears to be a kid friendly hotel many animals (penguins, flamingos, swans, parrots, koi fish ponds etc). They have a huge water slide and a whole area for children with a wading pool and small slide for younger children and sand area. They also have a kids camp as well. We do not have young children so I cannot comment on the camp. Maui has gotten extremely expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Definitly hit the right spots”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were all pleasantly pleased the more we discovered about this resort. The Hyatt and its' staff are a very first class operation and very accomodating. The facility was a mix of cultures and types, but every one of the guests were made to feel special and important, from the restaurant to the frontdesk, bellmen and housekeeping, if only for a few days. The staff was very well trained. And you could tell that training was continuous. Even the maintenance people that we encountered greeted us with a smile on their face and in their voice, and loved to use WE when describig their efforts to make the Hyatt the very best of an experience; this shows ownership. Hats off to management and all of the staff. The only downbside was the much hyped Luau at the Hyatt. It fell far short of the build up and was more of a buffet dinner with a show then a 'pricey' 'Experience'.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days in Maui at the hyatt before moving on to Kaui. It was fantastic. Check in was quick and easy, and within 10 minutes of arrival we were in our golf-view room. Requested a fridge, which was delivered within 20 min. The room was clean and well-maintained, and the bed was soooooo cozy! We arrived on a Monday, to be greeted by a free honeymooners cocktail hour. It was an outdoor bar where they played music, and had free drinks and cold appetizers. It was a great way to kick things off! We started every morning with breakfast at the Swan Court. This is a buffet breakfast that was incl in our price. Well worth it. Beautiful surroundings of swans and finches flying about. The food was fantastic (and so was the coffee). Nothing at the buffet ever ran out and the lines were not that long (went around 8 AM). Spent the mornings at the beach in front of whalers village, eat lunch in whalers village (cheap!), then head to the pool for the afternoon. Always found chairs available at the pool. The pool grotto bar was a little disappointing in the fact that you have to get out the pool to get to it, I assumed it was swim up and drink. We ate at some expensive restaurants, but our favorite meal was upstairs at Leilanis. Great food and service. Also loved lunch at Hula grill, also in Whalers village. Didn't eat much in the hotel except for some sushi at Cascades (pretty good) and Tidepools (god awful). WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT EAT AT TIDEPOOLS!! It was downright disgusting. Besides the fact that its expensive, I wouln't eat there if it was free. My wife got a pizza, which was cold in the center and the cheese tasted like it was spoiled ( and we eat tons of pizza!). I got a burger which was dry and tasteless. I am really not picky, but this was awful. Road to Hana was a bit too much hype, we enjoyed the drive up the west coast to the olivine pools and the blowhole more enjoyable. Hotel is baeutiful and people are very nice...you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: profpat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for our 20th anniversary from August 16 to 23. We admired the pool at the Hyatt 20 years ago when we stayed at the Sheraton, so we decided to stay at the Hyatt this time around. Amenities We asked for a refrigerator upon arrival and one was promptly delivered to our room. We stored soda in there and it was great to have it. As many people have mentioned, the daily $15 â€œresort feeâ€� is a bit ridiculous. It covers a paper delivered to your room, the coffeemaker/coffee in your room, 2 passes to the fitness center on the grounds and local calls. Can I pass on this stuff and NOT pay the fee? Service The service was good and workers are very polite. Another guest checked us out of our room by accident one day and they solved the problem within an hour. We were greated with a â€œcongratulations on your anniversaryâ€� and promised a bottle of champagne (which never materialized.) The only problem was when a worker walked into our room around 3:30pm without knocking and caught my husband with no clothes on after his shower. I was sitting on the couch in the room when it happened and she just backed out of the room without a â€œsorryâ€� or anything. (She was probably embarrassed.) We asked the front desk about it (when we straightened out the accidental check out thing) but we never found out who she was. So, we were paranoid from then on if we heard a noise by the door! Rooms Our room was in a terrible location! Room 103 is right across the hall from the hotel doctor and the elevator. Patients were lined up in the hall to get into the doctor and kept stealing our paper in the morning. Our room view was of the parking lot. Where would they have put us if we werenâ€™t celebrating a special occasion? The room itself is a good size, with a sofa to watch tv. But the bathrooms are tiny. You canâ€™t shut the door without edging out of the way. Nice walk-in closet, though. Grounds & Pool The lovely grounds have wooden plank walkways that take you through lush foliage give you a breathtaking ocean view. The pool is divided into a â€œkidâ€� area and an adult area by a giant 30ft lava rock formation. There is 30ft waterslide that comes out on the â€œkidâ€� side. You have to ask where it is because it is blends into the scenery so well that itâ€™s hidden from view. Beyond the pool area are more tropical areas with exotic black swans, which are nice to stroll through. Beach The beach is narrow but you can walk down a bit in either direction and it widens. When the tide is low you can see a lot of coral and rock about 10 feet from where the beach breaks. Activities They advertise surfing lessons but no employee was able to successfully get us to them. Each person would point and say â€œitâ€™s right by those cabanasâ€� or â€œitâ€™s right over thereâ€� and we would get there (well ahead of the appointed lesson time) and no one would show. Further inquiry yielded no results. Personally, I was curious to see where the lesson would be because the water directly in front of the hotel would be too dangerous due to the coral being less than a foot from the top of the water. No volleyball games or activities like we usually participate in. Kids The hotel has Camp Hyatt for kids. Plus, the kid pool is terrific to look at and swim in. There were more kids at this hotel than any other on Kaanapali. It was like Disneyworld in terms of quantity of kids. Lots of families brought their children and there were more of that crowd than couples without kids, which I found interesting considering the price of this hotel. The Hyatt on Maui is a great place to stay if you have kids, since the hotel really caters to them. Snorkeling Snorkeling in front of the Hyatt is dangerous in low tide. There is coral and fish but a wave could scrape you against the coral. We went to black rock by the Sheraton several times and it was as great as we remembered with lots of fish and giant sea turtles. We drove many miles in both directions and would pull over where we saw lots of cars parking. We snorkeled at some terrific sites and saw turtles at several of those sites. The water everywhere on Maui was crystal clear. Excursions The Hyatt has a travel facility at the hotel. We went on a trip taking us to both Molokini and Turtle Town for (gasp) $170 for two people. Molokini had a nice boat ride but tons of snorkeling boats there and very few fish. You see much more by the Sheraton or driving on your own (for free.) The turtle thing was a bust with only one turtle popping out of the water AFTER everyone got back on the boat to leave. (Almost like it was saying â€œgoodbye.â€�) A few people saw one turtle while snorkeling but most saw none. The boat ride is pleasant and the views of the islands are nice during the ride. Food and Drink Some drinks that I had at the Hyatt were really strong (Mai Tai) and some were medium (Hypnotic Martini) and some were really weak (Pina Colada, Lava something) but all were tasty and were priced around $9 or $9.50. We never ate at Swan court because their Italian restaurant Spats was serving dinner there while they refurbished its original location. We had a few lunches by the pool that were good, but very expensive ($30 to $40.) We ate three times at a restaurant two towns over called Roys which had unbelievable gourmet food. I found out that thereâ€™s a Royâ€™s in Chicago, which I will visit soon. That food was expensive but worth every single penny and included high end service too.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Resort from August 7th - August 15th for our honeymoon. In a word...fabulous. I would highly recommend this resort to couples and families alike. Our room was beautiful...we had a great view of both the ocean and the mountains. It was spacious and it was kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff. The front desk, conceirge, activities desk, and room service were all friendly, prompt, and quick to serve our every request. I can say the same for the entire staff at the resort. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. Lush gardens, waterfalls, swans, flamingos, penguins, tropical birds, hammocks, and palm trees gave the perfect backdrop for a romantic paradise. The grounds staff was also very friendly, as we often crossed their paths during our early morning walks down to the beach. This resort is both family and couple friendly, so please keep that in mind. There are going to be children running around. For us, it wasn't a huge deal, even though we were on our honeymoon. We still found plenty of quiet spots to relax and there were plenty of romantic opportunities that we took advantage of. The hotel also offers different activities for honeymooners and couples, such as a Cocktail Hour on the first Monday you arrive and a Romance Under the Stars starwatching activity on the rooftop (complete with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries) on Friday and Saturday nights. We attended both, and enjoyed them equally. Just make it your own experience and you will enjoy every moment. If you do have children, there appeared to be plenty of activities for them as well. There are water sports, a hotel camp, snorkeling, and of course, the pool...just to name a few. We ate at all four restaurants and enjoyed every meal. Cascades has excellent seafood and is also perfect for any sushi lover. Spats has fantastic Italian food. And Swan Court had a magnificent breakfast buffet with everything from fresh fruit and muffins to personalized omlets and my personal favorite, apple crepes. The Pavillion is down by the pool and is convienent for a quick bite to eat while lounging by the pool. The pool is wonderful. It is very large with four different sections. The biggest section has both a shallow and deep end and is where you will find the most people. The chairs in this area do fill up the quickest, but we always found a chair without struggle, even if it was not directly on top of the pool. More children are obvioulsy near the shallow end, so if you aren't looking to be splashed or 'bothered' by children, use common sense and pick a different area to sit. The next area is the Grotto...a shallow area of the pool that goes through waterfalls and then into a cave. Great for children and adults, as there is plenty of room to explore and also a fantastic bar that serves a wide variety of mixed and frozen drinks, as well as non-alcoholic fruit smoothies, among others. The next section is more child-friendly, as there is a small wading area for young children and also a great waterslide (not just for kids!). Make sure you get a bracelet along with your pool towels if you plan to go down the slide! The last section is the jacuzzi...very relaxing! There are easy access paths down to the beach. I will admit that the beach area directly in front of the hotel isn't exactly ideal. It's small and there is a lot of coral in this part of the water. But if you take a short stroll down a bit further, the beach is wider and you don't have to deal with walking over coral to swim. It's still a great place to relax and catch some beautiful sites. We have some great shots of the sunset from here. We also took advantage of Spa Moana's Hot Stone Couples Massage. As a regular massage-goer, I have to say that this was the best experience I've had yet. When you book any spa service, you have full access to the spa ammenities...complete with jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna. Once your amazing massage is over and you are feeling a bit like jelly, they invite you into the relaxation room, which is open-aired and overlooking the ocean. You can also enjoy complimentary iced tea, juice, water, and fruit throughout the entire experience. It was well worth every penny! We did attend the Drums of the Pacific Luau and it was quite enjoyable. I don't think it was very authentic, but the food was excellent and we were very entertained the entire time. A nice show to catch if you get the chance. Yes, this entire resort experience was expensive. But you don't go to an exquisite Hawaiian resort expecting to pinch your pennies. We went prepared and didn't complain when things cost more than they do elsewhere. It's honestly equivalent to what you would spend in a city. NYC, Chicago, Boston, and LA all have similar prices in their restaurants and shopping districts. If you are looking to save money on your vacation and watch every dime, this isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for an unforgettable Hawaiian experience with breathtaking views, especially is this is your first visit to Maui, then I wouldn't hesitate to book with the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was beautiful! they take great care of the foliage and the animals all around the hotel is a nice touch. i loved that there was a macys right inside the hotel, super conveinent. my suite was well kept. the beach wraps around the resort but there is only 20 ft of beach from the sidewalk to the shore which made it farly crowded for a resport beach. the food was good, nothing incredible. staff was attentive. the pool is really neat, it has numerous section and even has a pretty good size slide for the kids (and adults). booking excursions was easy and we had a lot of fun scubadiving... MUST go see turtle alley. i was here on a family trip and i must say i would not go here (or hawaii) without my significant other. it is SUPER romantic. i would recommend it too anyone, especiallly for a couple looking to get marrie din hawaii. they have a beautiful "swan court" to get married or take photos.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was first class!!!”
Reviews.Author: maryal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui and spent 10 days at the Hyatt. It was such an amazing place and everything about it was top notch! The employees were great, friendly and helpful....always smiling! The grounds are beautiful with penquins, flamingos and swan. The pool and surrounding area was beautiful, with plenty of room for everyone. It never felt too crowded. On Sunday nights they bring out a giant TV by the pool and play a "dive in movie" keeping families and children in mind. There are plenty of shops in the lobby from cheap trinkets to exclusive hand made pieces of art from Maui. Just down the walkway is beautiful Whaler's Village with more shops and plenty of places to eat a nice dinner. There are hammocks hanging out by the beach too, to relax in after a day at the pool! The staff knew we were celebrating our 30th anniversary and sent us a bottle of champagne. Valet parking is $10 a day but if you chose to park your own car, it's not a far walk at all. We usually parked very close to our room. We were also upgraded without any additional cost, just by asking. We were given a partial ocean view, and had a balcony to watch the awesome Maui sunsets every night!!!! We would not hesitate to return to the Hyatt. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: redheadsoccermom
Reviews.Content: We just came back from seven days at the Hyatt and after reading the reveiws I was a little worried! It was the most awesome experience my family and I have ever had! From the moment we check in till the moment we left we enjoyed the hotel! Our room was a ocean veiw with two beds and a nice large bathroom and a nice sized balcony over looking the ocean! Every morning we ate at the Swan court buffet which was included in our package, it was great the kids got there fill! The pool was beautiful we had a hard time getting the boys out to go to the beach! We did walk every morning to swim and snorkel at black rock! Saw tons of fish! Then we would head to Lelanis on the beach at the Whalers Village for lunch! Try the fish and chips and dont miss the hula pie it will make your vacation!! Then the rest of the day was spent at the pool which the kids loved the waterslide and the waterfalls! Everynight with the exception of the hyatt luau we went to Lahaina for shopping and dinner! Tons of resturants and great little shops! Then back to our hotel, the nicest beds! We highly recommend the Hyatt Regency! We will be making it our yearly summer vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this wonderful hotel. It was an ideal location for a family vacation because it allowed my children (two sons 12 and 10 years old) have a grand time running between the top notch pool, water slide, beach and game room while my wife and I relaxed by the pool all the while able to keep an eye on them. The hotel highlights are: excellent room (queen bed and double bed in the same room), unbelieveably comfort beds, great breakfast buffet (but make sure you get it included in the room rate otherwise it is awfully expensive), located within walking distance to many family restaurants, shopping on site and way above average gym. The beach in front of the hotel was much better than I had expected and if you want better it is only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Maui, a 4 and a half star hotel. Over 20 years ago, my sister and I stayed there, and it was gorgeous. Now, the hotel looks the same as it did in the 80s. Staff is friendly, and they claim they did a $19 million renivation, but it looks like they just replaced some of the furnature. The walls, ceiling, doors, patio furnature, etc are still from 1980. It is very load at this hotel. What made the experience more enjoyable was the birds in the lobby. If you are looking for a serene hotel, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway - Hyatt Regency Maui”
Reviews.Author: pmac2382
Reviews.Content: Maui is an unbelievably beautiful island to begin with, but Hyatt Regency Maui makes it even better. We 5 of our 10 night anniversary trip at the Hyatt Regency Maui. It was better than expected. Upon check-in we were upgraded from a terrace view to a golf mountain view. The view of the mountains are not quite what the oceanviews are, but it was well worth it. Our original room was only "ok." It was very spacious with a little love seat that allowed us to relax a bit, in addition to the bed. There happened to be some type of bug issue in our room. There are some type of pineapple bugs that were in and around the bathroom area. After one night, we called several times and finally we were moved to another room. In this transition, we were upgraded again to partial ocean view. This view was great, although there was no balcony to walk out on and sit. This was a bit disappointing. The resort itself is amazing. It has several restaurants with a little bit of something for everyone. The Swan Court (yes, real swans) restaurant is great, and has a wonderful view for a breakfast setting. The buffet style breakfast is perfect to start the day. The pool is probably the greatest asset to this hotel. It is large, with tons of seating capacity around. The wait staff was very quick and courteous in taking drink orders. There is a waterfall within the pool that is gorgeous. Underneath where the waterfall lands in the pool, you can actually swim to a bar that is beneath it. This poolside bar is very neat, as you can sit right in the water and have your drinks. There is a very fun slide in the pool that is certainly not just for children. We slid down it once and ended up doing it another few dozen times. Lots of fun and a definite way to get a smile and a laugh. If your trip is a special event for a loved one, I highly suggest you do the oceanfront candlelight dinner for two. You are set up dinner in a little thatched hut on the water, with tons of candles and a perfect setting for dinner. You have your own personal waiter who takes care of your order ahead of time, so you can enjoy the sunset and the food/wine. The food is 5-star, and the setting is just perfect. They certainly know how to make for a special night. The only setback we encountered, other than the room situation, was the beach. For three days, we were under the impression that there was basically no major beachfront sand. If you walk out from the resort, the water is in a cove of sorts, without waves. There is only a few feet of sand... What we didn't know is that if you walk around the corner 100 yards or so, the beach opens up. This, of course, is the beachfront for other hotels, which beckons the question on if it would be better to stay somewhere else. My suggestion is that you should definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency Maui for all of the non-beach amenities such as the dining and the pool, and know that there is only a very small walk to spend time on a lucious beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, tremendous beach access”
Reviews.Author: Islanddoc
Reviews.Content: We loved this place and in May of 04 was the second time we stayed there. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us. We were impressed by how much more helpful the staff at the Hyatt were than the staff down the beach at the Sheraton were...especially since the Sheraton is more expensive. The setup of the Hyatt and its restaurants are much better for enjoying the beautiful views of the expansive pacific than we found the Sheraton- although the snorkeling off Black rock near the Sheraton was much better than what was near the Hyatt. We require wheelchair accessibility and this was great at the Hyatt. Even the beach was just about 10 feet off the paved pathway- so that it was not difficult to get our wheelchair user across that limited space onto a beach recliner. Although the sushi at the Hyatt was expensive, we found the food there to be very good and better than many of the places one might try on Kaanapali. The spa at the Hyatt is small, but very nice, and has a wonderfully relaxing Lanai where one can fall asleep after a massage listening to the sound of the waves. Overall, we believe that the Hyatt is the best of the hotels on Kaanapali. We have not stayed on the Wailea side of the island, but frankly we like the older look of Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place; stayed 3 years in a row!”
Reviews.Author: RedZin
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at here 3 years in a row on the Regency Club Level. The staff in the Regency Club room is fantastic! They are friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Upon returning they make you feel like family. The continental breakfast and happy hour cocktails and pupus are wonderful, as are the free bottled water. You can also ask for a free mini fridge for your room. They also will assit you making golf reservations, etc. First class and a true 5-star experience! The facility is b-e-a-u-t-i-f-u-l !!!! The pool is wonderful. Our kids, now ages 11 & 12 have enjoyed the pool. The beach is nice, although a bit thin in most places. The ocean is very swimmable for the average swimmer, but be careful for the riptide and the steep drop-off. Young children need to be watched carefully. There are two parking lots; I would recommed using the "back" lot. Also, if you plan on eating dinners at the Whalers Village area simply walk, its alot easier than driving, parking, driving back, and parking again. I travel alot for business doing a lot of conventions and stay in some nice places. This Hyatt is a wonderful 5-Star facility. And my wife and I thought we'd never vacation to the same place 3 years in a row, but we've love'd it! The kids know where everything is, we know where everything is, and the staff know us now too. We had a FABULOUS time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from a 5 nights' stay at the Hyatt, July 20-25. This was the first family vacation that we've had in quite a while. We booked a good flight/hotel package about 4 1/2 months in advance through an online travel service. The travelers included myself (female college student), my younger brother, and my mom. We didn't rent a car while at Maui, so we took a taxi from the airport to the Hyatt. After the 40-45 minute taxi drive (which takes you along a very scenic and pretty route), we arrived at the Hyatt and were greeted with leis upon check-in. We were upgraded from a Terrace View room to a Mountain/Golf View room (with a little view of the ocean) at no extra cost. Our room was located in the Atrium Tower. The two other rectangular towers that are on either side of the Atrium Tower are called the Napili Tower and the Lahaina Tower (some rooms in the Lahaina Tower look directly onto the Hyatt's Drums of the Pacific Luau, so I suppose those rooms get a free nightly show, but it's probably loud and may get tiring after the first couple of nights). Some of the activities we did during our stay: - attempted to snorkel at Black Rock (but it was a particularly windy day and we didn't leave early enough in the morning, so the water was choppy, plus we're beginners) - swam around in the Hyatt's pool (which has huge waterfalls and a swim-up bar in a cavelike area between the waterfalls, but you don't literally swim up to the seats and sit in the pool while having your drink, instead you have to wade over to some steps and get out of the water and then take your seat at the bar) - bodyboarding at the beach in front of the hotel (if you walk down to the Hyatt's Beach Activity Center, you can rent boogie boards and other equipment and the beach is a little wider there, while the beach directly in front of the Hyatt's pool is really narrow) - my brother went jet skiing (which he said was his favorite activity, but since he isn't 18 my mom had to go down with him to the Beach Activity Center to sign for him) - shopping and dining at Whalers' Village (you can take the free shuttle to get there which leaves about every half hour, or you can just walk there which takes about 15 minutes or so; we went to Leilani's On the Beach three times during our stay, which is a restaurant at Whalers' Village and it has a very casual downstairs and a less casual upstairs, definitely try one of their fish entrees) - my younger brother did an ocean rafting excursion and the raft took him out to Lanai where he snorkeled and swam with turtles and Spinner dolphins, and he said he saw what looked like hundreds of dolphins while they were rafting (the raft left off of Mala Wharf, which was a short drive away but we didn't have a car, so the Hyatt arranged for a taxi to take my brother to the wharf and then to pick him up and take him back to the hotel; again, since he isn't 18, my mom had to go down with him to Mala Wharf to sign for him) - my mom and I went to the Hyatt's Drums of the Pacific Luau (we paid extra for VIP seating, so we sat in the front and didn't have to wait in line, but since it isn't a huge venue it seems like every seat has a good view, so VIP seating isn't necessarily worth it; if you've already been to a luau before, you can skip this one..it's entertaining, but it's probably not worth all the money if you've already seen one) - my mom went to Spa Moana at the Hyatt to use the whirlpool, steam room, and sauna (they charge $15/person for all-day access, but they waive this fee if you are paying for a massage, facial, etc) - my family and I did the Tour of the Stars (the astronomer takes you up to the hotel's roof and shows you stars which are invisible to the naked eye but visible with their giant telescope, different constellations, etc; the astronomer only takes up 10 people at a time and she spends about an hour with the group, we even saw a shooting star [which she explains is not really a star]..I really liked this, but it's about $20/person) - my brother and I went parasailing (this was really fun since we had never gone parasailing before; we had to check in at the beach directly in front of Whalers' Village; the staff took pictures of us with their camera and my mom chose to buy the film for $20..I just developed the pictures, they are ok, but there's no pictures that show how high up we were which was about 800 ft, there are only close shots so it's just us in life jackets with a big parachute behind our heads..not necessarily worth $20 plus the cost of developing) - and my favorite thing that we did, a snorkel sail aboard the Hyatt's Kiele V which leaves right off the beach in front of the Hyatt (we sailed out for about an hour to Oneloa Bay [? I might be wrong about which bay] and then snorkeled for a little over an hour, had lunch aboard the boat, and then sailed back; snorkeling there was a lot of fun, this was the first time that I had absolutely no problems with my mask and snorkel, we saw tons of fish, and the staff even got my mom snorkeling [and she was completely set on not snorkeling since she doesn't know how to swim, plus she had injured her leg shortly before our trip]; there was also a photographer aboard the ship who took pictures of the passengers and the fish, and he led the more adventurous snorkelers to a spot where turtles swim; at the end of the sail my mom decided to purchase a CD of photos for $90 that the photographer had taken of our trip, I haven't seen the photos yet, but we did get the CD in the mail today..I don't know if it's worth the $90, but hopefully it is. We arranged all the activities (jet skiing, ocean rafting, luau, tour of the stars, parasailing, snorkel sail) through the Expedia!Fun Activities Desk, which is located on-site at the hotel. It wasn't cheap, but it was extremely convenient and trustworthy. You don't have to find outside companies on your own and make a whole bunch of calls to RSVP or to cancel. You just tell the staff at the Expedia Activities Desk what you want to do and on what days, and they'll do all the calling and research, and then they'll get back to you with your itinerary. This pretty much describes the Hyatt - anything that you want to do, they can pretty much arrange for you. You don't even have to leave the hotel grounds if you don't want to (there's shopping and dining right there). And if you did have to leave the hotel grounds, the hotel can arrange transportation for you. But all this convenience obviously does come at a price..which you should probably already be expecting, especially if you're traveling to a resort area in Maui. Some cons (or maybe I'm just being picky): the fridge we had in our room didn't work and we didn't know until about a day later, but after calling the front desk the staff did replace it; the bathroom lock and then the room lock didn't work, but again, after calling the front desk the staff fixed them Some tips/recommendations: - if you are not renting a car and don't mind spending an extra $10-15, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel instead of a shuttle (this meant that we didn't have to wait for other families to get their luggage off the carousel, especially since we only brought carry-on's and didn't need to go to the carousel at all; plus, we didn't know if we'd have to end up waiting for other families to get dropped off at their hotels first) - if you want an in-room refrigerator, request it beforehand (I think there is some kind of waiting list for fridges - I'm not sure if requesting beforehand will improve your chances, but I think it does) - if you can splurge on one activity at the Hyatt, choose the Hyatt's Kiele V snorkel sail (it's about $80/person, but it's worth it) - if you want a good seat at the pool (ie. a seat located at the main pool) go down by around 9:30 or 10AM, or I guess you can just lay your towel out in the morning and then go eat breakfast..but that gets so annoying for the other people looking for seats - if you're waiting until you get there to decide what activities you want to do, then make RSVP's for the activities you want as soon as you get there (activities like the snorkel sail or tour of the stars were booked for a few days, so if our stay had been shorter we wouldn't have been able to do those), but it's probably better to RSVP before your trip and if you need to cancel you usually have 48 hours before the activity to do so - you can stock up on water and snacks at one of the shops located in the Hyatt called Lamonte's (I know it's probably more expensive than driving over to a nearby Safeway in Lahaina, but if you don't have a car this is the next most convenient thing..whatever you do, just don't drink the bottled water in your hotel room by the mini-bar..unless you want to pay about $4) - if you are taking along any annoying little brothers make sure to set them up with a busy itinerary (I know it will end up being pricey..but trust me, the ocean rafting excursion kept my brother away from us for over 4 hours, plus he was exhausted when he got back..so that was nearly one whole day without his whining) - and finally, don't bring luggage..only bring carry-on's, bring one backpack filled with your stuff and an empty duffel bag in case you want to fill it up with gifts, so on the way back you will have 2 carry-on's (the maximum that our airline allowed us)..you will also spend less time packing and more time enjoying your stay there..and you really don't need all that stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay. All our kids could say was "The Best Vacation Ever" Staff: Indredible !! Smiles and help from everyone. Consierge Jeffre spent the day finding our luggage for us after it never made it. All he could say is "you go enjoy and leave the problems to me". Had it delivered the next day and left two voice mails to reassure me. This was the pattern from the coffee shop to the staff that passed out towels. Food: Excellent but very expensive. What do you expect for the Hyatt at Maui. The Swan Court breakfast buffet is outstanding with great service but will run a family of 4 about $100. Try it once. Then go to the buffet at the poolside resaurant and get close to the same thing for $40 less. Food and drinks at the pool are great but pricey. Have a few meals at the hotel but venture to Lahaina for others at a better price. We stopped at the Safeway in Lahaina and stocked up on pop, chips, etc. A can of pop by the pool will cost you $2.60 and a burger is $9. Facilities: Incredible !! Beautiful pool. Huge with a waterfall that separates the big adult pool from the kids area. Even though the hotel was sold out it never seemed crowded. Get to the pool early for chairs but beware, they watch them closely and tag them for how long you are gone. They will pull towels after 1 hour if nobody shows up. This is nice really because many chairs went unclaimed. The water slide in the kids pool is great, even for adults. Hard pool to beat. The swim up bar is actually located in the waterfall tunnel between the pools and you are not really in the water but close enough. Nice place to sit and have a $9 drink. The hotel grounds are gorgeous with waterfalls, animals, etc.. Hard to beat We went to the Luau sponsored by the hotel and it was great. Excellent food and very entertaining show on a nice stage. We spent extra for VIP seating and food service. After a tired trip it was worth it. No long line to wait in, seated first, ate first and were in the front row for the show. If you go the standard route plan to line up at least 45 minutes before it starts and wait in line in the sun. Rooms were clean and plenty of space. Had a nice partial ocean view in the main tower. Nice balcony to sit on at night and late afternoon. Exercise room is incredible. Both of my kids are training for cross country and they had beautiful treadmills with TV's built in. The Nautilus equipment was incredible. If you work out this is the place to go. Better than most gyms I see in the states Beach: Not real good right at the Hyatt but you only need to walk about 20 minutes on a nice path to the Sheraton for a fantastic beach and great snorkeling. We did this several times. You can also walk to Whalers village for shopping and food. The path is concrete, lighted at night and travels along the shore past all the hotels. Real nice. We also drove up the road to the Public Beach park for one of the best beaches we have ever seen. Don't be afraid to stray of the property for some fun. You can't go wrong here. Incredible facility. Yes it is expensive but you are on Maui and everthint is. You get what you pay for here. I do suggest buying the gook Maui Revealed to get great tips on what to do, what to see, where to eat, etc.. It provided us with a lot of the drive to Hana and some fun little restaurants at low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Part of a perillo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although rated 5 star I think it is over rated. Its hard to find anything thats not beautifull in Hawaii, it is the attention to detail that makes a hotel worthy of five stars. In this case there were many things that were lacking. From chandeliers in the lobby needing dusting to rugs fraying (also in the lobby). We were at the pool and were accompanied by a pile of used towels for almost an hour before someone removed them. Although minor details, I at least do not expect these things for these prices and 5 stars. Without firsthand experience visiting each hotel the rating system is important. Hopefully reviews will compensate.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 great days at the Hyatt Regency. Make no mistake, this place is one of the best resorts I have ever stayed in. From the moment we drove up to the time we checked out, the staff was friendly, accomodating and determined to make my stay enjoyable. For example, my wife had mistakenly left my garment bag at the airport. When we discovered it the next day, we asked the conceriege for the phone number to Aloha Airlines. She asked why and we told her. Within 10 minutes, she called me back and told me that she contacted Aloha and they found my bag. She was about to make arrangements for Aloha to deliver the bag! Talk about customer service! Also, we went during a very, very busy time. But the place did not feel crowded. We never had a problem finding a chair by the pool. The only complaints (and I use the term mildly) was that I thought Camp Hyatt was a little weak (more activities needed for the kids..seeemed like they spend too much time coloring and watching movies) and the cocktail service by the pool was a tad slow when we first arrived (but by the end of the week, the waitresses knew us and they were on it!). We stayed in the Regency Club level of the hotel. The continental breakfast and evening cocktails were a very, very nice touch. Yes I realize it comes at a premium but I felt it ws worth the price. Following our stay at the Hyatt, we drove over to the Grand Wailea for a 4 day stay . While the GW may have better pools (the Hyatt pool is no slouch though) and the beaches directly in front of the GW were better, IMO the Hyatt offered a much friendlier atmosphere and we did not feel squeezed together at the Hyatt like we did at GW. Furthermore, there was next to ZERO poolside service at GW. Moreover, nicer beaches are within walking distance from the Hyatt. We are already planning a return trip next year....except all 8 days will be at they Hyatt this time!

Reviews.Title: “Maui a little short on the wowi”
Reviews.Author: Jeff511
Reviews.Content: I just finished spending 6 nights at the Hyatt and I was a little disappointed. This is a fantastic property. It was definitely kid friendly with a fantastic pool , waterslide, waterfalls, etc. It was also a place for couples with all kinds of romantic backdrops and places for some private time. However, the service in a majority of the areas of the hotel was awful. There were few places where you were greeted with a smile and an aloha. The Swan Court restaurant was a fiasco for breakfast in the morning- understaffed, could not get service. The Paradise Cafe and the service poolside made you want to get up and go purchase your own drinks or food. This is a four star hotel without a doubt, but you expect 4 star service and a friendly attitude , this was a one star in those regards. Sorry Sincerely, East coast family

Reviews.Title: “a honeymoon in paradise”
Reviews.Author: davacationexpert
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed at this hotel for ten days on the month of may this year for our honeymoon. we are from the north east and we never traveled this far somewhere and we couldn't believe how long the flight was. but when we first arrive on the airport as soon as the flight attendants open the door of the aircraft you notice the aroma of maui. it smells like you walked in to a sun tan lotion bottle (lol). we got our rental car and drove to the hotel the drive from the airport to the hotel is amazing so many beautiful things you see on your way up to the hotel you have to pinch yourself just to make sure its forreal and pull over to take pictures. the drive is very easy even if your bad with directions its impossible to get lost. we get to the hotel and we use the valet so that we can check in and bring our bags to the room. omg!!! as soon as you get there the employees of the hyatt jump on you and make sure you are treated like you are royalty! the check in was a very good experience the front desk staff was very helpful and answered all are questions. the bell boy was very friendly and gave us some hints on what to do on our stay. he told us there is channel you watch on the t.v. in your room that you can use to see all the activities you can do and all the best restaurants where you can eat at. there is a couple of restaurants in the hyatt but they are very very expensive but the food quality is and taste is awesome. there is not much night life but if you wanna just have a romantic time with your love one this is the place to go. dont get me wrong i saw alot of families at the hyatt but i think its more of a couples kind of resort than a family one. the pools are ginormous beatiful waterfalls and a slides as well. there is always a seat at the pool even though there is alot of people the staff is always on making sure everyone is happy at there stay at the hyatt. the swim up bar is cool and aslo the bar at the pavilion reasturant pool side is awesome gotta give a special shout out the "abner" this bartender is so friendly and one of the best employees in the hyattreally down to earth kinda guy. the hyatt also is host of one of the best shows i have ever seened the luou is a must see at your stay at the hyatt. i have nothing but good things so say about my stay at the hyatt maui all good experiences nothing bad to say. at the end of my trip my wife and i where practically in tears because we didnt want to leave paradise. it was kinda funny because when we checked out we asked the front desk lady for some comment cards and she was all out of them because everyone asked for them before they leave. so you know this place has great service!!!!! i cant wait to go back i recommend this to anyone that wants to experience first hand what paradise really is and to be treated like royalty!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was the best”
Reviews.Author: lynn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt with our 3 adult children. It was fabulous. The grounds, the birds in the lobby, breakfast in Swan Court, lovely rooms - everything was wonderful. We easily got lounges at the pool every day. We easily parked for free every night. We loved the Kiele V for snorkeling, wish we'd found time for the astronomy rooftop tour. The view from our suite was beautiful, the view from the kids' rooms was of the parking lot - but their rooms were free with stay certificates so who can complain? We loved walking on the paved beachwalk to other beaches (Sheraton is best) and restaurants (try the Hula Grill). The staff was great. After swimming I was loading up a heavy bag to carry up to my room (I use a cane) and the guy cleaning the pool area offered to take it up for me! We used the Hyatt concierge for all of our dinner reservations - we ate off site for dinners - and had the best tables at prime time at every restaurant. We loved the Feast at LeLe (make reservations months ahead), Pacifico's, ate one night at Ferraro's at Four Seasons - too far a drive, beautiful site but very honeymoonish - my kids were glad we didn't stay there. My family played golf, cheaper in the late afternoon. Tennis was the only problem. It was supposed to be "free" court time. Once they were required to rent shoes for $50, even though others had on the same shoes as theirs. Sometimes they had to rent racquets, other times told that racquets were free. Same for balls. This was irritating. Overall, however the Hyatt was great, my kids loved it and we would stay there again if we ever get to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SouthMilwaukeerocket
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt June 17-21. We did quite a bit of research and read all the comments for hotels on Maui on this site. The hotel was fabulous. We used the three for three package on the Hyatt website which included a rental car, upgraded room and breakfast. Upon check in we were greeted by the nicest bellman but found our room was not available. No problem- we walked around the beautiful grounds had lunch and ended up with an upgrade to a deluxe oceanfront. This was an outstanding corner room with two balconies overlooking the ocean/pool and the mountains. One minor point is that the bathroom is quite small. We suggest taking the Tour of the Stars on the rooftop of the Hyatt. The cost was $20 per person but the on site astronomer (Eddie) and the powerful telescopes make this a super experience. We had a perfect night for viewing the stars and the moon. Even if you are not a stargazer you'll enjoy this. Eddie was a super host and teacher. Also took the Kiele V the Hyatt boat for sailing and snorkeling. This was also a great time. The food, staff, and service at the hotel were top notch. You can't go wrong at the Hyatt Maui. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JK-Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt in Maui from June 14-18. Overall, it's a nice hotel but I found it overpriced. They also went out of their way to try to nickel and dime you with additional charges. We had two rooms as my mother-in-law was travelling with our family of four. Both rooms were fine and similar to the pictures on the website. The bedroom was average-sized and the bathroom area was somewhat generous. The porch/lenai was a little small, had a a partial ocean view and could seat two people. The room with the king-sized bed was a little nicer than the room with two beds. We stayed on the Regent Floor which provides a continental breakfast and drinks and appetizers at happy hour. Both the breakfast and happy hour were top notch. During the rest of the day they put out cookies and soft drinks. It's somewhat difficult to justify paying the premium ($150) to stay on the Regent Floor, but we enjoyed it. The grounds are nicely mainitained with the various birds and plants. Service was generally good. We didn't eat the the hotel - prices for dinner were awfully high for restaurants that aren't rated that highly. The pools were nice but it was very difficult to get a chair. We went down at 11:00 am and almost every chair was taken. Only about 25% of the chairs had people in them, most were simply claimed by a towel. The add on charges were very high and irritating. The Hyatt Kids program was $75 per day. Internet access at the the business center was an obscene $5 plus $1/minute. They charged for all beach-related items including chairs. Valet parking was $10/day and they practically forced you to use it by making the regular parking lot too small - it was about 20% the size of the valet lot. The hotel also charged a daily resort fee of $14 or $15. Excluding the additional cost for the Regent Floor, we paid $450 per night at the Hyatt. In contrast, we paid $550 per night at the Four Seasons on the Big Island, and for a bungalow at the Turtle Bay Resort on Oahu. The other two resorts provided much better value for the money than the Hyatt. Their rooms and facilities were much nicer than the Hyatt's and they didn't try to take advantage of you with the add-on charges. Based on the prices I paid elsehwere, I thought that the Hyatt should have been priced at about half of what we paid at the Four Seasons and Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Kanapali”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I finally got a chance to write my review. Spent one week at the Hyatt from May 7 to May 13 with my parents. I was definitely impressed with this hotel but it was also expensive ($385 a nite purchased on expedia or $2700 for 7 nites). Thankfully this included a breakfast buffet which was fabulous but only for 2 of us. I walked down the walkwayto check out the other hotels in Kanapali and the Hyatt was definitely the best.
